contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a transaction monitoring expert to join our Financial Crimes Compliance team. Reporting to the Global Head of Financial Crimes Compliance, the Director, Financial Crimes Transaction Monitoring, will be responsible for enhancing the design of our global AML/CTF transaction monitoring program, across both fiat and crypto. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working with financial intelligence, data and engineering teams to design transaction monitoring systems and scenarios, and is looking to find creative approaches to detect financial crimes in the fast-changing crypto ecosystem.

What you'll work on: 

  • Owning Circle’s global AML/CTF transaction monitoring program, including definition of scenarios, rules and thresholds.
  • Working closely with the Financial Intelligence Unit and Investigations Operations teams to enhance transaction monitoring based on SARs filed and broader ecosystem intelligence.
  • Partnering with Compliance Data & Technology, Product, and Engineering teams to implement enhancements to the transaction monitoring systems.
  • Driving scenario testing and tuning exercises to identify optimal transaction monitoring scenarios and thresholds.
  • Identifying opportunities to improve the overall efficacy of the transaction monitoring program, including but not limited to, use of machine learning and artificial intelligence to detect unusual activity.
  • Staying at the forefront of money laundering, terrorist financing and other financial crimes risks and typologies, and technologies to detect suspicious activity.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • A passion for harnessing the power of digital currency and blockchain technology and services built on top of it.
  • B.A./B.S. degree; quantitative or technical degree a plus.
  • 12+ years of relevant experience in AML/CTF, with a minimum of 5+ years developing transaction monitoring programs.
  • 5+ years of experience managing and leading teams. 
  • Deep knowledge of global financial crimes transaction monitoring programs and systems.
  • Deep understanding of cryptocurrency transactions, risks and typologies.
  • Experience with blockchain analytics and monitoring platforms, such as TRM Labs, Chainalysis or Elliptic.
  • An innovative and creative mind looking to suggest new solutions to old problems.
  • Proven experience working collaboratively and effectively with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders and internal teams.
  • Experience and comfort working in an ever changing industry and the flexibility to quickly react to changing demands.
  • CGSS, CAMS, or CFCS certification is a plus.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Washington D.C. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $185,000 - $260,000

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

name: Director, Financial Crimes Transaction Monitoring

contents:
Wir suchen nach Menschen, die mit uns die Digitalisierung von Morgen gestalten. Denn - Wir machen digital.

Wir sind Siemens Digital Industries Software. Wir sind kein Industrieunternehmen. Wir sind ein wachsendes Softwareunternehmen, das unseren Kundinnen schon heute die Technologien und Innovationen von morgen bietet. Mit den Chancen eines Großunternehmens sind Deine Möglichkeiten endlos. Die Stelle, auf die Du Dich heute bewirbst, ist nur der erste Schritt auf Deinem Weg zu Siemens.

Werde jetzt Teil unseres Teams als Solution Architect (w/m/d) - OEM / Trucks & Busses und gestalte die Welt von morgen mit!

Durch unser hybrides Arbeitsmodell kannst Du flexibel von zu Hause, unterwegs oder an einem unserer über 20 Standorte innerhalb Deutschlands arbeiten. Wir unterstützen Deine Mobilität mit einem Dienstwagen oder einer BahnCard 100.

Wie gestaltest Du die Welt von morgen? Herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert!

Die Digitalisierung stellt viele Unternehmen vor große Herausforderungen und wird die Prozesse in den kommenden Jahren immens verändern, die Schlagworte sind in aller Munde (z.B. Closed Loop Manufacturing, Product Lifecycle Management oder Totally Integrated Automation, Digitaler Zwilling, Industrie 4.0). Auch unsere Kundinnen müssen sich, mit unserer Hilfe, diesen Aufgaben stellen, nicht zuletzt steht dabei deren Wettbewerbsfähigkeit auf dem Prüfstand.

Als PLM Solution Architect mit Fokus auf OEM Prozesse wirst Du diese Reise wesentlich mitgestalten und die Anforderungen unserer Kundinnen in Digitalisierungslösungen mit dem Siemens Xcelerator Software Portfolio verwandeln.

Wir suchen einen PLM-Profi, derdie diese Aufgabe annimmt und mit seinem großen Erfahrungsschatz und Enthusiasmus unseren Kundinnen bei der Transformation zum digitalen Unternehmen zur Seite steht.

  • Als Solution Architect bringst Du die Anforderungen unserer Kundinnen und die im PreSales erarbeiteten Lösungsansätze zusammen. Du definierst konkrete Architekturen auf Basis der Bedürfnisse der Kundinnen, natürlich immer vor dem Hintergrund einer optimalen wirtschaftlichen Umsetzbarkeit
  • Fokus der Arbeit liegt auf dem Design, der Konzeption und Umsetzung von innovativen Lösungskonzepten rund um die Prozesse der Kundinnen.
  • Du arbeitest an Consulting- und Digitalisierungsprojekten und führst dabei Implementation und Technical Consultants in interdisziplinären Teams als Lead Architect.
  • Als "Trusted Advisor" führst Du die Kundinnen auch in schwierigen Situation und bist für die Umsetzung der technischen Lösungen verantwortlich
  • Die Zusammenarbeit mit dem Produktmanagement und der Entwicklung ist ein weiteres entscheidendes Element für den Erfolg unserer Arbeit.
  • Unterstützung des Presales/Engagement Team während der technischen Auswahl- oder Angebotsphasen eines Projekts
  • Du verantwortest die zielsichere Integration der Architekturen in die Gesamtsysteme unter Berücksichtigung bestehender IT-Systemlandschaften
  • Als technische/r Expertin arbeitest Du aktiv an der Dokumentation und Weiterentwicklung von Best-Practices und dem weiteren Ausbau unserer Wissensdatenbank
  • Dein zukünftiges, kollegiales Umfeld zeichnet sich durch ein offenes und partnerschaftliches Miteinander aus, wobei das Team im Vordergrund steht

Wie wirst Du Teil unseres Teams? Mit viel Leidenschaft und Mut!

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Fahrzeugtechnik, allg. Maschinenbau, Produktions- oder Fertigungstechnik o.ä.
  • Du hast mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Beratung und Konzepterstellung für PLM Prozesse
  • Du besitzt Prozesswissen aus der Automotive-Industrie im Umfeld der Produktentwicklung, Fertigung und Service
  • Du hast gute Kenntnisse über das Siemens PLM Produktportfolio
  • Du kennst die Vorteile der PLM Philosophie und verstehen die Rolle unserer Produkte
  • Grundkenntnisse in mindestens einem führenden CAD System, ERP Prozesse, MES/MOM, PLM übergreifende Prozesse
  • Du bist in der Lage den Kunden auf dem Weg zur Verwirklichung seiner individuellen PLM Bedürfnisse zu führen
  • Komplexe oder schwierige Situationen mit Kundinnen meisterst Du mit Routine, Weitblick und kühlem Verstand
  • Beratungs- und Führungskompetenz sowie hervorragende Kommunikationsfähigkeiten auch auf Management Ebene
  • Wir kommunizieren sowohl mit unseren Kundinnen als auch mit unseren nationalen und internationalen Geschäftspartnerinnen auf Deutsch und auf Englisch.
  • Unser Team arbeitet deutschlandweit. Wir können daher sowohl mit einer Homeoffice-Option entgegenkommen als auch mit einer attraktiven Dienstwagenregelung

Wir bieten ein internationales Umfeld mit mehr als 140.000 Kundinnen in aller Welt, die heute schon auf unsere Kompetenz in der Digitalisierung setzen. Dabei bringen sich in Deutschland über 2.000 Kolleginnen in spannende und abwechslungsreiche Kundenprojekte aus den Bereichen Luft- und Raumfahrt, Automobil- und Transportbranche, Konsumprodukte und Einzelhandel, Elektronik und Halbleiter, Energie- und Versorgungsindustrie, Industriemaschinen und Schwermaschinen, Maritime Industrie, sowie Medizinprodukte und Arzneimittel ein. Bei uns findest Du ein teamorientiertes Arbeitsumfeld, umfassende Weiterbildungsoptionen und attraktive Benefits. Durch individuelle Zielvereinbarungen und vielfältige Karrieremodelle mit Spezialisierungsoptionen bieten wir Dir die Möglichkeit, fachlich und persönlich zu wachsen.

Bist Du eine Ideengestalter*in? Dann werde jetzt Teil unseres Teams!

Wenn Du erste Fragen mit unserem Recruiting Team klären möchtest, wende Dich gerne per Mail an: careers-DACH.sisw@siemens.com

Ansprechperson dieser Stellenausschreibung ist Herr Marc Lerch.

Du möchtest vor Deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens Digital Industries Software erfahren? Mission / Vision und unser Software Portfolio - oder besuche unsere Homepage.

contents:
About us:

We'reSiemens. Award winning; Ranked on Fortune 500; Digital Engineering globalleader. A collection of over 300,000 excellent minds who are all making thefuture. This position is within the Simcenter Presales group, part of ourDigital Industries Software Business Unit.

Position overview:

As anApplication Engineer Modeling & Simulation you will act as the technicallead in demonstrating and promoting our Simcenter Simulation Solutions(primarily Simcenter Prescan) to our customers in a diverse range of industries,with primary focus on sophisticated driver assistance systems (ADAS) andautonomous vehicles (AV).

Thisexciting opportunity promoting innovative simulation solutions whilemaintaining a high level of technical knowledge offers a diverse range of skilldevelopment, from understanding the first principles of ADAS and AV Systems, todeveloping customer focused presentations, demonstrations, proof of conceptsand account leadership skills in support of our larger sales strategies.

Inthis position you will collaborate with the presales manager of ourfast-growing Simcenter Simulation and Test Solutions and be part of a largeteam of technical specialists, application and support engineers within theSiemens Digital Industries Software organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Work alongside the sales team to apply technical skills in the Simcenter Prescan portfolio, using a combination of application and domain expertise
  • Develops proof of concept models, provide demonstrations, and drives benchmarks using the Siemens Simcenter Simulation and Test Solutions portfolio
  • Collaborates with the product development roadmap by evaluating current product functionality, identifying customer needs, analyzing competitive products, analyzing and relaying customer requirements to the Siemens Simcenter product development team
  • Train and mentor client technical leads and domain authorities in the application of primarily Simcenter Prescan
  • Conduct technical discussions with customers to collect and understand simulation requirements, propose solutions, and explain benefits of our Simcenter portfolio
  • Join a community of highly skilled individuals maintaining professional and technical knowledge to stay at the forefront of innovation.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Master of Science in Automotive, Aerospace, Mechanical Engineering or other engineering team. Bachelor of Science with several years of shown experience will also be considered
  • Knowledge and experience using CAE simulation software
  • Strong interpersonal skills, communication skills and problem solving capabilities. Ability to work as an individual contributor and as a team member
  • Ability to travel up to 25%

QualifiedApplicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States.Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization nowor in the future for employment in the United .

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Experience using World, Sensor and Vehicle Modeling tools: Simcenter Prescan, Matlab/Simulink, Simcenter Amesim, Simcenter Heeds, Polarion, IPG Carmaker, Applied Intuition, Carla, SUMO, dSpace Aurelion, Carsim/Trucksim,
  • Proficiency with C/C++ and/or Python
  • Understanding of the properties and technologies of the sensors used in automated and autonomous systems (Camera/Lidar/Radar/Ultrasonic/dGPS/V2X)
  • Knowledge of the ADAS/AD system design process, including the validation and verification (V&V) process, including SIL/MIL/HIL
  • Experience with 3D design tools (CAD / Blender / OBS Studio)
  • Experience in student projects such as SAE Formula Student, EcoCAR Mobility Challenge, GM AutoDrive Challenge, Indy Autonomous Challenge
  • Industry domain experience in one of the following areas: Automotive / Ground Vehicle, Aerospace / Defense, Industrial Machinery

Thetotal cash compensation range for this position is $76,300 to $152,600with 10% of this being comprised of an annual incentive target. Theactual compensation offered is based on the successful candidate's worklocation as well as additional factors, including job-related skills,experience, and relevant education/training. Siemens offers a variety of healthand wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be foundhere: www.benefitsquickstart.comIn addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

AtSiemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We needthe most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

contents:
Thisrole will support the growth strategy, as we are undergoing a Transformationwhich will enable the company to scale & support next generation SaaSproducts & services. In alignment with the strategy, we are seeking amanager with strong experience in supporting our digital sales operations.

Youwill be a critical member in the sales operations team focused on working crossfunctionally to enable and streamline digital / ecommerce sales processes for ahigh-profile SaaS tech company. This role will supply to development anddeployment of new Configure, Price and Quote processes for the business unit

Responsibilities:

  • To continually improve the performance and efficiency (cost of operation) of our business systems; improve benefits of the system at the lowest achievable cost while delivering the required functionality
  • Leading brainstorming sessions, using market research for future products and/or product features that address our customers' growing needs
  • Help lead Digital Sales design & development projects through all phases of the product life cycle using Agile development principles
  • Planning & collaborating with product marketing on how to market and promote our products and the digital store
  • Working with our content team to ensure accurate training and development of support content
  • Develop detailed product design & requirements documentation
  • Use e-commerce platforms to enable a detailed customer experience for demos, purchase, activation, and renewals
  • Lead the go to market strategy through collaboration with our e-commerce channel manager, user experience guides and collaborators
  • Act as a product owner to identify, develop and evolve the product and technical requirements for the delivery and fulfillment of SaaS/PaaS products on our digital/e-commerce platforms.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education and Experience:

  • Very organized with a high attention to detail while keeping the big picture in mind
  • 4-6 years of product management experience in high-tech subscription or service-based products in a B2B environment, including use case and requirements definition
  • Functional knowledge of Software as a Service, E-commerce fundamentals, and user experience design, specifically including demos, free trials, subscriptions, and renewals
  • In depth experience evaluating and analyzing data and analytics, specifically for recurring, subscription-based revenue
  • Knowledge of Salesforce CRM and Commerce Cloud (required)
  • Knowledge of Salesforce Flow
  • Experience building cases, strategy, and alignment with product portfolios
  • Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently while collaborating with team members to achieve campaign timelines and goals
  • A good eye for UI/UX design.

Key Factors to Success:

  • Financial growth of the SaaS product revenue through digital sales
  • LeanData experience
  • Accurate case and market needs assessments for streamlined customer journey from purchase to use.

Thesalary range for this position is $113,900 to $205,000 and this role iseligible to earn incentive compensation. Siemens offers a varietyof health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefitscan be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com.In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

AtSiemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We needthe most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

Video: MEET US in 2 Minutes!

Wir sind Siemens Digital Industries Software. Wir sind das führende und kontinuierlich wachsende Softwareunternehmen für die Industrie, das unseren Kund*innen schon heute die Digitalisierungs-Technologien und Innovation von morgen bietet. Mit den Chancen eines Konzerns und der Dynamik eines modernen Softwareunternehmens sind Deine Möglichkeiten endlos. Die Stelle, auf die Du Dich heute bewirbst, ist nur der erste Schritt auf Deinem Karriereweg zu Siemens.

Werde jetzt Teil unseres Teams als "Application Support Engineer (m/w/d) für den Customer Support COMOS" vorzugsweise in Köln oder Düsseldorf.

Gemeinsam die Digitalisierung gestalten!

  • Teamzweck- die gemeinsame Vision, durch die ein Team fokussiert, engagiert und auf seine Ziele ausgerichtet bleibt
  • Kollektive Identität- ein Zugehörigkeitsgefühl, das die Arbeit in einem homogenen und globalen Team erleichtert
  • Sensibilität und Einbeziehung- das Verstehen der Dynamik zwischenmenschlicher Interaktion und die Wertschätzung anderer Meinungen
  • Vertrauen und Verletzlichkeit- die Bereitschaft von Teams, im zwischenmenschlichen Umgang Risiken einzugehen
  • Konstruktive Spannungen- die gestalterische Kraft, aus der neue Ideen und Erfolge erwachsen
  • Homeoffice als neue Normalität- mit Offenheit und Vertrauen das New Normal flexibel gestalten und trotzdem mittels moderner Lösungen den Zusammenhalt waren

Wie gestaltest Du die Welt von morgen? Herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert!

  • Du verantwortest die Umsetzung spezifischer Kundenanforderung (in Deutsch und Englisch) in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Bereichen Produktentwicklung und Produktmanagement
  • Du leistest Support für den Kunden, beantwortest eingehende Service-Anfragen und unterstützst bzw. koordinierst aktiv Kundenprojekte
  • Mit den technischen Anforderungen der Kunden kennst Du Dich aus und identifizierst etwaige Defizite - Abweichungen besprichst Du in regelmäßiger Kommunikation mit dem Kunden und berätst hinsichtlich der Priorisierung
  • Du erarbeitest Kundenlösungen in Zusammenarbeit mit der Produktentwicklung und dem Produktmanagement und transferierst das Know-how zum Kunden
  • Du analysierst alternative Lösungsmöglichkeiten und setzt diese in Abstimmung mit den Entscheidungsträgern um
  • Deine Arbeitserfahrung erlaubt es Dir Dich auch in komplexen Projektumgebungen sicher und eigenverantwortlich zu bewegen

Wie wirst Du Teil unseres Teams? Mit viel Leidenschaft und Mut!

  • Neben Deinem technisches Studium bringst Du Erfahrung im Bereich Customer Support mit - idealerweise auch Kenntnisse in der Anwendung mit Azure DevOps
  • Du bist IT-Affin und verfügst über CAE/CAD Kenntnisse insbesondere COMOS und hast Kenntnisse von Standards, Applikationssoftware, Softwareplattformen und Betriebssystemen
  • Auch objektorientierter Programmiersprachen wie C#, VB6 und C++ sind Dir nicht fremd
  • Wichtig ist es komplexe, technische Konzepte klar und effektiv zu kommunizieren oder präsentieren zu können
  • Du bist gerne auch beruflich in Deiner Region unterwegs und verstehst unsere Kunden in deutsch und englisch

contents:
If you really want to make a difference - make it with us

Siemens Mobility is a separately managed company of Siemens AG and has been a leading supplier in the field of mobility for over 160 years. Our core business includes rail vehicles, rail automation and electrification solutions, turnkey systems and related services. We have always been very innovative in making traveling faster, safer and more comfortable. Today, we need new solutions to new challenges such as climate change and rising populations worldwide. That's what drives us. That's why we shape mobility with passion, always being one step ahead. Through digitalization, we make infrastructures smart and create opportunities that get us from A to B sustainably and seamlessly. Our 38,200 employees are pioneers in mobility who help to keep the world moving.

Your new role - challenging and future-oriented

  • In our "Control, Communication and Information" department we craft the control system for our environmental-friendly Siemens locomotives. For the verification within the European approval process of electric and diesel-electric locomotives we are looking for reinforcement as soon as possible.
  • In your new role you will prepare approval documents in the areas of vehicle control, especially train control systems, data recorders, train radio and the train control functions.
  • To this end, you will work hand in hand with colleagues (f/m/d) in systems engineering on the creation of approval certificates and the associated creation process.
  • You will ensure that the verification process is complete and timely and will be in contact with internal and external partners.
  • You will continuously expand your system knowledge and increasingly gain a functionally broad view of the vehicle control of our locomotives.

Your qualifications - solid and appropriate

  • You have completed a technical degree (e.g. electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, mechatronics).
  • Furthermore, you help us best if you already have several years of professional experience in the field of rail vehicle engineering.
  • Ideally, you have already gained sound knowledge in approval process for rail vehicles in Europe and have already successfully completed approval projects as part of your project experience.
  • It is helpful if you assumed responsibility for approval-relevant functions in development and verification.
  • You enjoy getting to grips with complex problems and working on them together with colleagues. In addition, you have proficient skills in English, your German language skills are B2 or better and you are willing to travel throughout Europe (approx. 10 %).

Getting in touch with us - straightforward and direct

www.siemens.de/mobility
if you would like to find out more about Siemens before applying.
+49 (9131) 17 52430
if you wish to discuss any initial questions with our recruitment team. The contact person handling this job ad is Peter Wiebories.
www.siemens.com/careers
if you would like more information about jobs and careers at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

Experience Level: Mid-level Professional

Full / Part time: Full-time
name: Engineer (f/m/d) certification of approval for Locomotives

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Die Digitalisierung stellt viele Unternehmen vor große Herausforderungen und wird die Prozesse in den kommenden Jahren immens verändern. So auch bei der Siemens Mobility GmbH - als IT Architect & Service Integrator (w/m/d) werden Sie bei uns aktiv ein Siemens Teamcenter Transformationsprojekt mitgestalten und begleiten. Das Projekt arbeitet nach der SAFe-Methodik.

Was tragen Sie bei?

  • In Ihrer Rolle verantworten Sie die Analyse, das Entwerfen, Implementieren und Optimieren komplexer Teamcenter-Lösungen/-Module und geeigneter Architekturen für das Siemens Mobility Business.
  • Damit dies gelingt, supporten und entwickeln Sie Lösungen, IT-Prozesse sowie Anwendungen innerhalb der bestehenden Mobility Teamcenter-Landschaft, aufgrund der Verifizierung neuer Konzepte und Anforderungen, weiter.
  • Darüber definieren und integrieren Sie Teamcenter-Lösungen, inkl. Schnittstellengestaltung zu ERP- und Legacy-Systemen, in das Ökosystem des Unternehmens.
  • Sie dokumentieren selbständig die Applikations-Landschaft und -Architektur, pflegen und steuern die Richtlinien und Prinzipien inklusive Softwareauswahlkriterien.
  • Zudem definieren Sie das Rahmenwerk für Regeln und der übergeordneten Change- und Release-Prozesse, um Qualitätsanforderungen zu gewährleisten.
  • Sie leisten Applikations- und Prozesssupport, um auch weiterhin effiziente und harmonische Geschäftsprozesse und Strukturen zu gewährleisten.
  • Außerdem arbeiten Sie mit internationalen Kollegen in interdisziplinären Teams (inkl. Integration und Aussteuerung von Lieferanten) zusammen.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik-, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einer ähnlichen Studienrichtung.
  • Zudem verfügen Sie über langjährige fundierte Berufserfahrung als IT Architect & Service Integrator (w/m/d) im Bereich Teamcenter-Design & Entwicklung, sowie Konfiguration/Customizing, mit verteilter Systemumgebung und Integration von großen Softwaretools.
  • Sie zeichnet zudem Expertise in der Implementierung von Projekten und Change Requests inkl. des dazugehörigen Controlling & Administration aus.
  • Sie bringen theoretische und praktische Erfahrungen für Teamcenter Active Integration Gateway, SAP-Anbindung mit T4S/T4ST und idealerweise grundlegende SAP-Kenntnisse (z.B.: BAPI / Webservices) mit.
  • Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit in globalen Teams sowie idealerweise der fachlichen Führung/Management von Mitarbeitenden zeichnen Sie aus.
  • Gute Kenntnisse in Produktentstehungsprozessen in der Fertigungsindustrie sind wünschenswert.
  • Verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse sind aufgrund der globalen Unternehmensausrichtung und Funktion unbedingte Voraussetzung. Die Bereitschaft zu Dienstreisen (ca.20%) rundet Ihr Profil ab.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns haben Sie die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Sie zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein können. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Attraktive Konditionen

Sie erhalten ein attraktives Vergütungspaket einschließlich der Leistungen des Tarifvertrages (z.B. Zusatzentgelte und Urlaubsgeld) und weiteren Extras (z.B. betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Aktienprogramm).

Weiterentwicklung

Wir bieten Ihnen umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Mit unserem Learning Campus verfügen wir über einen Inhouse-Dienstleister mit einem vielfältigen On- und Offline-Angebot.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt?

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zum unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld - herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert

In unserem Werk München Allach fertigen wir moderne Lokomotiven für den Güterverkehr weltweit. Lernen Sie unser Werk näher kennen:
www.siemens.de/allach-jobs
#Jobs-mit-Loks #Allach

  • In Ihrer neuen Rolle schweißen Sie anspruchsvolle Baugruppen aus unlegiertem Baustahl im MAG-Verfahren in den Schweißpositionen: Wannenlage, horizontale und vertikale Position (PA, PB und PF evtl. PE).
  • Hierfür überprüfen Sie zunächst ob alle Materialien und benötigten Dokumente vorhanden sind, damit Sie den Schweißvorgang erfolgreich durchführen können.
  • Sie dokumentieren die ordnungsgemäße Arbeitsausführung und haben stets die einschlägigen Arbeitssicherheits- und Schweißvorschriften (z. B. WPS, Zeichnung) im Blick.

Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat

  • Grundlage Ihres Erfolges bildet eine technische Berufsausbildung oder vergleichbar erworbene Berufserfahrung.
  • Zudem überzeugen Sie mit erster Berufserfahrung als Schweißer (w/m/d) im Stahlbau.
  • Wenn Sie noch dazu gut Deutsch sprechen und bereit sind im 3-Schichtdienst zu arbeiten, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung.

So treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt - einfach und direkt

contents:
Aboutus:

SiemensPLM Software is a world-leading provider of product lifecycle management (PLM)software. We help thousands of companies make great products by optimizingtheir lifecycle processes, from planning and development through manufacturingand support.

Byproviding thoughtfully integrated information at exactly the right time, in thecorrect context, and with the precise level of detail for everyone involved inthe product lifecycle process, our customers achieve a new level ofproductivity, make inquisitive, timely decisions and deliver great products

Positionoverview:

SiemensPLM Software is looking for a highly qualified candidate to provide enterpriseintegration pre-sales, architecture, configuration, and implementationservices. A very strong knowledge of Teamcenter PLM fundamentals is required.The successful candidate must be able to conduct customer business processassessments, evaluate existing processes and suggest new improved ones. Thisindividual must understand diverse environments where the latest in PLM, ERPand MES software is being deployed, as they will be at the forefront of helpingto create integrated enterprise software landscapes.

Responsibilities:

  • Apply advanced knowledge of customer business needs, engineering and manufacturing processes, industry standard methodologies and competitive differentiation, prepare and deliver customized demonstrations of Integration products and solutions to customers in support of selling efforts
  • Educate customers on the strategic business benefits of Integration products and solutions and answer questions on capabilities and usage and solve sales and customer problems
  • Ability to architect and design integration solutions between Teamcenter and other enterprise applications.
  • Lead projects requiring a solid overall understanding of manufacturing systems (PLM), manufacturing processes and data flow into enterprise applications such as ERP, CRM, MES, MRP, and others.
  • Act as the ultimate authority on the integration design to address business problems.
  • Provide direction for integration design, deployment, and rollout activities.
  • Assist in the development of integration proposals based on requirements; deliver solution proposals in context of customer meetings.
  • Responsibilities typically include leading workshops, being responsible for the technical content of the integration solution and design specifications, validating solution configurations, leading unit testing, and acting as an advisor to the team supporting customer user acceptance testing and deployment activities.
  • Technical delivery experience required, but also requires the ability to act as a leader and technical mentor to the supporting Integration Implementation Consultants.
  • Work comfortably and collaboratively with other Siemens resources when required.
  • Work on projects both internally and at customer sites.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or another technical field is required. Additional certifications that reflect an ongoing investment in yourself will be an added plus
  • 5-7 years of experience with Teamcenter Product Lifecycle Management solutions in a customer facing technical delivery role is required. Functional Process expertise in SAP Business Suite or Oracle E-Business Suite preferred
  • Exercise strong problem-solving skills to overcome obstacles. Have a meticulous attention to detail.
  • Understands the competitive landscape as well as industry trends in manufacturing
  • Shown soft skills, business acumen, and the ability to read the room and effectively communicate and present to a diverse audience including technical and non-technical audiences including both Siemens and customer management teams
  • Must have excellent oral and written communications skills
  • Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, Project, Visio, and Outlook;
  • The ability to travel both domestic and international approximately 30% of the time after COVID restrictions are lifted
  • Exercises integrity and confidentiality when taking care of sensitive corporate and partner information.
  • Additional Experience in Enovia, Windchill or other PLM products will be considered.
  • Preferred work locations: Milford, OH; Chicago, IL; Detroit, MI.

Thesalary range for this position is $136,700 to $246,100 and thisrole is eligible to earn incentive compensation. The actual compensationoffered is based on the successful candidate's work location as well asadditional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevanteducation/training. Siemens offers a variety of health and wellness benefits toemployees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com.In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

AtSiemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We needthe most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

name: Principal Integration Architect REMOTE

contents:
Are you brave enough to challenge yourself?

Siemens Digital Industries Software is not a manufacturing company. We are a growing software company - bringing the technologies and innovations of tomorrow to our customers today. With the resources and opportunities of a large corporation, your opportunities are endless. The role you apply for today, is only the first step in your Siemens journey.

Join our team as Solution Architect Process Industry (f/m/d) and help us digitalize the future.

Our hybrid work model allows you to flexibly work from home, at customer sites or on-site at any of our 18 locations within Germany.

We support your mobility with a company car or a BahnCard 100.

How are you shaping the world of tomorrow? Challenging and future-oriented!

Digitalization poses major challenges for many companies and will change processes immensely in the coming years; everyone is talking about the buzzwords (e.g. closed loop manufacturing, product lifecycle management or Totally Integrated Automation, digital twin, Industry 4.0). We help our customers to face the transformation challenges they are facing on the path to sustainable and superior competitiveness.

We are looking for consultants who have already gained initial project experience with the customer and who can quickly integrate into our product landscape based on their MOM and PLM know-how.

  • As a MOM specialist, you will bring together the requirements of our customers and the solutions developed in pre-sales. You define concrete architectures based on customer needs, of course always with a view to optimal economic feasibility.
  • You are responsible for the targeted integration of the architectures into the overall systems, considering existing IT system landscapes.
  • You will work on-site at the customer's location as far as possible, both on your own and in project teams
  • In the event of technical problems arising in the customer project business, you will support our internal support and product development in order to work together to find a solution
  • As a technical expert, you will actively work on the documentation and further development of best practices and the further expansion of our knowledge database

Our culture is characterized by an open and cooperative atmosphere, the team at the center.

With us, you will be involved in exciting, highly complex projects at renowned and successful companies from various industries with the opportunity to act on your own responsibility. Reach for it!

How do you become part of our team? With a lot of drive and passion!

  • Methodical competence in consulting and concept development
  • You have process knowledge from one or more industries in the environment of product development and/or manufacturing and service
  • You know the benefits of the PLM philosophy, and understand the role of our products
  • You can guide the customer on the way to the realization of his individual PLM needs
  • Knowledge in CPG/FMCG processes and Industry
  • You like to communicate with people, and you are confident and confident with customers
  • You can familiarize yourself with new topics independently
  • Our customers experience you as enthusiastic, competent and with subtle powers of persuasion
  • Since we work very closely with our customers, a high degree of willingness to travel is required
  • Very good knowledge of German and English, both written and spoken

We offer an international environment with more than 140,000 customers around the world who already rely on our expertise in digitization. In Germany, more than 2,000 colleagues are involved in exciting and varied customer projects in the aerospace, automotive and transportation, consumer products and retail, electronics and semiconductors, energy and utilities, industrial machinery and heavy machinery, maritime, and medical devices and pharmaceuticals industries. With us, you will find a team-oriented work environment, comprehensive training options and attractive benefits. Through individual target agreements and diverse career models with specialization options, we offer you the opportunity to grow professionally and personally.


Are you an innovator? Then become part of our team!

If you would like to clarify initial questions with our recruiting team, please contact us by mail: careers-DACH.sisw@siemens.com

Contact person for this job posting is Marc Lerch.

Want to learn more about Siemens Digital Industries Software before you apply? Check out Mission / Vision and our software portfolio - or visit our homepage.

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities.
At Siemens, we believe people who've had real experiences dealing with being different will excel as leaders. Let's foster a culture of creativity and innovation. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

contents:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.
 

The Team:

We, as Extractor Teams at Celonis, bring the customer data into the EMS (Execution Management System), we are the entry point for our customers. We are responsible for extracting data from a wide variety of source systems (JDBC based and cloud databases, and streaming solutions) in a performant, robust and scalable way. In addition to our in-house built native integrations, we also give our customers a possibility to build their own extractor via a low-code development tool. We continuously work on improving data integration experience.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead in technical architecture and setting the technical vision within Extractors area.
  • Oversee the development and implementation for highly complex applications, tools, systems and workflows.
  • Lead the exploration of new trends, technologies and information, and evaluate these trends to pitch applicable projects that impacts Celonis through innovation.
  • Receive work in the form of objectives that regularly require innovation around original ideas.
  • Translate targeted solutions into end-to-end architectural designs.
  • Independently own multiple large problem spaces with significant ambiguity.
  • Consistently demonstrate ability to go deep into a variety of domains.
  • Communicate well to all levels of product development and across the company.
  • Navigate open-ended technical and workflow discussions, helping reach conclusions or constructive next steps.
  • Proactively engage with internal and external peers and management to develop unprecedented solutions.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
  • 15+ years of professional software development experience.
  • Expert knowledge and hands-on experience in an object-oriented programming language (ideally Java) and design patterns.
  • Exhibit excellent programming skills and a strong ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues.
  • Have a strong background in architecting reusable large-scale software components, developing scalable and highly available microservices, and a good understanding of  interrelationships between software components and systems.
  • Skilled in driving technical solutions to complex and ambiguous problems, with a focus on stability and scalability, and with cross-team collaboration.
  • Experienced working with cloud technologies, as well as with threading, concurrency, and performance tuning.
  • Experience in building integrations with different databases, designing data pipelines, and dealing with big data is a big plus.
  • Experienced in measuring, managing, and resolving technical debt to ensure the long-term viability of software systems.
  • Possess strong facilitation and communication skills, both in written and oral forms.
  • Capable of supporting and coaching mid- to senior-level colleagues.

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis enables customers to optimize their business processes. Powered by its leading process mining technology, Celonis provides a unique set of capabilities for business executives and users to continuously find improvement opportunities within and across processes, and execute targeted actions to rapidly enhance process performance. This optimization yields immediate cash impact, radically improves customer experience, and reduces carbon emissions. Celonis has thousands of implementations with global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
name: Senior Staff Software Engineer

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a Treasury Integrations Manager to join the team owning the collaboration and cross-functional effort between Treasury and Product teams. This team is working to streamline processes associated with treasury infrastructure across our products including design, operational needs, and reporting. This position will play a key role in partnering with both Product, Engineering, and Treasury on business roadmap and key initiatives. 

What you'll work on:

  • Developing and documenting problem statements and business needs for Treasury with input from subject-matter experts.
  • Supporting and facilitating the success of integration projects resulting from business need and Product planning such as feature updates, banking integrations, Treasury Management Systems, etc. 
  • Defining and developing project plans from a Treasury perspective where applicable.
  • Reviewing the Product organization’s project plans, designs and features to evaluate impact on Treasury organization.
  • Collaborating with Product, SMEs and Treasury leads to review project(s) scope and requirements including reporting, tooling, or other needs.
  • Supporting roadmap planning efforts including evaluating time and resources needed from partners.
  • Partnering with Treasury team leads to understand their roles and responsibilities.
  • Developing and communicating project updates within the Treasury Organization.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • 7+ years of experience in consulting, financial services or payments industry required.
  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or related field. 
  • Able to think critically, understand complex topics/technologies, define complex problems by developing concise summarization of technical initiatives put out by the business or problems identified by SMEs.
  • Proven collaborative problem solving skills with the ability to think critically and ask thoughtful questions.
  • Startup mindset.
  • Highly organized and detail oriented.
  • Takes pride in working on projects to successful completion.
  • Excels in a highly collaborative environment with different stakeholders and SMEs.
  • Practical experience creating process documentation and reports.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate information into actionable insights as well as the ability to coordinate feedback under tight timelines.
  • Highly proficient technical writing capabilities.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Chicago, IL. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $135,000 - $180,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

#LI-Remote
name: Treasury Integrations Manager

contents:
Job Title
Patient Monitoring Clinical Solutions Delivery Consultant (West Coast Florida)

Job Description

As a Clinical Services Delivery Specialist (CSDC) you will expertly lead the clinical delivery of HPM (Hospital Patient Monitoring) solutions for customers on the West Coast of Florida, covering Tampa to Fort Myers.

Your role:

  • In this role you will consult and partner with sales to deliver effectively on the customer solution. Responsible for leading the overall on-site or remote delivery of clinical services (education, go live support, troubleshooting, system optimization) and on-site third-party resources. Further the customer relationship and partner extensively with CSIC (Clinical Services Implementation Consultant) and CSWC (Clinical Services Workflow Consultants), Technical Consultants, Integration Engineers, etc.
  • Expertly deliver learning services, solutions, education and/or training (clinical, technical, operational, or strategic) and provide the highest-level customer experience possible in any learning environment (physical or digital).
  • Ensure Philips customers and employees receive consistent, streamlined learning services by using common company style, standards in the delivery of learning services & solutions. Takes a leadership role in the personal ownership of the learner experience.
  • Actively contribute to the design, development, implementation and evaluation of learning services, education and training courses and material, according to the applicable QMS directives and processes.
  • May be responsible for developing and/or reviewing course material, all consistent with adult learning theory for delivery, using interactive tools to keep learners engaged.
  • This position requires overnight travel, estimated to be 75%- that could look like departing your house on Sunday evening for a Monday meeting, and returning Monday or Tuesday, or it could be departing on another day of the week and returning same or different day. There could be weeks requiring travel to multiple hospital sites, all depending on work planned for the week.
You're the right fit if:
  • You have a Bachelor's degree in Nursing or a related science with a focus on education such as Nurse Educator, Clinical Nurse Specialist, Instructor, etc. and more than 5 years of related clinical experience or equivalent combination of education and experience. You also possess a current nursing license. Active CTT+ (Certified Technical Trainer Plus) and VCTT+ (Virtual Certified Technical Trainer Plus) certification are preferred.
  • You have experience delivering education in a formal classroom setting and preferably virtually/remotely as well, and a solid understanding of Adult learning principles and concepts. You are passionate about education delivery!
  • You preferable have previous experience with Philips Patient Monitoring products.
  • You are experienced and skilled with consulting and negotiation.
  • You must be able to meet all customer specific mandates such as vaccinations and or screening tests.
  • You must be able to successfully perform the following minimum Physical, Cognitive and Environmental job requirements with or without accommodation for this Clinical position.
  • You're a road warrior and are comfortable with travel overnight 75% of the time.
About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.
  • Learn more about our business .
  • Discover our rich and exciting history.
  • Learn more about our purpose.
  • Read more about our employee benefits .
If you're interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here .

Additional Information

US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa, now or in the future.

Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. For this position, you must reside in or within commuting distance to the Tampa or Fort Myers areas.

#LI-Remote

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was trägst Du bei?

Wir suchen einen Werkstudenten (w/m/d) mit Schwerpunkt Change & Communication, der uns bei dem Transformationsprogramm SHERPA X - Project Business unterstützt.

  • Als unser neuer Werkstudent (w/m/d) unterstützt Du das Team des Program Management Office bei diversen Tätigkeiten wie z.B. der Meeting-Vorbereitung und der Pflege der Dokumentenablage.
  • Idealerweise kannst Du deine Erfahrung im Bereich digitaler Tools und Applikationen bei der Erstellung oder Weiterentwicklung digitaler Lösungen zur Programmsteuerung einbringen.
  • Du bist im Bereich "Organizational Chance Management" tätig und hilfst bei der Erstellung von Kommunikationsmaterial sowie der Organisation von verschiedenen Change-Management Aktivitäten.

Was bringst Du mit?

  • Du bist eingeschriebener Student und stehst uns für 20 h/Woche zur Verfügung.
  • Idealerweise bringst Du erste Erfahrung im Bereich der Erstellung von digitalen Tools und Applikationen mit.
  • Erfahrungen in der Erstellung von Kommunikationsunterlagen sind wünschenswert.
  • Im Umgang mit MS Office bist Du dir sicher.
  • Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und hast sehr gute Englischkenntnisse.

Was bieten wir Dir?

Inklusion & Vielfalt

Bei Siemens Mobility setzen wir uns gegen Ungerechtigkeit und Ungleichheit ein. Bei uns findest Du ein Umfeld vor, in dem Du Du selbst sein kannst und dazugehörst.

Purpose

Wir sind Pioniere der Mobilität. Bei uns trägst Du in einem Zukunftsmarkt aktiv zu Verkehrswende und Klimaschutz bei, weil unsere Transportlösungen in aller Welt den CO2-Ausstoß verringern.

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns hast Du die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Du zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein kannst. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie trittst Du mit uns in Kontakt?

www.siemens.de/mobility
wenn Du vor deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchtest.
+49 (9131) 17 52430
wenn Du erste Fragen gern persönlich mit unserem Recruiting Team klären möchtest. Ansprechpartner für diese Stellenausschreibung ist Frau Julia Greff.
www.siemens.com/mobility-jobs
wenn Du mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchtest.

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

contents:
Location: Munich

Department: Controlling and Finance

Mode of Employment: permanent/ full time

Accelerate your career. Become a leader.

Our mission at Controlling and Finance Assurance (CF A) is to provide objective, factual and independent foresight to help Siemens be excellent and to improve the overall success of the company. As a business partner to Siemens management, we leverage our expertise in a wide range of topics in order to create an impact. Ecosystems of collaboration provide a basis to derive and apply innovative methodologies for a new level of assurance. We offer an inspiring, diverse and inclusive environment for our people to develop professionally and personally. Our core values, being respectful, curious, humble and open, define how we work together as a department.

To deliver on our vision of being pioneers in assurance and a talent incubator for Siemens, CF A offers a unique Grow and Development Model. We believe int the concept of lifelong learning and therefore encourage our people towards a mindset where continuous upskilling and reskilling becomes a natural part of our career. We invest in our expertise and therefore provide continuous career coaching, trainings and mentoring, all whilst working with top Siemens business leaders on multiple high-profile projects around the world. This is your chance to build your network within the company and become part of a truly diverse, international and innovative team.

As digitalization and technology gains increasing significance to Siemens, our Digitalization & IT Assurance Practice plays a pivotal role in providing assurance to the Managing Board and the Audit Committee on these topics. We as CF A create impact by exploring the bold questions around digitalization, cloud computing, data privacy and implementation of large IT projects. Using advanced analytics, visualization technologies and artificial intelligence, CFA is actively working on the future of assurance. Are you an authentic and persuasive spirit with a holistic and digital mindset who can not only leverage their own expertise but also inspire and empower people to give their best? Be bold and apply now for the position of (Senior) Audit Associate.

To discover more about CF A have a look at www.siemens.com/cfa.

What part will you play?

  • Identify key risks in Siemens's digital environments (e.g. SAP ERP, S/4 Hana and other IT-Systems) that form the backbone of our company, major IT transformation projects, new digital products and business models.
  • Design and execute comprehensive audit programs and controls to address the identified risks.
  • Enhance and challenge existing audit techniques.
  • Develop and promote digital use cases that increase coverage and the overall assurance in cooperation with our data analytics partners.
  • Mentor your fellow team members by sharing your expertise and lead by example in challenging environments.
  • Take ownership for audit topics within your relevant expertise.
  • Independently drive assurance objectives, define and align conclusions and recommended improvements to drive change in the organization.
  • Collaborate with external auditors to ensure effective and efficient audit procedures.
  • Lead meetings with clients to present the team's conclusions and recommended improvements.
  • Actively contribute to shaping the future of the practice by identifying priorities and implementing changes.
  • Maintain and build your network in various Siemens businesses and functions.
  • Make use of the unique chance to participate in audits within other functional areas offered in CF A.
  • Conduct your audit engagements using CF A's Agile Audit Framework.

What you need to make real what matters.

  • At least 7+ years of professional experience within Siemens, a technology company, or a respected assurance and consulting firm.
  • Strong academic history with a degree in IT, Business, Engineering or Finance.
  • Experience and advanced knowledge in at least one of the following areas: IT risk management and assurance, implementing digital use cases or possessing an expert view on digital business models, state-of-the-art technology (e.g. cloud computing, SAP ERP, S/4 Hana, blockchain, artificial intelligence, edge computing, DevOps).
  • Profound experience in complex IT projects and agile environments.
  • Advanced knowledge of IT controls.
  • Know how of basic logic programming.
  • Strong desire and drive to develop into a leadership role in the business.
  • Tech savvy and possessing the ability to provide assurance over new digitalization initiatives and emerging technologies.
  • Excellent communication skills in order to maximize audit results.
  • Proven track record of career development.
  • Fluency in English and flexibility to travel internationally as well as to live/ embrace our work remotely culture.What we offer.

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a future global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package, relocation and visa sponsoring if needed
  • CF A Grow & Development program for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Find more benefits here

Any questions left?

Click here if you wish to find out more about Siemens before applying.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

#LI-GET

#LI-CK1

Experience Level: Experienced Professional

Full / Part time: Full-time

contents:
ABOUT SOTHEBY'S

Established in 1744, Sotheby’s is the world’s premier destination for art and luxury. Synonymous with innovation, Sotheby’s promotes access, connoisseurship and preservation of fine art and rare objects through auctions, private sales and retail locations. Our trusted global marketplace is supported by a network of specialists spanning 40 countries and 50 categories, which include Contemporary Art, Modern and Impressionist Art, Old Masters, Chinese Works of Art, Jewelry, Watches, Wine and Spirits, and Interiors, among many others.

 

THE ROLE

We are revolutionizing a 276-year-old business, and we’re growing our technology team with software engineers and leaders who will help reshape the future of Sotheby’s through exceptional engineering practices, software development, and design. 

The ideal Director of Engineering candidate will help us lead engineering teams to build a healthy and productive engineering team and culture and oversee technical delivery, vision, and product development practices.  We’re looking for team players who value opinions other than their own, look to data to support their decisions, take the initiative, and improve areas they touch.

The team is a remote-first team distributed across multiple countries, and we require strong communicators who can work in a diverse, multicultural environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead a team of dozens of engineers building and operating the core platforms and infrastructure that power the company's products and services in a microservices environment. This includes data pipelines, APIs, messaging systems, databases, cloud infrastructure, etc.
  • Partner with product and business leaders to understand their technology needs and develop long-term technical roadmaps and architecture.
  • Drive engineering best practices in areas like security, reliability, scalability, and performance. Guide technical decision-making, standards, and trade-offs.
  • Hire and cultivate top engineering talent—coach and mentor team members to help them develop technically and take on more responsibility.
  • Promote a culture of technical excellence, continuous improvement, and innovation within the engineering organization.
  • Facilitate communication and alignment across engineering teams. Identify and remove cross-team blockers and bottlenecks.
  • Oversee systems design, implementation, troubleshooting, upgrades, and problem resolution.
  • Manage technical budgets and resources efficiently.

IDEAL EXPERIENCE & COMPETENCIES

  • 10+ years of overall engineering experience with at least 5 years of management experience leading teams of engineers.
  • Deep hands-on experience architecting and developing distributed systems and cloud infrastructure.
  • Experienced in areas like Unix/Linux, networking, databases, asynchronous messaging, containers, and automation.
  • Strong knowledge and experience with Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Experience with gRPC and GraphQL a plus.
  • Strong communication, leadership, and organizational abilities.
  • BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field.

The Company complies with applicable state and local laws prohibiting discrimination in employment in every jurisdiction in which it operates.
name: Director of Engineering, Platform

contents:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.
 

The Role:

As a Value Engineer, you are spearheading our mission of data-driven business transformation with our customers. You will work in partnership with the Celonis Sales Teams and have full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers. You are our customers trusted advisor and help them achieve their strategic goals and realize significant value using Celonis EMS. In collaboration with our partners and Celonis Services, you will drive measurable business impact across various processes and industries and accelerate the adoption of our platform. You will blend deep process and industry expertise with a proven consulting skill set with strong analytical skills at the forefront of one of the fastest-growing tech companies worldwide.

The work you’ll do:

Identify & Frame Value

  • Discover and translate customers’ strategic priorities into high-impact Celonis use cases
  • Build demos and business cases, leveraging industry benchmarks and best practices in order to win new customers 
  • Undertake Value Assessments or Proof-of-Value Projects and communicate the value opportunity and strategic roadmap to C-Level executives

Realize Value

  • Facilitate business value workshops and use Celonis to identify and qualify opportunities for process enhancement
  • Derive improvement measures in core business functions and initiate improvement actions and enterprise-wide change initiatives
  • Present results and realized value to senior management and C-level executives

Scale Value

  • Responsible for the end-to-end customer value journey, landing, expanding, adoption and renewing
  • Build a strategic expansion roadmap for customers embedding Celonis EMS as a strategic business transformation platform in their organization and therefore drive adoption and expansion
  • Provide feedback to our product development teams to enhance the Celonis platform and Apps based on new use cases

 

The qualifications you need:

  • Live for Customer Value: Several years experience in an analytical role with the objective to demonstrate or secure value through business data analysis, business process improvement and respective Software deployment. Ideally in a customer-facing role in Solution Consulting, Sales Engineering or IT/Management Consulting with a Business Software / SaaS Provider or a Consultancy. Alternatively in an Inhouse role (e.g. Center of Excellence for Data Mining / Analytics / Intelligence) within an Enterprise.
  • Data, Analytics, Applications & IT: Good knowledge of Business Software / SaaS applications (e.g. SAP),  experience with implementing RPA and/or BI Tools and/or building Dashboards, Apps and Action Flows. Knowledge of Python and/or SQL. Experience in collaborating with IT teams.
  • Process Improvement & Value Realization: Experience in identifying use cases for business process improvement and deploying improvement measures,  being a change agent and training users/process owners to realize value
  • Project Management: Experience in planning and managing project scopes, expectations and timelines. You will manage multiple projects across your aligned accounts that will be at different parts of the value journey. Also, you will leverage partners from the Celonis Ecosystem wherever possible.
  • Executive Stakeholder Management: Experience in preparing and communicating (value) roadmaps and results to stakeholders and management, both internally and externally. Excellent communication and presentation skills in German and English and sovereign appearance.
  • Business Domain Expertise: Understanding of the Finance and/or Supply Chain domain as well as strategic transformation initiatives (e.g. Shared Services Transformation or System Transformation)
  • Industry Expertise: Ideally expertise in one or more industries (e.g. Manufacturing, Automotive, Consumer, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Chemicals) and the ability to develop a deep understanding of industry trends and strategic opportunities   
  • Degree: in Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a comparable degree program


    #LI-SS6

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis enables customers to optimize their business processes. Powered by its leading process mining technology, Celonis provides a unique set of capabilities for business executives and users to continuously find improvement opportunities within and across processes, and execute targeted actions to rapidly enhance process performance. This optimization yields immediate cash impact, radically improves customer experience, and reduces carbon emissions. Celonis has thousands of implementations with global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.
