contents:
Video: MEET US in 2 Minutes!

Let's make the difference together!

We offer a role with responsibility, independence, and the possibility to contribute proactively. We foster a teamwork culture with room for individual development.

Join our team as "Senior Software Engineer (m/f/d)" in Munich or remotely anywhere in Germany.

Your area of responsibility - exciting and with a view into the future

  • As a Senior Software Engineer, you will act as a liaison between engineers in the software development team and product owners to directly design and engineer significant areas of the software and ensure our technical deliverables meet customer expectations.
  • You can and shall take responsibility for your projects beyond just developing software. You can and shall - together with your colleagues - improve our processes and provide guidance to our junior developers increasing their knowledge to make them an efficient part of the team.
  • You will be accountable for the software deliverables to meet all requirements of quality, scalability, modifiability, extensibility, testability etc. You will help establish effective and agile engineering practices across our engineering team.

Your qualifications - validated and adequate

  • You are a Developer because this is what you love. We will tackle projects that improve your skillset.
  • Proven track record of architecting and engineering commercial applications and services.
  • Proficiency in C++ backed by solid computer science fundamentals.
  • Team player who likes to share his/her knowledge and sees success as a team effort.
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming and architectural design patterns.
  • Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, and complexities.
  • Knowledge of Verilog and/or VHDL is a plus
  • Knowledge in Logic Synthesis is a plus.

What more do I need to know?

Siemens EDA is one of the top tier suppliers in the Electronic Design Automation industry and part of Siemens DI. As a technology leader, the company offers innovative solutions for electronic hardware and software design.

Siemens Digital Industries (DI) is an innovation leader in automation and digitalization. Closely collaborating with partners and customers, we drive the digital transformation in the process and discrete industries. With our Digital Enterprise portfolio, we provide companies of all sizes with an end-to-end set of products, solutions and services to integrate and digitalize the entire value chain. Optimized for the specific needs of each industry, our outstanding portfolio supports customers to achieve greater efficiency and flexibility. We are constantly adding innovations to its portfolio to integrate groundbreaking future technologies. We have our global headquarters in Nuremberg, Germany, and have around 75,000 employees internationally.

We'd love to hear from you, so apply now on siemens.com!

We look forward to your application! Please use only our career platform, which you can access via "Apply now".

Send us an email to careers-DACH.sisw@siemens.com, if you would like to clarify initial questions with our recruiting team. Contact person for this job advertisement is Ms Jaclyn Krieger.

Come and learn more about Siemens Software: Mission / Vision and our software portfolio - or visit our homepage.

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities. At Siemens, we believe people who've had real experiences dealing with being different will excel as leaders. Let's foster a culture of creativity and innovation. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

contents:
Are you interested in being part of a movement that's paving the way for a sustainable future?

Global demand for batteries is skyrocketing as we work towards reducing climate change through the electrification of mobility and the broader energy transition. To meet this demand, the industry needs to produce battery cells on a terawatt scale. Our automation controls, large scale distributed systems, and analytics are fundamentally changing the way batteries are produced. We're looking for motivated individuals to join our team and explore opportunities to drive progress within the battery field.

Create a better tomorrow with us! Ready to explore #YourSpaceToChargeUP+?

Join the #TeamBetterBattery - a team of internal startups. Engage with cell manufacturers, develop pilots, and craft the future of battery manufacturing.

  • Collaborate closely with stakeholders, including customers, development teams, to gather requirements and define product vision and roadmap.
  • Conduct market research and analysis to identify customer needs, market trends, and competitive landscape.
  • Define and prioritize product features, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide development efforts.
  • Create and maintain product backlogs, ensuring that they are well-groomed, properly prioritized, and aligned with business objectives.
  • Work closely with development teams, providing clear and concise product requirements and clarifications.
  • Facilitate communication and collaboration between cross-functional teams, including development, design, QA, and marketing.
  • Conduct regular meetings, such as sprint planning, backlog refinement, and sprint reviews, to ensure alignment and progress.
  • Act as the primary point of contact for product-related inquiries, providing guidance and support to internal teams and stakeholders.
  • Monitor and analyze product metrics and feedback to identify areas for improvement and inform product decisions.
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in product management.
  • Foster a positive team environment and contribute new ideas

What you need to make real what matters.
  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Business Administration) or equivalent practical experience.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience as a Product Owner or similar role in software product development.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of Agile methodologies, such as Scrum, Kanban and SAFe
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex concepts and collaborate with diverse stakeholders in international environments.
  • Demonstrated experience in defining and prioritizing product features based on customer needs and market analysis.
  • Proficiency in using product management tools, such as Jira, Confluence, or similar.
  • Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
  • Ability to adapt and embrace change, while maintaining a positive and proactive attitude.
  • Certification (e.g., SAFe) is a plus.

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • Up to 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your loved ones
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

contents:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow.

We develop networks that supply our cities with light and heat intelligently and we know our way around automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. For these and many other future projects, we need smart thinkers who bring skills, creativity, and dedication to the table. People like you! Experienced researchers who boldly broaden horizons, true specialists, and clever minds who like to get to the bottom of things. In short, help us tackle the most exciting challenges and put into practice what really matters. We'll give you the opportunity to really make a difference. So what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.

What part will you play?

As IT Operations Analyst (f/m/d) Firewall you will be responsible for planning, administration and 2nd level support of firewall and SSL VPN solutions in the high security data center in Munich (DE), Ohio (USA) and Singapore.

In your role, you will implement defined procedures and processes specific to data center firewall operations and perform related operational and/or support activities.

  • You will be responsible for the design and operation of the FW infrastructure including configuration of firewalls and SSL VPN gateways
  • Troubleshooting and fault clearance will be a part of your responsibilities
  • You will analyze and optimize internal processes with extension of automation
  • You will be responsible for optimizing the firewall and SSL VPN infrastructure in terms of costs and benefits, as well as for documenting the network plans from an L2 and L3 perspective, including CMDB
  • You will be responsible for monitoring and managing firewalls and SSL-VPN gateways of several data centers
  • You will also be responsible for vulnerability management with documentation and mitigation
  • You will support projects for the introduction of new firewall and remote access technologies and the development of new individual solutions
  • In addition, you will regularly coordinate with other departments regarding requirements and security aspects and communicate with suppliers and manufacturers (e.g. Checkpoint, Palo Alto)

What you need to make real what matters.
  • You have a degree in computer science (University, FH, BA) or a similar education and several years of experience in the mentioned field
  • You have one to three years of experience in network firewall and remote access environments
  • You have very good knowledge in Cloud Technology (AWS, Azure), Firewall & Routing and Ivanti SSL VPN Gateways and are an expert in CheckPoint and Palo Alto Firewalls
  • You bring analytical skills and strong communication and presentation skills
  • You have experience in creating and maintaining scripts preferably with Python
  • High level of results orientation, willingness to be on-call, and Technical English know-how round off your profile

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

contents:
Who We Are

Siemens Grid Software and Energy Automation

Here at Siemens Grid Software and Energy Automation, our mission is to accelerate and secure the energy transition. We ensure a reliable, affordable energy supply in a decentralizing, decarbonizing, digitalizing, and all-electrifying energy world. No matter where power comes from or where it must go, we ensure it makes its way - every step of the way!

Enterprise Account Management Lead - Utilities

Did you know that over 70% of all electricity in the world flows through infrastructure that was planned or analyzed by Siemens Grid Software?

Designed to accelerate the energy transition and electrification by adding mission-critical capabilities, Siemens Grid Software and Energy Automation help utilities shape the future of their power landscape. We offer a whole spectrum of innovative products and solutions - for energy protection and automation as well as communication technology including data analytics technologies based on digital twin solutions and IoT-applications.

We currently have a unique opportunity for a vibrant Technology Sales Head with the utility domain experience to join a group of innovative and future-thinking people, with a passion for growing technology sales across the United States.

Future Thinker? Read on.

  • Reporting to the VP of Sales, Grid Software, you will identify, implement, and drive sales for our Grid Software and Energy Automation business in the United States. The primary metrics for success in this position are Order Intake and Revenue.
  • Some of the highlights of this role that will contribute to achieving yearly sales targets & overall success include:
  • Leading and supporting enterprise account managers in the development and execution of go-to-market growth initiatives, sales strategies, and account plans.
  • Owning and managing the sales book of business.
  • Coaching and providing thought leadership to the sales team on key/large deals as well as on other strategic/organizational topics.
  • Building/maintaining a team around a positive culture of performance.
  • Cultivate CxO-level relationships with target investor-owned utilities, electric cooperatives, and municipalities.
  • Achieving strategic alignment between global headquarters and the US market on sales priorities, growth, and culture.
  • Driving the launch/roll-out of new offerings and commercial models.
  • Supporting enterprise account managers in the development of business cases for sales-related investment requests.
  • Provides the VP of Sales with weekly updates on forecast, funnel, initiatives, and key opportunities.
  • Clearly communicate Grid Software and Energy Automation's vision, value proposition, and key differentiators to C-level customers - and enable your team to do so.
  • Represent the enterprise utility team in other core functions, such as: product management, marketing, engineering, customer support, and solution delivery.

What Skills Will Help You Succeed

  • Extensive experience (10+ years) selling grid software and energy automation equipment and services to energy utility customers
  • Experienced manager of both direct reports and matrix reports
  • Experience with MEDDICC and/or Challenger selling
  • Demonstrated ability to manage, analyze, and win complex bids
  • You are an owner - you take responsibility for any issue relating to your business
  • Ability to communicate with all levels of an organization including director/VP and C-Suite
  • Ability to create, own and manage sales campaigns
  • Proven track record of account management, including accurate sales forecasting, sales process management, and successful attainment of quota across multiple product lines
  • Demonstrated negotiating skills, conflict management, and a sense of accountability
  • Ability to strategize and creatively solve problems to overcome customer challenges
  • Passionate about leading, empowering, and developing people
  • Have a Bachelors Degree in Science or Business
  • Fluent in English

Location: Remote (anywhere between US Western, Central, and Eastern Time Zones)

Travel: 30%

Find out how Siemens Grid Software is decoding the future of energy and what part you can play: https://sie.ag/DecodingTheFutureOfEnergy

name: Sales Director, Key Account Management - Utilities (remote US)

contents:
Wir verbessern Wohlbefinden und Arbeitsabläufe. Das ist Dein größter Beitrag.

Die Arbeitswelt befindet sich im digitalen kontinuierlichen Wandel. Die Gebäude, in denen wir Arbeiten, entwickeln sich weiter. Sie werden smart und nachhaltig. Die Erwartungen an einen ausgezeichneten innovativen Arbeitsplatz steigen. Mit Hilfe unserer Digital Building & Workplace Solutions ermöglichen wir es unseren Kunden, von den Chancen der Digitalisierung zu profitieren und eine Arbeitsumgebung zu schaffen, bei denen der Mensch im Mittelpunkt steht.

Indoor Navigation, Real Time Location Systems, Asset Tracking, Workplace Apps (Desk Booking und Room Booking) und auch intelligente Infrastrukturen sprechen dich an dann.

Verändere mit uns gemeinsam die Welt von morgen.

  • Du bist zentrale Ansprechperson für unser Portfolio mit Schwerpunkt Software as a Service (SaaS) im Bereich Digital Building & Workplace Solutions
  • Du promotest und standardisierst unser SaaS-Portfolio und definierst Marktpakete
  • Du bereitest und implementierst die Markteinführung des Portfolios in Deutschland und bist im Anschluss Dreh- und Angelpunkt bei Rückfragen zum Portfolio
  • Du kollaborierst mit internationalen Teams und sicherst dadurch die erfolgreiche Anpassung des Portfolios für den deutschen Markt
  • Du hast Freude eng mit Kunden zusammenzuarbeiten und unterstützt unser Sales & Customer Success Management Team bei wichtigen Kundengesprächen, internen Veranstaltungen oder auch externen Messen im deutschen Markt
  • Du bist die Ansprechperson für Expertise zu sinnvollen technischen Umsetzungsmöglichkeiten und identifizierst Kundenanforderung, um diese ins Portfolio Management einzubeziehen.
  • Du analysierst Markttrends und Mitbewerber und bewertest und priorisierst neue Ideen und erarbeitest Machbarkeitsanalysen
  • Im Rahmen von dedizierten Trainingseinheiten und Kundenprojekten vermittelst du sowohl Grundlagen wie auch Fachwissen im SaaS-Bereich von Digital Building & Workplace Solutions
  • Du gewährleistest die Erstellung und Verfügbarkeit von Dokumentation, Schulungen, Marketingmaterial und technischen Vorführungen

Dein Profil für zusammen "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Du verfügst über mehrjährige Erfahrung im Portfolio Management von Software as a Service (SaaS) Anwendungen, idealerweise im Smart Infrastructure oder Digital Buildings Umfeld
  • Du hast Expertise im Software-Kontext und bei Cloud Technologien, z. B. APIs, Konnektivität und UI/UX
  • Du überzeugst durch ein exzellentes Verständnis der unterschiedlichen IoT-Lösungen am Markt und kannst dein Wissen auf die verschiedenen Bedürfnisse unserer Kunden übertragen und Lösungskonzepte erstellen
  • Wir freuen uns zudem, wenn du die aktuellen Trends und Innovationen in der modernen Gebäudetechnik kennst, insbesondere im Bereich Smart Infrastructure
  • Du verstehst es, zuzuhören und hast ein feines Gespür für die möglichen Herausforderungen der Kunden
  • Außerdem bist du eine Persönlichkeit, die gerne in internationalen Teams und mit Technologie-Partnern zusammenarbeitet und mit ihren Kommunikationsfähigkeiten unsere Kunden begleitet und berät
  • Ein Masterabschluss zusammen mit sehr guten Deutsch- und Englischkenntnissen machen dein Profil komplett

Was wir bieten.

  • Coaching bei Deiner persönlichen und fachlichen Weiterentwicklung
  • Empowerment - als Basis für Deine Tätigkeit,
  • New Work Modus mit 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als zukünftiger, weltweiter Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Dich und Deine Familie ermöglichen
  • Aktienprogramme um Miteigentümer der Siemens AG zu werden
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

name: IoT Senior Portfolio Manager (w/m/d) Digital Building & Workplace Solutions (SaaS)

contents:
Make the future of industrial operations become reality..

Here at Digital Industries, one of the main pillars of Siemens, we are the market leader in industrial automation. Our products and services are used in factories across the world, from car production to pharmaceutical plants.

We know that future operation will be different than today. And we want to be the inspiring leader, building the future jointly with customers and partners. Delivering real value fast, in collaboration, solving fundamental problems, growing sustainability, optimizing systems, and living the change, this is what drives us in our daily operations.

For this we have created the Future of Industrial Operations. Our goal is to do nothing less than transforming the industry and ourselves, Siemens.

We are crafting a portfolio for tomorrow, iterating fast over new ideas and being in close touch with our customers to integrate their feedback back to the products we built.

With this approach, we are building the bridge into a sustainable world of tomorrow. Fast, agile and purpose driven, for us and the next generations to come.

What part will you play?

In your role as "DevOps Engineer" you will be at the core, that our future portfolio offerings become reality.

  • You will ensure the setup and maintenance of an efficient and future-proof infrastructure which enables software development teams to deliver at speed, with high quality, high reliability, and reusing components wherever possible
  • You will work on the templates provided by the central DevOps Enablement team, adapt them where needed towards your project needs, always with the focus to reach new levels of productivity using CI/CD
  • We are looking forward to your contribution in regards to best practices to enable our internal and external partners and to develop world class solutions based on our portfolio
  • Keeping the dots togethers, shape an inner-source community, and automate whatever is possible are other important tasks
  • You proficiently communicate and coordinate with other internal and external organizations and departments

What you need to make real what matters.

  • You are having a bachelor degree in computer science, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
  • Profound technical domain expertise working as a DevOps Engineer is your background
  • With multiple years of experience with CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code and Kubernetes you are well prepared
  • Your experience in providing Infrastructure as Code templates with tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, Crossplane, etc. is solid
  • You have expertise with cloud providers like AWS, Azure, etc.
  • Working experience as a Full-Stack SW Engineer with languages as Python, Node.js (TypeScript), JavaScript, Go, Java, or C# will help you getting to the core
  • Additionally very good know how in Jira, Visual Studio Code, K8s, FluxCD, Docker, et al. is of advantage
  • You can offer very good experiences in using and customizing Gitlab, Github, which are basis of code.siemens.com
  • Deriving best practices and providing profound documentations to a broad internal as well as external audience is something you did before
  • Fluent communication in English is your daily business and you are an absolute team player

To learn more check us out on: https://github.com/siemens & Siemens AG - Stack Overflow

What we offer.

  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

name: DevOps Engineer (f/m/d)

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you'll be responsible for:

Circle is looking for a passionate Security Leader with an expertise in Blockchain Security, deep understanding of different Blockchain technologies and Cloud based Product development. You’ll be part of the Security Engineering team and closely partner with the Engineering teams responsible for the development, deployment of USDC and supporting services.

What you'll work on: 

  • Own Circle’s Blockchain Security strategy, implementation and operationalization
  • Perform due diligence on potential Blockchains where USDC may be deployed to, in partnership with Product Compliance, Product and Engineering teams.
  • Recommend and validate Security controls and improvements across our technology stack
  • Own and build relationships with key external stakeholders such as customers, vendors, and auditors
  • Produce data-based reports on technology risk for senior management
  • Drive continuous improvement in the tech stack

You will aspire to our four core values: 

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you'll bring to Circle: 

  • 12+ years of experience as a security engineer or product security engineering leader with a minimum of five years (can be overlapping) with a focus on cybersecurity.
  • 5+ years demonstrated experience with security standard methodologies for Blockchain smart contract development and Cryptography
  • Demonstrated ability developing security controls that are easy to test and audit
  • Extensive knowledge of Security tool usage across SDLC including SAST, DAST and/or Security end to end testing
  • Proven experience developing automated, scalable, and reproducible security practices
  • Proficiency in managing multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order or priorities on the fly for themselves and their team.
  • Ability to influence internal and external customers to expediently resolve issues and achieve organizational objectives
  • The ability to design and operate controls that are easy to test and audit
  • Experience working in financial services or financial technology desired
  • Advanced degree in computer science, or related fields strongly preferred.
  • 5+ years proven experience building and managing small to medium sized teams
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Atlanta, GA. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $200,000 - $280,000

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

name: Director, Blockchain Security

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.



Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Du! Hilf uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Dir bieten ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Mach mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Deiner Karriere.

Verändere mit uns die Welt von morgen

  • Du löst mit uns Probleme für die Energiewende im Bereich Schutz und Automatisierung elektrischer Netze
  • In Deiner Rolle bist Du verantwortlich dafür, die Bedürfnisse unserer Kunden zu verstehen und in innovative Algorithmen für den Schutz elektrotechnischer Anlagen und Netze umzusetzen
  • Dabei bist Du an der Umsetzung innovativer Produkte und Lösungen beteiligt (auch mit internationalen Teams)
  • Zu Deiner Aufgabe gehört zudem das Realisieren und Qualifizieren der implementierten Softwarelösungen

Dein Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Masterstudium in Elektrotechnik, Technische Informatik oder einen vergleichbaren Abschluss
  • Du besitzt gute Kenntnisse im Bereich Schutz elektrischer Anlagen und Netze
  • Du verfügst über eine mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Algorithmen sowie in der Signalverarbeitung
  • Du hast grundlegende Kenntnisse in Embedded C/C++, Git und DevOps
  • Du überzeugst uns mit deiner lösungsorientierten und wissenschaftlichen Arbeits- und Vorgehensweise
  • Dazu kommunizierst Du sicher in sehr gutem Deutsch und Englisch

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für deine berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Dich und deine Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende

name: Software Developer (w/m/d) R&D

contents:
>>THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION<<

The Digital Services Building Engineer (DSE) assembles customer HVAC assets in Siemens cloud analytics software to enable ongoing Fault Detection & Diagnostics (FDD) analysis. During lifecycle, the DSE monitors HVAC equipment performance and either reports findings to the customer or coordinates with remote or onsite automation and/or mechanical specialists to resolve the faults identified at the customer's building.

This role is part of the Data Driven Services group in Siemens Smart Infrastructure Digital Service Center (DSC). Our goal is to turn building data into intelligence that yield building owners and service teams with informed recommendations to improve building performance. We strive to reduce energy usage and improve HVAC equipment and system reliability. In this role you will help ensure that buildings run the way they were designed or update control methodologies to improve operation and maximize energy efficiency. You will have the opportunity to work with teams across the US and Canada to optimize building performance across a wide range of building types and industries.

The DSC is headquartered in Austin, Texas. Our team is constantly growing due to an expanding presence in our market. We are looking for new hires in one of two DSE levels based on certifications and years of experience.

Basic Qualifications:

  • S. in Mechanical Engineering or applicable technical degree
  • Certification:
    • Level II: CEM & Engineer in Training (EIT) or PE License preferred
    • Level III: CEM or PE License required
  • Experience:
    • Level II: 4 - 8 years of energy management or HVAC systems / controls design experience
    • Level III: 8+ years of energy management or HVAC system / controls design experience, advanced degrees preferred
  • Effective communication skills to speak with building engineers, maintenance personnel, and/or C-level executives
  • Up to 5% travel is required for occasional Austin based events
  • Where permitted by applicable law, Siemens may require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 based on job requirements, and in accordance with an accommodation based on legally protected reasons
  • Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States without need for current or future employer-sponsored work authorization

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of facility and maintenance operations, maintenance best practices, and HVAC energy efficiency measures
  • Experience with building retro-commissioning, building modeling programs or spreadsheet energy analyses
  • Familiarity with data logging equipment and building automation systems trending
  • Enthusiasm to learn new skills and software
  • Able to adjust communication style to work with a variety of roles and interested parties
  • Confidence presenting recommendations and reports to internal and external stakeholders
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office suite programs, high level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel

Job Duties:

  • Understand components and operation methods of Air Handling Units, Water and Air-cooled Chillers, Cooling Towers, Boilers, Pumps, and Air/Water Distribution systems. Including physical and programmed components.
  • Identify faults and root cause to suggest control changes to improve building operational and energy efficiency
  • Become a subject matter expert of Facility Improvement Measures (FIMs) for HVAC systems
  • Compile customer facing reports and list of action items for operational improvements
  • Estimate energy and operational cost savings associated with identified faults and/or operational improvements
  • Study customer building management system (BMS) and mechanical design documents to select data points for analysis and to understand the existing operational intent.
  • Select rules to be applied for FDD, considering the relationship and interdependency of multiple building systems and their equipment.
  • Develop project structure and equipment parent/child relationships
  • Consult in the development of digital service offerings (feasibility, workflow, software, reporting structure, cost estimates etc.)
  • Collaborate with software development teams to discuss workflow and software product requirements
  • Contribute to rule development and improved data analysis strategies
  • Lead customer report presentations via Teams (video & screenshare)

Ideal Traits:

  • Familiarity with HVAC system and building controls. Knowledge of common HVAC and electrical building codes
  • Ability to read and understand design documentation (drawings, sequences of operation, schedules etc.)
  • Works independently with minimal supervision
  • Manages deliverable deadlines independently
  • Ability to remain organized while meeting expectations for numerous projects at once
  • Dresses professionally when necessary and comfortable working in a collaborative office environment
  • Proficiency in French language is a desirable quality, but not required

name: Digital Services Energy Engineer II or III - Smart Buildings - Remote

contents:
Are you interested in being part of a movement that's paving the way for a sustainable future?

Global demand for batteries is skyrocketing as we work towards reducing climate change through the electrification of mobility and the broader energy transition. To meet this demand, the industry needs to produce battery cells on a terawatt scale. Our automation controls, large scale distributed systems, and analytics are fundamentally changing the way batteries are produced. We're looking for motivated individuals to join our team and explore opportunities to drive progress within the battery field.

Create a better tomorrow with us! Ready to explore #YourSpaceToChargeUP+?
Join the #TeamBetterBattery - a team of internal startups. Engage with cell manufacturers, develop pilots, and craft the future of battery manufacturing.

  • Develop and maintain the enterprise architecture strategy, vision, and roadmap for our new battery software solution
  • Together with the Product Team you evaluate business needs, challenges, and requirements, and translate them into technology solutions and architectural designs as guidelines for the global development teams
  • Define and document architectural standards, principles, and guidelines specifically tailored for our business to ensure consistency, integration, and scalability
  • Conduct a comprehensive analysis of the current IT landscape, identifying integration points, gaps, and proposing solutions to optimize system integration and performance
  • Lead the design and implementation of the enterprise-level architecture for the battery lifecycle software solution, including infrastructure, applications, data, and security.

You will have impact to move the world forward!
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Systems
  • Many years of experience as an Enterprise Architect, with a consistent record in designing and implementing scalable cloud-based enterprise architectures
  • Strong, long-standing knowledge of modern programming languages, platforms, technologies, frameworks, architectural approaches, and design principles for software and API development and for building CI/CD pipelines, such as Java, Kotlin, Python, React, AngularJS, AWS native, Openshift, Kubernetes, Oracle, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, gRPC, Jenkins, Tekton, ArgoCD, Ansible and micro-services, service meshing, RESTful APIs, etc
  • Extensive experience in integrating software solutions with internal and external applications, accommodating rapid growth and expansion
  • Proficiency in evaluating and selecting appropriate technologies, platforms, and frameworks for enterprise-level solutions
  • Experience with battery or energy management systems is a plus

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • Up to 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your loved ones
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

name: Enterprise Architect (f/m/d) Digital Battery Lifecycle

contents:
Aboutus:

SiemensPLM Software is a world-leading provider of product lifecycle management (PLM)software. We help thousands of companies make great products by optimizingtheir lifecycle processes, from planning and development through manufacturingand support.

Byproviding thoughtfully integrated information at exactly the right time, in thecorrect context, and with the precise level of detail for everyone involved inthe product lifecycle process, our customers achieve a new level ofproductivity, make inquisitive, timely decisions and deliver great products

Positionoverview:

SiemensPLM Software is looking for a highly qualified candidate to provide enterpriseintegration pre-sales, architecture, configuration, and implementationservices. A very strong knowledge of Teamcenter PLM fundamentals is required.The successful candidate must be able to conduct customer business processassessments, evaluate existing processes and suggest new improved ones. Thisindividual must understand diverse environments where the latest in PLM, ERPand MES software is being deployed, as they will be at the forefront of helpingto create integrated enterprise software landscapes.

Responsibilities:

  • Apply advanced knowledge of customer business needs, engineering and manufacturing processes, industry standard methodologies and competitive differentiation, prepare and deliver customized demonstrations of Integration products and solutions to customers in support of selling efforts
  • Educate customers on the strategic business benefits of Integration products and solutions and answer questions on capabilities and usage and solve sales and customer problems
  • Ability to architect and design integration solutions between Teamcenter and other enterprise applications.
  • Lead projects requiring a solid overall understanding of manufacturing systems (PLM), manufacturing processes and data flow into enterprise applications such as ERP, CRM, MES, MRP, and others.
  • Act as the ultimate authority on the integration design to address business problems.
  • Provide direction for integration design, deployment, and rollout activities.
  • Assist in the development of integration proposals based on requirements; deliver solution proposals in context of customer meetings.
  • Responsibilities typically include leading workshops, being responsible for the technical content of the integration solution and design specifications, validating solution configurations, leading unit testing, and acting as an advisor to the team supporting customer user acceptance testing and deployment activities.
  • Technical delivery experience required, but also requires the ability to act as a leader and technical mentor to the supporting Integration Implementation Consultants.
  • Work comfortably and collaboratively with other Siemens resources when required.
  • Work on projects both internally and at customer sites.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or another technical field is required. Additional certifications that reflect an ongoing investment in yourself will be an added plus
  • 5-7 years of experience with Teamcenter Product Lifecycle Management solutions in a customer facing technical delivery role is required. Functional Process expertise in SAP Business Suite or Oracle E-Business Suite preferred
  • Exercise strong problem-solving skills to overcome obstacles. Have a meticulous attention to detail.
  • Understands the competitive landscape as well as industry trends in manufacturing
  • Shown soft skills, business acumen, and the ability to read the room and effectively communicate and present to a diverse audience including technical and non-technical audiences including both Siemens and customer management teams
  • Must have excellent oral and written communications skills
  • Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, Project, Visio, and Outlook;
  • The ability to travel both domestic and international approximately 30% of the time after COVID restrictions are lifted
  • Exercises integrity and confidentiality when taking care of sensitive corporate and partner information.
  • Additional Experience in Enovia, Windchill or other PLM products will be considered.
  • Preferred work locations: Milford, OH; Chicago, IL; Detroit, MI.

Thesalary range for this position is $136,700 to $246,100 and thisrole is eligible to earn incentive compensation. The actual compensationoffered is based on the successful candidate's work location as well asadditional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevanteducation/training. Siemens offers a variety of health and wellness benefits toemployees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com.In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

AtSiemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We needthe most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

name: Principal Integration Architect REMOTE

contents:
Thisrole will support the growth strategy, as we are undergoing a Transformationwhich will enable the company to scale & support next generation SaaSproducts & services. In alignment with the strategy, we are seeking amanager with strong experience in supporting our digital sales operations.

Youwill be a critical member in the sales operations team focused on working crossfunctionally to enable and streamline digital / ecommerce sales processes for ahigh-profile SaaS tech company. This role will supply to development anddeployment of new Configure, Price and Quote processes for the business unit

Responsibilities:

  • To continually improve the performance and efficiency (cost of operation) of our business systems; improve benefits of the system at the lowest achievable cost while delivering the required functionality
  • Leading brainstorming sessions, using market research for future products and/or product features that address our customers' growing needs
  • Help lead Digital Sales design & development projects through all phases of the product life cycle using Agile development principles
  • Planning & collaborating with product marketing on how to market and promote our products and the digital store
  • Working with our content team to ensure accurate training and development of support content
  • Develop detailed product design & requirements documentation
  • Use e-commerce platforms to enable a detailed customer experience for demos, purchase, activation, and renewals
  • Lead the go to market strategy through collaboration with our e-commerce channel manager, user experience guides and collaborators
  • Act as a product owner to identify, develop and evolve the product and technical requirements for the delivery and fulfillment of SaaS/PaaS products on our digital/e-commerce platforms.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education and Experience:

  • Very organized with a high attention to detail while keeping the big picture in mind
  • 4-6 years of product management experience in high-tech subscription or service-based products in a B2B environment, including use case and requirements definition
  • Functional knowledge of Software as a Service, E-commerce fundamentals, and user experience design, specifically including demos, free trials, subscriptions, and renewals
  • In depth experience evaluating and analyzing data and analytics, specifically for recurring, subscription-based revenue
  • Knowledge of Salesforce CRM and Commerce Cloud (required)
  • Knowledge of Salesforce Flow
  • Experience building cases, strategy, and alignment with product portfolios
  • Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently while collaborating with team members to achieve campaign timelines and goals
  • A good eye for UI/UX design.

Key Factors to Success:

  • Financial growth of the SaaS product revenue through digital sales
  • LeanData experience
  • Accurate case and market needs assessments for streamlined customer journey from purchase to use.

Thesalary range for this position is $113,900 to $205,000 and this role iseligible to earn incentive compensation. Siemens offers a varietyof health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefitscan be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com.In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

name: Digital Sales Operations IT Systems

contents:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow.

We develop networks that supply our cities with light and heat intelligently and we know our way around automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. For these and many other future projects, we need smart thinkers who bring skills, creativity, and dedication to the table. People like you! Experienced researchers who boldly broaden horizons, true specialists, and clever minds who like to get to the bottom of things. In short, help us tackle the most exciting challenges and put into practice what really matters. We'll give you the opportunity to really make a difference. So what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.

What part will you play?

  • In your new position you will coordinate and supervise product certifications for digital protection and field devices (e.g., EAC, UKCA, KC Mark, INMETRO, CCC)
  • You will work closely with external testing and approval bodies
  • Moreover, you are in exchange with the CE coordinators at our R&D sites (Berlin, Vienna, Goa, and Nanjing) and support them in conformity assessment procedures
  • You will support type testing/development/product management in evaluating new market requirements
  • Besides answering questions, also prepare documentation as part of their certification activities

What you need to make real what matters.
  • The basis is a completed master's degree in electrical engineering, communications engineering, or power engineering
  • Furthermore, you already have many years of experience in carrying out type tests and product certifications
  • You have good technical knowledge of the relevant standards on EMC, product safety and environmental testing
  • With your distinctive knowledge in the field of hardware development and project management you will convince us
  • Your German and English language skills are business proficient in written and spoken
  • You are willing to travel (at home and abroad)

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

name: Senior Hardware Certification Engineer (f/m/d)

contents:
Art der Anstellung: Befristet; 16-20 Std./Woche

In Richtung Zukunft? Bitte einsteigen.

Wie werden wir in Zukunft miteinander kommunizieren, Energien sinnvoll nutzen und uns fortbewegen? Wir können an den Antworten zusammenarbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorien in die Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken.

Als Werkstudent*in stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife jetzt die Chance und werde Teil unseres globalen Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Wir freuen uns, wenn du dein Talent bei uns einbringen willst!

Wir setzen um, worauf es ankommt. Das ist dein Beitrag.

  • Du unterstützt aktiv die Arbeit der Service-Experten im Bereich Ladetechnik für Elektrofahrzeuge
  • Du bist an der Erstellung und Pflege von Datenbanken und Websites beteiligt
  • Du hilfst bei der Erstellung von Software-Applikationen entsprechend den Anforderungen und bringst eigene Ideen ein
  • Du erstellst Auswertungen, Statistiken und Analysen für interne Untersuchungen und externe Präsentationen
  • Du behältst den Überblick über die Strukturierung von Workflows und die Datenhaltung
  • Gemeinsam mit uns bist du dafür verantwortlich, Flottendaten aus der Siemens Cloud zu prüfen und hierfür Auswertungen zu erstellen
  • Du erstellst für uns Arbeitsunterlagen nach unseren Vorgaben, um unser Arbeitsleben zu vereinfachen
  • Darüber hinaus trägst du bei der Dokumentation und Abbildung unserer Unternehmens- und Serviceprozesse in Workflow-Tools bei

Was du können solltest. Damit die Welt mehr kann.

  • Du studierst Informatik oder bist in einen ähnlichen Studiengang eingeschrieben
  • Du verfügst über Kenntnisse in gängigen Programmiersprachen (Python und SQL bevorzugt)
  • Du verfügst über Grundkenntnisse in der Netzwerktechnik
  • Du verfügst über Kenntnisse in Microsoft Dynamics-Tools wie PowerBI und Power Automate
  • Du zeichnest Dich durch eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe, gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowie ein sicheres Auftreten und Teamfähigkeit aus
  • Du hast fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
  • In den gängigen MS-Office-Tools bist Du fit (Textverarbeitung, Tabellenkalkulation, Präsentations- und Meilensteinpläne)

Wir wollen, dass du willst: Bewirb dich!

name: Werkstudent*in (w/m/d) IT / Informatik - eMobility

contents:
Are you interested in being part of a movement that's paving the way for a sustainable future?

Global demand for batteries is skyrocketing as we work towards reducing climate change through the electrification of mobility and the broader energy transition. To meet this demand, the industry needs to produce battery cells on a terawatt scale. Our automation controls, large scale distributed systems, and analytics are fundamentally changing the way batteries are produced. We're looking for motivated individuals to join our team and explore opportunities to drive progress within the battery field.

Create a better tomorrow with us! Ready to explore #YourSpaceToChargeUP+?

Join the #TeamBetterBattery - a team of internal startups. Engage with cell manufacturers, develop pilots, and craft the future of battery manufacturing.

  • Collaborate closely with stakeholders, including customers, development teams, to gather requirements and define product vision and roadmap.
  • Conduct market research and analysis to identify customer needs, market trends, and competitive landscape.
  • Define and prioritize product features, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide development efforts.
  • Create and maintain product backlogs, ensuring that they are well-groomed, properly prioritized, and aligned with business objectives.
  • Work closely with development teams, providing clear and concise product requirements and clarifications.
  • Facilitate communication and collaboration between cross-functional teams, including development, design, QA, and marketing.
  • Conduct regular meetings, such as sprint planning, backlog refinement, and sprint reviews, to ensure alignment and progress.
  • Act as the primary point of contact for product-related inquiries, providing guidance and support to internal teams and stakeholders.
  • Monitor and analyze product metrics and feedback to identify areas for improvement and inform product decisions.
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in product management.
  • Foster a positive team environment and contribute new ideas

What you need to make real what matters.
  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Business Administration) or equivalent practical experience.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience as a Product Owner or similar role in software product development.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of Agile methodologies, such as Scrum, Kanban and SAFe
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex concepts and collaborate with diverse stakeholders in international environments.
  • Demonstrated experience in defining and prioritizing product features based on customer needs and market analysis.
  • Proficiency in using product management tools, such as Jira, Confluence, or similar.
  • Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
  • Ability to adapt and embrace change, while maintaining a positive and proactive attitude.
  • Certification (e.g., SAFe) is a plus.

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • Up to 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your loved ones
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

name: Product Owner (f/m/d) Digital Battery Lifecycle

contents:
Wir suchen nach Menschen, die mit uns die Digitalisierung von Morgen gestalten. Denn - Wir machen digital.

Wir sind Siemens Digital Industries Software. Wir sind kein Industrieunternehmen. Wir sind ein wachsendes Softwareunternehmen, das unseren Kundinnen schon heute die Technologien und Innovationen von morgen bietet. Mit den Chancen eines Großunternehmens sind Deine Möglichkeiten endlos. Die Stelle, auf die Du Dich heute bewirbst, ist nur der erste Schritt auf Deinem Weg zu Siemens.

Werde jetzt Teil unseres Teams als Solution Architect (w/m/d) - OEM / Trucks & Busses und gestalte die Welt von morgen mit!

Durch unser hybrides Arbeitsmodell kannst Du flexibel von zu Hause, unterwegs oder an einem unserer über 20 Standorte innerhalb Deutschlands arbeiten. Wir unterstützen Deine Mobilität mit einem Dienstwagen oder einer BahnCard 100.

Wie gestaltest Du die Welt von morgen? Herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert!

Die Digitalisierung stellt viele Unternehmen vor große Herausforderungen und wird die Prozesse in den kommenden Jahren immens verändern, die Schlagworte sind in aller Munde (z.B. Closed Loop Manufacturing, Product Lifecycle Management oder Totally Integrated Automation, Digitaler Zwilling, Industrie 4.0). Auch unsere Kundinnen müssen sich, mit unserer Hilfe, diesen Aufgaben stellen, nicht zuletzt steht dabei deren Wettbewerbsfähigkeit auf dem Prüfstand.

Als PLM Solution Architect mit Fokus auf OEM Prozesse wirst Du diese Reise wesentlich mitgestalten und die Anforderungen unserer Kundinnen in Digitalisierungslösungen mit dem Siemens Xcelerator Software Portfolio verwandeln.

Wir suchen einen PLM-Profi, derdie diese Aufgabe annimmt und mit seinem großen Erfahrungsschatz und Enthusiasmus unseren Kundinnen bei der Transformation zum digitalen Unternehmen zur Seite steht.

  • Als Solution Architect bringst Du die Anforderungen unserer Kundinnen und die im PreSales erarbeiteten Lösungsansätze zusammen. Du definierst konkrete Architekturen auf Basis der Bedürfnisse der Kundinnen, natürlich immer vor dem Hintergrund einer optimalen wirtschaftlichen Umsetzbarkeit
  • Fokus der Arbeit liegt auf dem Design, der Konzeption und Umsetzung von innovativen Lösungskonzepten rund um die Prozesse der Kundinnen.
  • Du arbeitest an Consulting- und Digitalisierungsprojekten und führst dabei Implementation und Technical Consultants in interdisziplinären Teams als Lead Architect.
  • Als "Trusted Advisor" führst Du die Kundinnen auch in schwierigen Situation und bist für die Umsetzung der technischen Lösungen verantwortlich
  • Die Zusammenarbeit mit dem Produktmanagement und der Entwicklung ist ein weiteres entscheidendes Element für den Erfolg unserer Arbeit.
  • Unterstützung des Presales/Engagement Team während der technischen Auswahl- oder Angebotsphasen eines Projekts
  • Du verantwortest die zielsichere Integration der Architekturen in die Gesamtsysteme unter Berücksichtigung bestehender IT-Systemlandschaften
  • Als technische/r Expertin arbeitest Du aktiv an der Dokumentation und Weiterentwicklung von Best-Practices und dem weiteren Ausbau unserer Wissensdatenbank
  • Dein zukünftiges, kollegiales Umfeld zeichnet sich durch ein offenes und partnerschaftliches Miteinander aus, wobei das Team im Vordergrund steht

Wie wirst Du Teil unseres Teams? Mit viel Leidenschaft und Mut!

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Fahrzeugtechnik, allg. Maschinenbau, Produktions- oder Fertigungstechnik o.ä.
  • Du hast mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Beratung und Konzepterstellung für PLM Prozesse
  • Du besitzt Prozesswissen aus der Automotive-Industrie im Umfeld der Produktentwicklung, Fertigung und Service
  • Du hast gute Kenntnisse über das Siemens PLM Produktportfolio
  • Du kennst die Vorteile der PLM Philosophie und verstehen die Rolle unserer Produkte
  • Grundkenntnisse in mindestens einem führenden CAD System, ERP Prozesse, MES/MOM, PLM übergreifende Prozesse
  • Du bist in der Lage den Kunden auf dem Weg zur Verwirklichung seiner individuellen PLM Bedürfnisse zu führen
  • Komplexe oder schwierige Situationen mit Kundinnen meisterst Du mit Routine, Weitblick und kühlem Verstand
  • Beratungs- und Führungskompetenz sowie hervorragende Kommunikationsfähigkeiten auch auf Management Ebene
  • Wir kommunizieren sowohl mit unseren Kundinnen als auch mit unseren nationalen und internationalen Geschäftspartnerinnen auf Deutsch und auf Englisch.
  • Unser Team arbeitet deutschlandweit. Wir können daher sowohl mit einer Homeoffice-Option entgegenkommen als auch mit einer attraktiven Dienstwagenregelung

Wir bieten ein internationales Umfeld mit mehr als 140.000 Kundinnen in aller Welt, die heute schon auf unsere Kompetenz in der Digitalisierung setzen. Dabei bringen sich in Deutschland über 2.000 Kolleginnen in spannende und abwechslungsreiche Kundenprojekte aus den Bereichen Luft- und Raumfahrt, Automobil- und Transportbranche, Konsumprodukte und Einzelhandel, Elektronik und Halbleiter, Energie- und Versorgungsindustrie, Industriemaschinen und Schwermaschinen, Maritime Industrie, sowie Medizinprodukte und Arzneimittel ein. Bei uns findest Du ein teamorientiertes Arbeitsumfeld, umfassende Weiterbildungsoptionen und attraktive Benefits. Durch individuelle Zielvereinbarungen und vielfältige Karrieremodelle mit Spezialisierungsoptionen bieten wir Dir die Möglichkeit, fachlich und persönlich zu wachsen.

Bist Du eine Ideengestalter*in? Dann werde jetzt Teil unseres Teams!

Wenn Du erste Fragen mit unserem Recruiting Team klären möchtest, wende Dich gerne per Mail an: careers-DACH.sisw@siemens.com

Ansprechperson dieser Stellenausschreibung ist Herr Marc Lerch.

Du möchtest vor Deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens Digital Industries Software erfahren? Mission / Vision und unser Software Portfolio - oder besuche unsere Homepage.

name: Solution Architect (w/m/d) - OEM / Trucks & Busses

contents:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.
 

The Team

The Data Pipeline team builds and operates a collection of microservices that ensure a reliable, performant and predictable data flow within our cloud product.

We design, build and maintain the ETL pipeline supporting massive amounts of data intake, services that orchestrate pipeline workers, as well as intuitive UIs and APIs to configure the Celonis Data Integration. Made of a group of highly skilled engineers, we are passionate about reliability and best-in-class resiliency patterns, linear scalability, low latency, and high availability.

The Role

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to bring their experiences building large scale software and architecting Java based cloud systems to join our Data Pipeline team.

The Work You’ll Do

  • Design new distributed and asynchronous Java-based cloud services
  • Refactor existing functionality to achieve better performance and reliability
  • Implement Java microservices from scratch, or add features to existing services
  • Contribute to the technical vision of the Data Pipeline area
  • Independently own multiple large problem spaces with significant ambiguity
  • Proactively engage with internal and external peers and management to develop unprecedented solutions

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience architecting and building Java-based multi-cloud SaaS software
  • Microservice and event-driven architecture
  • Distributed systems
  • Relational and transactional databases
  • Java, Spring Boot
  • PostgreSQL
  • RabbitMQ
  • S3
  • Docker, Kubernetes

Preferred But Not Required

  • Streaming and batch data ingestion experience
  • Operating services in both AWS and Azure
  • Datadog and SLO-based observability
  • GitHub Actions deployment pipeline

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis enables customers to optimize their business processes. Powered by its leading process mining technology, Celonis provides a unique set of capabilities for business executives and users to continuously find improvement opportunities within and across processes, and execute targeted actions to rapidly enhance process performance. This optimization yields immediate cash impact, radically improves customer experience, and reduces carbon emissions. Celonis has thousands of implementations with global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
name: Senior Software Engineer - Data Pipeline

contents:
Siemens Digital Industries Software - Where today meets tomorrow.

Let's make the difference together!

Video: MEET US in 2 Minutes!

Are you brave enough to challenge yourself?

Siemens Digital Industries (DI) is an innovation leader in automation and digitalization. Closely, collaborating with partners and customers, we care about the digital transformation in the process and discrete industries. With our Digital Enterprise portfolio, we provide and encourage companies of all sizes with an end-to-end set of products, solutions, and services to integrate and digitalize the entire value chain. Meaningful optimization for the specific needs of each industry, our outstanding portfolio supports customers to achieve greater efficiency and flexibility. We are constantly adding innovations to its portfolio to integrate groundbreaking future technologies. We have our global headquarters in Nuremberg, Germany, and have around 75,000 employees internationally.

Join our team as "C++ Software Development Engineer from our office in Katowice, Poland or any of our other Siemens locations within Poland. We consider a mix between working remotely from home and meet with the team in the office. As a C++ Software Development Engineer, you will participate in developing breakthrough Electronic Design Automation (EDA) software, which is used by our customers to create a variety of amazing products, from smartphones to satellite systems. We believe in Agile development, so our teams are expected to be self-sufficient and perform without the classical management structure. Furthermore, these teams foster culture that allows everyone to express their views, be a contributor, and grow as a professional.

You'll help our customers drive digital innovation by

  • Develop new competitive functionalities and support the existing software solutions
  • Develop integration of existing software solution with modern Web Application based on Cloud Services
  • Analyze requirements and contribute to all levels of the architecture
  • Create automated tests on a regular basis and then maintain them
  • Participate in software design and code reviews
  • Collaborate within and outside your Agile scrum team in an international environment
  • Grow professionally together with your teammates

What do you need to realize what matters?

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer/Software Engineering, Electronics, or a related discipline
  • C++ knowledge with significant experience in C++ programming
  • Analytical skills and an understanding of data structures and algorithms
  • Experience with object-oriented software design and design patterns
  • Ability to work independently or with a team in a dynamic environment
  • English language skills that enhance collaboration (verbal and written) with your foreign colleagues

What we offer?

  • Competitive salary and benefits (Lunch Subvention, Holiday Allowance, Medical Care, Sport Card, Life Insurance)
  • Extra paid vacation days
  • Work on implementations as product producer (Siemens) not a partner company
  • Interesting and challenging career path within Siemens
  • Support with relocation (candidate outside of Katowice)

We offer an international environment with more than 140,000 customers around the world who already rely on our expertise in digitization. We are involved in exciting and varied customer projects in the aerospace, automotive and transportation, consumer products and retail, electronics and semiconductors, energy and utilities, industrial machinery and heavy machinery, maritime, and medical devices and pharmaceuticals industries. With us, you will find a team-oriented work environment, comprehensive training options and attractive benefits. Through individual target agreements and diverse career models with specialization options, we offer you the opportunity to grow professionally and personally.

We are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. Be part of the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

We'd love to hear from you, so apply now on siemens.com!

We look forward to your application! Please use only our career platform, which you can access via "Apply now".

Come and learn more about Siemens Software: Mission / Vision and our software portfolio - or visit our homepage.

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities. At Siemens, we believe people who've had real experiences dealing with being different will excel as leaders. Let's foster a culture of creativity and innovation. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
