contents:
Job Title
Field Service Engineer (Illinois/Indiana/Michigan/Ohio/Michigan with Nationwide Travel)

Job Description

The Field Service Engineer provides on-site, online and phone support within the zone and nationwide, as required, to resolve complex technical problems and product issues for both the Xper/Flex Cardio products and the Xcelera Cardiology PACS modality.

Your role:

  • Provide exceptional customer service by adhering to customer entitlements, setting clear expectations, and meeting commitments and arrival times to address and resolve customer needs. Understand the customer's business and competitive environment; generate service revenue.
  • Actively participate as a member of the regional work team; work to improve team processes and identify training gaps. Seek out opportunities to increase capability and capacity (i.e. may be required to become qualified in multiple modalities, learns new tools).
  • Perform all administrative duties within established Philips, State, and Federal regulatory requirements and timeframes including timesheets, service work orders, expense reports, Field Change Orders (FCO), preventative maintenance (PM), installation documents, site and service documentation, and other related paperwork. Adhere to established training, quality, and safety requirements.
  • Utilize tools, support, resources, and escalation processes within required time frames to resolve customer and system problems timely and effectively. Complete PMs, FCOs, installation and all related tasks (diagnose and resolve electronic, network, and mechanical problems).
  • Able to travel extensively, at least 75%, and must possess a valid driver's license and good driving record to travel to the customer site, zone office, or identified locations for meetings.
You're the right fit if:
  • 5+ years servicing the Philips Xper / Flex Cardio & Xcelera equipment/software or 5+ years servicing competitors' products with proficiency in resolving complex technical problems in a designated modality is Preferred.
  • Your skills include the ability to understand and apply electronic, mechanical, and networking theory to install, diagnose, and repair equipment, including knowledge and use of all necessary tools and test equipment.
  • You have an Associate Degree in electronics or equivalent combination of education and experience; BSEE/BSEET/BSME/BSMET preferred.
  • You must be able to successfully perform the following minimum Physical, Cognitive and Environmental job requirements with or without accommodation for this Field Service position.
  • You must be able to:
    • Work in an office/home office and/or remote setting, as well as in a hospital/healthcare environment; adhere to requirements.
    • Work flexible hours (based on business needs to include overtime, weekends, and on-call rotations).
    • Safely work with radiation sources and/or radioactive materials; wear all required personal protective equipment.
About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.
  • Learn more about our business .
  • Discover our rich and exciting history.
  • Learn more about our purpose.
  • Read more about our employee benefits .
If you're interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here .

Additional Information

US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa, now or in the future.

Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. For this position, you must reside in or within commuting distance to Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, Ohio, and Wisconsin. The ideal location is Chicago, IL.

#LI-PH1

#LI-Remote

Philips is an Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran and maintains a drug-free workplace.

contents:
Use your knowledge as a springboard.

Do you like the sound of finding the smartest solution side by side with professionals and experts? If so, join us as a PostDoc. We can help you to combine knowledge, discover connections, and drive your ideas. When you join our team, you will gain an insight into a range of departments and processes. With around 2,400 employees, the Corporate Technology Department (T) secures the future of the Siemens Group together with the business units. T innovates with internal and external partners (e.g., universities, research institutes) on future technologies. It is a chance like no other to break new ground as we head into the future of electrification, automation, and digitalization. Seize this opportunity today!

Change the future with us.

A digital transformation of the everyday happens globally. This requires access to computation and connectivity everywhere at industrial grade. Thus, non-terrestrial infrastructure like satellites is already targeted to be an integral part of future globally interconnected (e.g., via 5G /6G) systems. Still emerging industrial applications require to go beyond this and bring control and compute capabilities closer to the source of data and action.

In this research work, you will:

  • Identify and investigate challenges in moving edge computing infrastructures
  • Research and develop new mechanisms to optimize the infrastructure availability, latency, etc. regarding application end-to-end qualities
  • Research new approaches for industrial grade orchestration and self-organization of application and compute environments in moving infrastructure
  • Set up end-to-end quality (e.g., availability, resilience, latency) monitoring
  • Build a testbed for Edge computing scenarios in space to bring your ideas and approaches to life

Your research will be carried out in the context of international research projects with academic and business partners of Siemens. Beyond this we will support you to publish your work, to visit international conferences, to do academic stays at partner institutions, and to develop the ideas you have for the future of industrial systems.

What you need to make real what matters.

  • You already have an excellent PhD degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a similar field
  • You have a strong drive for achievement, a genuine desire to discover and try out new things, and your curiosity about new technologies outperforms others
  • You have sound knowledge of Distributed Systems, Software Architecture and Software Development preferably in the area of Internet of Things, Edge and/or Cloud Computing
  • You have advanced knowledge in communication technologies and basic knowledge in AI and machine learning
  • You have proven experience and deep knowledge in implementing software in at least two high-level programming language - you love to code
  • Due to the international structure of the projects, excellent written and verbal English skills are required. German skills would be advantageous

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ - if you need further information on the application process.

Organization: Technology

Company: Siemens AG

Experience Level: Experienced Professional

Full / Part time: Either
name: PostDoc (f/m/d) - Edge computing in moving non-terrestrial infrastructure

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 39.600 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld - herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert

Ihr Weg führt Sie in unser RAMS Management für ETCS Onboard Systeme. Sie leisten einen entscheidenden Beitrag zur Sicherheit unserer Produkte von der Entwicklung bis zur Integration in Bahnfahrzeuge weltweit.

  • Sie arbeiten an Projekten zur Sicherstellung der Systemanforderungen bezüglich RAMS und IT-Sicherheit mit. Diese erfolgt auf Grundlage der Entwicklungs- und Kundenanforderungen, der europäischen Richtlinien und länderspezifischen Gesetze und Regelwerke sowie der anzuwendenden Normen.
  • Ein wichtiger Teil Ihrer Aufgabe ist das Mitwirken bei der Analyse und Gestaltung der Systemarchitektur im Hinblick auf RAMS und IT-Sicherheit (Gefährdungs-, Threat & Risk-Analyse).
  • Sie beraten selbständig und unterstützen interne und externe Kunden sowie das System-, Hardware und Software-Engineering bezüglich der Belange von RAMS und IT-Sicherheit.
  • Sie stellen als Teilprojektleiter die Erfüllung der Anforderungen an RAMS und IT-Sicherheit sicher und sind verantwortlich für das termingerechte Vorliegen aller dafür notwendigen Dokumente (Planungsdokumente, Gefährdungsanalyse, Threat & Risk Analyse, Sicherheitsnachweis, Gefährdungslogbuch).

Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat

  • Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes elektrotechnisches Hochschulstudium mit einem Schwerpunkt im Bereich Safety oder Systems Engineering oder einem vergleichbaren Studiengang.
  • Sie überzeugen mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung in der Bahntechnik und verfügen über praktische Erfahrung im RAMS-Management und in der IT-Sicherheit.
  • Ihre Kenntnisse der Normen EN50126/50128/50129 sowie der IEC-Reihe 62443 und den damit verbundenen Methoden sind fundiert. Bewerber mit Kenntnissen der vergleichbaren Normen ISO26262 oder IEC61508 sind uns genauso Willkommen.
  • Für Ihre internationalen Projekte bringen Sie sehr gute Deutsch- sowie Englischkenntnisse und Reisebereitschaft (~10%) mit.

So treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt - einfach und direkt

www.siemens.de/mobility

name: Lead Security Engineer, Insider Risk & Investigations

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.



Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten, ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Machen Sie mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer Karriere. .

Verändern Sie zusammen mit uns die Welt von morgen.

Sie übernehmen eine spannende und herausfordernde Rolle als IT-Security Experte im Portfoliomanagement und sind mitverantwortlich für die kontinuierliche Verbesserung und Weiterentwicklung der IT-Sicherheit im Lösungs- und Serviceportfolio der Siemens Gebäudetechnik.

  • Zu Ihren Aufgaben zählen die Beratung, Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Blueprints für sichere Lösungen und Services, die Beratung bei der Implementierung von Sicherheitsfunktionen, sowie die Durchführung von Risikobewertungen und Penetrationstests.
  • Das Mitwirken an der Freigabe von neuen Portfolioelementen und die Optimierung des Freigabeprozesses rundet Ihr abwechslungsreiches Aufgabengebiet ab.
  • Sie wirken an der Entwicklung passender, sicherer Lösungen mit - z.B. für Industriekunden, Flughäfen, Krankenhäuser, Hochschulareale oder ähnliche und unterstützen bei der Umsetzung von Anforderungen aus der IT-Sicherheitsnormen und Gesetzgebungen.
  • Gemeinsam mit den Produkteigentümern stellen Sie sicher, dass die Architektur und das Design der Softwarekomponenten den erforderlichen nationalen und internationalen Sicherheitsstandards entsprechen.
  • Im Team tragen Sie dazu bei, dass das Bewusstsein für die Relevanz des Themas IT-Sicherheit nachhaltig in der Organisation etabliert wird.

Ihr Profil für gemeinsam "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Fachrichtung IT-Sicherheit, Informatik oder vergleichbar mit anschließender relevanter Berufserfahrung. Kenntnisse der Domäne der Gebäudetechnik sind hierbei von Vorteil.
  • Sie haben Erfahrung in der IT-Sicherheit gesammelt und kennen sich mit den gängigen IT-Sicherheitsstandards aus (IEC 62443, ISO 27001 und den BSI Grundschutz), idealerweise haben Sie sich bereits durch einschlägige Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen qualifiziert (z.B. CISSP, TISP, OCSP, etc).
  • Sie verfügen über erprobte und belastbare Erfahrungen im Bereich der technischen IT-Sicherheit und haben bereits erste Erfahrungen im Bereich der Entwicklung von Lösungen oder Penetrationstests gemacht.
  • Sie besitzen vertiefte Kenntnisse im Bereich der Netzwerksicherheit und Ihnen sind die Grundlagen der Anwendungssicherheit bekannt. Das Testen von Anwendungen und Lösungen auf Sicherheitsaspekte macht Ihnen Spaß und Sie bringen die hierfür notwendigen Kenntnisse mit. Hierzu sind Sie mit einer Skript-Sprache, wie z.B. Python oder Ruby, vertraut und besitzen auch Erfahrungen mit einschlägigen Werkzeugen wie Nessus und der Linux Distribution Kali Linu.
  • Darüber hinaus punkten Sie mit Ihrer zuverlässigen Arbeitsweise, einem kundenfreundlichen Auftreten, zukunftsorientierter Denkweise sowie mit einer engen kooperativen Zusammenarbeit im Team
  • Wir sind stolz darauf, dass sich der Siemens Smart Infrastructure Kollegenkreis aus Experten aus verschiedenen Ländern zusammensetzt - in diesem Umfeld sind Sie in der Lage sowohl auf Deutsch als auch auf Englisch zu kommunizieren und Dokumente zu bearbeiten.

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Barrierefreie Standorte
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

https://new.siemens.com/ - wenn Sie mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchten.

FAQ - wenn Sie eine Frage zum Thema Bewerbung bei Siemens haben.

name: Product and Solution Security Expert (m/w/d)

contents:
Who we are

Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations™ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing — and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.

Working at Samsara means you’ll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team that’s shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, you’ll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term. 

Recent awards we’ve won include:

Great Place To Work Certified™ 2023

Best Place to Work by Built In 2023

Financial Times The Americas’ Fastest Growing Companies 2023

Deloitte Fast 500 Companies

IoT Analytics Company of the Year in 2022’s IoT Breakthrough Winners

We see a profound opportunity for data to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of operations, and hope you consider joining us on this exciting journey. 

About the role:

Samsara is looking for an experienced engineering director to lead our Core Platform Features team. Our Core Platform Features team is responsible for the core enterprise capabilities that powers Samsara’s Connected Operations platform. This includes our Reporting, Alerting, Org/User management, Release management, and Monetization capabilities to support our rapidly growing footprint of customers. This organization is building the foundation to stay ahead of the needs of our expanding customer base and platform. 

You should apply if:

  • You want to impact the industries that run our world: Your efforts will result in real-world impact—helping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, reduce emissions, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely.
  • You are the architect of your own career: If you put in the work, this role won’t be your last at Samsara. We set up our employees for success and have built a culture that encourages rapid career development, countless opportunities to experiment and master your craft in a hyper growth environment.
  • You’re energized by our opportunity: The vision we have to digitize large sectors of the global economy requires your full focus and best efforts to bring forth creative, ambitious ideas for our customers.
  • You want to be with the best: At Samsara, we win together, celebrate together and support each other. You will be surrounded by a high-caliber team that will encourage you to do your best. 

Click here to learn about what we value at Samsara. 

In this role, you will: 

  • Drive the vision, roadmap and priorities for Samsara’s Platform teams.
  • Ensure high technical standards through both processes and the culture you instill.
  • Mentor and grow engineering managers and staff/senior engineers.
  • Champion, role model, and embed Samsara’s cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices
  • Hire, develop and lead an inclusive, engaged, and high performing team

Minimum requirements for the role:

  • 10+ years of industry experience in software engineering/development
  • 7+ years of engineering management experience
  • A track record of building high performing software teams 
  • Willingness to dive-deep and solve challenging technical problems

An ideal candidate also has:

  • Experience managing managers and teams of 40+ engineers
  • A customer-focused mindset and good product sense
  • 5+ years of experience in SaaS software development roles
  • B.S. in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Experience with best practices around testing, monitoring, and SLAs to ensure high product quality in large-scale distributed web services
Samsara’s Compensation Philosophy: Samsara’s compensation program is designed to deliver total compensation (based on role, level, and geography) that is above market. We do this through our base salary + bonus/variable + restricted stock unit awards (RSUs).  A new hire RSU award is awarded at the time of hire, and additional RSU refresh grants may be awarded annually.

We pay for performance, and top performers are eligible to receive above target equity refresh awards which allow employees to achieve higher market positioning.

The range of annual base salary for full-time employees for this position is below. Please note that base pay offered may vary depending on factors including your city of residence, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
$184,128—$287,700 USD

At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background, race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, etc. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

Accommodations

Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or click here if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.

Benefits

Full time employees receive an above market total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at our Benefits site to learn more.

Flexible Working 

At Samsara, we have adopted a flexible way of working, enabling teams and individuals to do their best work, regardless of where they’re based. We value in-person collaboration and know a change of scenery and quiet space to work is welcomed from time to time, but also appreciate that the world of work has changed. Our offices remain open for those who prefer to collaborate or work in-office, but we also encourage fully remote applicants. As most roles are not required to be in the office, we are able to hire remotely where Samsara has an established presence. If a role is required to be in a certain location and candidates do not have work authorization for that location, Samsara will conduct an immigration assessment. If the role is not required to be in a specific location, Samsara will move forward with the remote location that works best for the business. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individual’s ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company. 

 

Please note: Samsara does not accept agency resumes and is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Samsara employees.
name: Director, Engineering - Core Platforms

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you'll be responsible for:

Circle is looking for a passionate Security Leader with an expertise in Blockchain Security, deep understanding of different Blockchain technologies and Cloud based Product development. You’ll be part of the Security Engineering team and closely partner with the Engineering teams responsible for the development, deployment of USDC and supporting services.

What you'll work on: 

  • Own Circle’s Blockchain Security strategy, implementation and operationalization
  • Perform due diligence on potential Blockchains where USDC may be deployed to, in partnership with Product Compliance, Product and Engineering teams.
  • Recommend and validate Security controls and improvements across our technology stack
  • Own and build relationships with key external stakeholders such as customers, vendors, and auditors
  • Produce data-based reports on technology risk for senior management
  • Drive continuous improvement in the tech stack

You will aspire to our four core values: 

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you'll bring to Circle: 

  • 12+ years of experience as a security engineer or product security engineering leader with a minimum of five years (can be overlapping) with a focus on cybersecurity.
  • 5+ years demonstrated experience with security standard methodologies for Blockchain smart contract development and Cryptography
  • Demonstrated ability developing security controls that are easy to test and audit
  • Extensive knowledge of Security tool usage across SDLC including SAST, DAST and/or Security end to end testing
  • Proven experience developing automated, scalable, and reproducible security practices
  • Proficiency in managing multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order or priorities on the fly for themselves and their team.
  • Ability to influence internal and external customers to expediently resolve issues and achieve organizational objectives
  • The ability to design and operate controls that are easy to test and audit
  • Experience working in financial services or financial technology desired
  • Advanced degree in computer science, or related fields strongly preferred.
  • 5+ years proven experience building and managing small to medium sized teams
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Salt Lake City, UT. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $190,000 - $265,000

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

contents:
Job Title
Clinical Product Support Specialist (Gainesville, Fl or Remote, Southeastern US)

Job Description

Clinical Product Support Specialist (Gainesville, FL, or Remote, Southeastern US)

In this clinical role, you will be the to go to person related to UroNav related issues and improvements. This includes 3rd level escalations from countries as well as screening improvement suggestions.

Your role:

  • Serve as a trusted clinical advisor within the Disease Management Solutions Business Unit (DMS BU) and partner with various stakeholders to develop and implement new strategic methods/procedures/training; assess escalations, deliver operational support, and initiate corrective actions; and create Knowledge Center Service (KCS) inputs to deliver optimum solutions to and ensure faster resolution for our customers.
  • Provide DMS BU Level 3 product support for UroNav, serving as the critical clinical support for our customers (corresponding with markets, and end-users, as needed). You will create and maintain training materials (UroNav); create data analysis (identify trends, discuss reoccurring issues, and propose developmental solutions); and provide clinical support for the complaint handling unit (CHU) to ensure the desired quality level of complaint feedback.
  • Drive successful New Product Introduction (NPIs), provide NPI support via First of a Kind (FOK) and Hypercare: Field Monitoring Activities (FMT) to support Business Improvement, proactively monitoring High Activity Sites (HAS), support development and implementation of strategies and initiatives to meet business performance targets.
You're the right fit if:
  • You've acquired 5+ years of related experience as a clinical support specialist, in the areas of urology, prostate, or cryogen/laser ablation (ideal).
  • Your skills include functional knowledge of the healthcare industry with experience using UroNav or other Fusion related product. Additionally, you possess experience in New Product Introduction, and skilled at developing strategies to support NPI such as, creating playbooks and develop training materials for broader teams, customers, and end-users.
  • You have a Bachelors' degree (required), Masters' degree (desired) - with relevant career experiences and credentials as a Registered Radiologic Technologist with a subspeciality (and certified) in one or more of the following: Magnetic Resonance (MR), Cat Scan (CT) or Ultrasound (US).
  • You must be able to successfully perform the following minimum Physical, Cognitive and Environmental job requirements with or without accommodation for this position .
  • You're an excellent communicator with active listening skills; a well-organized multi-tasker, skilled at working in a high-demand environment with tight deadlines, capable of flexing to establish priorities, and work cross-functionally to develop and implement strategies defined to find solutions, while managing various projects and setting priorities to achieve desired customer and product outcomes.
About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.
  • Learn more about our business .
  • Discover our rich and exciting history.
  • Learn more about our purpose.
  • Read more about our employee benefits .
If you're interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here .

Philips Transparency Details

The pay range for this position is $71,000 to $154,000, annually. The actual base pay offered may vary depending on multiple factors including, job-related knowledge/skills, experience, business needs, geographical location, and internal equity.

In addition, other compensation, such as an annual incentive bonus, sales commission or long-term incentives may be offered. Employees are eligible to participate in our comprehensive Philips Total Rewards benefits program, which includes a generous PTO, 401k (up to 7% match), HSA (with company contribution), stock purchase plan, education reimbursement and much more. Details about our benefits can be found here .

At Philips, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top end of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent upon the facts and circumstances of each case.

Additional Information

US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa, now or in the future.

Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. For this position, it is preferred to reside in or within commuting distance to Gainesville, Florida (primary, preferred location) , although, we also will consider remote-home-based (secondary consideration within the Southeastern area of the United States).

Philips is an Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran and maintains a drug-free workplace.

name: Clinical Product Support Specialist (Gainesville, Fl or Remote, Southeastern US)

contents:
At Siemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

Responsibilities

  • Act as part of a Delivery Services group, work productively with XHQ Consultants, XHQ Architects, Project Managers, and other internal & external interfaces to ensure that the customer succeeds in their objectives.
  • As an Architect resource, responsible for the translation of business requirements into specific process aligned designs for the Siemens XHQ Software solution based on multi product/multi-industry domain knowledge and best practices in the subject area
  • In line with project processes and messaging, interact with the customer to support the management of customer expectations and support customer adoption by leveraging the complete Siemens Delivery framework.
  • Provide architectural guidance and advice to Sales/PreSales pursuits and Services projects, through the complexity of solution architecture options and the long-term roadmap for the solution.
  • Act as trusted advisor on architectural design to address business problems ensuring that the technical integrity of the solution remains aligned to requirements and value delivery throughout project and that the various project solutions will work together to deliver value.
  • Provides direction for XHQ solution process design, process integration and process change activities either internally or at customer sites.
  • Leverage relevant templates in the leadership of project solutions in own specialist area, and curate best practices and templates.
  • Engage marketing team to support the marketing plan, marketing materials and webinars/workshops
  • Works under self-management and will determine solutions, methods and procedures on assignments/projects at a country level, of basic to moderate complexity and diverse scope that require specialist architectural expertise and leadership.
  • Use the customer solution development experience to assist in solution testing of XHQ; replicate real world use cases, participate in Beta testing of product releases, serve as the liaison during testing between the customer and R&D, provide detailed bug reports, and communicate customer feedback.

Competencies

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering or foreign equivalent.
  • Solid experience on on-prem, hybrid and cloud solution deployment
  • Proven strong experience in SQL queries for MS SQL, Oracle and PostgreSQL and SQL queries performance tuning
  • Ability to translate business requirements into XHQ solution design and deliver project scoping document
  • Understanding on network communication, data routing and firewalls
  • Hands-on experiences on using Web Service, RESTful APIs
  • Deep understanding on Windows IIS and Web Applications
  • Exposure to real-time process historians, notably OSISoft PI, Honeywell PHD, and AspenTech IP21, including experience interfacing to historians using SDK-level interfaces.
  • Basic knowledge of Data Modeling, with some demonstrated hands-on experience.
  • Prior exposure to Data Visualization and dashboard design and development.
  • Exposure in performing Factory Acceptance Test and Site Acceptance Test procedures.
  • Basic knowledge of XML and SVG, exposure to XML parsers and XSLT.
  • One year of applications programming experience in Java, JavaScript, VB.NET and/or C# and PowerShell
  • Exposure developing Web Services-based web applications in (SaaS).
  • Development experience with relational databases and SQL, especially Oracle, and Microsoft SQL Server and PostgreSQL
  • Hands on experience with Siemens XHQ, ideally in the area of solution delivery to customers is a plus.
  • DBA-level knowledge of Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server is a plus.
  • Project Management experience is a plus
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Reporting Services, SQL Integration Services, Microsoft SharePoint. l
  • Knowledge of computer security, access control, authentication, and encryption a plus.
  • Basic knowledge of PC, servers, tablets and other computational devices.
  • Domain knowledge in Oil & Gas, Chemical, or Process industries
  • Knowledge of Windows operating systems, especially Windows 2012/2016/2019 server and Windows 10, including security aspects, administration
  • Strong analytical and multitasking skills, responsive, and keeps commitments
  • Results Oriented: Ability to estimate risks and meet deadlines
  • Ability to make decisions, show risk awareness, and evaluate options and solutions. Exercises judgment in making sound decisions.
  • Team player and contributes towards team goals, customer focused.
  • Communication skills: is able to articulate his/her thoughts convincingly in both verbal and written form. Fluent in written and spoken English
  • Good time management skills
  • Can require up to 30% travel and onsite staff augmentation working model

Thetotal target compensation for this position is $116,100 - $232,200 (consistingof a base and variable). Siemens offers a variety of health and wellnessbenefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com. In addition, thisposition is eligible for time off in accordance with Company policies,including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exempt employees)or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

name: Solution Architect (XHQ)

contents:
Art der Anstellung: Befristet; 15 - 20 Stunden/Woche

Deine Extraportion Praxis.

Wie werden wir uns übermorgen fortbewegen, miteinander kommunizieren, Energien nutzen? Lass uns gemeinsam an den Antworten arbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorie in Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken. Kurz: Menschen, die ihre und unsere Fragen in neue Ausrufezeichen verwandeln wollen! Als Werkstudent*in stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife die Chance und werde Teil unseres weltweiten Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Unsere Teams freuen sich auf dich.

Verändere mit uns die Welt von morgen.

Das SHERPA X (Shared ERP Architecture) Programm wurde ins Leben gerufen, um eine ERP-Architektur der nächsten Generation für Siemens zu implementieren. Ziel ist eine flexible Systemlandschaft, die eine schnellere Einführung neuer Geschäftsmodelle und eine rasche Umsetzung von Änderungen im Siemens-Portfolio sowie in den Organisationsstrukturen ermöglicht.

  • Wir arbeiten an einem Template Programm für neue Prozess und IT-Landschaft für Siemens weltweit
  • Im Rahmen der agilen Vorgehensweise unterstützt du den Scrum Master; Release Manager oder Process Owner bei ihrer/seiner täglichen Arbeit
  • Zeig uns dein Talent bei der Planung und Organisation von Events und Workshops
  • Unsere Projektteams freuen sich auf deine Mitarbeit bei der Definition, Umsetzung und Testen der Prozesse sowie der Aufgaben
  • Außerdem arbeitest du eng mit internen Partnern und Fachabteilungen zusammen

Dein Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".
  • Du studierst derzeit ab dem 3. Semester in der Fachrichtung Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften
  • Im Umgang mit MS 365 Anwendungen bist du fit, insbesondere in Excel, OneNote, MS Teams und Power Point
  • SAP-Kenntnisse sind ein großes Plus
  • Deine guten Deutsch- und sehr guten Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab

Gesucht: Mitgestalter von morgen.

www.siemens.de

wenn du vor deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchtest.

name: Werkstudent*in (w/m/d) Siemens Business Transformation Program SHERPA X GF

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for:

In 2020, Circle unveiled Circle APIs: a set of solutions and smarter technology to help businesses accept payments in a more global, scalable and efficient alternative to traditional banking rails (spoiler: we’re using USD Coin under the hood). The Circle Security Team works to protect Circle; our customers, clients, and partners; and the financial markets upon which we rely.  As a member of this team, you’ll lead projects and be responsible for key deliverables of the security program while collaborating across Circle teams.  You will continue to learn and stay current in a fun and rapidly changing environment.

What you'll work on:

  • Conduct analysis of user behavior and organizational controls apparent in security logging.
  • Leverage analysis to build technical detections and controls.
  • Drive the development and implementation of automated data access checks across various platforms to help detect abuse and data exfiltration.
  • Perform security incident investigations using data analytics and computer forensics.
  • Build automation and detection models to support identification of anomalous activity to mitigate insider risk at scale.
  • Identify gaps in our infrastructure, and work with business partners to gain visibility through logging and detection.
  • Partner with stakeholders to contribute to Security Awareness messaging, training and exercises.
  • Drive deployment, development, and improvements in Security Incident and Event Management, Case Management, and Automation.
  • Provide security guidance to various organizations throughout the company.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle:

  • 5-7+ years experience in security operations such as technical investigations or Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) with a minimum of two years (can be overlapping) with a focus on Insider Threat.
  • Experience with technologies relevant to Insider Threat (SIEMs, DLP solutions, CASBs, UEBA tools, host forensic solutions).
  • Experience in data science and analytics solutions applicable to the insider threat detection space.
  • Exposure to programming, scripting and query languages such as Python, Golang, bash, SQL.
  • Strong ability to work collaboratively across teams during high-stress situations.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order of priorities on the fly.
  • Self-motivated and creative problem-solver able to work independently with minimal guidance.
  • Enthusiasm for scalable, reproducible security management. 
  • In-depth knowledge of the insider threat landscape.
  • Deep knowledge of SIEM, Case Management, EDR/ MDR, and DLP solutions.
  • Experience working in financial services or financial technology desired.
  • Experience working in an AWS environment preferred.
  • Experience communicating technical findings to a variety of stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in Google Suite, Slack and Apple MacOS preferred. 
  • Certifications such as CMU CERT ITPM/ ITVA, CCITP, CISM, CDPSE or similar will receive favorable consideration but are not required.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Chicago, IL. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $175,000 - $230,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

#LI-Remote
name: Lead Security Engineer, Insider Risk & Investigations

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld - herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert

An unserem Siemens Mobility Standort in München-Allach entwickeln und fertigen wir Lokomotiven, die auf der ganzen Welt durch Ihre Zugkraft Dinge in Bewegung bringen. Zur Verbesserung der Arbeitssicherheitskultur als Teil der Siemens ZERO HARM Culture, Sicherstellung der Einhaltung von EHS-Standards/-Regeln sowie deren Aktualität, suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen "Experte (w/m/d) Arbeitssicherheit". Lernen Sie unser Werk näher kennen: www.siemens.de/allach-jobs #Jobs-mit-Loks #Allach

  • In Ihrer neuen Funktion unterstützen Sie uns bei der Verbesserung der Arbeitssicherheit in unserem Werk in München Allach.
  • Sie coachen die Mitarbeiter zum frühzeitigen Erkennen unsicherer Zustände, schreiten selbst ein und implementieren Abhilfemaßnahmen sowie Maßnahmen zur Verbesserung der Ergonomie.
  • Zudem treiben Sie proaktiv Maßnahmen zu Verbesserung der Arbeitssicherheit voran und halten diese nach.
  • Sie arbeiten aktiv bei der Analyse und Umsetzung von Maßnahmen aus Unfällen sowie Beinaheunfällen mit.
  • Sie stellen sicher, dass die aktuellen Arbeitssicherheits-Standards eingehalten werden und gewährleisten die Aktualität der notwendigen Dokumentationen (Gefährdungsbeurteilungen, Betriebsanweisungen, Nachweise etc.).
  • Sie führen regelmäßige Standortbegehungen durch, wobei Sie in direktem Austausch mit unseren Produktionsmitarbeitern stehen.
  • Ferner unterstützen Sie unsere Werkstattmeister darin, dass Bewusstsein unser Mitarbeiter für Arbeitssicherheit zu stärken und eine Sicherheitskultur zu etablieren.
  • Zudem prüfen Sie eingeleitete Maßnahmen auf deren Wirksamkeit und berichten regelmäßig an Ihre Leitung.

Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat

  • Sie besitzen eine abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung mit Weiterbildung zum Meister oder Techniker und verfügen zudem über eine Fortbildung zu Fachkraft für Arbeitssicherheit.
  • Sie haben Erfahrung in Prozessen zur Verbesserung der Arbeitssicherheitskultur sowie mit Prozessanalysen.
  • Sie bringen detaillierte Fachkenntnisse in Arbeitssicherheit, Umwelt-, Arbeits- und Gesundheitsschutz mit und sind erfahren im Coaching von Mitarbeitern.
  • Erfahrung aus einem interkulturellen Umfeld ist aufgrund unseres Teams aus zahlreichen Nationen wünschenswert.
  • Sie zeichnen sich durch gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten aus und arbeiten gerne mit Kollegen über unterschiedliche Hierarchieebenen zusammen.
  • Der routinierte Umgang mit IT-Tools, v.a. MS Office und SAP rundet Ihr Profil ab.

So treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt - einfach und direkt

www.siemens.de/mobility
wenn Sie vor Ihrer Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchten.
+49 (9131) 17 52430
wenn Sie erste Fragen gern persönlich mit unserem Recruiting Team klären möchten. Ansprechpartner für diese Stellenausschreibung ist Herr Martin Spandel.
www.siemens.de/karriere
wenn Sie mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchten.

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

# LI-MS1

Organization: Siemens Mobility

Company: Siemens Mobility GmbH

Experience Level: Mid-level Professional

Full / Part time: Full-time
name: Experte (w/m/d) Arbeitssicherheit

contents:
Are you brave enough to challenge yourself?

Siemens Digital Industries Software is not a manufacturing company. We are a growing software company - bringing the technologies and innovations of tomorrow to our customers today. With the resources and opportunities of a large corporation, your opportunities are endless. The role you apply for today, is only the first step in your Siemens journey.

Siemens EDA is one of the top tier suppliers in the Electronic Design Automation industry and part of Siemens DI. As a technology leader, the company offers innovative solutions for electronic hardware and software design.

The Application Engineer (AE) is the key connection between Siemens EDA and its customers. It's a dynamic & challenging role, requiring deep technical expertise and strong communication & business skills.

AEs work with businesses across all technology sectors, helping them to address their technical and business challenges by utilizing the latest verification solutions provided by Siemens EDA.

The AE role requires continuous development of knowledge & skills so provides an interesting & fulfilling career.

Join our team as Digital Functional Verification Application Engineer (f/m/d) and help us digitalize the future.

Our hybrid work model allows you to flexibly work from home, at customer sites or on-site at any of our 18 locations within Germany.

You will work as part of an account team to drive the growth of Siemens EDA functional verification business in Europe, through the successful adoption and expansion of Siemens EDA products and services.

How are you shaping the world of tomorrow? Challenging and future-oriented!

  • Drive business for Siemens EDA using hands-on technical expertise. This requires working directly with customers as a part of an account team.
  • Provide customer verification methodology guidance, verification tools training, and verification problem identification & resolution.
  • Build & maintain ongoing positive relationships with customers, understanding their technical needs & challenges.
  • Manage multiple customer issues concurrently, prioritizing activities as required. Work with design & verification engineers as well as their level managers.
  • Provide technical feedback to Siemens EDA product development teams relating to critical issues and recommended product enhancements.

How do you become part of our team? With a lot of drive and passion!

  • Education: MSEE (or equivalent) required with 3+ years' experience or BSEE (or equivalent) with 5+ years' experience in design & functional verification.
  • Experience should include:
    • A strong understanding of design and verification concepts in ASIC & FPGA flows is required.
    • Expert RTL coder including clock/reset and low power design & verification techniques.
    • Experienced with simulation and debug tools, with understanding of how to configure & optimize tools for maximum efficiency.
    • Verification planning and management experience with block level and top-level designs.
    • Expert in HDL coding (VHDL/Verilog/System Verilog) is mandatory; UVM, PSL/SVA expertise would be preferred.
    • Experience of a Functional Safety process & flow is a plus.
    • Experience with Linux and Windows environments including scripting languages.
    • Excellent presentation and communication skills are required.
    • Self-motivated and self-disciplined.
  • English mandatory / German preferable
  • Willingness to travel (domestically and internationally)

We offer an international environment with more than 140,000 customers around the world who already rely on our expertise in digitization. In Germany, more than 2,000 colleagues are involved in exciting and varied customer projects in the aerospace, automotive and transportation, consumer products and retail, electronics and semiconductors, energy and utilities, industrial machinery and heavy machinery, maritime, and medical devices and pharmaceuticals industries. With us, you will find a team-oriented work environment, comprehensive training options and attractive benefits. Through individual target agreements and diverse career models with specialization options, we offer you the opportunity to grow professionally and personally.

Are you an innovator? Then become part of our team!

If you would like to clarify initial questions with our recruiting team, please contact us by mail: careers-DACH.sisw@siemens.com

Contact person for this job posting is Jaclyn Krieger.

Want to learn more about Siemens Digital Industries Software before you apply?

Check out Mission / Vision and our software portfolio - or visit our homepage.

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities.

At Siemens, we believe people who've had real experiences dealing with being different will excel as leaders. Let's foster a culture of creativity and innovation. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Organization: Digital Industries

Company: Siemens Electronic Design Automation GmbH

Experience Level: Experienced Professional

Full / Part time: Full-time
name: Digital Functional Verification Application Engineer (f/m/d)

contents:
We are looking for IT professionals who want to drive the increase of business value by partnering with the business.

As an IT partner you should become familiar with the targets, strategy, challenges, and priorities of the business and provide guidance and support to implement digital innovations. You will work with the business on strategic and innovation initiatives and process improvements via technology. The focus will be on Innovation and Data Analytics related topics in the scope of the overall Lead to Cash process.

Business scope is Digital Industries in various European countries. This position will report to the Digital Industries IT Partner organization. You will get the chance to work with an international team and on global topics.

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Drive innovation with technology and scout for opportunities to increase business value
  • Understand business requirements from different DI stakeholders in the area of data management and develop suitable data solutions
  • Ensure that data activities in Europe get well aligned with the global data strategy of Digital Industries
  • Shape data analytics activities for the Lead to Cash process across European countries
  • Proactively recommend IT approaches to business opportunities and challenges
  • Build and maintain strong, long-lasting stakeholder relationship with assigned customer
  • Understand business environment, identify objectives, and manage the portfolio of demands, projects and services
  • Plan, drive and manage demands and projects from beginning to end.
  • Support the implementation of global tools in alignment with HQ
  • Keep the management and employees informed on IT strategies, key priorities, initiatives and projects
  • Align and share best practices with IT and Digital Industries IT organizations


What do you need to join us?

  • Preferably bachelor's degree in engineering/IT/Computer Science/Business Intelligence/Data Science. Other may be considered.
  • 3-5 years of experience in IT (preferably in customer facing IT role)
  • Knowledge about Siemens Digital Industries Business setup and processes
  • Program / Project management / Agile Methodology skills
  • Data Analytics, Data Engineering and Data Architect skills
  • Experience in requirement analysis, business case proposals and solution design
  • Versed with emerging technology trends: Robotics automation, AI/ML and Analytics, BI Frontend technologies, Data warehouse technologies (e.g. Snowflake)
  • Should have handled at least 2 mid-size project or/and 1 project in Digital technologies using agile project management methodology

Behavioral Skills:

  • Customer and value oriented
  • Relationship management soft skills (Stakeholder mgmt., business /customer centricity, conflict management)
  • Effective communication skills at all levels of the business and IT organizations
  • Strong analysis and trouble shooting skills
  • Experience in working with leadership independently
  • Willingness to learn, grasp and adapt new skills
  • Willingness to travel
  • Enthusiastic and Experimental
  • Resilience

We have quite a lot to offer you:

  • employment in an international organization who is a world leader in its sector and has a stable market position
  • chance for professional development, possibilities to learn and gain new skills
  • wide range of responsibilities and the opportunity to make a real impact on business
  • good work atmosphere and organizational culture based on trust, responsibility and respect
  • work in an international environment, opportunity to collaborate with cross-region teams
  • attractive benefits package, including:
    • cafeteria benefits system (Multisport card, cinema / theater tickets / concerts, shopping)
    • private medical care
    • life insurance
    • employee pension scheme
    • additional paid days off
    • lunch card

Siemens is an Equal Opportunity Employer

If we all thought the same way, we would never create anything new. We know that by creating a diverse work environment, we have a real impact on the success of our company, so we encourage you to apply for Candidates from different backgrounds (with different experiences and approaches). By creating a friendly and open work environment, we take care to support the culture of diversity at every stage of our activities. All applicants will be assessed in terms of their competences, knowledge and skills.

We are waiting for you application!

Please send us your CV in English.

Experience Level: Mid-level Professional

Full / Part time: Full-time
name: IT Partner Professional (f/m/d)

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.

Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Machen Sie mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer Karriere.

Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld - herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert.

  • In Ihrer neuen Rolle erarbeiten Sie im Team Architekturen für eingebettete Systeme mit Schwerpunkt auf Schutzgeräte der Niederspannungstechnik und implementieren die Firmware.
  • Innerhalb eines agilen Umfelds führen Sie Modul-, Funktions- und Integrationstests sowie Spezifikations- und Code-Reviews durch.
  • Sie entwickeln und warten die bestehenden Produkte der Niederspannungstechnik sowie die zugehörigen Software-Test-Tools.
  • Darüber hinaus unterstützen Sie die angrenzenden Fachbereiche wie Produktmanagement, Systemtest und Fertigung.

Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat.

  • Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Fachrichtung Informatik / Technische Informatik / Elektrotechnik
  • Sie bringen Berufserfahrung (1-3 Jahre) in dem aufgeführten Aufgabengebiet mit
  • Praktische Kenntnisse der hardwarenahen Programmierung in C/C++, insbesondere für eingebettete Systeme mit limitierten Ressourcen
  • Sie verfügen über gute Kenntnisse in der Programmierung mit C# für die Erstellung von PC-Softwareprogrammen mit MS Visual Studio
  • Kenntnisse in digitaler Signalverarbeitung, Bussystemen und Echtzeitsystemen und Software-Design-Methoden (UML) wären wünschenswert
  • Idealerweise bringen Sie Erfahrung zu drahtloser Kommunikation via WiFi, Bluetooth, ZigBee und NFC mit
  • Deutsch und Englisch beherrschen Sie fließend in Wort und Schrift
  • Persönlich überzeugen Sie uns durch Teamfähigkeit, eigenverantwortliches Handeln und Denken, strukturiertes Vorgehen, Analysefähigkeit sowie Qualitätsorientierung

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

https://new.siemens.com/ - wenn Sie mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchten.

FAQ - wenn Sie eine Frage zum Thema Bewerbung bei Siemens haben.

#LI-Remote
name: Lead Security Engineer, Insider Risk & Investigations

contents:
Are you a highly motivated individual with a passion for the latest engineering and manufacturing software trends including Edge Computing, IOT, and cloud-based solutions? Do you have the ability to guide customers through sophisticated digital transformations? Are you looking for a fast-paced high growth career? If so, please apply for this outstanding opportunity at Siemens Digital Industry Software!

Our Customers ...

Many companies are partnering with Siemens to build their Comprehensive Digital Twin; the virtual representation that give them the capability of linking design and virtual simulations, to physical engineering and manufacturing. These companies are in the Aerospace, Automotive, Consumer Products & Packaging, Electronics, Medical Device, and Semiconductor industries where this technology gives them a competitive advantage. These companies are selecting Siemens because we have a Comprehensive Digital Twin, available today - from concept through manufacturing into field maintenance.

Your Challenge ...

Can you be a creative and independent domain specialist?

Become a member of our Customer Outcomes team as a PLM Junior Consultant. As a PLM Junior Consultant you will work closely with customers to provide software solutions to help them realize their Comprehensive Digital Twin. Helping our customers blur the boundaries between industry domains by integrating the virtual and physical, hardware and software, design, and manufacturing worlds.

Who we are looking for ...

A strong technical contributor that will implement our software solutions for our customers. As part of our team, you will work efficiently with Consultants, Solution Architects, Project Managers, and other internal and external interfaces such as Industry and Product Development teams to ensure that the customer succeeds in their objectives. Be responsible for providing specialist product expertise by consulting, advising, recommending, designing, and where appropriate deploying, specific technical solutions for the Siemens Digital industries Software solution to be delivered optimally and provide value to the customer. Support project/program management activities to control scope, cost, schedule, and quality and in line with program and project processes and messaging, interact with the customer to support the management of customer expectations and support customer adoption.
We need you to already have:

  • Graduated college with a degree in engineering, computer science, etc.
  • One to three years' experience with Teamcenter or other enterprise PLM, ERP or MES systems
  • Experience with the phases of software implementation projects including installation, configuration, testing, deployment, and postproduction support.
  • Experience with Software Development Lifecycles (SDLC) best practices, standards, and testing.
  • Familiarity with programming languages and tools such as JAVA, C++, C#, SQL, JavaScript or JS Frameworks
  • General knowledge with Microsoft Windows administration
  • Familiarity with Windows and/or Linux operating system, Amazon Web Services and/or Microsoft Azure, server/client communications, VPN and reverse proxies and TLS (HTTP vs HTTPS), Docker or Kubernetes, Web Servers (IIS, JBOSS, Tomcat, WebLogic), databases (Oracle, SQL, Aurora, RDS)
Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.

About Us ...

Siemens is a large international corporation with diverse interests. This includes a digital industries software division that is focused on external sales, maintenance, and deployment of software that enables the fourth industrial revolution (Industry 4.0). Our customers are therefore progressive problem solvers, pursuing change that will make them market leaders.

Our products and services are based on Microsoft technologies, which scale for both small or medium companies, and large multi-national corporations. This position is with the Siemens Customer Outcomes team that architects and deploys comprehensive solutions in North America; other teams in South America, Europe, and Asia provide local services for global solutions.

Join Us ...

See the Digital Twin in action; watch, as virtual representations become real products!
Links:
Siemens Digital Industries Software

[Unlimited Tomorrow] A young innovator makes prosthetics personalized
The New Era of Smart Innovation

name: PLM Junior Consultant REMOTE

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for:

In 2020, Circle unveiled Circle APIs: a set of solutions and smarter technology to help businesses accept payments in a more global, scalable and efficient alternative to traditional banking rails (spoiler: we’re using USD Coin under the hood). The Circle Security Team works to protect Circle; our customers, clients, and partners; and the financial markets upon which we rely.  As a member of this team, you’ll lead projects and be responsible for key deliverables of the security program while collaborating across Circle teams.  You will continue to learn and stay current in a fun and rapidly changing environment.

What you'll work on:

  • Conduct analysis of user behavior and organizational controls apparent in security logging.
  • Leverage analysis to build technical detections and controls.
  • Drive the development and implementation of automated data access checks across various platforms to help detect abuse and data exfiltration.
  • Perform security incident investigations using data analytics and computer forensics.
  • Build automation and detection models to support identification of anomalous activity to mitigate insider risk at scale.
  • Identify gaps in our infrastructure, and work with business partners to gain visibility through logging and detection.
  • Partner with stakeholders to contribute to Security Awareness messaging, training and exercises.
  • Drive deployment, development, and improvements in Security Incident and Event Management, Case Management, and Automation.
  • Provide security guidance to various organizations throughout the company.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle:

  • 5-7+ years experience in security operations such as technical investigations or Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) with a minimum of two years (can be overlapping) with a focus on Insider Threat.
  • Experience with technologies relevant to Insider Threat (SIEMs, DLP solutions, CASBs, UEBA tools, host forensic solutions).
  • Experience in data science and analytics solutions applicable to the insider threat detection space.
  • Exposure to programming, scripting and query languages such as Python, Golang, bash, SQL.
  • Strong ability to work collaboratively across teams during high-stress situations.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order of priorities on the fly.
  • Self-motivated and creative problem-solver able to work independently with minimal guidance.
  • Enthusiasm for scalable, reproducible security management. 
  • In-depth knowledge of the insider threat landscape.
  • Deep knowledge of SIEM, Case Management, EDR/ MDR, and DLP solutions.
  • Experience working in financial services or financial technology desired.
  • Experience working in an AWS environment preferred.
  • Experience communicating technical findings to a variety of stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in Google Suite, Slack and Apple MacOS preferred. 
  • Certifications such as CMU CERT ITPM/ ITVA, CCITP, CISM, CDPSE or similar will receive favorable consideration but are not required.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Austin, TX. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $175,000 - $230,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.
