name: Director, Blockchain Security

contents:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow.

We develop networks that supply our cities with light and heat intelligently and we know our way around automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. For these and many other future projects, we need smart thinkers who bring skills, creativity, and dedication to the table. People like you! Experienced researchers who boldly broaden horizons, true specialists, and clever minds who like to get to the bottom of things. In short, help us tackle the most exciting challenges and put into practice what really matters. We'll give you the opportunity to really make a difference. So what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.

What part will you play?

  • In your new role, you'll work on the solutions our customers need to protect and control tomorrow's energy networks. The digital transformation of the electric power system and the challenges of the energy transition require new thinking and breaking paradigms.
  • As a developer, you will work on building drivers for our groundbreaking and modular products and platforms. You are responsible for implementing low-level software on FPGA-based systems.
  • You build specifications and documentation for your software and develop tests and test automations.
  • You work in agile and multi-functional teams.

What you need to make real what matters.
  • You have a Master's Degree in Computer Science, Technical Computer Science or a comparable degree
  • The following topics look familiar to you, or you are interested in familiarizing yourself with them
    • Operating systems: WindRiver VxWorks and/or Embedded Linux
    • Driver and maybe also VHDL development
    • Developing in the area of embedded systems with real-time requirements
  • You are able to code in C/C++ and are familiar with modern, professional software systems
  • You know your way around Git and Dev Ops based software development
  • You convince us with your structured, solution- and goal-oriented approach and work methodology
  • In addition, you communicate expertly in German and English

What we offer.

  • A varied job in an innovative and successful company
  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • Expert networks and other support programs with a wide range of exchange and career opportunities
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Mentoring programs to create networks and get to know the company
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

name: Embedded Software Developer (f/m/d) Driver and Firmware

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.



Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Machen Sie mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer Karriere.

Verändere mit uns die Welt von morgen.

  • In Deiner neuen Rolle bist Du verantwortlich dafür, die Lösungen zu designen, die unsere Kunden für den Schutz und die Steuerung der Energienetze von morgen benötigen. Die digitale Transformation des Elektroenergiesystems und die Herausforderungen der Energiewende erfordern neues Denken und das Brechen mit Paradigmen.
  • Du bist als Senior Full Stack Architekt*in ein wichtiger Bestandteil unseres internationalen Netzwerks von innovativen Forschungs- und Entwicklungsteams und bringst Innovationen zur Produktreife.
  • Du gewährleistest hierbei Systemstabilität und -sicherheit, wirkst nicht nur bei der Spezifikation von Produkten, sondern auch deren Testsystemen mit
  • Du arbeitest eng mit unserem Produktmanagement bei der Definition der technischen Umsetzung von Kundenanforderungen zusammen

Dein Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Masterstudium oder eine Promotion in Informatik, Elektrotechnik, Mathematik, Physik oder einen vergleichbaren Abschluss
  • Du kannst auf langjährige Berufserfahrung in der professionellen Software-Entwicklung zurückgreifen
  • Du kennst Dich mit Embedded Systemen mit Echtzeitanforderungen aus
  • Du programmierst exzellent in C/C++ und Python, bist sicher in C#, JavaScript und Java, arbeitest Dich zügig in neue Entwicklungs-Umgebungen und Tools ein und findest Dich in modernen, professionellen Software-Systemen gut zurecht
  • Du verstehst die Bedeutung von äußeren Systemqualitäten wie Security, Usability, Performance und Reliability. Eine saubere Strukturierung, Robustheit, Nachvollziehbarkeit und Qualitäten wie Modularity, Testability, Maintainability und Extensibility sind Dir ein wichtiges Anliegen.
  • Du bist thematisch interessiert, agil, kooperierst gut, kannst Deine Fähigkeiten in einem Team zur Blüte bringen.
  • Du hast Fantasie, traust Dir zu, an vertikal integrierten Lösungen mitzuarbeiten, die Cloud, Server und Embedded Systeme einbeziehen.
  • Du überzeugst uns mit Deiner strukturierten, lösungs- und zielorientierten Vorgehensweise und Arbeitsmethodik
  • Dazu kommunizierst Du sicher in sehr gutem Deutsch und Englisch

Was wir bieten.

  • Eine herausfordernde und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem innovativen und erfolgreichen Unternehmen
  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten
  • Umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Deine berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • Experten-Netzwerke und andere Förderprogramme mit vielfältigen Austausch- und Karrieremöglichkeiten
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Dich und Deine Familie ermöglichen
  • Mentoring-Programme, um Netzwerke zu schaffen und das Unternehmen kennen zu lernen
  • Attraktives Vergütungspaket
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Du willst: Bewerbe Dich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

contents:
About us:

We'reSiemens. Award winning; Ranked on Fortune 500; Digital Engineering globalleader. A collection of over 300,000 excellent minds who are all making thefuture.

Position overview:

The Simcenter 3D Application Support Engineer is responsible for ensuring thetechnical success of our customers in their use of our software, Simcenter 3Dand Nastran. Working closely with customers to understand their engineeringworkflow, the Application Support Engineer proposes solutions and bestpractices to help the client meet their objectives as well as improve theirprocesses. The role includes classroom training, mentoring, and providingdirect customer support. The position works closely with the sales organizationto discover opportunities to grow usage within accounts and engage the customerto realize that growth.

Excellent communicationskills and a desire to work with clients are critical to success in thisfast-paced and broad engineering role. If you are creative, entrepreneurial,and possess excellent communication skills, we would like to hear from you.

Responsibilities:

  • Act as primary point ofcontact to assigned set of accounts for all technical issues related to theiruse of Simcenter 3D and Nastran. Identify problems and take responsibility forsuccessful resolution of issues
  • Facilitate the salesprocess in developing account intelligence, pursuing opportunities for growthof software usage, and assisting in software deployment
  • Conduct technicaldiscussions with customers to collect and understand simulation requirements,propose solutions, and explain benefits of our approach
  • Conduct training onintroductory and advanced topics in Simcenter 3D and Nastran
  • Perform benchmarksimulations and test cases to explore new methods, define best practices andverify results
  • Create Knowledge Basearticles for the customer community
  • Work on multipleprojects and support engagements simultaneously
  • Collaborate with productmanagement and industry teams to provide input on future product direction, andcommunicate and demonstrate new software capabilities to customers.

RequiredKnowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Bachelor of Science inMechanical Engineering, Aerospace or related field
  • Successful applicationof finite element, multi body or fatigue analysis to meet real world goals inresearch or design
  • Experience withsolutions for linear statics, buckling & normal modes on models ofunlimited size
  • Ability to learn new skillsand adapt to customer application needs
  • Excellent communication,organization, time management, and presentation skills
  • Ability to travel up to20%

PreferredKnowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • M.S. or Ph.D. inAerospace or Mechanical Engineering, or related field.
  • Experience withSimcenter 3D, Nastran, HEEDS or similar commercial tools.
  • Experience withStructural analysis; Dynamic Forced Response; Acoustics; Advanced Nonlinear;Rotor Dynamics; Super element Components; Design Optimization; TopologyOptimization; Aeroelastic; Steady-state and Transient Thermal analysis
  • Working knowledge ofcommon design processes, objectives and constraints in one of the followingindustries: Aerospace, Turbomachinery, Automotive, etc.

The salary range for this position is $95,800 to $172,400 and thisrole is eligible to earn incentive compensation. The actual compensationoffered is based on the successful candidate's work location as well asadditional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevanteducation/training. Siemens offers a variety of health and wellnessbenefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com.In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Die Digitalisierung stellt viele Unternehmen vor große Herausforderungen und wird die Prozesse in den kommenden Jahren immens verändern. So auch bei der Siemens Mobility GmbH - als IT Architect & Service Integrator (w/m/d) werden Sie bei uns aktiv ein Siemens Teamcenter Transformationsprojekt mitgestalten und begleiten. Das Projekt arbeitet nach der SAFe-Methodik.

Was tragen Sie bei?

  • Sie verstärken unser Team als erfahrener IT Solution Expert (w/m/d). In dieser anspruchsvollen Rolle sind Sie für das Release Management von komplexen IT-Anforderungen und -Projekten, innerhalb der bestehenden Mobility Teamcenter-Landschaft, verantwortlich.
  • Sie organisieren selbständig zusammen mit Ihren IT-Kollegen entsprechende Releases, beschreiben den funktionalen Umfang und führen erforderliche System- und Integrationstests durch. Sie erstellen anschließend die nötigen Release-Notes und kommunizieren ihre Ergebnisse in vorhandenen Gremien.
  • Das Erstellen von Plänen und Berichten über den Zustand der Releases gehört mit zu Ihren täglichen Aufgaben.
  • Zusammen mit Business-Ansprechpartner planen und koordinieren Sie den globalen Rollout der Releases.
  • Sie leisten Applikations- und Prozesssupport, um auch weiterhin effiziente und harmonische Geschäftsprozesse und Strukturen zu gewährleisten.
  • Dazu gehört auch die ständige Verbesserung des Software Release-Prozesses inklusive der Zeitstrecken und Erhöhung des Automatisierungsgrades.
  • Als Teamplayer arbeiten Sie Hand in Hand mit den relevanten Fachabteilungen und internationalen Kollegen, sowie externen Dienstleistern und stimmen sich regelmäßig mit Ihnen zu diesen vielfältigen Themen/Aufgaben ab.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik-, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einer ähnlichen Studienrichtung.
  • Sie haben darüber hinaus mehrjährige Berufserfahrung mit klassischen und agilen Methoden des Projektmanagements sammeln können.
  • Zudem überzeugen Sie uns mit sehr guten Kenntnissen als IT Solution Expert (w/m/d) im Release Management, idealerweise im Teamcenter-Umfeld.
  • Sie bringen eine strukturierte, eigenständige und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise sowie Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit mit.
  • Ihre Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit in globalen Teams sowie idealerweise der fachlichen Führung/Management von Mitarbeitenden setzen wir für diese Funktion voraus.
  • Fortgeschrittene Englischkenntnisse sind aufgrund der globalen Unternehmensausrichtung und Funktion unbedingte Voraussetzung.
  • Die Bereitschaft zu Dienstreisen (ca.20%) rundet Ihr Profil ab.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns haben Sie die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Sie zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein können. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Attraktive Konditionen

Sie erhalten ein attraktives Vergütungspaket einschließlich der Leistungen des Tarifvertrages (z.B. Zusatzentgelte und Urlaubsgeld) und weiteren Extras (z.B. betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Aktienprogramm).

Weiterentwicklung

Wir bieten Ihnen umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Mit unserem Learning Campus verfügen wir über einen Inhouse-Dienstleister mit einem vielfältigen On- und Offline-Angebot.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt?

name: IT Solution Expert (w/m/d) Release Management

contents:
Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition. 

For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.

Implementation Engineer

Adyen is looking for Implementation Engineers with a solid understanding of and hands-on experience with technology, integration design, project management and a strong merchant focus. As an Implementation Manager , you will be the primary point of contact for our merchant's technical teams, guiding them through the design, development, testing, and launch phases of their integrations with Adyen's platform. Your focus will be on ensuring an exceptional merchant experience throughout the project lifecycle. 

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on diverse projects that encompass various payment solutions, including Point of Sale (POS) systems, e-commerce platforms, marketplaces, and card issuing programs. By leveraging your technical proficiency and business acumen, you will play a vital role in guaranteeing a smooth implementation process and maintaining open lines of communication with our merchants and internal teams.

What you'll do:

  • Utilize development and programming expertise to create scalable and robust solutions for merchant integrations, while ensuring adherence to payment best practices.
  • Serve as a consultative partner in specific verticals such as e-commerce, point of sale, and multi-faceted platforms, guiding merchants through integration processes.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Account Managers, Product, and Engineering teams to deliver seamless merchant experiences and drive continuous improvements.
  • Leverage project management and technical consulting skills to oversee high-quality project delivery, guaranteeing the technical integrity of merchant integrations.
  • Provide consultation on optimizing payment solutions, including checkout experiences, authentication, omni-channel payments, and platform onboarding, while collaborating with Developers and Product Managers to enhance the platform.

Who you are:

  • Around 4 years of experience in a technical role, wowing prospects with technical capabilities and design of software products
  • Strong ability to translate technical jargon into clear business benefit
  • Experience in web API integration, technical consulting and web development
  • Technical educational backoground coupled with experience in either payment technology, travel & hospitality or networked devices (Internet of Things) is a big plus
  • Ability to identify and clearly communicate pragmatic solutions to complex integration problems
  • Proven ability to quickly learn new technologies, understand complex systems (APIs, databases, SDK's, etc.), and desire to improve technical acumen
  • Excellent communication skills, comfortable leading meetings with high level decision makers
  • Fluency in English and German is required for this position

Check out what our Implementation Engineers have to say about their roles here and here.

Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments 

Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you’re from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen. 

Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!

What’s next?

Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don’t be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.

This role is based out of our Berlin office. We are an office-first company and value in-person collaboration; we do not offer remote-only roles.
name: Implementation Engineer

contents:
Art der Anstellung: Befristet; 17,5 Std./Woche

Entwickeln, was morgen wichtig ist.

Wir haben viele Ideen, wie wir die Digitalisierung in Unternehmen erfolgreich vorantreiben können. Etwa durch offene Cloud-Plattformen, hochentwickelte Sicherheitssysteme oder clevere Werkzeuge für Entwickler. Ihre Rolle dabei? Werden Sie mit Ihrem IT-Know-how und Ihrer Begeisterung für wegweisende Informationstechnologien zu einem Welt-hinter-den-Kulissen-Beweger. Denken Sie IT einfach anders und lenken Projekte in völlig neue Richtungen. Zeigen Sie dort Mut, wo andere längst aufgeben würden. Kurz: Treiben Sie die Digitalisierung entscheidend voran! Wir bieten Ihnen die notwendigen Ressourcen dazu. Außerdem vielfältige Einsatzmöglichkeiten und die Chance, Teil eines weltweiten Netzwerks an IT-Experten und Profis zu werden. Willkommen in unserer Welt!

Wollen Sie die Zukunft des Betriebs von technischen Systemen mitgestalten? Mein Team ist führend in der Entwicklung von Technologien zur betriebsparallelen Simulation großer, komplexer Anlagen und Systeme. Sie wollen industrienahe Forschung auf folgendem top aktuellen Gebiet machen, dann kommen Sie in mein Team

Manche nennen es Aufgaben. Wir "Auf-in-die-Zukunft"!

  • Forschung an Methoden zur Anwendung betriebsparalleler Digitaler Zwillinge mit Fokus auf die Erkennung von Cyberattacken, Nutzung für vorausschauende Wartung oder Analyse von Fehlerursachen.
  • Konzipierung und Erstellung der Digitalen Zwillinge von komplexen technischen Systemen.
  • Entwicklung von Methoden um die Digitalen Zwillinge "on the edge" auszuführen.
  • Sie kalibrieren Ihre Modelle mit realen Daten
  • Sie bauen sich ein Netzwerk zu den relevanten Experten auf und diskutieren mit diesen ihre aussagekräftigen Demonstratoren.
  • Unterstützung bei der Akquise von öffentlich geförderten Projekten.

Wir suchen keine Superhelden. Sondern super helle Köpfe.

  • Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in Maschinenbau, technischer Informatik oder Physik.
  • Sie sind vertraut mit der Modellbildung technischer Systeme mit mindestens einem der folgenden Tools: Amesim, Plant Simulation, Process Simulate, SIMIT oder Mechatronics Concept Designer.
  • Sie haben Erfahrung mit den Siemens Automatisierungssystemen S7 1500, TIA Portal etc., PLC Sim Advanced.
  • Sie sind vertraut mit Hardware/ Software in the Loop.
  • Sie verfügen über gute Programmierkenntnisse, insbesondere in Python, C#, C++, oder .NET.
  • Bitte laden Sie zur Vervollständigung Ihrer Bewerbungsunterlagen das Abschlusszeugnis hoch.

Weitergehende Fähigkeiten:

  • Sie beherrschen fließend Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift, um mit einem internationalen Team problemlos zusammenarbeiten zu können.
  • Zu Ihren Stärken zählt eine selbstständige Arbeitsweise die von Motivation, Eigeninitiative und kreativem Denken geprägt ist.
  • Sie verfügen über ausgezeichnete analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, die durch eine unternehmerische Denkweise untermauert werden.
  • Sie verfügen über gute Präsentations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und sind in der Lage, komplexe Zusammenhänge verständlich darzustellen.
  • Sie sind aufgeschlossen und haben eine positive und mutige Einstellung.

Gesucht: Mitgestalter von morgen.

name: Doktorand*in (w/m/d) für betriebsbegleitende Digitale Zwillinge

contents:
Are you brave enough to challenge yourself?

Siemens Digital Industries Software is not a manufacturing company. We are a growing software company - bringing the technologies and innovations of tomorrow to our customers today. With the resources and opportunities of a large corporation, your opportunities are endless. The role you apply for today, is only the first step in your Siemens journey.

Join our team as Solution Architect Process Industry (f/m/d) and help us digitalize the future.

Our hybrid work model allows you to flexibly work from home, at customer sites or on-site at any of our 18 locations within Germany.

We support your mobility with a company car or a BahnCard 100.

How are you shaping the world of tomorrow? Challenging and future-oriented!

Digitalization poses major challenges for many companies and will change processes immensely in the coming years; everyone is talking about the buzzwords (e.g. closed loop manufacturing, product lifecycle management or Totally Integrated Automation, digital twin, Industry 4.0). We help our customers to face the transformation challenges they are facing on the path to sustainable and superior competitiveness.

We are looking for consultants who have already gained initial project experience with the customer and who can quickly integrate into our product landscape based on their MOM and PLM know-how.

  • As a MOM specialist, you will bring together the requirements of our customers and the solutions developed in pre-sales. You define concrete architectures based on customer needs, of course always with a view to optimal economic feasibility.
  • You are responsible for the targeted integration of the architectures into the overall systems, considering existing IT system landscapes.
  • You will work on-site at the customer's location as far as possible, both on your own and in project teams
  • In the event of technical problems arising in the customer project business, you will support our internal support and product development in order to work together to find a solution
  • As a technical expert, you will actively work on the documentation and further development of best practices and the further expansion of our knowledge database

Our culture is characterized by an open and cooperative atmosphere, the team at the center.

With us, you will be involved in exciting, highly complex projects at renowned and successful companies from various industries with the opportunity to act on your own responsibility. Reach for it!

How do you become part of our team? With a lot of drive and passion!

  • Methodical competence in consulting and concept development
  • You have process knowledge from one or more industries in the environment of product development and/or manufacturing and service
  • You know the benefits of the PLM philosophy, and understand the role of our products
  • You can guide the customer on the way to the realization of his individual PLM needs
  • Knowledge in CPG/FMCG processes and Industry
  • You like to communicate with people, and you are confident and confident with customers
  • You can familiarize yourself with new topics independently
  • Our customers experience you as enthusiastic, competent and with subtle powers of persuasion
  • Since we work very closely with our customers, a high degree of willingness to travel is required
  • Very good knowledge of German and English, both written and spoken

We offer an international environment with more than 140,000 customers around the world who already rely on our expertise in digitization. In Germany, more than 2,000 colleagues are involved in exciting and varied customer projects in the aerospace, automotive and transportation, consumer products and retail, electronics and semiconductors, energy and utilities, industrial machinery and heavy machinery, maritime, and medical devices and pharmaceuticals industries. With us, you will find a team-oriented work environment, comprehensive training options and attractive benefits. Through individual target agreements and diverse career models with specialization options, we offer you the opportunity to grow professionally and personally.


Are you an innovator? Then become part of our team!

If you would like to clarify initial questions with our recruiting team, please contact us by mail: careers-DACH.sisw@siemens.com

Contact person for this job posting is Marc Lerch.

Want to learn more about Siemens Digital Industries Software before you apply? Check out Mission / Vision and our software portfolio - or visit our homepage.

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities.
At Siemens, we believe people who've had real experiences dealing with being different will excel as leaders. Let's foster a culture of creativity and innovation. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

name: Solution Architect Process Industry (f/m/d)

contents:
Are you a highly motivated individual with a passion for the latest engineering and manufacturing software trends including Edge Computing, IOT, and cloud-based solutions? Do you have the ability to guide customers through sophisticated digital transformations? Are you looking for a fast-paced high growth career? If so, please apply for this outstanding opportunity at Siemens Digital Industry Software!

Our Customers ...

Many companies are partnering with Siemens to build their Comprehensive Digital Twin; the virtual representation that give them the capability of linking design and virtual simulations, to physical engineering and manufacturing. These companies are in the Aerospace, Automotive, Consumer Products & Packaging, Electronics, Medical Device, and Semiconductor industries where this technology gives them a competitive advantage. These companies are selecting Siemens because we have a Comprehensive Digital Twin, available today - from concept through manufacturing into field maintenance.

Your Challenge ...

Can you be a creative and independent domain specialist?

Become a member of our Customer Outcomes team as a PLM Junior Consultant. As a PLM Junior Consultant you will work closely with customers to provide software solutions to help them realize their Comprehensive Digital Twin. Helping our customers blur the boundaries between industry domains by integrating the virtual and physical, hardware and software, design, and manufacturing worlds.

Who we are looking for ...

A strong technical contributor that will implement our software solutions for our customers. As part of our team, you will work efficiently with Consultants, Solution Architects, Project Managers, and other internal and external interfaces such as Industry and Product Development teams to ensure that the customer succeeds in their objectives. Be responsible for providing specialist product expertise by consulting, advising, recommending, designing, and where appropriate deploying, specific technical solutions for the Siemens Digital industries Software solution to be delivered optimally and provide value to the customer. Support project/program management activities to control scope, cost, schedule, and quality and in line with program and project processes and messaging, interact with the customer to support the management of customer expectations and support customer adoption.
We need you to already have:

  • Graduated college with a degree in engineering, computer science, etc.
  • One to three years' experience with Teamcenter or other enterprise PLM, ERP or MES systems
  • Experience with the phases of software implementation projects including installation, configuration, testing, deployment, and postproduction support.
  • Experience with Software Development Lifecycles (SDLC) best practices, standards, and testing.
  • Familiarity with programming languages and tools such as JAVA, C++, C#, SQL, JavaScript or JS Frameworks
  • General knowledge with Microsoft Windows administration
  • Familiarity with Windows and/or Linux operating system, Amazon Web Services and/or Microsoft Azure, server/client communications, VPN and reverse proxies and TLS (HTTP vs HTTPS), Docker or Kubernetes, Web Servers (IIS, JBOSS, Tomcat, WebLogic), databases (Oracle, SQL, Aurora, RDS)
Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.

About Us ...

Siemens is a large international corporation with diverse interests. This includes a digital industries software division that is focused on external sales, maintenance, and deployment of software that enables the fourth industrial revolution (Industry 4.0). Our customers are therefore progressive problem solvers, pursuing change that will make them market leaders.

Our products and services are based on Microsoft technologies, which scale for both small or medium companies, and large multi-national corporations. This position is with the Siemens Customer Outcomes team that architects and deploys comprehensive solutions in North America; other teams in South America, Europe, and Asia provide local services for global solutions.

Join Us ...

See the Digital Twin in action; watch, as virtual representations become real products!
Links:
Siemens Digital Industries Software

[Unlimited Tomorrow] A young innovator makes prosthetics personalized
The New Era of Smart Innovation

name: PLM Junior Consultant REMOTE

contents:
At Siemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

Responsibilities

  • Act as part of a Delivery Services group, work productively with XHQ Consultants, XHQ Architects, Project Managers, and other internal & external interfaces to ensure that the customer succeeds in their objectives.
  • As an Architect resource, responsible for the translation of business requirements into specific process aligned designs for the Siemens XHQ Software solution based on multi product/multi-industry domain knowledge and best practices in the subject area
  • In line with project processes and messaging, interact with the customer to support the management of customer expectations and support customer adoption by leveraging the complete Siemens Delivery framework.
  • Provide architectural guidance and advice to Sales/PreSales pursuits and Services projects, through the complexity of solution architecture options and the long-term roadmap for the solution.
  • Act as trusted advisor on architectural design to address business problems ensuring that the technical integrity of the solution remains aligned to requirements and value delivery throughout project and that the various project solutions will work together to deliver value.
  • Provides direction for XHQ solution process design, process integration and process change activities either internally or at customer sites.
  • Leverage relevant templates in the leadership of project solutions in own specialist area, and curate best practices and templates.
  • Engage marketing team to support the marketing plan, marketing materials and webinars/workshops
  • Works under self-management and will determine solutions, methods and procedures on assignments/projects at a country level, of basic to moderate complexity and diverse scope that require specialist architectural expertise and leadership.
  • Use the customer solution development experience to assist in solution testing of XHQ; replicate real world use cases, participate in Beta testing of product releases, serve as the liaison during testing between the customer and R&D, provide detailed bug reports, and communicate customer feedback.

Competencies

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering or foreign equivalent.
  • Solid experience on on-prem, hybrid and cloud solution deployment
  • Proven strong experience in SQL queries for MS SQL, Oracle and PostgreSQL and SQL queries performance tuning
  • Ability to translate business requirements into XHQ solution design and deliver project scoping document
  • Understanding on network communication, data routing and firewalls
  • Hands-on experiences on using Web Service, RESTful APIs
  • Deep understanding on Windows IIS and Web Applications
  • Exposure to real-time process historians, notably OSISoft PI, Honeywell PHD, and AspenTech IP21, including experience interfacing to historians using SDK-level interfaces.
  • Basic knowledge of Data Modeling, with some demonstrated hands-on experience.
  • Prior exposure to Data Visualization and dashboard design and development.
  • Exposure in performing Factory Acceptance Test and Site Acceptance Test procedures.
  • Basic knowledge of XML and SVG, exposure to XML parsers and XSLT.
  • One year of applications programming experience in Java, JavaScript, VB.NET and/or C# and PowerShell
  • Exposure developing Web Services-based web applications in (SaaS).
  • Development experience with relational databases and SQL, especially Oracle, and Microsoft SQL Server and PostgreSQL
  • Hands on experience with Siemens XHQ, ideally in the area of solution delivery to customers is a plus.
  • DBA-level knowledge of Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server is a plus.
  • Project Management experience is a plus
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Reporting Services, SQL Integration Services, Microsoft SharePoint. l
  • Knowledge of computer security, access control, authentication, and encryption a plus.
  • Basic knowledge of PC, servers, tablets and other computational devices.
  • Domain knowledge in Oil & Gas, Chemical, or Process industries
  • Knowledge of Windows operating systems, especially Windows 2012/2016/2019 server and Windows 10, including security aspects, administration
  • Strong analytical and multitasking skills, responsive, and keeps commitments
  • Results Oriented: Ability to estimate risks and meet deadlines
  • Ability to make decisions, show risk awareness, and evaluate options and solutions. Exercises judgment in making sound decisions.
  • Team player and contributes towards team goals, customer focused.
  • Communication skills: is able to articulate his/her thoughts convincingly in both verbal and written form. Fluent in written and spoken English
  • Good time management skills
  • Can require up to 30% travel and onsite staff augmentation working model

Thetotal target compensation for this position is $116,100 - $232,200 (consistingof a base and variable). Siemens offers a variety of health and wellnessbenefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com. In addition, thisposition is eligible for time off in accordance with Company policies,including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exempt employees)or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

name: Solution Architect (XHQ)

contents:
Siemens Digital Industries Software - Where today meets tomorrow.

Let's make the difference together!

Meet the team - Video

Siemens Industry Software is a leading provider of solutions for the design, simulation and manufacture of products across many different industries. Formula 1 cars, skyscrapers, ships, space exploration vehicles, and many of the objects we see in our daily lives are being conceived and manufactured using our Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software. Headquartered in Plano, Texas, Siemens Industry Software works collaboratively with companies to deliver open solutions to help them make smarter decisions that result in better products.

Siemens has invested heavily in software companies (circa $11 Billion) to become the world leader in the Digital Revolution for Industry. It has a unique position in providing software to manage all four disciples - Mechanical, Electrical, Electronics and Software. Also, working with a sister Siemens company, can provide all the control electronics and drives to provide a complete factory automation solution.

We offer a role with responsibility, independence, and the possibility to contribute proactive. We foster a teamwork culture with room for individual development

Please visit https: https://www.siemens.com/plm.

About the Role

This role will be based in a Hybrid/remote working capacity, and we are fully supportive of flexible working arrangements.

As a Solutions Architect you will be responsible for executing consulting programs and working with customers to implement and deploy harness design and manufacturing process, utilizing Siemens Capital tool suit, you will work with the customer to ensure a focused approach for leveraging the strength of Capital tool-suite to address the customer wire harness design problems and fully realize the ROI of adopting the Capital toolset. Contributing to the success of a team of consultants, product specialists and account managers by increasing the deployment of Siemens SW in European region accounts. Primary focus will be on Siemens customers in Transportation Industry and Automotive/Military Aerospace.

Area of Responsibility

  • Engaging with customers who use and deploy Siemens Capital SW for electrical system design and manufacturing
  • Working with customers and technical sales resources to define and document recommended deployment plans
  • Executing and manage deployment projects at customer site according to agree upon deployment plan with constant communication and coordination with consulting management, sales team and SW engineering.
  • Delivering technical workshops as determined in deployment projects
  • Developing Plug-ins and configure tools to tailor environment to fit to customer's requirements
  • Assisting consulting management and account managers in determining incremental sales opportunities (services & products) and strategy leveraged by the successful deployment project
  • Providing technical assistance to customers including technical problem solving
  • Communicate customer technical requirements to product marketing

Your Qualifications & Experience

  • Experience in wire harness design and manufacturing processes, and understanding of key issues in Cabling, Automotive, Aerospace or Harness manufacturing industry and its principles, practices and techniques
  • Experience with Siemens Capital tools or other electrical system design tools
  • Demonstrated ability to build strong rapport and credibility with customers organizations while maintaining a company internal network of contacts
  • Programming skills
  • Project management and communication (written and verbal) skills
  • BSc or MSc, experinced of electrical harness design and manufacturing experience desired

Working at Siemens Software

Why us?

Working at Siemens Software means flexibility - Choosing between working at home and the office at other times is the norm here. We offer great benefits and rewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At Siemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.

Siemens Industry Software is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate unlawfully on the grounds of age, disability, gender assignment, marriage, and civil partnership, pregnancy and parental, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, or trade union membership.

Siemens. Making real what matters

If you want to make a difference - make it with us

contents:
Experte, Pionier, Netzwerker.

Du bist Ohren und Augen unserer Kunden. Du hörst genau hin und schaust weit voraus, suchst nach umfassenden Lösungen und schätzt den persönlichen Kontakt. Welche Möglichkeiten gibt es für den Kunden? Du wartest nicht ab, sondern ergreifst die Initiative. Du verwandelst "Das klingt interessant!" in konkrete Aufträge und ebnest den Weg für neue Geschäftsfelder. Wir versorgen Dich dabei mit neuestem Wissen und viel Freiraum für selbstständiges Handeln und Entscheiden. Das macht Dich zur zuverlässigen, vertrauenswürdigen und vorausschauenden Kontaktperson für unsere Kunden - diese warten bereits auf Dich!

Verändere mit uns gemeinsam die Welt von morgen.

  • Du gestaltest neue agile Software-Entwicklungen in der Automatisierungstechnik gemeinsam mit uns und unseren Kunden
  • Du entwickelst zuverlässig Konzepte mit technisch anspruchsvollen Produkten sowie kundenspezifischen Systemen und Lösungen im Bereich Engineering Workflow und innovativer Automatisierungsplattformen
  • Du definierst eigenverantwortlich Zielkunden und legst zusammen mit unserem Vertriebsteam Schritte fest, um diese Kunden für uns zu gewinnen
  • Deine Erfahrungen aus dem Markt bringst Du ein, um unser Angebot an Lösungen und Produkten im Automatisierungs- und Digitalisierungsumfeld zusammen mit Headquarter-Abteilungen stetig weiterzuentwickeln
  • Du analysierst verantwortungsvoll die Markt- und Wettbewerbssituation und entwickelst Strategien zur Steigerung des Marktanteils

Dein Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Du besitzt gute Kenntnisse in der Softwareerstellung und Agile Softwareentwicklung, DevOps-Ansatz und Continuous Integration sind keine Fremdwörter für Dich
  • Dich begeistern IT-Tools und Technologien wie GIT, Docker und Hochsprachen, z.B. C#, C++ und Javascript, und du kennst den Aufbau und die Funktionsweisen von IT-Systemen
  • Deine Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten für die Beratung von Kunden und Multiplikatoren sowie eine hohe Kundenorientierung zeichnen Dich aus
  • Du hast die Fähigkeit analytisch Lösungen für unsere Kunden zu konzipieren
  • Du besitzt einschlägige, langjährige Berufserfahrung sowie ein abgeschlossenes technisches Studium; Kenntnisse im Bereich PLC Programmierung, z.B. mit dem TIA Portal sind von Vorteil
  • Reisebereitschaft sowie sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden Dein Profil ab

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Deine berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Dich und deine Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Du willst: Bewirb dich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

https://new.siemens.com/ - wenn Du mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchtest.

FAQ - wenn Du eine Frage zum Thema Bewerbung bei Siemens hast.

contents:
We are looking for IT professionals who want to drive the increase of business value by partnering with the business.

As an IT partner you should become familiar with the targets, strategy, challenges, and priorities of the business and provide guidance and support to implement digital innovations. You will work with the business on strategic and innovation initiatives and process improvements via technology. The focus will be on Innovation and Data Analytics related topics in the scope of the overall Lead to Cash process.

Business scope is Digital Industries in various European countries. This position will report to the Digital Industries IT Partner organization. You will get the chance to work with an international team and on global topics.

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Drive innovation with technology and scout for opportunities to increase business value
  • Understand business requirements from different DI stakeholders in the area of data management and develop suitable data solutions
  • Ensure that data activities in Europe get well aligned with the global data strategy of Digital Industries
  • Shape data analytics activities for the Lead to Cash process across European countries
  • Proactively recommend IT approaches to business opportunities and challenges
  • Build and maintain strong, long-lasting stakeholder relationship with assigned customer
  • Understand business environment, identify objectives, and manage the portfolio of demands, projects and services
  • Plan, drive and manage demands and projects from beginning to end.
  • Support the implementation of global tools in alignment with HQ
  • Keep the management and employees informed on IT strategies, key priorities, initiatives and projects
  • Align and share best practices with IT and Digital Industries IT organizations


What do you need to join us?

  • Preferably bachelor's degree in engineering/IT/Computer Science/Business Intelligence/Data Science. Other may be considered.
  • 3-5 years of experience in IT (preferably in customer facing IT role)
  • Knowledge about Siemens Digital Industries Business setup and processes
  • Program / Project management / Agile Methodology skills
  • Data Analytics, Data Engineering and Data Architect skills
  • Experience in requirement analysis, business case proposals and solution design
  • Versed with emerging technology trends: Robotics automation, AI/ML and Analytics, BI Frontend technologies, Data warehouse technologies (e.g. Snowflake)
  • Should have handled at least 2 mid-size project or/and 1 project in Digital technologies using agile project management methodology

Behavioral Skills:

  • Customer and value oriented
  • Relationship management soft skills (Stakeholder mgmt., business /customer centricity, conflict management)
  • Effective communication skills at all levels of the business and IT organizations
  • Strong analysis and trouble shooting skills
  • Experience in working with leadership independently
  • Willingness to learn, grasp and adapt new skills
  • Willingness to travel
  • Enthusiastic and Experimental
  • Resilience

We have quite a lot to offer you:

  • employment in an international organization who is a world leader in its sector and has a stable market position
  • chance for professional development, possibilities to learn and gain new skills
  • wide range of responsibilities and the opportunity to make a real impact on business
  • good work atmosphere and organizational culture based on trust, responsibility and respect
  • work in an international environment, opportunity to collaborate with cross-region teams
  • attractive benefits package, including:
    • cafeteria benefits system (Multisport card, cinema / theater tickets / concerts, shopping)
    • private medical care
    • life insurance
    • employee pension scheme
    • additional paid days off
    • lunch card

Siemens is an Equal Opportunity Employer

If we all thought the same way, we would never create anything new. We know that by creating a diverse work environment, we have a real impact on the success of our company, so we encourage you to apply for Candidates from different backgrounds (with different experiences and approaches). By creating a friendly and open work environment, we take care to support the culture of diversity at every stage of our activities. All applicants will be assessed in terms of their competences, knowledge and skills.

We are waiting for you application!

Please send us your CV in English.

contents:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.
 

The Role:

As a Consultant in our delivery organization, you are part of our agile project teams to accelerate our customers’ digital transformation and drive Celonis’ international expansion. To generate high-value use cases, you work closely with our customers. You perform data transformations, develop analyses and derive business cases. You develop data-driven process insights and actions. You implement the newest features and functionalities of the Celonis software, such as Process Automation, Task Mining and Machine Learning.  

The work you'll do:

Initiate:

  • Play a key role in the Celonis implementation project to ensure the optimal solution to tackle the customer’s pain points
  • Design innovative analyses and execution apps and enrich them with Machine Learning algorithms or Task Mining to make the customer’s processes transparent 
  • Use our Celonis technology to identify process inefficiencies and understand the root causes, always in close collaboration with the customer

Implement:

  • Conduct value creation workshops and align measures to improve process inefficiencies 
  • Quantify the business and financial potential and present the findings to the management 
  • Implement our Process Automation technology to speed up the customer’s processes, to drive value and to improve the process conformance rate

Adopt:

  • Implement the most relevant KPIs measuring the customer’s success
  • Ensure the enablement of the customer to continuously improve processes
  • Set the foundation of the path to value to make the long-term customer success journey happen

The qualifications you need:

  • Min. 2-3 years working experience in IT-Consulting, Management Consulting, Process Improvement or a similar area 
  • You are knowledgeable of data related languages (SQL required, other programming languages such as Python are a plus...) 
  • You are very dedicated and visionary and want to actively drive the Celonis Process Mining technology forward 
  • Excellent analytical skills, well organised and known for being a quick learner
  • You search for a job with a steep learning curve in order to think outside the box and to continuously broaden your knowledge
  • Strong communication skills in German and English and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
  • Successfully completed your studies in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Information-oriented Business Administration/ Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis enables customers to optimize their business processes. Powered by its leading process mining technology, Celonis provides a unique set of capabilities for business executives and users to continuously find improvement opportunities within and across processes, and execute targeted actions to rapidly enhance process performance. This optimization yields immediate cash impact, radically improves customer experience, and reduces carbon emissions. Celonis has thousands of implementations with global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
name: Solutions Consultant - Delivery

contents:
Create a better tomorrow with us!

At our locations in Nuremberg, Erlangen and Fürth, we develop the SIMATIC automation system in agile teams. Our system concept is one of the key success factors of our automation technology. Our customers appreciate the smooth interaction of our products, and this system concept is safeguarded by the Factory Automation Systems Engineering teams.

We are looking for a dynamic and motivated thought leader to support our existing Systems Engineering Teams as System Expert (f/m/d). We'll give you the opportunity to really make a difference. Take your next career step with us!

What part will you play?

  • Sustainable strengthening of the system values, focus on innovative system architecture to enable cross-product customer use cases and the expansion of competitive advantages
  • Drive overarching system topics across Factory Automation Segments including interface coordination between FA products, to Division-Level and to partner Business Units
  • Define guidelines for documentation and to ensure system conformity
  • Derive technical requirements from system strategies for FA products, define overarching architecture and concepts
  • Support our cross-functional system teams with architecture expertise and guidance to align their top-level architecture
  • Establish and manage a network of System Experts across FA
  • Provide technical guidance to drive strategically important system topics
  • You have a personal focus on the customer side: you understand customer workflows and the usage of our products to identify innovations and improvements. You are responsible to develop system concepts and designs
  • You clearly understand business goals, system requirements and trace to realization
  • You understand the needs of our partners and feel comfortable to explain complex workflows to the management
  • You actively contribute with your participation to strategic projects, portfolio alignment across the boundaries of different organizations and major innovation initiatives

What you need to make real what matters.

  • The basis of your success is a technical degree or comparable knowledge with good business understanding, especially in the Software domain
  • You are an experienced software architect, and you know the challenge of leading architecture and development teams
  • You have in-depth knowledge in the domains of automation and software for industrial automation, and you are familiar with new technologies like Edge, Cloud, SaaS, IoT and their business models
  • You have already worked many years in globally distributed development environments and understand the impact of this development environment on the organization
  • You are ready to take over multiple responsibilities and act within our team and across the boundaries of our organization
  • You have highly proficient communication skills and build strong relationships with a wide range of partners, management and customers
  • Very high proficiency in German and proficient in English

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a future global standard
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Broad range of wellbeing offerings
  • Appealing Siemens pension benefits
  • Location-dependent childcare services to combine family and career
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

name: System Architect (f/m/d) Factory Automation

contents:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow.

We develop networks that supply our cities with light and heat intelligently and we know our way around automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. For these and many other future projects, we need smart thinkers who bring skills, creativity, and dedication to the table. People like you! Experienced researchers who boldly broaden horizons, true specialists, and clever minds who like to get to the bottom of things. In short, help us tackle the most exciting challenges and put into practice what really matters. We'll give you the opportunity to really make a difference. So what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.

What part will you play?

  • In your new role, you will be responsible for designing the solutions our customers need to protect and control tomorrow's energy grids. The digital transformation of the electric power system and the challenges of the energy transition require new thinking and the breaking of paradigms.
  • As a Senior Full Stack Architect, you are an important part of our international network of innovative research and development teams and bring innovations to product maturity.
  • You ensure system stability and security, not only in the specification of products, but also in their test systems.
  • You work closely with our product management team to define the technical implementation of customer requirements.

What you need to make real what matters.
  • You have a master's degree or a PhD in computer science, electrical engineering, mathematics, physics or a comparable degree
  • You have many years of professional experience in professional software development
  • You are familiar with embedded systems with real-time requirements
  • You have excellent programming skills in C/C++ and Python, are proficient in C#, JavaScript and Java, quickly familiarise yourself with new development environments and tools and are comfortable with modern, professional software systems.
  • You understand the importance of external system qualities such as security, usability, performance and reliability. Clean structuring, robustness, traceability and qualities such as modularity, testability, maintainability and extensibility are important to you.
  • You are thematically interested, agile, cooperate well and can bring your skills to blossom in a team.
  • You are creative and have the confidence to work on vertically integrated solutions that include cloud, server and embedded systems.
  • You convince us with your structured, solution- and goal-oriented approach and work methodology
  • In addition, you communicate confidently in very good German and English

What we offer.

  • A challenging and varied job in an innovative and successful company
  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Mentoring programmes to create networks and get to know the company
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • Expert networks and other support programmes with diverse exchange and career opportunities
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

contents:
Applicant Privacy Notice

Looking to join a world-class blockchain development team? Ava Labs makes it simple to deploy high-performance solutions for Web3, led by innovations on Avalanche. The company was founded by Cornell computer scientists, who partnered with Wall Street veterans and early Web3 leaders to execute a promising vision for redefining the way people build permissionless networks. Ava Labs is redefining the way people create value with Web3. Join us as we empower people to easily and freely digitize all the world’s assets on one open, programmable blockchain platform

We currently have an excellent opportunity to add a Client Support Engineer to help us support our growth for our AvaCloud clients in the Asia-Pacific region. This role will be an integral team member to ensure continued success of our clients deploying web3 applications on AvaCloud. 

WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Monitor and support active client implementations to ensure SLAs are met
  • Produce applications to monitor and alert on client implementations
  • Work closely with client technical teams to optimize deployments
  • Create reports on capacity, availability and performance of implementations
  • Support the Japan team in planning and implementations of new releases
  • Optimize Avalanche AvaCloud deployment process and identify opportunities for improvement
  • Identify and troubleshoot issues in AvaCloud operations and maintenance, provide solutions and/or escalate tickets to development teams
  • Drive AvaCloud upgrade cycles
  • Produce new dashboards to improve AvaCloud monitoring and alerting capabilities
  • Assess/analyze customer insights, issues and needs and provide timely feedback to internal stakeholders 
  • Influence feature enhancements, new feature development and roadmap prioritization
  • Perform duties during APAC business hours and quickly assess and respond to any alerts or incidents in order to maintain SLA limits
  • Perform on call support for regional clients

WHAT YOU WILL BRING

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
  • 2+ years of technical experience in the area of blockchain technology and deep technical understanding of the Avalanche Platform and Subnets
  • Ability to navigate highly dynamic and complex deployment environments with ease
  • Ability to clearly and precisely communicate detailed information with clients and internal stakeholders
  • Deep understanding of modern back end technologies and tools (Kubernetes, Datadog, PagerDuty, Terraform)
  • Experience with Go, Rust and/or Javascript preferred
  • Experience with collaboration tools like Github, Jira, Confluence
  • Fluent in written and spoken Japanese and proficient in English

#LI-Remote #LI-RP1

WHY AVA LABS?

If you've ever thought about joining an early stage Web3 company - this is it! We're a global, world-class team of experts in computer science, economics, finance, marketing, and law with offices in New York City and Miami. We're highly passionate about Web3 and redefining the way people build and use finance and decentralized applications of all kinds. The company received early-stage funding from Andreessen Horowitz, Initialized Capital, and Polychain Capital, with angel investments from Balaji Srinivasan and Naval Ravikant. Join us and be a pioneer in a new technology that will have implications across a range of verticals such as finance, gaming, investing, collectibles, among many others.

Ava Labs is committed to diversity in the workplace and we’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not hire on basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state or federal law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.
name: AvaCloud Client Support Engineer - Japan

contents:
Wir verbessern Wohlbefinden und Arbeitsabläufe. Das ist Dein größter Beitrag.

Die Arbeitswelt befindet sich im digitalen kontinuierlichen Wandel. Die Gebäude, in denen wir Arbeiten, entwickeln sich weiter. Sie werden smart und nachhaltig. Die Erwartungen an einen ausgezeichneten innovativen Arbeitsplatz steigen. Mit Hilfe unserer Digital Building & Workplace Solutions ermöglichen wir es unseren Kunden, von den Chancen der Digitalisierung zu profitieren und eine Arbeitsumgebung zu schaffen, bei denen der Mensch im Mittelpunkt steht.

Indoor Navigation, Real Time Location Systems, Asset Tracking, Workplace Apps (Desk Booking und Room Booking) und auch intelligente Infrastrukturen sprechen dich an dann.

Verändere mit uns gemeinsam die Welt von morgen.

  • Du bist zentrale Ansprechperson für unser Portfolio mit Schwerpunkt Software as a Service (SaaS) im Bereich Digital Building & Workplace Solutions
  • Du promotest und standardisierst unser SaaS-Portfolio und definierst Marktpakete
  • Du bereitest und implementierst die Markteinführung des Portfolios in Deutschland und bist im Anschluss Dreh- und Angelpunkt bei Rückfragen zum Portfolio
  • Du kollaborierst mit internationalen Teams und sicherst dadurch die erfolgreiche Anpassung des Portfolios für den deutschen Markt
  • Du hast Freude eng mit Kunden zusammenzuarbeiten und unterstützt unser Sales & Customer Success Management Team bei wichtigen Kundengesprächen, internen Veranstaltungen oder auch externen Messen im deutschen Markt
  • Du bist die Ansprechperson für Expertise zu sinnvollen technischen Umsetzungsmöglichkeiten und identifizierst Kundenanforderung, um diese ins Portfolio Management einzubeziehen.
  • Du analysierst Markttrends und Mitbewerber und bewertest und priorisierst neue Ideen und erarbeitest Machbarkeitsanalysen
  • Im Rahmen von dedizierten Trainingseinheiten und Kundenprojekten vermittelst du sowohl Grundlagen wie auch Fachwissen im SaaS-Bereich von Digital Building & Workplace Solutions
  • Du gewährleistest die Erstellung und Verfügbarkeit von Dokumentation, Schulungen, Marketingmaterial und technischen Vorführungen

Dein Profil für zusammen "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Du verfügst über mehrjährige Erfahrung im Portfolio Management von Software as a Service (SaaS) Anwendungen, idealerweise im Smart Infrastructure oder Digital Buildings Umfeld
  • Du hast Expertise im Software-Kontext und bei Cloud Technologien, z. B. APIs, Konnektivität und UI/UX
  • Du überzeugst durch ein exzellentes Verständnis der unterschiedlichen IoT-Lösungen am Markt und kannst dein Wissen auf die verschiedenen Bedürfnisse unserer Kunden übertragen und Lösungskonzepte erstellen
  • Wir freuen uns zudem, wenn du die aktuellen Trends und Innovationen in der modernen Gebäudetechnik kennst, insbesondere im Bereich Smart Infrastructure
  • Du verstehst es, zuzuhören und hast ein feines Gespür für die möglichen Herausforderungen der Kunden
  • Außerdem bist du eine Persönlichkeit, die gerne in internationalen Teams und mit Technologie-Partnern zusammenarbeitet und mit ihren Kommunikationsfähigkeiten unsere Kunden begleitet und berät
  • Ein Masterabschluss zusammen mit sehr guten Deutsch- und Englischkenntnissen machen dein Profil komplett

Was wir bieten.

  • Coaching bei Deiner persönlichen und fachlichen Weiterentwicklung
  • Empowerment - als Basis für Deine Tätigkeit,
  • New Work Modus mit 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als zukünftiger, weltweiter Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Dich und Deine Familie ermöglichen
  • Aktienprogramme um Miteigentümer der Siemens AG zu werden
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen:

Sie fragen sich, wie wir in Zukunft arbeiten werden? Und wie wir es schaffen, dass der Mensch hierbei im Mittelpunkt steht? Wie Gebäude zum Schlüssel für nachhaltiges Wachstum werden? Und wie man durch Datensammeln CO2 sparen kann? Dann kommen Sie zu uns, wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung! Siemens Real Estate verantwortet das globale Siemens-Immobilienportfolio. Weltweit sind wir für 8,7 Millionen Quadratmeter Büro und Produktionsflächen an rund 1.400 Standorten verantwortlich. Wir planen, bauen und gestalten. Wir betreiben und bieten die dazugehörigen Services. Unsere Leidenschaft gilt den Menschen, unserem Planeten und den unternehmerischen Anforderungen. Wir bringen jahrzehntelange Erfahrung und modernstes technisches Know-how über den gesamten Lebenszyklus von Immobilien ein. Wir bieten Lösungen für die Transformation unserer Arbeitswelt und für nachhaltiges Wachstum. Mit unserem Wissen beraten wir auch externe Unternehmen.

Wir sind ein Team aus Projektentwicklern, die weltweit verantwortlich für das Management von Development Projekten der Siemens Real Estate mit dem Fokus auf Bürogebäuden und Fabrikbauten sind. Als Corporate Real Estate Unternehmen entwickeln wir maßgeblich marktgerechte Neubauten für Siemens und ergänzend mit Potentialen für den externen Markt maßgeblich im europäischen Umfeld. Als Bauherrnorganisation verantworten wir ganzheitlich die Projekte, von der ersten Machbarkeitsstudie über die Baurechtschaffung, die Realisierung der Neubauten bis zur Fertigstellung und Vermietung.

Ein weiteres Feld für Entwicklungsvorhaben in Deutschland wird zukünftig der Bereich Wohnungsbau sein, für den wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine/n erfahrene/n Developer/in suchen, die/der unser Team maßgeblich mit ihrem/seinem Fachwissen und ihrer/seiner Kompetenz verstärkt.

Folgende Aufgaben beschreiben die Tätigkeit:

  • Sie verantworten ganzheitlich ein oder mehrere Development Projekte mit hohem Millioneninvestitionsvolumen im europäischen Umfeld, von der ersten Machbarkeitsstudie über die Baurechtschaffung, der Realisierung von Neubauten bis zur Fertigstellung und Vermietung.
  • Mit aufmerksamem Blick analysieren Sie den jeweiligen regionalen Immobilienmarkt und konzipieren und realisieren marktgerechte Gebäude mit dem Fokus auf Wohnungsbau.
  • Sie bringen Ihr Knowhow in großvolumige Wohnimmobilienprojekte ein, übernehmen die fachliche Leitung der einzelnen Projektteams und führen Ihr Team auf Augenhöhe.
  • Bei Baurechtschaffungen bemühen Sie sich um die kompetente Abwicklung der Verhandlungen mit Behörden und steigern die Kommunikation aller Projektbeteiligten.
  • Die regelmäßige Aufbereitung von Unterlagen für die Projektberichterstattung an interne Stakeholder gehört ebenfalls in Ihr Aufgabenspektrum.

Ihr Profil:

  • Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Masterstudium mit Schwerpunkt Immobilien (z. B. Corporate Real Estate Management, Architektur, Bauingenieurwesen, BWL).
  • Sie besitzen mehrjährige relevante Berufserfahrung in der komplexen Entwicklung von großen marktgerechten Wohn-Immobilienprojekten.
  • Sie bringen ein gutes Gespür für Ihr Team und Führungserfahrung auf fachlicher Ebene mit - ein respektvolles Miteinander ist Ihnen wichtig.
  • Ihr Umgang ist kooperativ, unterstützend und kundenorientiert und zeichnet sich durch einen hohen Verständnisgrad aus.
  • Die Anwendung von gängigen Tools (z. B. Office365, Sharepoint, SAP) ist für Sie selbstverständlich, zudem sind Sie affin gegenüber neuen Technologien und Tools.
  • Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse, sowie Reisebereitschaft runden Ihr Profil ab.

Was wir bieten:

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard.
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket.
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung.
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen.
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende.
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

contents:
If you really want to make a difference - make it with us

Siemens Mobility is a separately managed company of Siemens AG and has been a leading supplier in the field of mobility for over 160 years. Our core business includes rail vehicles, rail automation and electrification solutions, turnkey systems and related services. We have always been very innovative in making traveling faster, safer and more comfortable. Today, we need new solutions to new challenges such as climate change and rising populations worldwide. That's what drives us. That's why we shape mobility with passion, always being one step ahead. Through digitalization, we make infrastructures smart and create opportunities that get us from A to B sustainably and seamlessly. Our 38,200 employees are pioneers in mobility who help to keep the world moving.

Your new role - challenging and future-oriented

  • In our "Control, Communication and Information" department we craft the control system for our environmental-friendly Siemens locomotives. For the verification within the European approval process of electric and diesel-electric locomotives we are looking for reinforcement as soon as possible.
  • In your new role you will prepare approval documents in the areas of vehicle control, especially train control systems, data recorders, train radio and the train control functions.
  • To this end, you will work hand in hand with colleagues (f/m/d) in systems engineering on the creation of approval certificates and the associated creation process.
  • You will ensure that the verification process is complete and timely and will be in contact with internal and external partners.
  • You will continuously expand your system knowledge and increasingly gain a functionally broad view of the vehicle control of our locomotives.

Your qualifications - solid and appropriate

  • You have completed a technical degree (e.g. electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, mechatronics).
  • Furthermore, you help us best if you already have several years of professional experience in the field of rail vehicle engineering.
  • Ideally, you have already gained sound knowledge in approval process for rail vehicles in Europe and have already successfully completed approval projects as part of your project experience.
  • It is helpful if you assumed responsibility for approval-relevant functions in development and verification.
  • You enjoy getting to grips with complex problems and working on them together with colleagues. In addition, you have proficient skills in English, your German language skills are B2 or better and you are willing to travel throughout Europe (approx. 10 %).

Getting in touch with us - straightforward and direct

www.siemens.de/mobility
if you would like to find out more about Siemens before applying.
+49 (9131) 17 52430
if you wish to discuss any initial questions with our recruitment team. The contact person handling this job ad is Peter Wiebories.
www.siemens.com/careers
if you would like more information about jobs and careers at Siemens.
