contents:
Job Title
Field Service Engineer - Ultrasound (Remote/Travel: Kansas City, MO/KS)

Job Description

Allow your passion for improving lives to shine in this role where you'll be responsible for customer relationship management through the effective use of technical knowledge to install, troubleshoot, service, and maintain equipment at customer sites.

Your role:

  • Provide exceptional customer service by adhering to customer entitlements, setting clear expectations, and meeting commitments and arrival times to address and resolve customer needs. Understand the customer's business and competitive environment; generate service revenue.
  • Actively participate as a member of the regional work team; work to improve team processes and identify training gaps. Seek out opportunities to increase capability and capacity (i.e. may be required to become qualified in multiple modalities, learns new tools).
  • Perform all administrative duties within established Philips, State, and Federal regulatory requirements and timeframes including timesheets, service work orders, expense reports, Field Change Orders (FCO), preventative maintenance (PM), installation documents, site and service documentation, and other related paperwork. Adhere to established training, quality, and safety requirements.
  • Utilize tools, support, resources, and escalation processes within required time frames to resolve customer and system problems timely and effectively. Complete PMs, FCOs, installation and all related tasks (diagnose and resolve electronic, network, and mechanical problems).
  • Travel across the specified geography is required. The average driving time is 1-4 hours daily and may exceed 50% at times. Occasional overnight stays and travel by air and/or train may be required.
You're the right fit if:
  • You've acquired 5+ years of experience in a diagnostic imaging (field or hospital-based) service environment. Philips ultrasound training and experience is highly preferred.
  • Your skills include the ability to understand and apply electronic, mechanical, and networking theory to install, diagnose, and repair equipment, including knowledge and use of all necessary tools and test equipment.
  • You have a bachelor's degree in electronics or related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience; BSEE/BSEET/BSME/BSMET preferred.
  • You must be able to successfully perform the following minimum Physical, Cognitive and Environmental job requirements with or without accommodation for this Field Service position.
  • You must be able to:
    • Work in an office/home office and/or remote setting, as well as in a hospital/healthcare environment; adhere to requirements.
    • Work flexible hours (based on business needs to include overtime, weekends, and on-call rotations).
    • Safely work with radiation sources and/or radioactive materials; wear all required personal protective equipment.
About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.
  • Learn more about our business .
  • Discover our rich and exciting history.
  • Learn more about our purpose.
  • Read more about our employee benefits .
If you're interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here .

Philips Transparency Details

This is an hourly pay position with overtime eligibility. This role also includes, field service and lead generation incentive bonus plans, on-call pay, company fleet/car, training, and advancement opportunities. The actual base pay offered may vary depending on multiple factors including, job-related knowledge/skills, experience, business needs, geographical location, and internal equity.

In addition, other compensation, such as an annual incentive plan, field service incentive bonus, sales commission or long-term incentives may be offered. Employees are eligible to participate in our comprehensive Philips Total Rewards benefits program, which includes a generous PTO, 401k (up to 7% match), HSA (with company contribution), stock purchase plan, education reimbursement and much more. Details about our benefits can be found here .

At Philips, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top end of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent upon the facts and circumstances of each case.

Additional Information

US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa, now or in the future.

Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. For this position, you must reside in or within commuting distance to Kansas City, MO/KS .

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was tragen Sie bei?

Wir suchen für zwei unserer Projekte bei unseren Nahverkehrskunden nach Netzwerkspezialisten (w/m/d). Dabei ist der Einstellort Braunschweig, der Einsatzort ist jedoch wahlweise Hamburg oder Frankfurt am Main.

  • In Ihrer neuen Position errichten Sie OT-Netzwerke und Systeme oder Teilsysteme für Verkehrssteuerung und Automatisierung und setzen diese in Betrieb.
  • Sie integrieren und testen Erweiterungen komplexer und betriebener Anlagen oder führen Umbauten daran durch.
  • Darüber hinaus installieren, konfigurieren und administrieren Sie Netzwerkkomponenten und Serverbetriebssysteme in Kundennetzwerken.
  • Sie erfassen und analysieren auftretende Probleme und sorgen für deren Behebung.
  • Außerdem erstellen und ergänzen Sie Berichte und Protokolle (z.B. Prüf -, Mess- und Fehlerprotokolle) und stellen die Einhaltung von normativen- und Sicherheitsanforderungen sicher.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung zum Staatlich anerkannten Techniker (oder vergleichbar) im Bereich Netzwerke und IT-Systeme oder der Industrieautomatisierung.
  • Sie besitzen eine mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in der Errichtung, Wartung und Integration von OT-Netzwerken oder Automatisierungsanlagen.
  • In diesem Zuge haben Sie bereits komplexe (Gesamt)Systeme realisiert, administriert, getestet sowie entstört.
  • Die Begriffe TCP/IP-Netzwerke, Layer3-Komponenten, VNC, IT-Security, Windows- Server und Active Directory können sie bereits heute mit Inhalt füllen.
  • Sie bringen gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse mit.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Purpose

Wir sind Pioniere der Mobilität. Bei uns tragen Sie in einem Zukunftsmarkt aktiv zu Verkehrswende und Klimaschutz bei, weil unsere Transportlösungen in aller Welt den CO2-Ausstoß verringern.

Weiterentwicklung

Wir bieten Ihnen umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Mit unserem Learning Campus verfügen wir über einen Inhouse-Dienstleister mit einem vielfältigen On- und Offline-Angebot.

Attraktive Konditionen

Sie erhalten ein attraktives Vergütungspaket einschließlich der Leistungen des Tarifvertrages (z.B. Zusatzentgelte und Urlaubsgeld) und weiteren Extras (z.B. betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Aktienprogramm).

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt?

contents:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow.

We develop networks that supply our cities with light and heat intelligently and we know our way around automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. For these and many other future projects, we need smart thinkers who bring skills, creativity, and dedication to the table. People like you! Experienced researchers who boldly broaden horizons, true specialists, and clever minds who like to get to the bottom of things. In short, help us tackle the most exciting challenges and put into practice what really matters. We'll give you the opportunity to really make a difference. So what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.

What part will you play?

  • You solve problems with us for the energy transition in the area of protection and automation of electrical networks
  • In your role, you will be responsible for understanding our customers' needs and translating them into innovative algorithms for the protection of electrotechnical systems and networks
  • You will be involved in the implementation of innovative products and solutions (also with international teams)
  • Your task also includes the realization and qualification of the implemented software solutions

What you need to make real what matters.

  • You have a master's degree in electrical engineering, computer engineering or a comparable degree
  • You have good knowledge in the field of protection of electrical systems and networks
  • You have many years of experience in algorithm development and signal processing
  • You have basic knowledge in embedded C/C++, Git and DevOps
  • You convince us with your solution-oriented and scientific approach to work and procedure
  • In addition, you communicate confidently in very good German and English

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

contents:
Entwickeln, was morgen bedeutend ist.

Die Welt steht nie still. Und jeden Tag kommen neue Herausforderungen hinzu. Wir sehen darin eine Chance, uns ihnen zu stellen. Zum Beispiel, indem wir fragen: Wie kann das Leben der Menschen nachhaltig verbessert werden? Helfen Sie uns bei der Suche nach den passenden Antworten. Entwickeln Sie gemeinsam mit uns, was morgen entscheidend ist. Mit dem Ziel: die Gesellschaft in eine nachhaltige Zukunft zu begleiten. Ob durch schlaue Energie-Netzwerke oder smarte Gebäude. Willkommen in unserer Welt.

Verändern Sie zusammen mit uns gemeinsam die Welt von morgen.

  • Sie übernehmen alle anfallenden organisatorischen Aufgaben der Leitung Food & Beverage Digital Industries Deutschland
  • Sie behalten beim Vereinbaren von Terminen die Übersicht und bringen Menschen zum richtigen Zeitpunkt zusammen

  • Sie haben ein offenes Ohr für Anfragen interner Partner und Kunden, unterstützen interne Sonderthemen und führen mit Leidenschaft sämtliche bürowirtschaftliche Abläufe
  • Sie planen und koordinieren Besprechungen, Sitzungen und Workshops, gestalten den Rahmen kreativ mit und betreuen unsere Besucher
  • Sie haben ein offenes Ohr für Anfragen interner und externer Partner und unterstützen interne Sonderthemen

Was Sie können sollten. Damit die Welt mehr kann.

  • Sie verfügen über eine stellenspezifische Ausbildung, z.B. kaufmännische Ausbildung oder Ausbildung im Bereich Fremdsprachenkorrespondenz
  • Kenntnisse in CRM-Tools sowie im Eventmanagement interner und externer Veranstaltungen sind wünschenswert
  • Sie haben Berufserfahrung im Sekratariatsumfeld und besitzen ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten für den Kontakt mit unseren internen und externen Partnern
  • Sie interessieren sich für unsere Produkte und Dienstleistungen und kennen die Siemens Geschäftsprozesse und unser Portfolio

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you'll be responsible for:

Circle is looking for a passionate Security Leader with an expertise in Blockchain Security, deep understanding of different Blockchain technologies and Cloud based Product development. You’ll be part of the Security Engineering team and closely partner with the Engineering teams responsible for the development, deployment of USDC and supporting services.

What you'll work on: 

  • Own Circle’s Blockchain Security strategy, implementation and operationalization
  • Perform due diligence on potential Blockchains where USDC may be deployed to, in partnership with Product Compliance, Product and Engineering teams.
  • Recommend and validate Security controls and improvements across our technology stack
  • Own and build relationships with key external stakeholders such as customers, vendors, and auditors
  • Produce data-based reports on technology risk for senior management
  • Drive continuous improvement in the tech stack

You will aspire to our four core values: 

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you'll bring to Circle: 

  • 12+ years of experience as a security engineer or product security engineering leader with a minimum of five years (can be overlapping) with a focus on cybersecurity.
  • 5+ years demonstrated experience with security standard methodologies for Blockchain smart contract development and Cryptography
  • Demonstrated ability developing security controls that are easy to test and audit
  • Extensive knowledge of Security tool usage across SDLC including SAST, DAST and/or Security end to end testing
  • Proven experience developing automated, scalable, and reproducible security practices
  • Proficiency in managing multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order or priorities on the fly for themselves and their team.
  • Ability to influence internal and external customers to expediently resolve issues and achieve organizational objectives
  • The ability to design and operate controls that are easy to test and audit
  • Experience working in financial services or financial technology desired
  • Advanced degree in computer science, or related fields strongly preferred.
  • 5+ years proven experience building and managing small to medium sized teams
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Austin, TX. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $200,000 - $280,000

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

About us:

We'reSiemens. Award winning; Ranked on Fortune 500; Digital Engineering globalleader. A collection of over 300,000 excellent minds who are all making thefuture. This position is within the Simcenter Presales group, part of ourDigital Industries Software Business Unit.

Position overview:

As anApplication Engineer Modeling & Simulation you will act as the technicallead in demonstrating and promoting our Simcenter Simulation Solutions(primarily Simcenter Prescan) to our customers in a diverse range of industries,with primary focus on sophisticated driver assistance systems (ADAS) andautonomous vehicles (AV).

Thisexciting opportunity promoting innovative simulation solutions whilemaintaining a high level of technical knowledge offers a diverse range of skilldevelopment, from understanding the first principles of ADAS and AV Systems, todeveloping customer focused presentations, demonstrations, proof of conceptsand account leadership skills in support of our larger sales strategies.

Inthis position you will collaborate with the presales manager of ourfast-growing Simcenter Simulation and Test Solutions and be part of a largeteam of technical specialists, application and support engineers within theSiemens Digital Industries Software organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Work alongside the sales team to apply technical skills in the Simcenter Prescan portfolio, using a combination of application and domain expertise
  • Develops proof of concept models, provide demonstrations, and drives benchmarks using the Siemens Simcenter Simulation and Test Solutions portfolio
  • Collaborates with the product development roadmap by evaluating current product functionality, identifying customer needs, analyzing competitive products, analyzing and relaying customer requirements to the Siemens Simcenter product development team
  • Train and mentor client technical leads and domain authorities in the application of primarily Simcenter Prescan
  • Conduct technical discussions with customers to collect and understand simulation requirements, propose solutions, and explain benefits of our Simcenter portfolio
  • Join a community of highly skilled individuals maintaining professional and technical knowledge to stay at the forefront of innovation.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Master of Science in Automotive, Aerospace, Mechanical Engineering or other engineering team. Bachelor of Science with several years of shown experience will also be considered
  • Knowledge and experience using CAE simulation software
  • Strong interpersonal skills, communication skills and problem solving capabilities. Ability to work as an individual contributor and as a team member
  • Ability to travel up to 25%

QualifiedApplicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States.Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization nowor in the future for employment in the United .

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Experience using World, Sensor and Vehicle Modeling tools: Simcenter Prescan, Matlab/Simulink, Simcenter Amesim, Simcenter Heeds, Polarion, IPG Carmaker, Applied Intuition, Carla, SUMO, dSpace Aurelion, Carsim/Trucksim,
  • Proficiency with C/C++ and/or Python
  • Understanding of the properties and technologies of the sensors used in automated and autonomous systems (Camera/Lidar/Radar/Ultrasonic/dGPS/V2X)
  • Knowledge of the ADAS/AD system design process, including the validation and verification (V&V) process, including SIL/MIL/HIL
  • Experience with 3D design tools (CAD / Blender / OBS Studio)
  • Experience in student projects such as SAE Formula Student, EcoCAR Mobility Challenge, GM AutoDrive Challenge, Indy Autonomous Challenge
  • Industry domain experience in one of the following areas: Automotive / Ground Vehicle, Aerospace / Defense, Industrial Machinery

Thetotal cash compensation range for this position is $76,300 to $152,600with 10% of this being comprised of an annual incentive target. contents:
Erwerben Sie das Wissen, das Sie für die Welt von morgen benötigen.

Als Immobiliendienstleister der Siemens AG trägt Siemens Real Estate die globale Verantwortung für das Immobiliengeschäft des Konzerns. Wir verwalten das Portfolio, betreiben die Immobilien inklusive aller immobilienbezogenen Dienstleistungen, sind für deren Verwertung verantwortlich und gewährleisten alle Bauprojekte der Siemens AG. So gewährleisten wir einen unter Kosten-, Transparenz- und Effizienzgesichtspunkten optimierten und nachhaltigen Ressourceneinsatz an über 2.500 Standorten in der Welt.

Dies beinhaltet die Transformation zur CO²-Neutralität für das globale Siemens Real Estate Portfolios bis 2030. Zur ganzheitlichen Umsetzung von Dekarbonisierungs- und Instandhaltungsprojekten an unseren Fertigungs- und Bürostandorten suchen wir einen Projektmanager zur Steuerung der Planungs-, Ausführungs- und Inbetriebnahmephasen.

Verändern Sie mit uns die Welt von morgen.

  • Sie sind Mitglied eines Operations Teams im Hub Deutschland. Sie werden hauptsächlich regionale Energie- und Datentechnikprojekte steuern.
  • Sie übernehmen die Verantwortung für das Energy- und CO2-Reporting. Hierzu entwickeln Sie Mess- und Zählkonzepte inkl. Netzwerkanbindung und koordinieren die Implementierung.
  • Sie analysieren und optimieren die Verbrauchserfassung und leiten geeignete Maßnahmen auf einen ressourcenschonenden Einsatz von Energieträgern ab.
  • Sie sind verantwortlich für eine effiziente Projektrealisierung und Zielerreichung. Sie stellen die compliancegerechte Umsetzung im Hinblick auf Qualität, Zeitrahmen und Kosten sicher.
  • Im Rahmen der Projektabwicklung übernehmen Sie die Verantwortung für das Steuern der Projektteams und sorgen für den termingerechten Einsatz der Projektressourcen.
  • Durch regelmäßige Kommunikationsroutinen und Berichterstattung innerhalb der Organisation kontrollieren Sie die Einhaltung der Projektziele und initiieren bei Abweichung entsprechende Maßnahmen.
  • Sie bilden die Verbindung zwischen internationalem Energie-Management und den Property Managern innerhalb des deutschen Hubs.
  • Sie agieren jederzeit als kompetenter und zuverlässiger Partner (w/m/d) für unsere internen und externen Kunden, Siemens-/SRE Kolleginnen und Kollegen und Projektpartner.

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Der Grundstein Ihres beruflichen Erfolgs bildet ein abgeschlossenes technisches Studium, präferiert in den Fachrichtungen Versorgungstechnik, TGA oder Informatik.
  • Sie haben langjährige Erfahrung in der Planung, Koordination, Steuerung und Realisierung von Projekten.
  • Sie sind mit den neuesten technologischen Entwicklungen vertraut und haben die Fähigkeit die erforderlichen Ableitungen für SRE zu treffen.
  • Sie verfügen über Erfahrung in der virtuellen sowie digitalen Zusammenarbeit und können Projektteams führen. Sie sind äußerst geschickt im Umgang mit digitalen Werkzeugen.
  • Sie besitzen ein grundlegendes Verständnis von IT-Infrastrukturen und IT-Kabelungen für die Gebäudeleittechnik-Netzwerke.
  • Sie praktizieren unternehmerisches Denken und Handeln in Eigentümerkultur.
  • Sie besitzen verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.
  • Die Stelle setzt die Bereitschaft zu regelmäßigen Dienstreisen voraus.

Was wir bieten.

  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Vielfältige Gesundheitsangebote
  • Barrierefreie Standorte
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld - herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert

  • Als Berufs-/Quereinsteiger werden Sie im Rahmen einer spannenden Qualifizierungsphase Ihren späteren Beruf als Systemingenieur optimal kennenlernen. Diese Phase besteht aus verschiedenen Projekteinsätzen und Schulungen, die auf Ihre aktuellen Kompetenzen und zukünftigen Aufgaben abgestimmt werden.
  • Hierbei haben Sie selbst Einfluss auf die Wahl der Projekteinsätze, wobei Sie Ihr persönliches Interesse und die zu erwerbenden Kenntnisse miteinander vereinbaren können.
  • Als Systemingenieur (w/m/d) werden Sie den gesamten Lebenszyklus unserer Systeme kennenlernen - von der Spezifikation der Anforderungen über die Entwicklung und die Lösungsarchitektur bis hin zur Zulassung und Inbetriebnahme. Sie arbeiten an interdisziplinären Aufgabenstellungen mit und entwickeln sowohl im Nah- als auch im Fernverkehr die Bahnsysteme von Morgen.
  • Ferner besteht zudem auch die Möglichkeit, bei entsprechend vorhandenem Interesse, sich in die Richtung Sicherheits- bzw. Zuverlässigkeitsthematik zu entwickeln.
  • Dabei werden Sie Teil einer aufgeschlossenen, interdisziplinären Gruppe aus ehemaligen und aktuellen Programmteilnehmern und erweitern auf dieser Grundlage Ihr persönliches Netzwerk, das Sie bei komplexen Aufgabenstellungen unterstützt.
  • Schon während der Qualifizierungsphase übernehmen Sie anspruchsvolle Aufgaben und starten Ihre Karriere im System Engineering.

Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat

  • Sie haben Ihr Master-Studium oder Promotion einer ingenieur- oder naturwissenschaftlichen Fachrichtung überdurchschnittlich gut abgeschlossen oder stehen kurz vor dem Abschluss.
  • Darüber hinaus konnten Sie im Rahmen von Praxisphasen bereits erste praktisch Erfahrungen in einem Industrieunternehmen sammeln.
  • Sie zeichnen sich durch eine sehr gute Auffassungsgabe, eine hohe Analysefähigkeit und systemübergreifendes Denken aus.
  • Zudem verfügen Sie über eine ausgeprägte Kommunikationsstärke, Teamfähigkeit und Eigeninitiative und Sie wollen neue Wege mit uns gehen.
  • Interkulturelle Erfahrungen, z.B. aus Auslandsaufenthalten oder der Zusammenarbeit in multinationalen Teams, bringen Sie mit.
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab.

Bitte bewerben Sie sich mit vollständigen Unterlagen, d.h. einschließlich der Notenspiegel aus Bachelor und Master sowie Abiturzeugnis.

contents:
Location: This position can be fully Remote in the United States.

The Talos Detection Response Team creates network and endpoint signatures that are distributed world-wide to multiple products in Cisco's security portfolio and the open-source community.

In this position you will create detection content for vulnerabilities in a variety of Cisco and non-Cisco products. Understanding these vulnerabilities may come from reviewing technical reports, reading code diffs, or generating network traffic from proofs-of-concepts. Once released, these protections directly impact the security of people and organizations around the globe. With time and experience, you may have the opportunity to conduct in-depth research on novel threats, create tooling that forwards the mission of the team, and mentor junior team members.

If you're a tenacious learner, have an excruciating interest in detail, and want to expand your career in information security this may be the right role for you.

Role and Responsibilities:

  • Research security threats, attacker techniques and tools, 0-day vulnerabilities
  • Create advanced signatures and detection content for Snort, ClamAV, AMP, and other Cisco products
  • Write in-depth technical advisories about threats and signatures
  • Capture network traffic from threats for testing IPS and IDS security effectiveness
  • Analyze malware samples and vulnerable binaries using static/dynamic analysis, debuggers

Basic Qualifications:

3+ years professional and/or educational experience in all these areas:

  • Experience with vulnerability analysis and/or common methods of exploiting vulnerabilities in web applications, or network protocols, or binary applications
  • Experience using packet analysis tools like Wireshark to analyze common network protocols such as: HTTP/TLS, SMB, DNS, LDAP
  • Experience with a compiled language (e.g., C, C++, Rust, Go) and a scripting language (e.g., Python, Ruby, Perl)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with reverse engineering, malware analysis, and relevant tools (e.g., IDA Pro, Binary Ninja, Ghidra, radare2, x64dbg, WinDbg, OllyDbg), as well as analyzing assembly code and identifying code patterns in disassembled binaries
  • In-depth experience with vulnerability analysis and common methods of exploiting vulnerabilities, such as Buffer Overflows, Cross-Site Request Forgery, Use-After-Free, XXE
  • Experience with the structure of common file formats, such as PDF, MS Office, EXE, ELF, and an ability to identify anomalies using popular file-analysis tools such as 010 Editor
  • Knowledge of operating system internals and familiarity with concepts such as: application memory layout, C runtime or OS-related functions, kernel vs user space functionality
  • Familiarity with asymmetric ciphers (ECC, Diffie-Hellman, etc.), symmetric ciphers (AES, DES, etc.), and hashing algorithms (MD5, SHA256, etc.)
  • 2+ years of related industry experience in roles like: incident response, intrusion detection, forensic analysis, pentesting or red teaming, or vulnerability development
  • Experience with Snort rules language
  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience

Why Cisco Secure

We're global, we're adaptable, we're diverse, and our security portfolio is as extensive as it is groundbreaking. Have you heard of Threat, Detection & Response, Zero Trust by Duo, Common Services Engineering, or Cloud & Network Security? Those are only a few of our product teams! The only thing we're missing is YOU.

Join an enterprise security leader with a start-up culture, committed to driving innovation and giving you the opportunity to make an impact. We #InnovateToWin and we know we're better together, that's why we're dedicated to inclusivity, collaboration, and diversity in everything we do.

We're proud to be the Best Small and Mid-Size Enterprises Security Solution Cisco Secure continues to grow and evolve year after year with 100% of Fortune 100 Companies using our products, and we're excited to see the new heights we'll reach with your passion for security, your customer focus, and your desire to change things up!

"Cisco Secure offers an environment that combines cutting-edge, mission-critical, technology with some of the brightest, most diverse set of people I've ever had the pleasure of working with." - Chief of Staff, Engineering

There are so many amazing reasons to join Cisco. Learn more here!

#CiscoSecureEng23

#TalosEngFY23

#LI-Remote

Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S.:

When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.

U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. Employees accrue up to 20 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their PTO. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. Employees are also able to purchase company stock through our Employee Stock Purchase Program.

Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco pays at the standard rate of 1% of incentive target for each 1% revenue attainment against the quota up to 100%. Once performance exceeds 100% quota attainment, incentive rates may increase up to five times the standard rate with no cap on incentive compensation. For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

Auf der Suche nach einer neuen Herausforderung? Wir erfüllen Deinen Wunsch!

Bei Siemens Global Business Services (GBS) gestalten wir die "Shared Services" - Landschaft der Zukunft. Wir unterstützen Siemens Kunden aus jeder Branche und weltweit. Wir sind der Partner der Wahl, wenn es um maßgeschneiderte und herausragenden Unternehmensdienstleistungen in höchster Qualität geht.

Innerhalb der GBS ist Global Marketing Services (GMS) unser konzernweiter Inhouse-Partner für alle Fragestellungen im Vertriebs- und Marketingumfeld. Die Markt- und Kundensicht als Hebel zum Erfolg ist unsere Handlungsmaxime.

Vertriebs- und Marketingstrategien, Customer Experience Messung und Optimierungen, globale Marktforschungsprojekte, Kommunikationskonzepte, automatisierte Sales- & Marketing-Lösungen, Vertriebssteuerung über Dashboards und Tablets: All das und vieles mehr gehört zu unserem vielfältigen und innovativen Portfolio, das allen Siemens Einheiten und Regionen zur Verfügung steht. contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a transaction monitoring expert to join our Financial Crimes Compliance team. Reporting to the Global Head of Financial Crimes Compliance, the Director, Financial Crimes Transaction Monitoring, will be responsible for enhancing the design of our global AML/CTF transaction monitoring program, across both fiat and crypto. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working with financial intelligence, data and engineering teams to design transaction monitoring systems and scenarios, and is looking to find creative approaches to detect financial crimes in the fast-changing crypto ecosystem.

What you'll work on: 

  • Owning Circle’s global AML/CTF transaction monitoring program, including definition of scenarios, rules and thresholds.
  • Working closely with the Financial Intelligence Unit and Investigations Operations teams to enhance transaction monitoring based on SARs filed and broader ecosystem intelligence.
  • Partnering with Compliance Data & Technology, Product, and Engineering teams to implement enhancements to the transaction monitoring systems.
  • Driving scenario testing and tuning exercises to identify optimal transaction monitoring scenarios and thresholds.
  • Identifying opportunities to improve the overall efficacy of the transaction monitoring program, including but not limited to, use of machine learning and artificial intelligence to detect unusual activity.
  • Staying at the forefront of money laundering, terrorist financing and other financial crimes risks and typologies, and technologies to detect suspicious activity.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • A passion for harnessing the power of digital currency and blockchain technology and services built on top of it.
  • B.A./B.S. degree; quantitative or technical degree a plus.
  • 12+ years of relevant experience in AML/CTF, with a minimum of 5+ years developing transaction monitoring programs.
  • 5+ years of experience managing and leading teams. 
  • Deep knowledge of global financial crimes transaction monitoring programs and systems.
  • Deep understanding of cryptocurrency transactions, risks and typologies.
  • Experience with blockchain analytics and monitoring platforms, such as TRM Labs, Chainalysis or Elliptic.
  • An innovative and creative mind looking to suggest new solutions to old problems.
  • Proven experience working collaboratively and effectively with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders and internal teams.
  • Experience and comfort working in an ever changing industry and the flexibility to quickly react to changing demands.
  • CGSS, CAMS, or CFCS certification is a plus.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a Treasury Integrations Manager to join the team owning the collaboration and cross-functional effort between Treasury and Product teams. This team is working to streamline processes associated with treasury infrastructure across our products including design, operational needs, and reporting. This position will play a key role in partnering with both Product, Engineering, and Treasury on business roadmap and key initiatives. 

What you'll work on:

  • Developing and documenting problem statements and business needs for Treasury with input from subject-matter experts.
  • Supporting and facilitating the success of integration projects resulting from business need and Product planning such as feature updates, banking integrations, Treasury Management Systems, etc. 
  • Defining and developing project plans from a Treasury perspective where applicable.
  • Reviewing the Product organization’s project plans, designs and features to evaluate impact on Treasury organization.
  • Collaborating with Product, SMEs and Treasury leads to review project(s) scope and requirements including reporting, tooling, or other needs.
  • Supporting roadmap planning efforts including evaluating time and resources needed from partners.
  • Partnering with Treasury team leads to understand their roles and responsibilities.
  • Developing and communicating project updates within the Treasury Organization.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • 7+ years of experience in consulting, financial services or payments industry required.
  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or related field. 
  • Able to think critically, understand complex topics/technologies, define complex problems by developing concise summarization of technical initiatives put out by the business or problems identified by SMEs.
  • Proven collaborative problem solving skills with the ability to think critically and ask thoughtful questions.
  • Startup mindset.
  • Highly organized and detail oriented.
  • Takes pride in working on projects to successful completion.
  • Excels in a highly collaborative environment with different stakeholders and SMEs.
  • Practical experience creating process documentation and reports.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate information into actionable insights as well as the ability to coordinate feedback under tight timelines.
  • Highly proficient technical writing capabilities.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

name: Treasury Integrations Manager

contents:
Wissen für die neue moderne Welt von morgen.

Siemens Smart Infrastructure verbindet die realen und die digitalen Welten über Energiesysteme, Gebäude und Industrien hinweg. Insbesondere befassen wir und mit den Medien Strom und Gas sowie den Wärmeenergieträgern für Wärme und Kälte. Damit verbessern wir die Art und Weise, wie Menschen leben und arbeiten und sorgen gleichzeitig für mehr Effizienz und Nachhaltigkeit. Wir arbeiten mit Kunden und Partnern zusammen daran ein Ökosystem zu schaffen, das sowohl intuitiv auf die Bedürfnisse der Menschen eingeht als auch den Kunden hilft, ihre Ziele zu erreichen. Es hilft unseren Kunden erfolgreich zu sein, Gemeinschaften voranzubringen und unterstützt eine nachhaltige Entwicklung, um unseren Planeten für die nächste Generation zu bewahren.

Welche Rolle wirst du spielen?

  • Als Solution Designer bist du die Angebotsleitung in der Konzeptions-, Studien- und Analysephase von ganzheitlichen Energie- und Medienversorgungslösungen für unsere Kunden im Umfeld von Industrie, Gewerbe, Stadtwerken und Kommunen.
  • Du arbeitest eng und respektvoll mit unserem eigenen Vertrieb an Kundenangeboten und bist hier unsere wichtige Ansprechperson.
  • Zusammen mit dem Vertrieb erstellst du Kosten- und Nutzenrechnungen unserer eigenen Lösungen und Services und optimierst diesen gewinnbringend für unsere Kunden.
  • Du steuerst die weitere Ausarbeitung unserer techno-ökonomischen Lösungen und Services.
  • Die Fachleute und Ingenieure aus den einzelnen Disziplinen werden von dir fachlich geführt.
  • Für das Gesamtlösungsdesign unter weiterer Berücksichtigung der Kundenanforderungen und unseres Lösungs- und Serviceportfolios bist du zuständig.
  • Zu deinen weiteren Aufgaben gehört zudem die Kalkulation von Angebotsprojekten und die Verfolgung der Angebotskosten und -fortschritte.
  • Des Weiteren erstellst du Terminpläne für die Angebotsprojekte und verfolgst die Einhaltung von Meilensteinen.
  • Du entwickelst die Konzeptions-, Studien- und Analyseprojekte in ein Umsetzungs- und Serviceangebot an unsere Kunden.
  • Mit der Beauftragung der entsprechenden Angebote bist du für eine reibungslose Übergabe an unser Projekt Management verantwortlich.
  • Zu deinen klassischen Aufgaben gehört des Weiteren die operative Umsetzung von Gelerntem und die anschließende Optimierung von verschiedenen internen Prozessen.

Was du brauchst, um das zu verwirklichen, was zählt.

  • Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Maschinenbau, Elektrotechnik, Energie- und Versorgungstechnik oder Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen und bringst mindestens 5 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung mit.
  • Du konntest langjährige, einschlägige Berufserfahrung in der Konzeptionierung, Planung und Ausführung im Industrie- und Anlagenbau vorweisen und kennst dich mit allen Leistungsphasen der Vorbereitung bestens aus.
  • Du kannst Aufwände in der Ausarbeitung von Analysen, Konzepten und Angeboten abschätzen.
  • Kundenanforderungen erkennst du schnell und kannst entsprechende Grundkonzepte erstellen.
  • In der Erstellung von Angebotsstrukturen bist du versiert, ebenso in der Zusammenstellung von Angebotsprojektteams.
  • Du überzeugst durch deine Kommunikationsstärke und bist ein vertrauensvoller und gleichzeitig kollegialer Teamplayer.
  • Du behältst den Überblick, wer was bis wann machen muss.
  • Abgerundet wird dein Profil durch fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.

Das bieten wir dir:

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als zukünftiger, globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für deine berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für dich und deine Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Mitarbeiteraktienplänen
  • Attraktive Siemens Altersvorsorge
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Gesucht: Mitgestalter von morgen.

www.siemens.de

wenn du vor deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchtest.

www.siemens.de/karriere/faq

wenn du eine Frage zum Thema Bewerbung bei Siemens hast.

www.siemens.de/karriere

wenn du mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchtest.

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

name: Solution Design / Technische Angebotsleitung (w/m/d) für Konzepte, Studien und Analysen

contents:
We are looking for IT professionals who want to drive the increase of business value by partnering with the business.

As an IT partner you should become familiar with the targets, strategy, challenges, and priorities of the business and provide guidance and support to implement digital innovations. You will work with the business on strategic and innovation initiatives and process improvements via technology. The focus will be on Innovation and Data Analytics related topics in the scope of the overall Lead to Cash process.

Business scope is Digital Industries in various European countries. This position will report to the Digital Industries IT Partner organization. You will get the chance to work with an international team and on global topics.

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Drive innovation with technology and scout for opportunities to increase business value
  • Understand business requirements from different DI stakeholders in the area of data management and develop suitable data solutions
  • Ensure that data activities in Europe get well aligned with the global data strategy of Digital Industries
  • Shape data analytics activities for the Lead to Cash process across European countries
  • Proactively recommend IT approaches to business opportunities and challenges
  • Build and maintain strong, long-lasting stakeholder relationship with assigned customer
  • Understand business environment, identify objectives, and manage the portfolio of demands, projects and services
  • Plan, drive and manage demands and projects from beginning to end.
  • Support the implementation of global tools in alignment with HQ
  • Keep the management and employees informed on IT strategies, key priorities, initiatives and projects
  • Align and share best practices with IT and Digital Industries IT organizations


What do you need to join us?

  • Preferably bachelor's degree in engineering/IT/Computer Science/Business Intelligence/Data Science. Other may be considered.
  • 3-5 years of experience in IT (preferably in customer facing IT role)
  • Knowledge about Siemens Digital Industries Business setup and processes
  • Program / Project management / Agile Methodology skills
  • Data Analytics, Data Engineering and Data Architect skills
  • Experience in requirement analysis, business case proposals and solution design
  • Versed with emerging technology trends: Robotics automation, AI/ML and Analytics, BI Frontend technologies, Data warehouse technologies (e.g. Snowflake)
  • Should have handled at least 2 mid-size project or/and 1 project in Digital technologies using agile project management methodology

Behavioral Skills:

  • Customer and value oriented
  • Relationship management soft skills (Stakeholder mgmt., business /customer centricity, conflict management)
  • Effective communication skills at all levels of the business and IT organizations
  • Strong analysis and trouble shooting skills
  • Experience in working with leadership independently
  • Willingness to learn, grasp and adapt new skills
  • Willingness to travel
  • Enthusiastic and Experimental
  • Resilience

We have quite a lot to offer you:

  • employment in an international organization who is a world leader in its sector and has a stable market position
  • chance for professional development, possibilities to learn and gain new skills
  • wide range of responsibilities and the opportunity to make a real impact on business
  • good work atmosphere and organizational culture based on trust, responsibility and respect
  • work in an international environment, opportunity to collaborate with cross-region teams
  • attractive benefits package, including:
    • cafeteria benefits system (Multisport card, cinema / theater tickets / concerts, shopping)
    • private medical care
    • life insurance
    • employee pension scheme
    • additional paid days off
    • lunch card

Siemens is an Equal Opportunity Employer

If we all thought the same way, we would never create anything new. We know that by creating a diverse work environment, we have a real impact on the success of our company, so we encourage you to apply for Candidates from different backgrounds (with different experiences and approaches). By creating a friendly and open work environment, we take care to support the culture of diversity at every stage of our activities. All applicants will be assessed in terms of their competences, knowledge and skills.

We are waiting for you application!

Please send us your CV in English.

name: Treasury Integrations Manager

contents:
Explore our Digital World

Do you want to create technologies that transform the everyday for billions of people? Our digital careers offer the opportunity to shape the next era of growth and innovation, challenging ourselves to build a better future. By creating ground breaking technologies that transform our world, we need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Picture yourself in the Digital World of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

Why you'll love working for Siemens!

  • Freedom and a healthy work- life balance- Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
  • Solve the world's most significant problems - Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
  • Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
  • Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
  • Competitive total rewards package.
  • Profit sharing available.
  • Rewarding vacation entitlement with the opportunity to buy and sell your vacation depending on your lifestyle.
  • Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
  • Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
  • Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
  • Employee perks and discounts.
  • Diversity and inclusivity focused.

Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada's Top 100 Employers, Canada's Greenest Employers 2022, Canada's Top Employers for Young People 2022 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.

What will you do?

Siemens Power Technologies International (PTI) is seeking for a Power System Consultant to join our Power System Consulting group part of the Siemens Smart Infrastructure Division. You will be accountable to model and study electrical transmission, distribution, and industrial systems as well as develop plans to meet future system needs of clients such as independent system operators, transmission and distribution providers, and power producers. The Consultant will be working remotely in Canada for our PTI team.

The core responsibilities of the Consultant include the application of power system knowledge, modeling, simulation, and analysis of power system steady state, dynamic, and transient phenomena. In addition, the Consultant will prepare reports and presentations of the study results and provide recommendations accordingly. In this role, it is crucial for the Consultant to develop and maintain a strong relationship with our customers through ongoing communication. The successful candidate requires great problem-solving skills enabling quality and accuracy in a project environment. Attention to detail is a success factor.

What will you do?

  • Effectively conduct transmission, distribution, and industrial system studies within time and budget constraints
  • Provide direct customer support and keep ongoing line of communication with customer for scope delivery
  • Prepare study reports and other technical documentation and ensure the compliance in their completion and delivery
  • Present study reports to clients in a manner to effectively communicate the findings
  • Provide support to project teams as required

What will you need to succeed?

  • Degree in Electrical Engineering with a Power Systems focus, preferably Master's or PhD degree
  • 2-5 years' working experience in Power System Studies/Consulting; engineering internships and graduate programs will be considered as working experience
  • Knowledge with commercial software such as PSS®E, TSAT, PSLF, PSCAD, TARA
  • Familiarity with one or more programming languages such as C++/C, Fortran, and Python, for building user defined models and developing automation scripts to improve the speed and accuracy of simulations and analysis.
  • Great English written and spoken communication skills are required
  • Additional languages such as Spanish, French, German are assets

The successful candidate for this position must be fluent in English (verbal and written) to interact with English-speaking customers and suppliers across Canada and/or internationally as well as with Siemens colleagues based outside of Quebec, nationally and internationally

Please submit your resume in English.

About us.

We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.

For over 110 years, Siemens Canada has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality and reliability. Active across Canada, the company focuses on intelligent infrastructure for buildings and distributed energy systems and on automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. Siemens brings together the digital and physical worlds to benefit customers and society. Through Mobility, a leading supplier of intelligent mobility solutions for rail and road transport, Siemens is helping to shape Canada's passenger rail services. Via its majority stake in the publicly listed company Siemens Healthineers, Siemens is also a leading supplier of medical technology and digital health services. In addition, Siemens holds a minority stake in Siemens Energy, a global leader in the transmission and generation of electrical power.

Making a difference together we raised $385,000 towards charitable contributions, support over 38 non-profit organizations and planted 660 trees in our local communities. Siemens Canada has 2,500 employees from coast-to-coast and 24 office and production facilities across Canada. Join our team of approximately 293,000 talented professionals in more than 190 countries/regions and help us tackle the most exciting challenges to build a successful future together. So, what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.

To learn more about Siemens Canada, visit our website at www.siemens.ca

While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted

name: Junior Power System Consultant - Remote Canada

contents:
Mode of Employment: Fixed Term / 17,5h/week

Do you want to help create the future of healthcare? Our name, Siemens Healthineers, was selected to honor our people who dedicate their energy and passion to this cause. It reflects their pioneering spirit combined with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting?

Then come and join our global team as a PhD (f/m/d) for Advanced Clinical Magnetic Resonance Imaging to come and strengthen our EMEA (Europa Middle East and Africa) Scientific Partnerships organization to coordinate and drive collaborative research activities between Siemens Healthineers and our Partner Institutions in the field of Advanced Clinical MR.

Choose the best place for your work - Within the scope of this position, it is possible, in consultation with your manager, to work mobile (within Germany) up to an average volume of 60% of the respective working hours.

Your tasks and responsibilities:

  • In this role you will be embedded in our international and interdisciplinary EMEA Scientific Partnerships (SP) network and will be in close contact with collaboration and innovation teams of our Business Lines in the headquarter
  • Your main tasks will be in the field of MRI sequence development for advanced clinical applications (e.g. body arterial spin labeling, advanced neuro imaging, Glymphatic flow/brain waste disposal, X-nuclei imaging)
  • Based on-site in Kiel you serve as an interface between on-site clinical researchers and development at Siemens Healthineers
  • You will work in collaboration with medical professionals, scientists and engineers at our partner site in Kiel and in the Research and Development departments at Siemens Healthineers
  • You will ensure the successful planning, execution and completion of joint research projects in collaboration with our research partners
  • You will support the clinical experts in research activities and support clinical documentation and generation of scientific publications
  • You will drive the validation of technical concepts for future product integration, and continuous collection of feedback for prototypes and coordinate communication amongst the participating departments
  • As part of our global collaboration team, you will maintain regular contact and actively contribute to our EMEA expert community and contribute to the predevelopment roadmaps of the R&D teams in Erlangen
  • At our clinical partner in Kiel you will join an enthusiastic, international, 30+ members biomedical imaging group with a focus on MRI methods development, with access to the latest equipment from Siemens (e.g. 3T MAGNETOM Cima.X, MAGNETOM Vida, 1.5 T MAGNETOM Sola)

To find out more about the specific business, have a look at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/services/value-partnerships

Your qualifications and experience:

  • You own a master's degree in Physics, Engineering, Materials Science or a comparable discipline (Master, Diploma, etc.)
  • You have excellent knowledge, practical experience and abilities in the fields of magnetic resonance
  • You have Experience in programming (Matlab, C, C++, Python), modelling and analyzing data would be an advantage
  • You possess a high degree of conscientiousness, reliability, and diligence
  • You have the readiness for planning, structure and attention to detail a good spoken and written English
  • Ideally you have experiences with MR sequence developments


Your attributes and skills:

  • You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills in English (spoken and written), German is considered a plus
  • You have excellent organizational skills with a high degree of autonomy, process orientation, and attention to detail, while creative at finding solutions through interpersonal communication
  • You are passionate about healthcare innovations
  • You are willing to travel to (work on-site at) our partnering hospital in Kiel, Schleswig-Holstein 100% of your time

Our global team:

Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company. 68,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services.

Our culture:

Our culture embraces different perspectives, open debate, and the will to challenge convention. Change is a constant aspect of our work. We aspire to lead the change in our industry rather than just react to it. That's why we invite you to take on new challenges, test your ideas, and celebrate success.

Check our Careers Site at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/de/careers
As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals with disabilities.

Wish to find out more before applying? Contact us:

contents:
If you really want to make a difference - make it with us

Siemens Mobility is a separately managed company of Siemens AG and has been a leading supplier in the field of mobility for over 160 years. Our core business includes rail vehicles, rail automation and electrification solutions, turnkey systems and related services. We have always been very innovative in making traveling faster, safer and more comfortable. Today, we need new solutions to new challenges such as climate change and rising populations worldwide. That's what drives us. That's why we shape mobility with passion, always being one step ahead. Through digitalization, we make infrastructures smart and create opportunities that get us from A to B sustainably and seamlessly. Our 38,200 employees are pioneers in mobility who help to keep the world moving.

Your new role - challenging and future-oriented

Are you interested in a technically challenging and promising job that will enable you to make a significant contribution to expanding the rail share of freight and passenger traffic? Then join our engineering team, develop the globally successful rail vehicles from Siemens Mobility and contribute to bringing maximum tractive power to the rails in the future.

  • You will design and develop the software for controlling the electric drives of our high-performance locomotives.
  • You will also coordinate the functions and interfaces with the specialists for the other system components.
  • You will work together as a team on solutions for current designs, new customer requirements, improvements and new functions.
  • You always focus on the reusability of your work results in terms of a platform strategy.
  • In addition, you put the results into practice to increase the efficiency and reliability of the vehicles.
  • You actively support the testing of drive functions in simulation, in the laboratory and on the vehicles.
  • You will continuously develop yourself in this position. In doing so, various development directions are open to you with the technical expert role in engineering as well as the assumption of technical project coordination.

Your qualifications - solid and appropriate

  • You have completed a master's or diploma degree at a university in the field of electrical engineering or mechatronics.
  • Sound knowledge of the control and regulation of electric drives is part of your background.
  • You have practical knowledge of structured and model-based software development - from requirements analysis to testing and documentation.
  • You enjoy dealing with complex problems, are goal-oriented and communicative.
  • You consciously use presence work in the office as well as mobile work to achieve your work goals.
  • You are willing to travel at home and abroad as required in the work environment (up to 20%)
  • In addition, you speak German at least on Level B2 and very good English.

Getting in touch with us - straightforward and direct

if you wish to discuss any initial questions with our recruitment team. The contact person handling this job ad is Peter Wiebories.

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was tragen Sie bei?

  • In Ihrer neuen Rolle als Enterprise Solution Architect (w/m/d) erstellen und pflegen Sie die Referenz-Architektur und entwickeln das Architektur-Portfolio strategisch weiter.
  • Dabei berücksichtigen Sie die Vorgaben aus Vision und Strategie zur Unterstützung der Solution Architekten in Projekten.
  • Sie verantworten die Integration und Einhaltung der Siemens Mobility Customer Services Enterprise Architecture Methodik.
  • Sie erstellen, pflegen und kommunizieren die modulare wiederverwendbare Standard-Architektur.
  • Sie erstellen und pflegen eine Management Check-Liste für Projekte und bewirken im Falle einer Abweichung von der definierten Standard-Architektur Lösung eine Entscheidung des Managements.
  • Sie etablieren und steuern eine Siemens Mobility Customer Services weite Solution-Architektur-Community zur regelmäßigen Kommunikation und Abstimmung.
  • Sie unterstützten bei der Auswahl von strategischen Partnern.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Masterstudium der Fachrichtung Elektrotechnik, Informatik, Mathematik oder vergleichbares.
  • Sie können langjährige Erfahrungen als Solution Architekt für komplexe Lösungen mit Schwerpunkt auf Integration verschiedener Systeme vorweisen.
  • Sie haben bereits Erfahrungen mit Architekturmodellierungstools und Methodiken gesammelt (z.B. System Architect, Archi, TOGAF).
  • Sie besitzen außerdem Erfahrungen mit Daten-basierten Diensten und Kompetenzen im Bereich IT-Lösungen, Software-Lösungen und Kommunikationstechnologien.
  • Idealerweise verfügen Sie darüber hinaus über Kenntnisse aus dem Service/Rail-Umfeld und bringen bereits Projekterfahrung mit.
  • Sie haben bereits interkulturelle Erfahrungen gesammelt, idealerweise auch durch Auslandsaufenthalte.
  • Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und fließende Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns haben Sie die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Sie zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein können. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Purpose

Wir sind Pioniere der Mobilität. Bei uns tragen Sie in einem Zukunftsmarkt aktiv zu Verkehrswende und Klimaschutz bei, weil unsere Transportlösungen in aller Welt den CO2-Ausstoß verringern.

Weiterentwicklung

Wir bieten Ihnen umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Mit unserem Learning Campus verfügen wir über einen Inhouse-Dienstleister mit einem vielfältigen On- und Offline-Angebot.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

name: Enterprise Solution Architect (w/m/d)

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.

Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Machen Sie mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer Karriere.

Verändern Sie zusammen mit uns die schöne Welt von morgen.

  • Sie sind Teil unseres ca. 120-köpfigen Service-Teams in einem langfristigen Kundenprojekt in München-Allach
  • In Ihren Zuständigkeitsbereich fallen die elektronische Instandsetzung und Störbeseitigung an komplexen CNC-, SPS-gesteuerten Produktionsanlagen und zugehöriger Peripherie
  • Sie analysieren verlässlich Fehlerursachen, sorgen für eine nachhaltige Fehlerbehebung und Erarbeiten wirksame Abstellmaßnahmen
  • Ihre Arbeitsaufträge erhalten und dokumentieren Sie in SAP PM
  • Zu Ihren Aufgaben gehört die zuverlässige Sicherung von SPS- und NC-Programmen
  • Die Betreuung von Fremdfirmen im Rahmen von Instandhaltungsaufträgen zählt ebenso in Ihren Aufgabenbereich

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung, wenn Sie eine abgeschlossene (elektro-) technische Ausbildung z.B. Elektroniker (w/m/d) für Automatisierungstechnik, Mechatroniker (w/m/d) sowie mindestens ein Jahr einschlägige Berufserfahrung haben
  • Sie verfügen über Kenntnisse und erste Erfahrungen in der Instandhaltung von Werkzeugmaschinen und Anlagen (z.B. Dreh-, Fräsmaschinen, verkettete Bearbeitungszentren)
  • Kenntnisse über CNC-Steuerungen (Sinumerik), Bus-Systeme und Antriebstechnik unterstreichen Ihr eigenes Profil
  • Darüber hinaus punkten Sie auch mit Ihrer zuverlässigen Arbeitsweise, einem kundenfreundlichen Auftreten sowie mit einer kooperativen Zusammenarbeit im Team
  • Eine generelle Bereitschaft zur Schicht,- Samstagsarbeit und Rufbereitschaft sowie sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden Ihr Profil ab

Was wir bieten.

  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

contents:
Location: Global

Mode of Employment: permanent / full time

Rethinking IT.

We have lots of ideas about how to drive digitalization in companies successfully. For example, with open cloud platforms, highly developed security systems, and clever tools for developers. What is your role in this? Move the world with your IT expertise and passion for game-changing information technology. Be bold when others would have given up. In short, play a key role in driving digitalization forward! We'll provide the resources you need to do this. We also offer a variety of opportunities to get involved and be part of a global network of IT experts and professionals. Welcome to our world!

We make real what matters. This is your role.

We are seeking an experienced IT Strategy Manager to lead our IT initiatives and support the development of our technology roadmap. As a key member of our Digital IT Strategy team, you will be responsible for defining and executing our company's IT strategy, ensuring it aligns with our business goals and objectives.

• Align - Align with Siemens Strategy, Business and Corporate Functions Strategy, and IT Leadership. Reflect market trends/ innovations and needs for change.

• Define - Lead development of IT Strategy and formulation of directions, guiding principles, frameworks, focus topics/ priorities, major changes, objectives, and values together with stakeholders (including a breakdown by different stakeholders and their strategic measures).

• Communicate & socialize - Make the organization aware of IT Strategy, desired business outcomes, targeted major changes, and their reasons. Ensure teams understand how they will contribute to the strategy's success and overall goals.

• Implement - Trigger, guide, consult and orchestrate IT strategy implementation - enforce relevant implementation support if necessary.

• Measure - Develop and maintain strategy implementation target system/ KPIs with stakeholders.

What you need to make real what matters.

• Master's degree in IT (e.g., Computer Science, Information Systems) or business administration with a focus on IT or a similar degree

• Many years of IT leadership experience in large international IT organizations or IT strategy consulting; with a proven track record of developing and implementing IT strategies, preferably in complex/ federated organizational structures

• Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects in a fast-paced environment

• Excellent communication in English and collaboration skills on all levels of the organization

• Strong business acumen with cross-industry experience (e.g., Software/Technology, Industrial, Building, Mobility, and Financial Services) and understanding of the interplay between technology and business objectives

• Strong understanding of current trends and technologies, including cloud computing, data analytics & AI, cybersecurity, and IT sustainability, as well as emerging technologies like the industrial metaverse

We've got quite a lot to offer. How about you?
