name: Senior IT Strategy Manager (f/m/d)

contents:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow.

We develop networks that supply our cities with light and heat intelligently and we know our way around automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. For these and many other future projects, we need smart thinkers who bring skills, creativity, and dedication to the table. People like you! Experienced researchers who boldly broaden horizons, true specialists, and clever minds who like to get to the bottom of things. In short, help us tackle the most exciting challenges and put into practice what really matters. We'll give you the opportunity to really make a difference. So what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.

What part will you play?

  • As a Product Lifecycle Manager, you will be the entrepreneur for IoT connectivity and edge computing offerings for protection and substation automation in power systems. This includes responsibility for defining and implementing reliable and scalable IoT data collection, connectivity, and edge computing capabilities that enable our SaaS offerings running in cloud environments.
  • You will be in charge of bringing versatile, interoperable, and efficient IoT connectivity & edge capabilities to the market, which will provide the basis for flexible and scalable rollout of our SaaS/Cloud offerings into customer deployments. You will thereby establish the IoT data collection, connectivity and edge computing system blueprint, and shape decisions on the related platforms & technologies.
  • Your responsibilities will also include establishing the pricing models, delivery and execution concepts, sales materials, calculation methods, and standard quotations for the IoT connectivity and edge offerings.
  • You will stay abreast with new technologies and market developments worldwide to address the constantly evolving digital transformation landscape for power systems.
  • Additionally, you will support Cloud product managers on strategic customer projects to ensure the success of our IoT offerings. Your responsibilities will range from sales support during customer interactions, to enabling delivery teams during I&C stages, to leading all aspects of the smooth operation of the connectivity & computing solutions at productive customer sites.
  • Working closely with the R&D, Sales, Operations, and Customer Services, you will ensure detailed integration of IoT connectivity offerings with our Cloud offerings, and other protection and substation automation functions, including device management.
  • You will collaborate closely with other teams within the Siemens businesses in pursuing alignments to grow the IoT connectivity capabilities in power automation-intensive markets of mutual relevance.
  • Via close agreement with our regional units, you will chip in to achieving sales, revenue und margin targets for our overall IoT/Cloud offerings.

What you need to make real what matters.
  • You hold an equivalent bachelor's or master's degree in electrical engineering, and at least longterm experience applying the aforementioned knowledge and skills.
  • Furthermore, you have at least mid-term experience in delivering IoT connectivity & edge computing solutions in one or more of the following verticals: power grids, power generation, industry & infrastructure.
  • You have in-depth functional and technical knowledge of protocols and sensors used in protection and substation automation, with deep expertise of the following areas: IoT connectivity via secured protocols such as MQTTS and HTTPS; field data acquisition via IEC 61850, SNMP, and Modbus TCP protocols; Computing on constrained devices and industrial PC platforms; Establishing secured IoT connectivity & networking concepts for greenfield and brownfield industrial sites.
  • Besides a strong understanding of product lifecycle management and strategic planning, you can also quickly grasp new technologies and translate them into customer benefit.
  • Your proficiency and experience in energy automation concepts is highly desirable.
  • With your initiative, result-orientation, and good interpersonal skills, you drive topics to in collaboration and teamwork with diverse faculties to successful results.
  • You are a strong communicator in English and preferably also in German and have confirmed this in the past in an intercultural environment.

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

name: Product Lifecycle Manager (f/m/d) IoT Connectivity and Edge Computing

contents:
Technical Leader, Platform Engineering

Have you ever had a poor customer experience and thought of a million ways in which it could be improved? Have you ever empathized with those whose job it is to deliver customer experience and envisioned how, if properly empowered and motivated, the overall service delivery experience could be better? If so, we want to talk.


We are looking for an expert Cloud Infrastructure Engineer to join our team of highly skilled Platform Engineers. Engineers on our team have a strong background in scripting languages, AWS services, and orchestration tools. We also expect to have experience with telemetry tools. As a technical leader for Platform Engineering team is accountable for design, development and implementation of scalable and reliable infrastructure solutions. Hands on usage of service discovery tools and secret management tools would be helpful.

Additionally, familiarity with data processing pipelining, in-memory cache database, CICD tools, version control tools, service mesh, message streaming services would be a strong asset. This Leader will also lead initiatives on cost reduction, security posture improvement, improving reliability and uptime of all core infrastructure services. Dedication, hard-working, influencing others, inspiring others, transparent communication are some of the core expectations from this role. Technical leader in this role is encouraged to direct a team of dedicated engineers to differentiate Platform and services in collaborative environment.


Qualifications required for this role:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field.
  • 15+ years of proven experience in the field DevOps Engineer and/or Software/QA Engineer role out of which 7+ years in Platform/Infrastructure Engineer role and 3+ years in providing Technical Mentorship to engineers on Platform development is encouraged.
  • Proficient in scripting with Python and Shell.
  • Strong skills with AWS services including EC2, S3, EBS, VPC, ELB, IAM, Route 53, Security Groups, and Elasticache.
  • Experience with orchestration tools like Kubernetes (EKS), Terraform, and HashiCorp Nomad.
  • Experience with monitoring tools which includes AppDynamics, Prometheus, Statsd, Grafana, Burrow (kafka lag), Kafka minion, and Victoria Metrics.
  • Experience with logging using Elasticsearch, Fluentd, and Kibana.
  • Experience with alerting using Prometheus alert manager, Sensu, and PagerDuty.
  • Experience with service discovery using HashiCorp Consul.
  • Experience with container platforms such as Docker.
  • Experience with secure secret stores such as HashiCorp Vault.
  • Experience with data pipelining using Kafka/Zookeeper/Apache Flink/MongoDB/S3/Elasticsearch.
  • Experience with in-memory cache using Redis and Elasticache.
  • Experience with CI and CD tools: GitHub actions, Jenkins, Argo Workflows, ArgoCD, Spinnaker, GitHub Actions, and Helm
  • Experience with version control using GitHub.
  • Experience with ops tools such as Rundeck.
  • Extensive experience with Istio service mesh.
  • Experience with software lifecycle processes such as Agile and Kanban.


Why Cisco


We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.

We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.


We Are Cisco. #WeAreCisco

Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S.:

When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.

U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. Employees accrue up to 20 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their PTO. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. Employees are also able to purchase company stock through our Employee Stock Purchase Program.

Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco pays at the standard rate of 1% of incentive target for each 1% revenue attainment against the quota up to 100%. Once performance exceeds 100% quota attainment, incentive rates may increase up to five times the standard rate with no cap on incentive compensation. For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.
name: Technical Leader - Cloud Infrastructure Engineering

contents:
Wissen für die neue moderne Welt von morgen.

Siemens Smart Infrastructure verbindet die realen und die digitalen Welten über Energiesysteme, Gebäude und Industrien hinweg. Damit verbessern wir die Art und Weise, wie Menschen leben und arbeiten und sorgen gleichzeitig für mehr Effizienz und Nachhaltigkeit. Wir arbeiten mit Kunden und Partnern zusammen daran ein Ökosystem zu schaffen, das sowohl intuitiv auf die Bedürfnisse der Menschen eingeht als auch den Kunden hilft, ihre Ziele zu erreichen. Es hilft unseren Kunden erfolgreich zu sein, Gemeinschaften voranzubringen und unterstützt eine nachhaltige Entwicklung, um unseren Planeten für die nächste Generation zu bewahren.

Verändern Sie zusammen mit uns die Welt von morgen.

  • Sie sind zuständig für die kaufmännische Steuerung und praktische Abwicklung von komplexen Aufträgen unter Beachtung der Bilanzierungsvorschriften sowie der Projektmanagement-Richtlinien.
  • Sie führen Planungs-, Steuerungs- und Kontrollaufgaben nach finanz- und betriebswirtschaftlichen Vorgaben durch. Hierunter fallen die Termin- und Kostenverfolgung, die Wirtschaftlichkeitsüberwachung, die Mit- und Nachkalkulationen sowie die Bewertung in der Risk Contingency.
  • Zudem analysieren, kommentieren und verhandeln Sie Kunden- und Lieferantenverträge.
  • Sie identifizieren und bewerten zusätzliche Kundenansprüche, wie z.B. Preis-, Mengen- und Terminänderungen und setzen diese im Claim-Management gegenüber dem jeweiligen Kunden durch.
  • Des Weiteren bewerten Sie unter Einbindung unserer Legal-Abteilung Chancen und mögliche Risiken. Danach werden die Maßnahmen ergriffen und entsprechend dokumentiert.
  • Sie führen das Assetmanagement aus, und sind im Rahmen dessen für die ordnungsgemäße Erstellung von Rechnungen, Gutschriften und Anzahlungsanforderungen, sowie die ständige Überwachung von Zahlungseingängen und Forderungen zuständig.
  • Außerdem führen Sie vertrauensvoll die Quartals- bzw. Jahresabschlussarbeiten unter genauer Beachtung der internen und gesetzlichen Vorgaben, sowie die Vorsorgebewertung und -erfassung durch.

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Als wesentliche Grundlage für Ihren persönlichen Erfolg bringen Sie ein abgeschlossenes kaufmännisches Studium mit.
  • Sie konnten in Ihrer gesamten Laufbahn bereits entsprechend mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im System- und Anlagengeschäft sammeln.
  • Sie verfügen über fundierte betriebswirtschaftliche Kenntnisse, insbesondere im Bereich Projektmanagement.
  • Sie können finanztechnische Zusammenhänge analysieren und entsprechend Maßnahmen daraus ableiten.
  • Darüber hinaus besitzen Sie umfassende Kenntnisse in den zentralen Bereichen Angebots- und Auftragsabwicklungsprozesse, Claim- und Risikomanagement und Vertragsrechtsthemen.
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie der sichere Umgang mit den MS-Office Applikationen und SAP runden ihr Profil ab.
  • Wir freuen uns darauf Sie kennenzulernen, wenn Sie Engagement zeigen, kollegial, ergebnis- und kundenorientiert arbeiten und außerdem Entscheidungsfreude und hohe Teamfähigkeit mitbringen.

Das bieten wir Ihnen:

  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • Ein Arbeitsumfeld, in dem sich jeder mit seiner ganzen Persönlichkeit einbringen kann und sich als Teil von Siemens fühlt
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Mitarbeiteraktienplänen
  • Attraktive Siemens Altersvorsorge
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

contents:
Who we are

Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations™ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing — and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.

Working at Samsara means you’ll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team that’s shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, you’ll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term. 

Recent awards we’ve won include:

Great Place To Work Certified™ 2023

Best Place to Work by Built In 2023

Financial Times The Americas’ Fastest Growing Companies 2023

Deloitte Fast 500 Companies

IoT Analytics Company of the Year in 2022’s IoT Breakthrough Winners

We see a profound opportunity for data to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of operations, and hope you consider joining us on this exciting journey. 

About the role:

Samsara is looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead our new Safety Events team in the UK. Samsara operates one of the largest AI-enabled, connected fleets globally. In FY23, we detected 110M+ AI-based safety events and analyzed 40B+ miles worth of driving data. Video is at the core of Samsara’s Fleet Safety product. Utilizing Samsara’s GPS Fleet Tracking and AI Dash Cam hardware products, the Fleet Safety team uses real-time computer vision and sensor data to detect and alert drivers of dangerous conditions.  These real-time video events enable Samsara customers to coach risky driver behaviors and recognize/reward safe driving.

Samsara’s safety event platform integrates advanced sensor data and data analytics to enable customer and driver workflows that ensure safe driving behavior. The team owns the end-to-end feature stack and builds data storage in a variety of technologies, backend services in Go, web components in React, and mobile components in React native. It collaborates closely with the Safety scoring teams to integrate new data and event detection types into coaching workflows and works with product and design partners to deeply understand customer workflows to optimize efficiency and effectiveness for Samsara’s customers.

You should apply if:

  • You want to impact the industries that run our world: The software, firmware, and hardware you build will result in real-world impact—helping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely.
  • You want to build for scale: With over 2.3 million IoT devices deployed to our global customers, you will work on a range of new and mature technologies driving scalable innovation for customers across industries driving the world's physical operations.
  • You are a life-long learner: We have ambitious goals. Every Samsarian has a growth mindset as we work with a wide range of technologies, challenges, and customers that push us to learn on the go.
  • You believe customers are more than a number: Samsara engineers enjoy a rare closeness to the end user and you will have the opportunity to participate in customer interviews, collaborate with customer success and product managers, and use metrics to ensure our work is translating into better customer outcomes.
  • You are a team player: Working on our Samsara Engineering teams requires a mix of independent effort and collaboration. Motivated by our mission, we’re all racing toward our connected operations vision, and we intend to win—together.

Click here to learn about what we value at Samsara. 

In this role, you will: 

  • Participate with senior leadership and cross-functional peers to develop a long-term roadmap and strategy for Samsara’s event detection features
  • Collaborate with senior engineers to drive technical strategy to expand the safety event detection platform
  • Collaborate with ML/CV teams to improve model feedback loops and results
  • Set quarterly goals and balance product/engineering priorities for maximum impact
  • Drive planning and execution on the roadmap, delivering features and infrastructure enhancements to delight customers and other mobile developers
  • Champion, role model, and embed Samsara’s cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices
  • Hire, develop and lead an inclusive, engaged, and high performing team

Minimum requirements for the role:

  • Experience building scalable, mission-critical SaaS applications
  • Experience operating, maintaining, and improving upon large scale application services
  • Strong interpersonal communication skills (including listening, speaking, and writing) and ability to work well in a diverse, team-focused environment
  • Strong track record of delivering products and features that customers love
  • Proven record of attracting top talent and coaching the team
  • 8+ years of relevant software engineering work experience
  • 3+ years of hands-on technical management experience

An ideal candidate also has:

  • B.S. in Computer Science or related technical discipline
  • Experience building customer-facing web applications

At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background, race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, etc. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

Accommodations

Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or click here if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.

Benefits

Full time employees receive an above market total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at our Benefits site to learn more.

Flexible Working 

At Samsara, we have adopted a flexible way of working, enabling teams and individuals to do their best work, regardless of where they’re based. We value in-person collaboration and know a change of scenery and quiet space to work is welcomed from time to time, but also appreciate that the world of work has changed. Our offices remain open for those who prefer to collaborate or work in-office, but we also encourage fully remote applicants. As most roles are not required to be in the office, we are able to hire remotely where Samsara has an established presence. If a role is required to be in a certain location and candidates do not have work authorization for that location, Samsara will conduct an immigration assessment. If the role is not required to be in a specific location, Samsara will move forward with the remote location that works best for the business. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individual’s ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company. 

 

Please note: Samsara does not accept agency resumes and is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Samsara employees.
name: Manager, Software Engineering - Fleet Safety

contents:
Job Title
Field Service Engineer, Medical Laser (Detroit, MI)

Job Description

Allow your passion for improving lives to shine in this role where you'll be responsible for customer relationship management through the effective use of technical knowledge to install, troubleshoot, service, and maintain equipment at customer sites.

Your role:

  • Provide exceptional customer service by adhering to customer entitlements, setting clear expectations, and meeting commitments and arrival times to address and resolve customer needs. Understand the customer's business and competitive environment; generate service revenue.
  • Actively participate as a member of the regional work team; work to improve team processes and identify training gaps. Seek out opportunities to increase capability and capacity (i.e. may be required to become qualified in multiple modalities, learns new tools).
  • Perform all administrative duties within established Philips, State, and Federal regulatory requirements and timeframes including timesheets, service work orders, expense reports, Field Change Orders (FCO), preventative maintenance (PM), installation documents, site and service documentation, and other related paperwork. Adhere to established training, quality, and safety requirements.
  • Utilize tools, support, resources, and escalation processes within required time frames to resolve customer and system problems timely and effectively. Complete PMs, FCOs, installation and all related tasks (diagnose and resolve electronic, network, and mechanical problems).
  • Travel across the specified geography is required. The average driving time is 1-4 hours daily and may exceed 50% at times. Occasional overnight stays and travel by air and/or train may be required.
You're the right fit if:
  • You've acquired 2+ years of experience in a diagnostic imaging (field or hospital-based) service environment or 4+ years' in electromechanical industries.
  • 5+ years of related experience is preferred in the medical device service field. imaging laser and/or Optic experience is a plus.
  • Your skills include the ability to understand and apply electronic, mechanical, and networking theory to install, diagnose, and repair equipment, including knowledge and use of all necessary tools and test equipment.
  • You have an Associate Degree in electronics or equivalent combination of education and experience; BSEE/BSEET/BSME/BSMET preferred.
  • You must be able to successfully perform the following minimum Physical, Cognitive and Environmental job requirements with or without accommodation for this Field Service position.
  • You must be able to:
    • Work in an office/home office and/or remote setting, as well as in a hospital/healthcare environment; adhere to requirements.
    • Work flexible hours (based on business needs to include overtime, weekends, and on-call rotations).
    • Safely work with radiation sources and/or radioactive materials; wear all required personal protective equipment.
    • Travel to Canada is required, must have a valid US Passport.
About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.
  • Learn more about our business .
  • Discover our rich and exciting history.
  • Learn more about our purpose.
  • Read more about our employee benefits .
If you're interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here .

Additional Information

US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa, now or in the future.

The territory for this position supports Michigan, part of Ohio and Canada. The ideal candidates should reside within a commutable distance to the territory (Detroit, MI ).

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was tragen Sie bei?

  • Siemens Mobility treibt die Digitalisierung voran und implementiert mit Siemens Teamcenter ein neues globales PLM-System - getreu unserem Motto "moving beyond".
  • In Ihrer neuen Rolle sind Sie IT-Projektleiter (w/m/d) des globalen PLM-Einführungsprojekts für die Siemens Mobility GmbH. Sie berichten an das Project Steering Committee auf Mobility C-Level.
  • Das aktuelle PLM-System basiert auf einer maßgeschneiderten SAP-Lösung, die abgekündigt wird. Wir adressieren ca. 15.000 Anwendende in allen Mobility-Geschäftsbereichen und auf verschiedenen PLM-Prozessen.
  • Der Aufbau und das Aufgabenmodell sind als gemeinsames Team aus IT, Geschäftsprozessverantwortlichen und Externen (inkl. dem Softwareanbieter) vorgesehen.
  • Ihre Aufgabe wird es sein, das Projekt nach definierten Projektmanagement-Standards (PM) auf der Grundlage von SAFE zu konzipieren, zu entwickeln und durchzuführen.
  • Sie erhalten die End-to-End-Verantwortung für den wirtschaftlichen Erfolg des Projekts (Ergebnisse, Qualität etc.).
  • Dabei ist Kommunikation der Schlüssel, da Sie die Verfügbarkeit von Ressourcen mit anderen Abteilungen in verschiedenen Geschäftsbereichen und externen Stakeholdern wie Product Owner, Engineering, Anbietern und Unternehmensfunktionen stets eng abstimmen.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie haben ein Masterstudium / MBA in Informatik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder vergleichbar erfolgreich abgeschlossen.
  • Sie verfügen über langjährige Berufserfahrung in der Industrie, Beratung oder IT innerhalb einer komplexen Organisation.
  • Außerdem verfügen Sie über eine Zertifizierung als Senior Project Manager/Projektleiter und bringen Führungsqualitäten, insbesondere in der Leitung internationaler Teams, mit.
  • Darüber hinaus bringen Sie Referenzen aus einem in Größe und Komplexität vergleichbaren Projekt mit.
  • Ihr beeindruckendes Profil beinhaltet ein Expertenniveau in End2end PLM Prozessen und Expertenwissen in Siemens Teamcenter.
  • Darüber hinaus sind Erfahrungen im Bereich Transport und Mobilität sowie Kenntnisse in PTC Windchill, CREO, NX, Cloud-Umgebung, IT-Architekturen, Cybersecurity-Anforderungen, Applikationen und Infrastruktur von Vorteil.
  • Wenn Ihr Profil durch exzellente Kommunikationsfähigkeiten auf C-Level sowie fließende Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse abgerundet wird, freuen wir uns darauf, Sie kennenzulernen!

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns haben Sie die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Sie zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein können. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Vielfalt & Internationalität

Wir sind Weltunternehmer und auf allen fünf Kontinenten aktiv. Wir arbeiten für Kunden in aller Welt in internationalen Projekten. Deshalb legen wir in unseren Teams größten Wert auf Inklusion und fördern Vielfalt in all ihren Dimensionen.

Weiterentwicklung

Wir bieten Ihnen umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Mit unserem Learning Campus verfügen wir über einen Inhouse-Dienstleister mit einem vielfältigen On- und Offline-Angebot.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt?

name: Senior IT Project Manager (f/m/d) Global PLM Implementation

contents:
Art der Anstellung: Befristet; 16-20 Std./Woche

In Richtung Zukunft? Bitte einsteigen.

Wie werden wir in Zukunft miteinander kommunizieren, Energien sinnvoll nutzen und uns fortbewegen? Wir können an den Antworten zusammenarbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorien in die Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken.

Als Werkstudent*in stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife jetzt die Chance und werde Teil unseres globalen Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Wir freuen uns, wenn du dein Talent bei uns einbringen willst!

Wir setzen um, worauf es ankommt. Das ist dein Beitrag.

  • Du unterstützt aktiv die Arbeit der Service-Experten im Bereich Ladetechnik für Elektrofahrzeuge
  • Du bist an der Erstellung und Pflege von Datenbanken und Websites beteiligt
  • Du hilfst bei der Erstellung von Software-Applikationen entsprechend den Anforderungen und bringst eigene Ideen ein
  • Du erstellst Auswertungen, Statistiken und Analysen für interne Untersuchungen und externe Präsentationen
  • Du behältst den Überblick über die Strukturierung von Workflows und die Datenhaltung
  • Gemeinsam mit uns bist du dafür verantwortlich, Flottendaten aus der Siemens Cloud zu prüfen und hierfür Auswertungen zu erstellen
  • Du erstellst für uns Arbeitsunterlagen nach unseren Vorgaben, um unser Arbeitsleben zu vereinfachen
  • Darüber hinaus trägst du bei der Dokumentation und Abbildung unserer Unternehmens- und Serviceprozesse in Workflow-Tools bei

Was du können solltest. Damit die Welt mehr kann.

  • Du studierst Informatik oder bist in einen ähnlichen Studiengang eingeschrieben
  • Du verfügst über Kenntnisse in gängigen Programmiersprachen (Python und SQL bevorzugt)
  • Du verfügst über Grundkenntnisse in der Netzwerktechnik
  • Du verfügst über Kenntnisse in Microsoft Dynamics-Tools wie PowerBI und Power Automate
  • Du zeichnest Dich durch eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe, gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowie ein sicheres Auftreten und Teamfähigkeit aus
  • Du hast fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
  • In den gängigen MS-Office-Tools bist Du fit (Textverarbeitung, Tabellenkalkulation, Präsentations- und Meilensteinpläne)

Wir wollen, dass du willst: Bewirb dich!

www.siemens.de
wenn du vor deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchtest.

Du hast Fragen zur Bewerbung? Hier findest du Antworten auf häufig gestellte Fragen.

Wenn du darüber hinaus noch Fragen hast, wende dich gerne an uns:
www.siemens.de/fragenzurbewerbung

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a transaction monitoring expert to join our Financial Crimes Compliance team. Reporting to the Global Head of Financial Crimes Compliance, the Director, Financial Crimes Transaction Monitoring, will be responsible for enhancing the design of our global AML/CTF transaction monitoring program, across both fiat and crypto. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working with financial intelligence, data and engineering teams to design transaction monitoring systems and scenarios, and is looking to find creative approaches to detect financial crimes in the fast-changing crypto ecosystem.

What you'll work on: 

  • Owning Circle’s global AML/CTF transaction monitoring program, including definition of scenarios, rules and thresholds.
  • Working closely with the Financial Intelligence Unit and Investigations Operations teams to enhance transaction monitoring based on SARs filed and broader ecosystem intelligence.
  • Partnering with Compliance Data & Technology, Product, and Engineering teams to implement enhancements to the transaction monitoring systems.
  • Driving scenario testing and tuning exercises to identify optimal transaction monitoring scenarios and thresholds.
  • Identifying opportunities to improve the overall efficacy of the transaction monitoring program, including but not limited to, use of machine learning and artificial intelligence to detect unusual activity.
  • Staying at the forefront of money laundering, terrorist financing and other financial crimes risks and typologies, and technologies to detect suspicious activity.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • A passion for harnessing the power of digital currency and blockchain technology and services built on top of it.
  • B.A./B.S. degree; quantitative or technical degree a plus.
  • 12+ years of relevant experience in AML/CTF, with a minimum of 5+ years developing transaction monitoring programs.
  • 5+ years of experience managing and leading teams. 
  • Deep knowledge of global financial crimes transaction monitoring programs and systems.
  • Deep understanding of cryptocurrency transactions, risks and typologies.
  • Experience with blockchain analytics and monitoring platforms, such as TRM Labs, Chainalysis or Elliptic.
  • An innovative and creative mind looking to suggest new solutions to old problems.
  • Proven experience working collaboratively and effectively with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders and internal teams.
  • Experience and comfort working in an ever changing industry and the flexibility to quickly react to changing demands.
  • CGSS, CAMS, or CFCS certification is a plus.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Boston, MA. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $185,000 - $260,000

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

#LI-Remote
name: Director, Financial Crimes Transaction Monitoring

Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zum unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld - herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert

  • Sie überwachen und koordinieren alle organisatorischen und administrativen Aufgaben für die Abteilung "Turnkey Projects and Rail Electrification" innerhalb der Siemens Mobility GmbH.
  • Hierfür übernehmen Sie die Organisation von Dienstreisen (Flug-, Hotelreservierungen, Mietwagen, Visa etc.) im In- und Ausland sowie deren Abrechnung.
  • Sie unterstützen die Eingliederung neuer Mitarbeiter (Vorbereitung Checkliste; Beantragung der Zugänge, Laufwerksfreigaben, Aufnahme in Verteiler, Einrichten von Tools).
  • Weiter sind Sie der Ansprechpartner (m/w/d) für weitere anfallende abteilungsinterne Abläufe (z.B. Anwesenheitslisten der Mitarbeiter, Teilnahme an Schulungen etc.).
  • Zudem unterstützen Sie bei der Erstellung von Präsentationen und Schriftstücken.

Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat

  • Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene kaufmännische Berufsausbildung sowie mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Sekretariatsbereich / Assistenzbereich.
  • Außerdem bringen Sie erste Erfahrungen in der Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Führungsebenen sowie im interkulturellen Umfeld mit und überzeugen durch eine strukturierte Vorgehensweise.
  • Darüber hinaus verfügen Sie über ausgezeichnete Kenntnisse im Umgang mit MS Office (insb. Word, Excel und Power Point). Idealerweise haben Sie auch Kenntnisse in SAP.
  • Fließende Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse setzen wir voraus.

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for:

In 2020, Circle unveiled Circle APIs: a set of solutions and smarter technology to help businesses accept payments in a more global, scalable and efficient alternative to traditional banking rails (spoiler: we’re using USD Coin under the hood). The Circle Security Team works to protect Circle; our customers, clients, and partners; and the financial markets upon which we rely.  As a member of this team, you’ll lead projects and be responsible for key deliverables of the security program while collaborating across Circle teams.  You will continue to learn and stay current in a fun and rapidly changing environment.

What you'll work on:

  • Conduct analysis of user behavior and organizational controls apparent in security logging.
  • Leverage analysis to build technical detections and controls.
  • Drive the development and implementation of automated data access checks across various platforms to help detect abuse and data exfiltration.
  • Perform security incident investigations using data analytics and computer forensics.
  • Build automation and detection models to support identification of anomalous activity to mitigate insider risk at scale.
  • Identify gaps in our infrastructure, and work with business partners to gain visibility through logging and detection.
  • Partner with stakeholders to contribute to Security Awareness messaging, training and exercises.
  • Drive deployment, development, and improvements in Security Incident and Event Management, Case Management, and Automation.
  • Provide security guidance to various organizations throughout the company.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle:

  • 5-7+ years experience in security operations such as technical investigations or Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) with a minimum of two years (can be overlapping) with a focus on Insider Threat.
  • Experience with technologies relevant to Insider Threat (SIEMs, DLP solutions, CASBs, UEBA tools, host forensic solutions).
  • Experience in data science and analytics solutions applicable to the insider threat detection space.
  • Exposure to programming, scripting and query languages such as Python, Golang, bash, SQL.
  • Strong ability to work collaboratively across teams during high-stress situations.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order of priorities on the fly.
  • Self-motivated and creative problem-solver able to work independently with minimal guidance.
  • Enthusiasm for scalable, reproducible security management. 
  • In-depth knowledge of the insider threat landscape.
  • Deep knowledge of SIEM, Case Management, EDR/ MDR, and DLP solutions.
  • Experience working in financial services or financial technology desired.
  • Experience working in an AWS environment preferred.
  • Experience communicating technical findings to a variety of stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in Google Suite, Slack and Apple MacOS preferred. 
  • Certifications such as CMU CERT ITPM/ ITVA, CCITP, CISM, CDPSE or similar will receive favorable consideration but are not required.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Seattle, WA. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $175,000 - $230,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

name: Lead Security Engineer, Insider Risk & Investigations

contents:
Use your knowledge as a springboard.

Do you like the sound of finding the smartest solution side by side with professionals and experts? If so, join us as a PostDoc. We can help you to combine knowledge, discover connections, and drive your ideas. When you join our team, you will gain an insight into a range of departments and processes. With around 2,400 employees, the Corporate Technology Department (T) secures the future of the Siemens Group together with the business units. T innovates with internal and external partners (e.g., universities, research institutes) on future technologies. It is a chance like no other to break new ground as we head into the future of electrification, automation, and digitalization. Seize this opportunity today!

Change the future with us.

Future factory IT/OT applications are agile, smart, reconfigurable, modular, and flexible. Strict hierarchies in system architectures are dissolved by everchanging demands of applications, and the continuous integration of new heterogeneous systems. One of the major technical enablers to address the paradigm change in system topologies is the middleware with the loose coupling and data-centric communication of all connected components. In addition, wireless networks and system mobility bring further major challenges to industrial distributed system architectures.

In this research work, you will:

  • Research the demands and requirements for data-centric communication in wireless networks like 5G / 6G for industrial use cases
  • Research and develop new concepts, mechanisms, architectures to achieve E2E QoS/QoE in data-centric application designs and middleware technologies
  • Examine new approaches to optimize programmability of E2E QoS/QoE communication in distributed / decentralized applications
  • Build a testbed to bring your ideas and new approaches to life
Your research will be carried out in the context of international research projects with academic and business partners of Siemens. Beyond this we will support you to publish your work, to visit international conferences, to do academic stays at partner institutions, and to develop the ideas you have for the future of industrial systems.

What you need to make real what matters.

  • You already have an excellent PhD degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a similar field
  • You have a strong drive for achievement, a genuine desire to discover and try out new things, and your curiosity about new technologies outperforms others
  • You have sound knowledge of Distributed Systems, Software Architecture and Software Development preferably in the area of Internet of Things, Edge and/or Cloud Computing
  • You have advanced knowledge in communication technologies and basic knowledge in AI and machine learning
  • You have proven experience and deep knowledge in implementing software in at least one high-level programming language - you love to code
  • Due to the structure of the projects, excellent written and verbal English and German skills are required

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ - if you need further information on the application process.

Organization: Technology

Company: Siemens AG

Experience Level: Experienced Professional

Full / Part time: Either

contents:
Siemens Digital Industries Software is seeking an experienced andhighly motivated individual for a position as a Solution Architect within ourAerospace, Defense, Federal and Marine (ADFM) Business Unit. As an ADFMSolution Architect, you will be a leading resource that is responsible fordesigning innovative software solutions, using our Xcelerator portfolio, thataid our customers in realizing their digital future.

As part of a Professional Services team, you will work efficientlyalongside Consultants, Architects, Project Managers, and other internal &external interfaces to ensure that the customer succeeds in their objectives.This position requires excellent interpersonal skills, leadership skills,process improvement skills as well as configuration and implementation skills.As an Architect resource, you will be responsible for the translation ofbusiness requirements into specific process aligned designs for the Siemens DISoftware solution-based on standard methodologies in the subject area. In thisrole, you will get along with the customer to support the management ofcustomer expectations and support customer adoption by demonstrating thecomplete Siemens Delivery framework.

You will establish the technical integrity of the solution andensure it remains aligned to requirements and value delivery throughout projectto achieve customer value. Your leadership will also provide direction forprocess design, integration and change activities either internally or atcustomer sites and leverage relevant templates in the leadership of projectsolutions while also curating standard methodologies and templates. This rolewill primarily work under self-management and will determine solutions, methodsand procedures on assignments/projects. Lastly, you will be asked toparticipate in the Architecture Community of Practice, promoting adoptionwithin projects, and ensuring that knowledge and lessons learned are sharedacross project/program boundaries.

Responsibilities:

  • Understand and demonstrate how Siemens solutions will alter and integrate with customers' initiatives, business drivers, value and impact
  • Analyze and translate business requirements into an architectural blueprint that outlines solutions that integrate across applications, systems and platforms to achieve business objectives
  • Bring to bear industry standard methodologies and templates for the Siemens PLM Software solution delivered to provide customer value
  • Lead the application of Solution Definition and Solution Enablement elements DI Deployment Framework on projects
  • Provide accurate and timely information to project management team collaborating on reporting project status, issues, risks and benefits
  • Establish, build and maintain effective relationships with internal or external customers technical peers and build new relationships through networking within the customer and other involved parties to support effective delivery
  • Set and lead customers' expectations, demonstrating thought leadership to effectively influence key contacts and recommend solutions
  • In conjunction with the senior project leadership and account team, apply customer management methods to support successful adoption of a viable DI solution
  • Be responsible for validation activities, including any required prototyping, with the customer to verify if the outstanding templated solution applies to the customers' environment, rationalize and defend selected solution to the customer explaining why and how this solution will deliver the highest value to their business
  • Outline process changes that will need to occur and assist the customer drive Organizational Change.

Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment inthe United States. Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsoredwork authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, andExperience:

  • Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university or college, preferably with software engineering background, Advanced Degree may be substituted for industry experience
  • Multiple years designing Teamcenter or similar customer solutions
  • Experience in the technical leadership of large software implementation projects
  • Experience using Agile principles in project execution
  • Excellent presentation skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, to present sophisticated issues to multi-level audiences and optimally communicate progress, status and issues to internal and external Customers
  • Shown team leadership skills
  • Location: Any Major Midwest or Eastern U.S. City
  • Expected Travel requirements: 25%-50%

The total compensation salary range for thisposition (base + variable pay) is $116,100.00 to $232,200.00 with 7.5% of this being compromised of an annual incentive target. Siemens offers avariety of health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding ourbenefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com. In addition, thisposition is eligible for time off in accordance with Company policies,including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exempt employees)or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

At Siemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a betterfuture. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to developtomorrow's reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemenshere: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld - herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert

  • Für unseren Kunden Deutsche Bahn prüfen Sie Software für Leit- und Sicherungstechnik für Betriebszentralen sowie Leitstände und setzen diese in Betrieb.
  • Zunächst prüfen Sie in unserem Testzentrum die Softwarekomponenten auf die Erfüllung der Kundeanforderungen.
  • Dazu spielen Sie Testszenarien durch, arbeiten Prüfpläne ab und stoßen ggf. Änderungsmaßnahmen an.
  • Nach Fertigstellung der Software führen Sie die Inbetriebnahme einschließlich Montagetätigkeiten beim Kunden vor Ort durch.
  • Dazu koordinieren Sie einen Arbeitsplan mit dem Kunden und spielen die Daten gemeinsam mit ihrem Team auf den Kundensystemen ein.

Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat

  • Sie sind staatlich geprüfter Techniker (w/m/d) mit Schwerpunkt Elektrotechnik / Datenverarbeitung und begeistern sich für die Administration und Inbetriebnahme von komplexen IT-Systemen.
  • Sie zeichnen sich durch gute MS Office-Kenntnisse und idealerweise auch SAP-Know-how aus.
  • Sie bringen sehr gute Deutsch-Kenntnisse sowie Reisebereitschaft (ca. 50% innerhalb Deutschlands) mit.

So treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt - einfach und direkt

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.

Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Machen Sie mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer Karriere.

Verändern Sie mit uns die Welt von morgen.

  • In Ihrer neuen Rolle übernehmen Sie Planung, Administration, Betrieb und 2nd Level Support der DNS-Lösung der Siemens AG sowie auch der Secure Mailgateway Umgebung
  • Darüber hinaus setzen Sie definierte Verfahren und Prozesse um, die speziell für den DNS- und Mail-Betrieb gelten und führen entsprechende operative und / oder Unterstützungsaktivitäten durch
  • Sie sind verantwortlich für Design und Betrieb der Siemens AG DNS Infrastruktur sowie auch der Secure Mailgateway Lösung
  • Außerdem übernehmen Sie die Erstellung und Wartung komplexer Scripten im Bereich der Automatisierung von Prozessen
  • Gleichzeitig unterstützen Sie das Firewall Team bei einfachen Tätigkeiten
  • Auch Troubleshooting und Entstörung sowie Monitoring und Management der DNS- und Mail-Umgebung gehören zu Ihrem Aufgabenbereich
  • Sie sind für 7x24 Bereitschaft im Rahmen des Troubleshootings und Entstörung (DNS, Mail, Firewall) offen
  • Die regelmäßige Abstimmung mit anderen Fachabteilungen bzgl. Anforderungen und Security Aspekten liegt in Ihrer Verantwortung

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Die Basis für Ihren Erfolg ist ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder Vergleichbares
  • Sie haben mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen DNS, Scripting und Mail
  • Zu Ihren technischen Fähigkeiten gehören sehr gute Kenntnisse in DNS (Bind 9), DNSSEC, Scripting (Bash, PHP, Perl), Secure Mail
  • Sie verfügen außerdem über ausgezeichnete analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten
  • Darüber hinaus bringen Sie Erfahrung in der Erstellung und Pflege von Skripten mit, vorzugsweise mit Python
  • Sie zeichnet zudem ein hohes Maß an Ergebnisorientierung, Offenheit für Bereitschaftsdienst und Know-How in Technical English aus

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was tragen Sie bei?

  • Sie helfen die Verfügbarkeit von Bahnanlagen sicher zu stellen, in dem Sie Fahrleitungs- und Stromversorgungslangen montieren, warten und instand halten.
  • Nach einer umfassenden Einarbeitung führen Sie Montagearbeiten durch und stellen die Betriebsbereitschaft der montierten Anlagen sicher.
  • Ferner wirken sie an notwendigen Service- und Instandhaltungsarbeiten mit.
  • Sie erstellen die Leistungsberichte und kontrollieren die technischen Dokumentationen.
  • Je nach Bedarf werden Sie deutschlandweit in Projekten eingesetzt.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie haben eine Ausbildung zum Elektriker, Mechatroniker, Elektroniker, Schlosser, Freileitungsmonteur oder Fahrleitungsmonteur abgeschlossen.
  • Idealerweise bringen Sie bereits mehrjährige Erfahrungen als Elektromonteur im Bahn- oder Industrieumfeld mit.
  • Erfahrungen im Bereich der Mittelspannung und im 15kV- Fahrleitungsbereich sind von Vorteil.
  • Idealerweise besitzen Sie einen Triebfahrzeugführerschein der Klasse 2 oder 3 für schwere Nebenfahrzeuge.
  • Zudem bringen Sie gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift mit.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Attraktive Konditionen

Sie erhalten ein attraktives Vergütungspaket einschließlich der Leistungen des Tarifvertrages (z.B. Zusatzentgelte und Urlaubsgeld) und weiteren Extras (z.B. betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Aktienprogramm).

Purpose

Wir sind Pioniere der Mobilität. Bei uns tragen Sie in einem Zukunftsmarkt aktiv zu Verkehrswende und Klimaschutz bei, weil unsere Transportlösungen in aller Welt den CO2-Ausstoß verringern.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt?

contents:
The primary purpose is to work with sales and field technical team members to help lead, define, and implement the technical engagements that support sales campaigns.

  • Drive products into customer projects through adoption by creating methodology and flows, including infrastructure and integration into a customer's environment, identifying pilot projects for tool use, debugging issues, and bringing up new methods and flows.
  • Develop close relationships with customers through as many levels as possible to assess their technical and business requirements. Identify the options/ability for Siemens/Mentor's flows/solutions to develop and implement technical sales plans.
  • Uncover or qualify new opportunities, the technical viability of a lead, and strategize the opportunity clearly with the sales team.
  • To proactively share account, evaluation, competitor, technology, and other helpful information with peers, sales teams, management, and product divisions to help us compete more effectively.
  • Provide technical leadership for assigned accounts.
  • Apply company policies and procedures to resolve routine issues. Works on problems of broad and undefined scope and brings scope to them.
  • Willing to develop deep product knowledge for Silicon Test Solutions products and has the competent technical skills to support the products.
  • Follows standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data from which answers can be readily obtained.
  • Other reasonable actions not named are required by management or leadership.

Job Qualifications: (Must have ASIC, DFT, and FPGA experience to be considered)

  • BSEE or BSCS from an accredited institution.
  • Minimum of 2+ years of experience as an Applications Engineer or related field
  • Digital design experience and RTL coding with Verilog or VHDL, or both.
  • Simulation and verification expertise.
  • Proven track record of Design for Test (DFT) for ASIC design.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of Tcl language and programming concepts.
  • Command of Microsoft Office products
  • Project management experience
  • An in-depth understanding of Design for Test (DFT) structures is required. This includes scan-based testing, Scan Compression, Memory BIST, Logic BIST, and Boundary Scan (1149.1 and .6).
  • Knowledge of scan data compression methodologies
  • Experience with diagnosis-driven yield analysis is also an asset.
  • Excellent communication, written and verbal; influencing, teamwork, and diplomacy skills
  • Demonstrable drive and commitment
  • Adaptability, dedication, persistence, and assertiveness
  • Marketing-related knowledge
  • Understands basic sales tactics
  • Familiarity with business and financial terminology
  • High energy, practical presentation skills
  • Has a Global perspective
  • Able to communicate at all levels of management, both internally and at the customer
  • Problem-solving skills
  • Self-starter that can work independently of the team

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MSEE in a related field
  • Experience with Siemens/Mentor DFT products

At Siemens, we are always challengingourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative anddiverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Find out more aboutthe Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

The total cash compensation range for this position is $101,100 to $202,000 with 20% of this being comprised of an annual incentive target. If you reside in the Bay Area, the total cash compensation range for this position is $115,800 to $218,600 with 20% of this being comprised of an annual incentive target. The compensation offered is based on the successful candidate's work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education/training.

Siemens offers a variety of health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Company policies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exempt employees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you'll be responsible for:

Circle is looking for a passionate Security Leader with an expertise in Blockchain Security, deep understanding of different Blockchain technologies and Cloud based Product development. You’ll be part of the Security Engineering team and closely partner with the Engineering teams responsible for the development, deployment of USDC and supporting services.

What you'll work on: 

  • Own Circle’s Blockchain Security strategy, implementation and operationalization
  • Perform due diligence on potential Blockchains where USDC may be deployed to, in partnership with Product Compliance, Product and Engineering teams.
  • Recommend and validate Security controls and improvements across our technology stack
  • Own and build relationships with key external stakeholders such as customers, vendors, and auditors
  • Produce data-based reports on technology risk for senior management
  • Drive continuous improvement in the tech stack

You will aspire to our four core values: 

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you'll bring to Circle: 

  • 12+ years of experience as a security engineer or product security engineering leader with a minimum of five years (can be overlapping) with a focus on cybersecurity.
  • 5+ years demonstrated experience with security standard methodologies for Blockchain smart contract development and Cryptography
  • Demonstrated ability developing security controls that are easy to test and audit
  • Extensive knowledge of Security tool usage across SDLC including SAST, DAST and/or Security end to end testing
  • Proven experience developing automated, scalable, and reproducible security practices
  • Proficiency in managing multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order or priorities on the fly for themselves and their team.
  • Ability to influence internal and external customers to expediently resolve issues and achieve organizational objectives
  • The ability to design and operate controls that are easy to test and audit
  • Experience working in financial services or financial technology desired
  • Advanced degree in computer science, or related fields strongly preferred.
  • 5+ years proven experience building and managing small to medium sized teams
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Miami, FL. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $200,000 - $280,000

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

contents:
Spüren Sie die Leidenschaft: #Passion For Process Control

Wenn modernste Technologie ein Muss ist, machen Menschen den Unterschied. Menschen, die sich für die Herausforderungen unserer Kunden einsetzen. Und die nicht aufhören, bis die perfekte Lösung gefunden wurde. Das sind wir: Passioneers. Mit dem Ehrgeiz, dass unsere Kunden immer einen Schritt voraus sind!

Ihr Beitrag.

  • Sie verantworten die Beratung von Prozessleittechnik bei unseren Kunden aus der Prozessindustrie während der Presales- und Postsales Phase
  • Zudem beraten Sie unsere Kunden im Umfeld der Prozessleittechnik SIMATIC PCS 7
  • Darüber hinaus konzipieren Sie technische Lösungen sowie technisch anspruchsvolle Angebote
  • Diese Konzepte begleiten Sie in Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Team und bringen diese zur Umsetzung
  • Zusätzlich führen Sie unser neues, innovatives Prozessleitsystem SIMATIC PCS neo bei unseren Kunden ein
  • Des Weiteren konzipieren Sie Kundenpräsentationen und Workshops sowie akquisitorische Maßnahmen, dessen Durchführung Sie verantworten

Ihr Profil.

  • Die Basis Ihres Erfolgs bildet ein abgeschlossenes, technisches Hochschulstudium, z.B. der Elektrotechnik oder Automatisierungstechnik, oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
  • Darauf aufbauend besitzen Sie mehrjährige, einschlägige Erfahrung in der Prozessindustrie sowie sehr gute Kenntnisse mit dem Prozessleitsystem SIMATIC PCS 7
  • Sie haben die Fähigkeit analytisch, strukturiert und zielgerichtet Lösungen für unsere Kunden zu konzipieren
  • Ihre Kundenorientierung, Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten verstehen Sie für die Beratung unserer Kunden gewinnbringend einzusetzen
  • Sie sind eine engagierte Persönlichkeit, die eine vertrauensvolle und kooperative Zusammenarbeit im Team schätzt
  • Reisebereitschaft für Kundenbesuche im lokalen Umfeld bringen sie ebenfalls mit (ein Führerschein der Klasse B wird vorausgesetzt)
  • Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab

Was wir bieten.

  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als zukünftiger, weltweiter Standard
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • Zugang zu Mitarbeiteraktienplänenen
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.
