contents:
Who we are

Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations™ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing — and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.

Working at Samsara means you’ll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team that’s shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, you’ll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term. 

Recent awards we’ve won include:

Great Place To Work Certified™ 2023

Best Place to Work by Built In 2023

Financial Times The Americas’ Fastest Growing Companies 2023

Deloitte Fast 500 Companies

IoT Analytics Company of the Year in 2022’s IoT Breakthrough Winners

We see a profound opportunity for data to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of operations, and hope you consider joining us on this exciting journey. 

About the role:

The Compliance team builds software and tooling that helps our customers and their drivers stay in compliance with transportation law and regulation. We also seek to cultivate a quality culture that produces best in class product reliability, usability, and performance across all of our product development teams.

We're looking for a self-driven, experienced QE for our Compliance Engineering team who has a real passion for quality, and strives to innovate and try new things, incorporating continuous improvement of testing methods.

You should apply if:

  • You want to impact the industries that run our world: The software, firmware, and hardware you build will result in real-world impact—helping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely.
  • You want to build for scale: With over 2.3 million IoT devices deployed to our global customers, you will work on a range of new and mature technologies driving scalable innovation for customers across industries driving the world's physical operations.
  • You are a life-long learner: We have ambitious goals. Every Samsarian has a growth mindset as we work with a wide range of technologies, challenges, and customers that push us to learn on the go.
  • You believe customers are more than a number: Samsara engineers enjoy a rare closeness to the end user and you will have the opportunity to participate in customer interviews, collaborate with customer success and product managers, and use metrics to ensure our work is translating into better customer outcomes.
  • You are a team player: Working on our Samsara Engineering teams requires a mix of independent effort and collaboration. Motivated by our mission, we’re all racing toward our connected operations vision, and we intend to win—together.

Click here to learn about what we value at Samsara. 

In this role, you will: 

  • Be a part of a development team, quickly understand the product, the architecture and come up with a plan to test/validate functionality, and identify and target weaknesses
  • Be a part of the development process, collaborating with the engineering and product teams to discover details of proposed functionality, spotting gaps/conflicts and understanding upcoming work
  • Rapidly diagnose issues and perform root cause analysis with backend, mobile, and fullstack developers
  • Execute manual and automated test plans across the backend, mobile and web
  • Develop test fixtures using a hands-on approach to shift from a manual end-to-end testing environment to an automated one
  • Design, write and deliver high quality test fixtures, frameworks and build tools to production standards as part of team sprints
  • Document, structure and maintain automated test cases and code used for test execution
  • Track performance, report results to management, drive issues to closure
  • Champion, role model, and embed Samsara’s cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices

Minimum requirements for the role:

  • 7+ years of experience in a quality engineering function
  • 3+ years of experience in developing test suites using QA automation tools like Selenium, Cypress etc
  • Proficiency with programming and querying languages: Python, SQL
  • Proven abilities for effective troubleshooting, debugging and perform root cause analysis
  • Strong communication skills, comfortable working with distributed teams from diverse backgrounds

An ideal candidate also has:

  • Experience working in teams operating in the Compliance domain
  • Experience working in the automative or transportation industry domains
  • Proficiency with programming and querying languages: GoLang

#LI-Remote

At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background, race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, etc. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

Accommodations

Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or click here if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.

Benefits

Full time employees receive an above market total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at our Benefits site to learn more.

Flexible Working 

At Samsara, we have adopted a flexible way of working, enabling teams and individuals to do their best work, regardless of where they’re based. We value in-person collaboration and know a change of scenery and quiet space to work is welcomed from time to time, but also appreciate that the world of work has changed. Our offices remain open for those who prefer to collaborate or work in-office, but we also encourage fully remote applicants. As most roles are not required to be in the office, we are able to hire remotely where Samsara has an established presence. If a role is required to be in a certain location and candidates do not have work authorization for that location, Samsara will conduct an immigration assessment. If the role is not required to be in a specific location, Samsara will move forward with the remote location that works best for the business. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individual’s ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company. 

 

Please note: Samsara does not accept agency resumes and is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Samsara employees.
name: Senior Quality Automation Engineer

contents:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.
 

The Role:

As a Value Engineer, you are spearheading our mission of data-driven business transformation with our customers. You will work in partnership with the Celonis Sales Teams and have full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers. You are our customers trusted advisor and help them achieve their strategic goals and realize significant value using Celonis EMS. In collaboration with our partners and Celonis Services, you will drive measurable business impact across various processes and industries and accelerate the adoption of our platform. You will blend deep process and industry expertise with a proven consulting skill set with strong analytical skills at the forefront of one of the fastest-growing tech companies worldwide.

The work you’ll do:

Identify & Frame Value

  • Discover and translate customers’ strategic priorities into high-impact Celonis use cases
  • Build demos and business cases, leveraging industry benchmarks and best practices in order to win new customers 
  • Undertake Value Assessments or Proof-of-Value Projects and communicate the value opportunity and strategic roadmap to C-Level executives

Realize Value

  • Facilitate business value workshops and use Celonis to identify and qualify opportunities for process enhancement
  • Derive improvement measures in core business functions and initiate improvement actions and enterprise-wide change initiatives
  • Present results and realized value to senior management and C-level executives

Scale Value

  • Responsible for the end-to-end customer value journey, landing, expanding, adoption and renewing
  • Build a strategic expansion roadmap for customers embedding Celonis EMS as a strategic business transformation platform in their organization and therefore drive adoption and expansion
  • Provide feedback to our product development teams to enhance the Celonis platform and Apps based on new use cases

 

The qualifications you need:

  • Live for Customer Value: Several years experience in an analytical role with the objective to demonstrate or secure value through business data analysis, business process improvement and respective Software deployment. Ideally in a customer-facing role in Solution Consulting, Sales Engineering or IT/Management Consulting with a Business Software / SaaS Provider or a Consultancy. Alternatively in an Inhouse role (e.g. Center of Excellence for Data Mining / Analytics / Intelligence) within an Enterprise.
  • Data, Analytics, Applications & IT: Good knowledge of Business Software / SaaS applications (e.g. SAP),  experience with implementing RPA and/or BI Tools and/or building Dashboards, Apps and Action Flows. Knowledge of Python and/or SQL. Experience in collaborating with IT teams.
  • Process Improvement & Value Realization: Experience in identifying use cases for business process improvement and deploying improvement measures,  being a change agent and training users/process owners to realize value
  • Project Management: Experience in planning and managing project scopes, expectations and timelines. You will manage multiple projects across your aligned accounts that will be at different parts of the value journey. Also, you will leverage partners from the Celonis Ecosystem wherever possible.
  • Executive Stakeholder Management: Experience in preparing and communicating (value) roadmaps and results to stakeholders and management, both internally and externally. Excellent communication and presentation skills in German and English and sovereign appearance.
  • Business Domain Expertise: Understanding of the Finance and/or Supply Chain domain as well as strategic transformation initiatives (e.g. Shared Services Transformation or System Transformation)
  • Industry Expertise: Ideally expertise in one or more industries (e.g. Manufacturing, Automotive, Consumer, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Chemicals) and the ability to develop a deep understanding of industry trends and strategic opportunities   
  • Degree: in Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a comparable degree program

#LI-SS6

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis enables customers to optimize their business processes. Powered by its leading process mining technology, Celonis provides a unique set of capabilities for business executives and users to continuously find improvement opportunities within and across processes, and execute targeted actions to rapidly enhance process performance. This optimization yields immediate cash impact, radically improves customer experience, and reduces carbon emissions. Celonis has thousands of implementations with global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
name: (Lead / Senior) Value Engineer

contents:
Leidenschaft für Security.

Unsere Cybersicherheitsspezialisten sind echte Profis, wenn es darum geht, über den Tellerrand hinauszuschauen. Sie prüfen alle Möglichkeiten, wenn es darum geht, IT-Systeme effektiv zu täuschen, zu umgehen und zu schwächen, um sie noch erfolgreicher schützen zu können. Dazu stellen sie Fragen, auf die es noch keine Antworten gibt, und suchen nach Lücken, wo kaum jemand sie vermuten würde. Das ist entscheidend für die Digitalisierung! Kommen Sie in unser Team und wir fördern Ihre berufliche Weiterentwicklung und den Austausch mit Kollegen aus aller Welt. So können Sie sich spezialisieren oder Ihr Wissen als Generalist ausbauen. Eines ist sicher: Ihre Ideen werden nicht zu den Akten gelegt, sondern finden fast immer den Weg in die Unternehmenspraxis. Weltweit.

Was sind meine Aufgaben?

  • Sie schützen die kritischen IT-Assets von Siemens (IT-Systeme, Anwendungen und Daten), indem Sie Sicherheitsprobleme identifizieren, Sicherheitsrisiken bewerten und starke Schutzlösungen empfehlen
  • Sie unterstützen die Chief Cybersecurity Officers aktiv bei der Entwicklung von Schutzkonzepten für die IT-Assets des Siemens-Konzerns und verfolgen dabei einen ganzheitlichen Ansatz, der alle Schutzaspekte abdeckt
  • Sie unterstützen die effektive und effiziente Umsetzung des Asset Classification & Protection (ACP)-Prozesses für bestimmte IT-Assets mit starken Infrastrukturabhängigkeiten. Sie führen Business Impact Assessments von Daten, Anwendungen, Systemen und Services durch und berücksichtigen dabei auch die geschäftlichen Anforderungen
  • Sie fungieren als Schnittstelle zwischen den technischen Spezialisten und der Managementebene, indem Sie dem Management die technischen Risiken erläutern und die Geschäftsrisiken transparent machen. Sie empfehlen geeignete Maßnahmen, um Sicherheitsprobleme zu beheben und Risiken auf ein akzeptables Niveau zu reduzieren
  • Sie beraten die Siemens-Cybersecurity-Community und die Geschäftseinheiten zu allen Sicherheitsaspekten, um die entwickelten Schutzkonzepte umzusetzen und die Sicherheitsmaßnahmen aufrechtzuerhalten

Was brauche ich, um mich für diese Stelle zu qualifizieren?
  • Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, IT-Sicherheit oder verwandten Bereichen
  • Mehrjährige (>3 Jahre) Erfahrung im IT-Bereich mit Schwerpunkt Audit und Cybersicherheit
  • Allgemeine Kenntnisse der Cybersicherheitsstandards (ISO27001, NIST). Entsprechende Ausbildungen in mehreren Sicherheitsbereichen und Zertifizierungen (z.B. CISSP, CISM, CRISC) sind von Vorteil
  • Erfahrung als Berater in internationalen IT-Projekten mit englischer Kommunikation im Team und mit Kunden
  • Kenntnisse in der Sicherheitsbewertung von IT-Systemen und der bedrohungs- und risikobasierten Evaluierung von Schutzmaßnahmen (z.B. Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, DNS, Data Center, Storage, Firewalls, Proxy, WAN, LAN, SD-WAN, Netzwerksicherheit, Remote Access)
  • Lösungsorientiertes Denken, ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten und exzellente Teamarbeit sind vorausgesetzt
  • Sie sprechen und schreiben fließend in Englisch und Deutsch. Gute zwischenmenschliche Fähigkeiten und Aufmerksamkeit für Details runden Ihr Profil ab

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

name: Information Security Spezialist (m/w/d)

contents:
Mode of Employment: Limited; 20 hours / week

Develop what will be important tomorrow.

How will we travel, communicate, and use energy in the world of tomorrow? Work on the right answers with us. We are looking for bright minds - thinkers with a passion for practical matters. In short, people who can turn their questions and ours into exciting new discoveries. When you join our team as one of our working students, you will find many opportunities to get involved. Seize the chance to be part of our global network, make key contacts, and get your career as well as your personal life on the best track. Our teams are curious to meet you.

We make real what matters. This is your role.

For our Occupational Safety team at Siemens AG we are looking for a working student:

  • You will bring data modeling and data visualization for the global Siemens EHS community to the next level
  • You will support the development of machine learning models for the explorative data analysis of occupational safety data
  • You will support company-specific data analyses, evaluations and reports

Use your skills to move the world forward.

  • You are studying computer science, statistics, engineering, or, in the case of other fields, have a high affinity for data analysis and handling software tools
  • You are familiar with at least one business intelligence tool (preferably Power BI) and one programing language (preferably Python)
  • You want to translate your know-how to applied IT-solutions that can improve the health, safety, and well-being of our employees
  • You are highly motivated and are able to acquire necessary skills independently
  • Fluent German and English are fundamental for this profile

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a Treasury Integrations Manager to join the team owning the collaboration and cross-functional effort between Treasury and Product teams. This team is working to streamline processes associated with treasury infrastructure across our products including design, operational needs, and reporting. This position will play a key role in partnering with both Product, Engineering, and Treasury on business roadmap and key initiatives. 

What you'll work on:

  • Developing and documenting problem statements and business needs for Treasury with input from subject-matter experts.
  • Supporting and facilitating the success of integration projects resulting from business need and Product planning such as feature updates, banking integrations, Treasury Management Systems, etc. 
  • Defining and developing project plans from a Treasury perspective where applicable.
  • Reviewing the Product organization’s project plans, designs and features to evaluate impact on Treasury organization.
  • Collaborating with Product, SMEs and Treasury leads to review project(s) scope and requirements including reporting, tooling, or other needs.
  • Supporting roadmap planning efforts including evaluating time and resources needed from partners.
  • Partnering with Treasury team leads to understand their roles and responsibilities.
  • Developing and communicating project updates within the Treasury Organization.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • 7+ years of experience in consulting, financial services or payments industry required.
  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or related field. 
  • Able to think critically, understand complex topics/technologies, define complex problems by developing concise summarization of technical initiatives put out by the business or problems identified by SMEs.
  • Proven collaborative problem solving skills with the ability to think critically and ask thoughtful questions.
  • Startup mindset.
  • Highly organized and detail oriented.
  • Takes pride in working on projects to successful completion.
  • Excels in a highly collaborative environment with different stakeholders and SMEs.
  • Practical experience creating process documentation and reports.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate information into actionable insights as well as the ability to coordinate feedback under tight timelines.
  • Highly proficient technical writing capabilities.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to New York, NY. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $135,000 - $180,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

contents:
>>THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION<<

The Digital Services Building Engineer (DSE) assembles customer HVAC assets in Siemens cloud analytics software to enable ongoing Fault Detection & Diagnostics (FDD) analysis. During lifecycle, the DSE monitors HVAC equipment performance and either reports findings to the customer or coordinates with remote or onsite automation and/or mechanical specialists to resolve the faults identified at the customer's building.

This role is part of the Data Driven Services group in Siemens Smart Infrastructure Digital Service Center (DSC). Our goal is to turn building data into intelligence that yield building owners and service teams with informed recommendations to improve building performance. We strive to reduce energy usage and improve HVAC equipment and system reliability. In this role you will help ensure that buildings run the way they were designed or update control methodologies to improve operation and maximize energy efficiency. You will have the opportunity to work with teams across the US and Canada to optimize building performance across a wide range of building types and industries.

The DSC is headquartered in Austin, Texas. Our team is constantly growing due to an expanding presence in our market. We are looking for new hires in one of two DSE levels based on certifications and years of experience.

Basic Qualifications:

  • S. in Mechanical Engineering or applicable technical degree
  • Certification:
    • Level II: CEM & Engineer in Training (EIT) or PE License preferred
    • Level III: CEM or PE License required
  • Experience:
    • Level II: 4 - 8 years of energy management or HVAC systems / controls design experience
    • Level III: 8+ years of energy management or HVAC system / controls design experience, advanced degrees preferred
  • Effective communication skills to speak with building engineers, maintenance personnel, and/or C-level executives
  • Up to 5% travel is required for occasional Austin based events
  • Where permitted by applicable law, Siemens may require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 based on job requirements, and in accordance with an accommodation based on legally protected reasons
  • Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States without need for current or future employer-sponsored work authorization

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of facility and maintenance operations, maintenance best practices, and HVAC energy efficiency measures
  • Experience with building retro-commissioning, building modeling programs or spreadsheet energy analyses
  • Familiarity with data logging equipment and building automation systems trending
  • Enthusiasm to learn new skills and software
  • Able to adjust communication style to work with a variety of roles and interested parties
  • Confidence presenting recommendations and reports to internal and external stakeholders
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office suite programs, high level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel

Job Duties:

  • Understand components and operation methods of Air Handling Units, Water and Air-cooled Chillers, Cooling Towers, Boilers, Pumps, and Air/Water Distribution systems. Including physical and programmed components.
  • Identify faults and root cause to suggest control changes to improve building operational and energy efficiency
  • Become a subject matter expert of Facility Improvement Measures (FIMs) for HVAC systems
  • Compile customer facing reports and list of action items for operational improvements
  • Estimate energy and operational cost savings associated with identified faults and/or operational improvements
  • Study customer building management system (BMS) and mechanical design documents to select data points for analysis and to understand the existing operational intent.
  • Select rules to be applied for FDD, considering the relationship and interdependency of multiple building systems and their equipment.
  • Develop project structure and equipment parent/child relationships
  • Consult in the development of digital service offerings (feasibility, workflow, software, reporting structure, cost estimates etc.)
  • Collaborate with software development teams to discuss workflow and software product requirements
  • Contribute to rule development and improved data analysis strategies
  • Lead customer report presentations via Teams (video & screenshare)

Ideal Traits:

  • Familiarity with HVAC system and building controls. Knowledge of common HVAC and electrical building codes
  • Ability to read and understand design documentation (drawings, sequences of operation, schedules etc.)
  • Works independently with minimal supervision
  • Manages deliverable deadlines independently
  • Ability to remain organized while meeting expectations for numerous projects at once
  • Dresses professionally when necessary and comfortable working in a collaborative office environment
  • Proficiency in French language is a desirable quality, but not required

name: Digital Services Energy Engineer II or III - Smart Buildings - Remote

contents:
Who we are

Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations™ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing — and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.

Working at Samsara means you’ll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team that’s shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, you’ll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term. 

Recent awards we’ve won include:

Great Place To Work Certified™ 2023

Best Place to Work by Built In 2023

Financial Times The Americas’ Fastest Growing Companies 2023

Deloitte Fast 500 Companies

IoT Analytics Company of the Year in 2022’s IoT Breakthrough Winners

We see a profound opportunity for data to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of operations, and hope you consider joining us on this exciting journey. 

About the role:

As a Staff Engineer focusing on the Telematics Full Stack team at Samsara, you will define the technical strategy for our Telematics product group. You will architect, design, and develop features across a broad surface area with a tangible impact on active and future customers. You’ll tackle engineering challenges ranging from architecting data structures for mass data collection to presenting data analytics in intuitive and performant ways on web and mobile. Our Telematics team takes real-time signals from our IoT devices deployed in vehicles (think: GPS, Engine RPM, Fuel Levels and hundreds more) and processes them to help our customers make their vehicle fleets safer, greener, and more efficient. 

We use Golang for our backend, Typescript and React for our web client, GraphQL to fetch data from our backend, and React Native for our mobile app. Direct experience with these technologies is not required.

You should apply if:

  • You want to impact the industries that run our world: The software, firmware, and hardware you build will result in real-world impact—helping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely.
  • You want to build for scale: With over 2.3 million IoT devices deployed to our global customers, you will work on a range of new and mature technologies driving scalable innovation for customers across industries driving the world's physical operations.
  • You are a life-long learner: We have ambitious goals. Every Samsarian has a growth mindset as we work with a wide range of technologies, challenges, and customers that push us to learn on the go.
  • You believe customers are more than a number: Samsara engineers enjoy a rare closeness to the end user and you will have the opportunity to participate in customer interviews, collaborate with customer success and product managers, and use metrics to ensure our work is translating into better customer outcomes.
  • You are a team player: Working on our Samsara Engineering teams requires a mix of independent effort and collaboration. Motivated by our mission, we’re all racing toward our connected operations vision, and we intend to win—together.

Click here to learn about what we value at Samsara.

In this role, you will work on: 

  • A system that optimizes routes for fleets of vehicles that drive a million miles per week
  • Live rendering and animating thousands of vehicles concurrently on country-scale maps
  • Using driving quality metrics computed from vehicle sensor data to gamify the driver experience
  • Champion, role model, and embed Samsara’s cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices

Minimum requirements for the role:

  • 9+ years of professional experience building customer-facing applications
  • Strong programming/coding fundamentals in a language such as Java, Python, or Golang
  • Experience designing and architecting large, high-scale systems
  • A focus on and desire to mentor fellow engineers
  • An ability to estimate, communicate, and deliver upon project milestones with your team
  • You speak English proficiently

An ideal candidate also has:

  • Experience with a public cloud such as AWS
  • Familiarity with multiple tiers, like React Frontends and Microservices
  • Contributed heavily to driving significant value to their customers
  • Curiosity about our customers, and is eager to improve their day-to-day experience
  • Loves shipping features that are immediately used by our customers
  • Seeks to iterate on new products based on customer feedback
  • A Bachelors or higher in Computer Science or related discipline

#LI-Remote

At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background, race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, etc. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

Accommodations

Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or click here if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.

Benefits

Full time employees receive an above market total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at our Benefits site to learn more.

Flexible Working 

At Samsara, we have adopted a flexible way of working, enabling teams and individuals to do their best work, regardless of where they’re based. We value in-person collaboration and know a change of scenery and quiet space to work is welcomed from time to time, but also appreciate that the world of work has changed. Our offices remain open for those who prefer to collaborate or work in-office, but we also encourage fully remote applicants. As most roles are not required to be in the office, we are able to hire remotely where Samsara has an established presence. If a role is required to be in a certain location and candidates do not have work authorization for that location, Samsara will conduct an immigration assessment. If the role is not required to be in a specific location, Samsara will move forward with the remote location that works best for the business. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individual’s ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company. 

 

Please note: Samsara does not accept agency resumes and is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Samsara employees.
name: Staff Software Engineer, Telematics

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.



Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten, ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Machen Sie mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer Karriere. .

Verändern Sie zusammen mit uns die Welt von morgen.

Sie übernehmen eine spannende und herausfordernde Rolle als IT-Security Experte im Portfoliomanagement und sind mitverantwortlich für die kontinuierliche Verbesserung und Weiterentwicklung der IT-Sicherheit im Lösungs- und Serviceportfolio der Siemens Gebäudetechnik.

  • Zu Ihren Aufgaben zählen die Beratung, Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Blueprints für sichere Lösungen und Services, die Beratung bei der Implementierung von Sicherheitsfunktionen, sowie die Durchführung von Risikobewertungen und Penetrationstests.
  • Das Mitwirken an der Freigabe von neuen Portfolioelementen und die Optimierung des Freigabeprozesses rundet Ihr abwechslungsreiches Aufgabengebiet ab.
  • Sie wirken an der Entwicklung passender, sicherer Lösungen mit - z.B. für Industriekunden, Flughäfen, Krankenhäuser, Hochschulareale oder ähnliche und unterstützen bei der Umsetzung von Anforderungen aus der IT-Sicherheitsnormen und Gesetzgebungen.
  • Gemeinsam mit den Produkteigentümern stellen Sie sicher, dass die Architektur und das Design der Softwarekomponenten den erforderlichen nationalen und internationalen Sicherheitsstandards entsprechen.
  • Im Team tragen Sie dazu bei, dass das Bewusstsein für die Relevanz des Themas IT-Sicherheit nachhaltig in der Organisation etabliert wird.

Ihr Profil für gemeinsam "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Fachrichtung IT-Sicherheit, Informatik oder vergleichbar mit anschließender relevanter Berufserfahrung. Kenntnisse der Domäne der Gebäudetechnik sind hierbei von Vorteil.
  • Sie haben Erfahrung in der IT-Sicherheit gesammelt und kennen sich mit den gängigen IT-Sicherheitsstandards aus (IEC 62443, ISO 27001 und den BSI Grundschutz), idealerweise haben Sie sich bereits durch einschlägige Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen qualifiziert (z.B. CISSP, TISP, OCSP, etc).
  • Sie verfügen über erprobte und belastbare Erfahrungen im Bereich der technischen IT-Sicherheit und haben bereits erste Erfahrungen im Bereich der Entwicklung von Lösungen oder Penetrationstests gemacht.
  • Sie besitzen vertiefte Kenntnisse im Bereich der Netzwerksicherheit und Ihnen sind die Grundlagen der Anwendungssicherheit bekannt. Das Testen von Anwendungen und Lösungen auf Sicherheitsaspekte macht Ihnen Spaß und Sie bringen die hierfür notwendigen Kenntnisse mit. Hierzu sind Sie mit einer Skript-Sprache, wie z.B. Python oder Ruby, vertraut und besitzen auch Erfahrungen mit einschlägigen Werkzeugen wie Nessus und der Linux Distribution Kali Linu.
  • Darüber hinaus punkten Sie mit Ihrer zuverlässigen Arbeitsweise, einem kundenfreundlichen Auftreten, zukunftsorientierter Denkweise sowie mit einer engen kooperativen Zusammenarbeit im Team
  • Wir sind stolz darauf, dass sich der Siemens Smart Infrastructure Kollegenkreis aus Experten aus verschiedenen Ländern zusammensetzt - in diesem Umfeld sind Sie in der Lage sowohl auf Deutsch als auch auf Englisch zu kommunizieren und Dokumente zu bearbeiten.

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Barrierefreie Standorte
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

name: Product and Solution Security Expert (m/w/d)

contents:
We are Siemens

Siemens Digital Industries Software is a leading provider of solutions for the design, simulation and manufacture of products across many different industries. Formula 1 cars, skyscrapers, ships, space exploration vehicles, and many of the objects we see in our daily lives are being conceived and manufactured using our Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software.

Meet the team - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k6mVLaUyO4U

What we're looking for:

We are seeking an intern to join us for a year (2023-2024) to work within the Technology and Application group, focused on the Siemens flagship computational fluid dynamics (CFD) product Simcenter STAR-CCM+. The intern will be responsible for building, solving and reporting on the current capabilities for plasma simulations.

Is this your dream role? Please take a moment to meet some of our current interns who share their thoughts on working as an intern at Siemens. If you can picture yourself learning, growing, and succeeding in our team then we would love to hear from you!

What you'll be doing

As well as developing and assessing the accuracy of simulation models for plasma applications, you will also be involved with the Documentation and presentation of findings to stakeholders

During you time with us, you will acquire a broad understanding of our products, their domains, and their application; have the confidence to express ideas as part of a creative software team; have a genuine interest in technological trends; to think creatively about solutions to complex technical problems; and be constantly striving to enhance the team's results and the quality of the software.

What you'll bring

  • An undergraduate degree in Physics, Engineering, Applied Mathematics or another closely related field
  • Theoretical background and/or experience in simulating plasma physics
  • Theoretical background and/or experience in electrical arcs / circuit breakers
  • An inquisitive and methodical approach with good attention to detail
  • Strong analysis, organisational, and problem-solving ability
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

A knowledge of any of the following would be desirable:

  • Experience with Computational Fluid Dynamics
  • Data Analytics
  • Experience in a Linux environment

Join our Digital World

Siemens is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Working at Siemens means great work life balance and flexibility - whether that is full time in the office, hybrid or fully remote. We are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We look for the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality and provide all the comfort and benefits employees need to achieve those goals. Join our Talent Community today and let's stay connected in areas that interest you: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

Siemens Software. Where today meets tomorrow!

contents:
Standort: BLN

Art der Anstellung: Permanent / Full-time

Wissen für die Welt von morgen.



Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Machen Sie mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer Karriere.

Verändern Sie mit uns die Welt von morgen.

  • Konstruktion und Koordination von Themen im Rahmen der Fertigungsbetreuung des offenen Leistungsschalters 3WL/3WA
  • Aufdeckung und Umsetzung von Verbesserungspotential innerhalb der 3WL/3WA-Familie in Bezug auf Konstruktion und Fertigung
  • Koordination und technische Unterstützung der angrenzende Abteilungen und der Fertigungsstandorte

  • Generierung und Umsetzung von kostensenkenden Maßnahmen im Modul

  • Ursachenklärung bei Störungen in der Montagelinie und im Feld
  • Erarbeitung von konstruktiven Lösungsvarianten und Konzepten
  • Erstellen der gesamten Dokumentation (Zeichnungen, Stücklisten) mit den Entwicklungstools
  • Erstellung von Prüfvorgaben
  • Toleranz- und Schnittstellenanalyse, Erstellung und Abstimmung Technischer Spezifikationen
  • Verfolgung und Einhaltung von Terminen und Aufgaben

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Maschinenbau, Mechatronik oder vergleichbar
  • Sicherer Umgang mit 3D-CAD Programm, idealerweise Creo
  • Erfahrung im Bereich Werkstoff- und Kunststofftechnik von Vorteil
  • Kenntnisse im Bereich Thermo-/Fluidsimulation von Vorteil
  • Erfahrung mit SAP von Vorteil
  • Erfahrung mit EDM-System Agile Cadim und/oder Teamcenter von Vorteil
  • Sprachkenntnisse neben Deutsch auch in Englisch erforderlich
  • Anwesenheit vor Ort (Schaltwerk Berlin)

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen

contents:
Wir sind Partner für die Industrie in der digitalen Transformation

Siemens Digital Industries (DI) ist ein Technologie- bzw. Innovationsführer für die industrielle Automatisierung und die Digitalisierung. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit Partnern und Kunden, treiben wir die digitale Transformation in der diskreten Industrie und in der Prozessindustrie voran. Die zahlreichen Vorteile der digitalisierten und vernetzten Welt haben jedoch ihren Preis: Cyberangriffe sind zu einer ernsten Gefahr geworden. Wenn wir das volle Potenzial der digitalen Welt ausschöpfen wollen, muss eine effektive Cybersicherheit darin ein elementarer Bestandteil sein. Wir nutzen unsere weltweit führende Technologie und fundierte Branchenexpertise, um den umfassenden Schutz über all unsere Produkte, Lösungen und Services kontinuierlich zu erhöhen. So gewährleisten wir maximale Sicherheit - für unsere Kunden und die Gesellschaft als Ganzes.

Dein Engagement.

  • Du arbeitest eigenverantwortlich in der ganzheitlichen Beratung unserer Kunden in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Vertriebsteam in Deutschland und weiteren internen Partnern
  • Du entwickelst und pflegst Beziehungen zu Entscheiden bei unseren Endkunden (z.B. CIOs / CISOs, Lead Architekten bzw. Lösungsverantwortlichen bei Integratoren, etc.) welche dir als Trusted Advisor vertrauen
  • Du berätst eigenständig zu Themen wie IT-Sicherheit, Cyber Risk Management, regulatorischen Vorgaben
  • Daraus abgeleitet entwickelst und verantwortest Du die IT/OT Zielarchitektur im Dialog mit den Kunden
  • Dabei berücksichtigst Du das Produkt-, System- und Servicegeschäft aller unserer BUs, sowie die Cybersecurity Angebote ausgewählter Partner
  • Über neue Security Lösungen unserer Marktbegleiter bist Du stets gut informiert und neue technologische Trends verfolgst du proaktiv
  • Zudem hast Du bei deiner Beratung immer die Gesamtlösung im Blick, welche du verantwortest
  • Hierfür schlägst Du Brücken und koordinierst zwischen allen internen / externen Stakeholdern
  • Darüber hinaus unterstützt Du die Vertriebsverantwortlichen im Pre-Sales, klärst Anfragen und präsentierst unseren Kunden das finale Ergebnis
  • Du entwickelst und treibst eigenverantwortlich Cybersecurity Opportunities bis zum erfolgreichen Abschluss
  • Im Rahmen von Workshops bzw. Kundenevents positionierst Du unser Portfolio, moderierst bei der Entwicklung der Security Zielarchitektur und treibst die Markteinführung von neuen innovativen Cybersecurity Lösungen voran

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Die Basis Deiner beruflichen Karriere bildet ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Fachrichtung Elektrotechnik, Informationstechnik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
  • Darauf aufbauend hast Du langjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich der Cybersecurity für IT oder OT-Umgebungen
  • Ergänzend kannst Du fundierte Beratungserfahrung im direkten Kunden- und Lösungsgeschäft vorweisen
  • Darüber hinaus kannst Du anerkannte Aus- und Weiterbildungen mit Zertifikat im Bereich Cybersecurity vorweisen (z.B. CISSP, CSSP, CISA, CASP+, IEC 62443)
  • Des Weiteren kannst Du Kunden auf dem Weg der Digitalisierung aktiv voranbringen und bei der Transformation in das IoT-Umfeld unterstützen
  • Darüber hinaus hast Du Transparenz zu regulatorischen Vorgaben wie dem IT-Sicherheitsgesetz, der NIS-2 Direktive, branchenspezifischen Anforderungen an KRITIS-Infrastrukturen (B3S) sowie der IEC 62443
  • Zudem überzeugst Du uns und unsere Kunden mit deiner raschen Auffassungsgabe, deinem sicheren Auftreten und deinem unternehmerischem Denkvermögen
  • Mit Deiner Empathie und strategischen Stärke schaffst du es nachhaltige Kundenbeziehungen aufzubauen und zu pflegen
  • Abgerundet wird Dein Profil durch deine verhandlungssicheren Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch sowie deiner Bereitschaft zu deutschlandweiten Reisen

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Deine berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • Ein Arbeitsumfeld, in dem sich jeder mit seiner ganzen Persönlichkeit einbringen kann und sich als Teil von Siemens fühlt
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Dich und deine Familie ermöglichen
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

contents:
Applicant Privacy Notice

Looking to join a world-class blockchain development team? Ava Labs makes it simple to deploy high-performance solutions for Web3, led by innovations on Avalanche. The company was founded by Cornell computer scientists, who partnered with Wall Street veterans and early Web3 leaders to execute a promising vision for redefining the way people build permissionless networks. Ava Labs is redefining the way people create value with Web3. Join us as we empower people to easily and freely digitize all the world’s assets on one open, programmable blockchain platform

WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Maintain existing Virtual Machines on Avalanche, improve their performance using simulations and instrumentation, and increase the coverage of their core components
  • Create new Virtual Machines on top of our SDKs to empower community builders (i.e. an “app store” of virtual machines anyone can pull of the shelf to use on their own blockchain)
  • Extend and optimize the Ethereum Virtual Machine for use within Avalanche Subnets

WHAT MAKES YOU A GOOD FIT

  • You believe in a future where blockchain technologies make the world a more fair and free place for everyone.
  • You have the desire to work on open-source code and engage with the community. You wish to work together with other talented contributors instead of working alone.
  • You are a coder. You implement demos and proofs-of-concept before writing multi-page technical documents.
  • You create and find projects that provide value. You don’t need to wait for someone to tell you what to research or work on. We hire awesome engineers to tell us what we should build, not the other way around.
  • You have an obsession with code quality and performance. You ship code when it is ready, not as soon as it passes unit tests.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING

  • Demonstrated capability in subject area (open source code or published work is a bonus)
  • Rust, Golang, Java, or C++ programming experience

What about minimum experience or education?  If you are smart and talented, it doesn’t matter how you became smart and talented. What about location restrictions? We have a fully remote engineering team and look to hire the best wherever they are.

Salary Range: $158,400.00 - $208,200.00 (**This is not a guarantee of compensation or salary, a final offer amount may vary based on factors including but not limited to experience and geographic location.)

#LI-Remote #LI-DS1

WHY AVA LABS?

If you've ever thought about joining an early stage Web3 company - this is it! We're a global, world-class team of experts in computer science, economics, finance, marketing, and law with offices in New York City and Miami. We're highly passionate about Web3 and redefining the way people build and use finance and decentralized applications of all kinds. The company received early-stage funding from Andreessen Horowitz, Initialized Capital, and Polychain Capital, with angel investments from Balaji Srinivasan and Naval Ravikant. Join us and be a pioneer in a new technology that will have implications across a range of verticals such as finance, gaming, investing, collectibles, among many others.

Ava Labs is committed to diversity in the workplace and we’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not hire on basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state or federal law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.
name: Senior Virtual Machine Engineer

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.

Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Machen Sie mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer Karriere.

Verändern Sie mit uns die Welt von morgen.

Als IT Operations Analyst (w/m/d) Firewall sind Sie zuständig für die Planung, Administration und 2nd Level Support von Firewall und SSL-VPN Lösungen im Hochsicherheits-Datacenter in München (DE), Ohio (USA) und Singapur.

In Ihrer Rolle setzen Sie definierte Verfahren und Prozesse um, die speziell für den Datacenter Firewall Betrieb gelten und führen entsprechende operative und/oder Unterstützungsaktivitäten durch.

  • Sie verantworten das Design und Betrieb der FW-Infrastruktur inkl. Konfiguration der Firewalls und SSL-VPN Gateways
  • Dabei gehören Troubleshooting und Entstörung zu Ihrem Aufgabenbereich
  • Sie analysieren und optimieren interne Prozesse mit Erweiterung der Automatisierung
  • Die Optimierung der Firewal und SSL-VPN lnfrastruktur im Hinblick auf Kosten und Nutzen gehört genauso wie die Dokumentation der Netzwerkpläne aus L2- und L3-Sicht inkl. CMDB zu Ihrem Aufgabenbereich
  • Ihnen obliegen das Monitoring und Management der Firewalls und der SSL-VPN Gateways mehrerer Datacenter
  • Des Weiteren sind Sie verantwortlich für das Vulnerability Management mit Dokumentation und Mitigation
  • Sie begleiten Projekte bei Einführung neuer Firewall und Remote Access Technologien und Neuaufbau von Individuallösungen
  • Außerdem stimmen Sie sich regelmäßig mit anderen Fachabteilungen bzgl. Anforderungen und Security Aspekten ab und stehen im Austausch mit Lieferanten und Herstellern (z.B. Checkpoint, Palo Alto)

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Sie besitzen ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik (Uni, FH, BA) oder eine vgl. Ausbildung und mehrjährige Erfahrung im genannten Themengebiet
  • Sie bringen ein bis drei Jahre Erfahrung im Umfeld Netzwerk Firewall und Remote Access mit
  • Sie haben sehr gute Kenntnisse in Cloud Technology (AWS, Azure), Firewall & Routing und Ivanti SSL VPN Gateways und sind Experte in CheckPoint und Palo Alto Firewalls
  • Sie zeichnen sich durch analytische Fähigkeiten sowie starke Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten aus
  • Sie haben Erfahrung im Erstellen und Warten von Scripten vorzugsweise mit Python
  • Außerdem bringen Sie ein hohes Maß an Ergebnisorientierung, Bereitschaft zum Bereitschaftsdienst sowie Technical Englisch Know-how mit

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

contents:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.
 

The Role:

As a Value Engineer, you are spearheading our mission of data-driven business transformation with our customers with the focus on Manufacturing Industry. You will work in partnership with the Celonis Sales Teams and have full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers. You are our customers trusted advisor and help them achieve their strategic goals and realize significant value using Celonis EMS. In collaboration with our partners and Celonis Services, you will drive measurable business impact across various processes and industries and accelerate the adoption of our platform. You will blend deep process and industry expertise with a proven consulting skill set with strong analytical skills at the forefront of one of the fastest-growing tech companies worldwide.


The work you’ll do:

Identify & Frame Value

  • Discover and translate customers’ strategic priorities into high-impact Celonis use cases
  • Build demos and business cases, leveraging industry benchmarks and best practices in order to win new customers 
  • Undertake Value Assessments or Proof-of-Value Projects and communicate the value opportunity and strategic roadmap to C-Level executives

 

Realize Value

  • Facilitate business value workshops and use Celonis to identify and qualify opportunities for process enhancement
  • Derive improvement measures in core business functions and initiate improvement actions and enterprise-wide change initiatives
  • Present results and realized value to senior management and C-level executives

 

Scale Value

  • Responsible for the end-to-end customer value journey, landing, expanding, adoption and renewing
  • Build a strategic expansion roadmap for customers embedding Celonis EMS as a strategic business transformation platform in their organization and therefore drive adoption and expansion
  • Provide feedback to our product development teams to enhance the Celonis platform and Apps based on new use cases

 

The qualifications you need:

  • Value Selling Methodology: You have advanced knowledge and experience following the Celonis value selling methodology alongside the customer journey: including discovery, qualification, value assessment and PoV’s, and demonstrate the full value potential of Celonis EMS
  • Product Expertise: You are an expert in guiding the customer’s IT team throughout their EMS journey, demonstrating hands-on the power of EMS and accelerating value realization by building dashboards, Apps, Action Flows
  • Value Realization: You have advanced knowledge and expertise in identifying and prioritising use cases, implementing improvement measures and becoming a change agent for the customer by establishing an operating model and training users for the customer to realize value and renew/expand their subscription with Celonis
  • Project Management: You are able to plan and manage project scope, expectations and timelines. You will need to manage multiple projects across your aligned accounts that will be at different parts of the value journey. Also, you will leverage partners from the Celonis Ecosystem wherever possible.
  • Executive Stakeholder Management: Proven experience in preparing and communicating results to stakeholders and management, both internally and externally.
  • Domain Expertise: Leverage your advanced business domain expertise, such as in Finance or Supply Chain as well as strategic transformation initiatives (e.g. Shared Services Transformation or System Transformation) and build a compelling value roadmap for the customer
  • Industry Expertise: You have advanced industry expertise and a proven ability to develop a deep understanding of industry trends and strategic opportunities of the C-Suite and build an integrated Celonis EMS roadmap


If you see a match, let us know and apply now!

#LI-PB1

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis enables customers to optimize their business processes. Powered by its leading process mining technology, Celonis provides a unique set of capabilities for business executives and users to continuously find improvement opportunities within and across processes, and execute targeted actions to rapidly enhance process performance. This optimization yields immediate cash impact, radically improves customer experience, and reduces carbon emissions. Celonis has thousands of implementations with global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
name: Value Engineer/Solution Engineer - Production

contents:
Wir suchen nach Menschen, die mit uns die Digitalisierung von Morgengestalten. Denn - Wir machen digital.

Wir sind Siemens Digital Industries Software. Wir sind keinIndustrieunternehmen. Wir sind ein wachsendes Softwareunternehmen, das unserenKunden schon heute die Technologien und Innovationen von morgen bietet. Mit denRessourcen und Möglichkeiten eines Großunternehmens sind Ihre Möglichkeitenendlos. Die Stelle, auf die Sie sich heute bewerben, ist nur der erste Schrittauf Ihrem Weg zu Siemens.

Werden Sie jetzt Teil unseres Teams als Enterprise IntegrationArchitect (m/w/d)

Welche Rolle werden Sie spielen?

In einem internationalen Team erfahrener Architekten und Berater übernehmenSie nach fundierter Einarbeitung eine Schlüsselrolle in der Planung undRealisierung optimierter Produktentstehungs-, Logistik- und Produktionsprozessemit Teamcenter in Verbindung mit 3rd-Party-Anwendungen. Unsere Kunden sindmittelständische und große Unternehmen der Fertigungsindustrie in Deutschlandebenso wie in anderen Ländern weltweit, in allen Branchen, vom Einzelfertigerbis zum Großserienhersteller. Sie gestalten mit unseren Kunden gemeinsam neueWege, um systemübergreifende Prozesse im Umfeld PLM-ERP-MOM effizienter zugestalten und die Informationen für die beteiligten Mitarbeiter zielgerichtetbereitzustellen.

Die Basis dafür bilden unsere "Active Integration Gateway Solutions",eine Kombination aus in unserem Hause entwickelter Integrationssoftware mitprofessioneller Prozess- und Systemintegrationsberatung. Zu Ihren Aufgabengehört es, weitestgehend in Eigenverantwortung Prozess- undLösungsanforderungen gemeinsam mit dem Kunden und Fachkollegen zu erarbeiten,diese Anforderungen selbständig in technische Lösungen zu überführen sowiederen Umsetzung in betriebsbereite Anwendungen zu begleiten. Gleichzeitigbringen Sie sich aktiv bei der Dokumentation von Best Practices und derDefinition von zukunftsfähigen Standardlösungen für komplexesystemübergreifende Geschäftsprozesse ein.

Was Sie brauchen, um gemeinsam erfolgreich zu sein?

  • Erfolgreiches Studium der Fachrichtung Ingenieurswesen, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
  • Praktische Erfahrungen in der Beratung, Konzipierung und Umsetzung von systemübergreifenden Geschäftsprozessen oder gute Kenntnisse von Prozessen in der Produktentwicklung, der Fertigungsplanung bzw. im ERP Umfeld bei mittleren bis großen Industrieunternehmen
  • Erfahrung im Umgang mit PDM / PLM, MES oder ERP-Systemen, Kenntnisse in Teamcenter und SAP sind von Vorteil
  • Freude am Umgang mit Menschen in Kombination mit einer hohen IT Affinität
  • Aktive, teamorientierte Arbeitsweise und hohe Lernbereitschaft
  • Ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung, Kommunikationsstärke sowie sicheres Auftreten
  • Sie betreuen unsere nationalen und internationalen Kunden sowohl auf Deutsch als auch auf Englisch, Kenntnisse in weiteren Sprachen sind von Vorteil
  • Reisebereitschaft (ca. 50%) und Flexibilität

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

Mehr als 140.000 Kundinnen in aller Welt setzten heute schon auf unsereKompetenz in der Digitalisierung . Dabei bringen sich in Deutschland über 2.000Kolleginnen und Kollegen in spannende und abwechslungsreiche Kundenprojekte ausden Bereichen Luft- und Raumfahrt, Automobil- und Transportbranche,Konsumprodukte und Einzelhandel, Elektronik und Halbleiter, Energie- undVersorgungsindustrie, Industriemaschinen und Schwermaschinen, MaritimeIndustrie, sowie Medizinprodukte und Arzneimittel ein. Bei uns findest Du einteamorientiertes Arbeitsumfeld, umfassende Weiterbildungsoptionen undattraktive Benefits. Durch individuelle Zielvereinbarungen und vielfältigeKarrieremodelle mit Spezialisierungsoptionen bieten wir Dir die Möglichkeit,fachlich und persönlich zu wachsen.

Sind Sie ein Ideengestalterin? Dann werden Sie Teil unseres Teams!

Sie möchten vor Ihrer Bewerbung mehr über die Siemens Digital IndustriesSoftware erfahren? Mission / Vision und unser Software Portfolio -oder besuchen Sie unsere Homepage.
