name: Enterprise Integration Architect (m/f/d)

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a Treasury Integrations Manager to join the team owning the collaboration and cross-functional effort between Treasury and Product teams. This team is working to streamline processes associated with treasury infrastructure across our products including design, operational needs, and reporting. This position will play a key role in partnering with both Product, Engineering, and Treasury on business roadmap and key initiatives. 

What you'll work on:

  • Developing and documenting problem statements and business needs for Treasury with input from subject-matter experts.
  • Supporting and facilitating the success of integration projects resulting from business need and Product planning such as feature updates, banking integrations, Treasury Management Systems, etc. 
  • Defining and developing project plans from a Treasury perspective where applicable.
  • Reviewing the Product organization’s project plans, designs and features to evaluate impact on Treasury organization.
  • Collaborating with Product, SMEs and Treasury leads to review project(s) scope and requirements including reporting, tooling, or other needs.
  • Supporting roadmap planning efforts including evaluating time and resources needed from partners.
  • Partnering with Treasury team leads to understand their roles and responsibilities.
  • Developing and communicating project updates within the Treasury Organization.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • 7+ years of experience in consulting, financial services or payments industry required.
  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or related field. 
  • Able to think critically, understand complex topics/technologies, define complex problems by developing concise summarization of technical initiatives put out by the business or problems identified by SMEs.
  • Proven collaborative problem solving skills with the ability to think critically and ask thoughtful questions.
  • Startup mindset.
  • Highly organized and detail oriented.
  • Takes pride in working on projects to successful completion.
  • Excels in a highly collaborative environment with different stakeholders and SMEs.
  • Practical experience creating process documentation and reports.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate information into actionable insights as well as the ability to coordinate feedback under tight timelines.
  • Highly proficient technical writing capabilities.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Seattle, WA. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $135,000 - $180,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

#LI-Remote
name: Treasury Integrations Manager

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was tragen Sie bei?

  • Auf den Führerstand-Displays unserer modernen Lokomotiven sieht der Lokführer die wichtigsten technischen Daten der Lokomotive in Echtzeit - als Softwareentwickler (w/m/d) für das Display sorgen Sie für eine einwandfreie und übersichtliche Darstellung.
  • Dazu sammeln und strukturieren Sie Anforderungen, erstellen Lösungskonzepte in Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Engineering-Einheiten und entwickeln Software-Architekturen für das Führerstand-Display.
  • Das Ergebnis Ihrer Arbeit ist eine hochwertige Display-Software deren Schnittstellen zur Fahrzeugsteuerung bzw. Fahrzeugleittechnik reibungslos funktionieren.
  • Sie implementieren neue Software und Tools für eingebettete Systeme auf Basis von Linux und Windows inklusive Dokumentation.
  • Darüber hinaus führen Sie Software-Integrationen und -Tests durch und überzeugen sich vom Ergebnis Ihrer Arbeit durch die Sicherstellung der Funktionalität im Fahrzeug.
  • Aufbauend auf diese Aufgabe können Sie sich je nach Interesse und Eignung als Fachexperte (w/m/d) in einem spannenden technischen Umfeld weiterentwickeln.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium (Bachelor) der Fachrichtung Informatik oder Elektrotechnik mit gutem Abschluss.
  • Sie besitzen erste praktische Erfahrung in der strukturierten und systematischen Softwareentwicklung in Python.
  • Erfahrungen im Gui/3D-Toolkit, z.B. mit Qt, GTK, SDL2 oder PyGame wären ideal.
  • Erfahrung mit Linux, Arbeiten auf der Kommandozeile (Shell) ist wünschenswert.
  • Idealerweise haben Sie Erfahrung im Umfeld des spurgeführten Verkehrs und/oder Erfahrung mit bildgebenden Systemen.
  • Sie haben Grundkenntnisse in Requirement-Engineering, Konfigurations- und Change-Request-Management.
  • Sie verfügen über sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Inklusion & Vielfalt

Bei Siemens Mobility setzen wir uns gegen Ungerechtigkeit und Ungleichheit ein. Bei uns finden Sie ein Umfeld vor, in dem Sie Sie selbst sein können und dazugehören.

Purpose

Wir sind Pioniere der Mobilität. Bei uns tragen Sie in einem Zukunftsmarkt aktiv zu Verkehrswende und Klimaschutz bei, weil unsere Transportlösungen in aller Welt den CO2-Ausstoß verringern.

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns haben Sie die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Sie zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein können. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt?

www.siemens.de/mobility

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for an experienced Director who will be responsible for building and scaling a global best-in-class Treasury Operations function covering OTC operations, digital asset operations, and fiat operations. In this role, you will seek to actively identify and leverage synergies in operations processes to achieve standardization and automation across all operational aspects of Circle’s business.  This position plays a key strategic role in partnering with our Product, Engineering, and Customer Success teams to deliver operational solutions that help to create value for Circle’s customers. You will also lead Circle’s efforts to develop best in class processes and controls that exceed existing and future regulatory requirements. This is an opportunity to build a strategic function from the ground up.

What you'll work on: 

  • Building and scaling a best-in-class firmwide operations function to support 24/7 crypto and fiat flows.
  • Partnering closely with internal functions such as Product and Engineering to ensure that new products and services incorporate key operational features and functionality.
  • Developing and implementing a global foreign exchange strategy for crypto and fiat operations.
  • Providing operational expertise and support to the OTC market making business, including asset custody, reporting, margin operations, and financial risk management.
  • Facilitating new product launches and lines of business with robust operational process design and infrastructure.
  • Automating operational and reconciliation process flows to reduce error incidence and increase efficiencies.
  • Developing and establishing operational redundancy and resiliency to ensure continued operations and zero downtime.
  • Owning and continually improving fiat operations including funds flows, return/exception handling, critical metrics, and reporting. Developing automated reporting and reconciliation solutions across payments systems and platforms.
  • Building and maintaining operational controls, policies, standards and procedures for operational activities. 
  • Collaborating closely with internal partners to ensure end to end process flows are performed according to regulatory requirements and internal controls/processes as well as documenting evidence of compliance.
  • Testing and improving operations architecture resiliency to ensure continued operations across unplanned and unexpected events. 

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • 12+ years full time or internship experience in treasury, banking, payments industry or related field.
  • 5+ years of experience managing and leading teams. 
  • Prior experience building and scaling an operations function.
  • Strong work ethic and ability to excel in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities.
  • Inquisitiveness and interest in macroeconomics and business cycle modeling.
  • Interest in the cryptocurrency and web3 ecosystems and how they interact with the traditional finance industry.
  • Advanced excel/spreadsheet skills and/or basic computer programming capabilities (SQL, Python, AppScript, VBA, etc.)  
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Miami, FL. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $197,500 - $267,500

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

#LI-Remote
name: Director, Treasury Operations

contents:
Mitgestalten, was morgen wichtig ist.

Sie sind mit Leidenschaft dabei, Mehrwert für Ihre Kunden zu schaffen. Sie wissen, wie man eine Produktfamilie definiert und durch alle Phasen des Produktlebenszyklus begleitet, vom Konzept bis zum Ende des Lebenszyklus. Genau dafür suchen wir schlaue und zuverlässige Köpfe wie Sie, die Visionen für neue Produkte mitbringen. Um dies zu erreichen, hinterfragen wir den Status-Quo und schaffen Raum für Neues, das Sie persönlich mitgestalten können. Wir sind stolz darauf, in einem schnelllebigen Umfeld zu arbeiten, in dem agile Entwicklung großgeschrieben wird und Innovationen gefördert werden. Gerne übertragen wir Ihnen Verantwortung und bieten Ihnen alles, was Sie dazu brauchen.Worauf warten Sie noch? Lassen Sie uns gemeinsam die Zukunft gestalten!

Verändern Sie mit uns die Welt von morgen.

  • Als Experte für den Arbeitsschritt optische Kontrolle ergänzen Sie unsere Produktions-Technologieabteilung mit dem Schwerpunkt maschinenspezifischer Applikation.
  • Sie passen Programme an, betreuen unsere AOI-/SPI-/AXI Systeme und stellen dabei einen reibungslosen Prozessablauf sicher.
  • Sie pflegen unsere Datenbanken und optimieren somit unsere optischen-Prüfsysteme.
  • Sie arbeiten Hand in Hand mit dem entsprechenden Operator (m/w/d) zusammen, z. B. beim Beseitigen von Fehlern.

Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat

  • Sie haben ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium vorzugsweise im Bereich Automatisierungssysteme, Maschinenbau-Produktionssysteme oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation (z. B. Industrial Engineering oder Mechatronik).
  • Mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung im Bereich der Elektronikproduktion bringen Sie mit.
  • Kenntnisse im Bereich der Bestück- und Lötqualität und im Bereich der Flachbaugruppenfertigung erleichtern Ihnen den Einstieg.
  • Persönlich überzeugen Sie uns durch Ihre Initiative, Analyse- und Teamfähigkeit und Ihre Kommunikationsfähigkeit.
  • Sie verfügen über sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse und sind sicher im Umgang mit WIN-Betriebssystemen, SAP und Office 365.
  • Sie bringen eine hohe Motivation und praktische Umsetzungskraft mit, dies unterstützen Sie durch Ihre eigenverantwortliche, strukturierte und zuverlässige Arbeitsweise.

Was wir bieten.

  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was tragen Sie bei?

Der Bereich "Control, Communication and Information" ist für die Erstellung der Fahrzeugsteuerung für die Siemens Lokomotiven zuständig. Für die Nachweisführung im Rahmen des europäischen Zulassungsprozesses elektrischer und dieselelektrischer Lokomotiven suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Verstärkung.

  • In Ihrer neuen Rolle sind Sie verantwortlich für die Erstellung von Zulassungsnachweisen in den Fachgebieten der Fahrzeugsteuerung, v.a. Zugbeeinflussungssysteme, Datenrekorder, Zugfunk und den Funktionen der Zugsteuerung.
  • Hierfür arbeiten Sie mit den Kollegen (w/m/d) des Systemengineerings an der Erstellung von Zulassungsnachweisen und am zugehörigen Erstellungsprozess.
  • Sie stellen sicher, dass die Nachweisführung vollständig und zeitgerecht erfolgt und stehen dazu im Austausch mit den internen wie externen Beteiligten.
  • Sie erweitern kontinuierlich Ihr Systemwissen und erlangen zunehmend eine funktional breite Sicht auf die Fahrzeugsteuerung unserer Lokomotiven.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes technisches Studium (z. B. Elektrotechnik, Maschinenbau, Mechatronik).
  • Des Weiteren konnten Sie bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich des Engineerings von Schienenfahrzeugen sammeln.
  • Idealerweise haben Sie bereits Erfahrungen im europäischen Zulassungsprozess von Schienenfahrzeugen gesammelt und Zulassungsvorhaben im Rahmen Ihrer Projekterfahrung bereits erfolgreich durchlaufen.
  • Vorteilhaft ist es, wenn Sie bereits die Verantwortung für zulassungsrelevante Funktionen in Entwicklung und Nachweis wahrgenommen haben
  • Sie haben Freude daran, komplexe Problemstellungen zu durchdringen und gemeinsam mit Kollegen (w/m/d) zu bearbeiten. Dazu agieren Sie verbindlich, sprechen fließend Deutsch und Englisch und bringen eine Europa-weite Reisebereitschaft (ca. 10 %) mit.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Inklusion & Vielfalt

Bei Siemens Mobility setzen wir uns gegen Ungerechtigkeit und Ungleichheit ein. Bei uns finden Sie ein Umfeld vor, in dem Sie Sie selbst sein können und dazugehören.

Purpose

Wir sind Pioniere der Mobilität. Bei uns tragen Sie in einem Zukunftsmarkt aktiv zu Verkehrswende und Klimaschutz bei, weil unsere Transportlösungen in aller Welt den CO2-Ausstoß verringern.

Weiterentwicklung

Wir bieten Ihnen umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Mit unserem Learning Campus verfügen wir über einen Inhouse-Dienstleister mit einem vielfältigen On- und Offline-Angebot.

contents:
Explore our Digital World

Do you want to create technologies that transform the everyday for billions of people? Our digital careers offer the opportunity to shape the next era of growth and innovation, challenging ourselves to build a better future. By creating ground breaking technologies that transform our world, we need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Picture yourself in the Digital World of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds.

Why you'll love working for Siemens!

  • Freedom and a healthy work- life balance- Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
  • Solve the world's most significant problems - Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
  • Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
  • Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
  • Competitive total rewards package.
  • Profit sharing available.
  • Rewarding vacation entitlement with the opportunity to buy and sell your vacation depending on your lifestyle.
  • Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
  • Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
  • Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
  • Employee perks and discounts.
  • Diversity and inclusivity focused.

Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada's Top 100 Employers, Canada's Greenest Employers 2022, Canada's Top Employers for Young People 2023 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.

What will you do?

Siemens is looking for a Senior Technical Program Manager to help deliver a new Software-as-a-service platform for EV fleets across the world.

Key Objectives:

Delivery - As a Technical Program Manager, you will lead cross-functional teams from different locations to deliver a complex program. You will plan and manage project schedules, anticipate project risks and provide mitigation strategies. You will as need be providing escalation management recommending engineering trade-offs and decisions aligned with business goals.

Stakeholder Management - As a Technical Program Manager, you will manage conflicts, drive effective teamwork, communication and collaboration partnering across multiple teams with competing priorities by the Product Management teams.

Program Management - As a Technical Program Manager, you will identify opportunities, define and institutionalize processes for accurately capturing scope, dependencies, schedule, metrics, risks for program success and effectively communicating the program status and updates/reports to all stakeholders on a regular cadence.

  • Strategize, implement, and maintain program initiatives that adhere to organizational objectives.
  • Develop program assessment protocols for evaluation and improvement.
  • Maintain organizational standards of satisfaction, quality, and performance.
  • Oversee multiple project teams, ensuring program goals are reached.
  • Manage budget and funding channels for maximum productivity.
  • Work closely with project sponsor, cross-functional teams, and assigned engineering managers to plan and develop scope, deliverables, required resources, work plan, budget, and timing for new initiatives.
  • Develop and manage budget for projects and be accountable for delivering against established business goals/objectives.
  • Work with engineering managers to identify risks and opportunities across multiple teams.
  • Analyze, evaluate, and overcome program risks, and produce program reports for management and stakeholders.

What will you need to succeed?

  • Overall, 10-14 years of software industry experience (preferably in product development)
  • Minimum 5 years of Strong experience managing large cross-functional software projects right from inception to launch seeing the full life cycle with a deep understanding of agile methodologies.
  • Good knowledge of one or more technology stack (preferably Java, Spring boot and Cloud)
  • Preferably a PMP or Agile PM certification.
  • Experience providing cross-functional coordination with engineering, product and inter/intra team communications to technical and non-technical groups.
  • Experience working with tools to manage schedule, cost and risks of ongoing projects and provide reports to management.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, proven ability to build strong relationships and lead and influence cross-functional and partner teams.
  • Exercise good business judgement skills to find short-term solutions working cross-functionally for difficult/tricky engineering problems while not sacrificing the long-term goals.
  • Knowledge of JIRA
  • Strong drive to bring change, identifies opportunities and highly perseverant until they are realized Challenges status-quo and always pushes for new, innovative, and simple solutions.
  • Excellent communication skills, somebody who can understand the business problem/domain fast and articulate problem/solution to different audience types (technical/business)

About us.

We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.

For over 110 years, Siemens Canada has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality and reliability. Siemens Canada is a technology leader providing comprehensive solutions for Smart Infrastructure and Digital Industries. We make real what matters by setting the benchmark in the way we electrify, automate and digitalize the world around us. Ingenuity drives us and what we create together in yours.

Making a difference together we raised $$385,000 towards charitable contributions, support over 38 non-profit organizations and planted 660 trees in our local communities. Siemens Canada has 2,500 employees from coast-to-coast and 24 office and production facilities across Canada. Join our team of approximately 293,000 talented professionals in more than 190 countries/regions and help us tackle the most exciting challenges to build a successful future together. So, what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.

To learn more about Siemens Canada, visit our website at www.siemens.ca

While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

name: Senior Technical Program Manager -Remote

contents:
Mentor Graphics is now Siemens EDA

Company Overview

Siemens EDA is a global technology leader in Electronic Design Automation, providing software and hardware design solutions that help engineers around the world create new and innovative products. Each year, our customers use our technologies and tools to push their design and development boundaries in order to deliver smaller, faster and more reliable products.

Position Overview

Support the use of Siemens EDA ICVS technologies in design and verification of complex ASIC & FPGA designs for the most advanced military and aerospace companies. This position brings the technical role to the Americas' Account team. As a Functional Verification Application Engineer, you will be part of a team comprising of Account Manager, Account Technology Manager, Product Engineer, and Product Specialists, contributing to increase the deployment and adoption of Functional Verification products within North America customers, and develop new customers.

The Functional Verification Applications Engineer will be responsible for:

  • Providing technical leadership for all ICVS technologies and solutions, contribute toward and the execution of pre/post sales strategy established by the account team.
  • Uncovering, Qualifying and Executing functional verification opportunities.
  • Articulating customer's technical requirements and influencing product engineering to shape product direction.
  • Developing technical presentations, conducting demonstrations, evaluations, and benchmarks.
  • Effectively communicating how Mentor's solutions will solve customer's problems.
  • Building and maintaining ongoing positive relationships with customers.
  • Working collaboratively with team members to ensure mutual success.
  • Mentor and/or coach other junior AEs on the team.

Job Qualifications

The successful candidate will possess the following combination of education and experience:

  • BSEE, BSCS or related engineering discipline plus 7+ years of experience in the EDA, or Semiconductor field.
  • MSEE, MSCS or related engineering discipline plus 5+ years of experience in EDA, or Semiconductor field.
  • A strong understanding of Design and Verification concepts in ASIC & FPGA flow is required.
  • Expert in Advanced Verification methodologies & environments is essential.
  • Expert in coding with Verilog/VHDL/SystemVerilog, UVM, PSL/SVA is mandatory.
  • Experience with Verification IP, Formal & Emulation technology is a plus.
  • Good presentation and communication skills is essential.
  • Self-motivated and self-disciplined.
  • Prior leadership roles or experiences is essential.
  • US Citizenship is mandatory.

Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States

The total cash compensation range for this position is $134,700 to $269,400 with 20% of this being comprised of annual incentive target. If you reside in the Bay Area the total cash compensation range for this position is $154,800 to $294,100 with 20% of this being comprised of an annual incentive target. The actual compensation offered is based on the successful candidate's work location as well as additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education/training. Siemens offers a variety of health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com. In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Company policies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exempt employees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

At Siemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

contents:
This candidate will be a multi-disciplinary team member and will develop design methodologies to exploit and expand the use of Siemens EDA Xpedition products. The candidate will need strong communication skills, consulting, and presenting to customers to articulate how the Siemens EDA Xpedition tool suite will help them to maximize the performance of the leading-edge technologies in their designs. The candidate will need to point out gaps in the customer's design flow and articulate what is possible to increase the customer's design capability while driving efficiencies in their development flow to meet their Time-To-Market (TTM) goals with high quality.

Finally, the candidate must have strong experience in design and data management, along with strong programming and scripting skills.

Minimum Requirements:

  • BS degree with a strong engineering background from an accredited institution.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role.
  • Strong knowledge in HW & SW development.
  • Experience with Siemens Teamcenter and other PLMs (e.g., Windchill)
  • Knowledge of scripting languages.
  • Self-motivated and have the ability to work effectively.
  • Good written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, programming, and troubleshooting skills.
  • Strong knowledge of PLM methodology, tools, and design flow.
  • Strong knowledge of Data Management Design & library methodology, tools, and design flow.
  • Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States and will not require employer-sponsored work authorization, now or in the future, for employment in the United States.

contents:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.
 

The Team:​

Celonis Services is a strategic services organisation that focuses on the technical aspects of our customers' journeys, which includes Consulting Services, Academy and Customer Support. We are thought leaders with deep product, technical and domain expertise and focus on delivering Celonis implementations and driving product adoption for our customers. We achieve this by bringing together our best practices, delivery experience, award-winning enablement and support expertise.

The Role:

As a Senior Consultant, you lead our agile project teams to accelerate our customers’ digital transformation and drive Celonis’ international expansion. You identify our customers’ strategic priorities and lead your project team towards developing data-driven process insights using SQL and creating complex data models to ensure that customers receive maximum value. You will become an expert in all kinds of company processes such as Finance, Order Management, Procurement, Warehouse Management, Customer Service, Production, e-Commerce, Opportunity Management, Supply Chain Management. You always leverage the newest features and functionalities of the Celonis software, such as Process Analytics, Execution Apps, Process Automation, Real Time Data Ingestion, Task Mining and Machine Learning. You are fluent in German and English.

The work you’ll do:

  • Lead and drive the implementation process while delivering exceptionally high levels of service to ensure the optimal solution for our customers with our Celonis technology 
  • Transform the customer’s data using SQL to create the data model for your process analysis
  • Design and implement innovative analyses and execution apps and enrich them with Machine Learning algorithms (Python) or Task Mining to make the customer’s processes transparent and automated 
  • Analyse the data to identify process inefficiencies and understand the root causes to jointly suggest approaches to overcome them
  • Quantify the business and financial potential and present the most relevant KPIs to the management 
  • Translate business requirements into technical specifications
  • Conduct value creation workshops and align measures to improve process inefficiencies 
  • Set the foundation of the path to value to make the long-term customer success journey happen

The qualifications you need:

  • Min. 5 years working experience in IT-Consulting, Management Consulting, Process Improvement/Excellence or a similar area 
  • Proficiency with SQL or other programming languages (Python, R, Matlab...) and a strong interest in Big Data, Data Analytics, Data Mining, and Process Mining
  • Strong communication skills in German and English and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
  • You are very dedicated and visionary and want to actively drive the Celonis Process Mining and Execution technology forward 
  • Excellent analytical skills, well organized and known for being a quick learner
  • Successfully completed your studies in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Information-oriented Business Administration/ Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis enables customers to optimize their business processes. Powered by its leading process mining technology, Celonis provides a unique set of capabilities for business executives and users to continuously find improvement opportunities within and across processes, and execute targeted actions to rapidly enhance process performance. This optimization yields immediate cash impact, radically improves customer experience, and reduces carbon emissions. Celonis has thousands of implementations with global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen:

Digitalisierung verändert unsere Welt. Dies gilt auch für unsere Arbeit, dem Management von technischer Regelsetzung und Standardisierung im Unternehmen und die Arbeit in externen Gremien. Dies reicht von der Standardisierung digitaler Technologien wie Datenanalyse, Künstliche Intelligenz, IoT und Metaverse bis hin zu Smart Standards, die in Prozessen und Tools digital verfügbar sein werden. Unsere Aufgabe im Unternehmen ist es, diesen Wandel intern und extern zu gestalten.

Gestalten Sie gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft:

  • Sie entwickeln und implementieren eigenverantwortlich Standardisierungsstrategien für die Digitalisierung.
  • Sie haben den Überblick über neue, standardrelevante Technologien im Bereich der Digitalisierung.
  • Sie erarbeiten und pflegen Prozesse für die Standardisierungsarbeit und stimmen diese im Unternehmen ab.
  • Sie etablieren und betreuen firmeninterne Netzwerke von Experten der Standardisierung und technischen Regulierung. Dabei moderieren Sie die Meinungsbildung im Unternehmen zur Teilnahme an externen Standardisierungsprojekten.
  • Sie fördern den reibungslosen Informations- und Wissensaustausch innerhalb der internen Standardisierungs-Community.
  • Sie konzipieren die Nutzung digital bereitgestellter Standards für die maschinelle Verarbeitung in Prozessen und Tools des Unternehmens.
  • Sie beteiligen sich an internationalen, regionalen und nationalen Standardisierungsaktivitäten.
  • Sie überwachen und analysieren Regulierungen im Zusammenhang mit der Digitalisierung.

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen":

  • Grundlage bildet Ihr abgeschlossenes technischen Masterstudium sowie langjährige Berufserfahrung im Umfeld digitaler Technologien, Tools und Prozesse.
  • Sie besitzen sehr gute Kenntnisse zu internationalen Standards im Bereich der Digitalisierung.
  • Sie haben Erfahrung bei der digitalen Transformation von Unternehmensprozessen.
  • Sie haben Interesse an der Mitarbeit in Standardisierungsprojekten.
  • Sie haben bereits internationale Teams moderiert und fachlich geleitet.
  • Sie können sich fließend in Deutsch und Englisch ausdrücken.
  • Sie bringen die notwendige Reisebereitschaft mit.

Was wir Ihnen bieten:

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

https://new.siemens.com/ - wenn Sie mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchten.

FAQ - wenn Sie eine Frage zum Thema Bewerbung bei Siemens haben.

contents:
Who We Are

Tech evolves fast. We evolve faster.

We are engineers, architects, strategists, and leaders. We're innovators, inventors, futurists, and explorers. But we don't stop there.

Here at Outshift, we're drivers of real change.

We are Cisco's incubation engine. By thoughtfully applying innovation to what we build and how we build it, we outpace the competition. We always bring our customers along for the ride.

Put simply, we are here to deliver really awesome products that solve real problems-full speed ahead.

Learn more about us at:

https://outshift.com

https://eti.cisco.com/blog/introducing-outshift-by-cisco



Who You'll Work With

The team is a highly visible group which reports directly to Cisco's CEO. ET&I focuses on the next wave of innovation by anticipating, investing in, and incubating new technologies and business ventures. You will be part of the incubation team to develop new products and bring them to market in a startup-like environment.

What You'll Do

In this role, you'll work in an innovative team, apply and advance powerful AI technologies in products that make tangible business impacts, create the latest AI-powered user experiences on various platforms, work alongside a committed generative AI product management team, gain expertise in the most in-demand AI domains for the future, and contribute to shaping Cisco's AI strategies for the next decade.

The Impact You'll Make

If you want the challenge of fast-paced growth, the satisfaction of seeing your thoughtful ideas come to life, and the pride in helping grow a world-class AI team, this is the place for you.

Your Responsibilities Will Include

• Design and implement end-to-end generative AI driven products Collaborate with multi-functional teams to identify and implement the most effective generative AI solutions for various business use cases.

• Work closely with product managers to understand business requirements and develop appropriate solutions.

• Continuously monitor and improve the performance of existing generative AI models to enhance their effectiveness and efficiency.

• Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of AI and apply them to develop break-through solutions.

• Conduct research and develop innovative AI models using state-of-the-art techniques and tools Develop novel algorithms and techniques for text, image, video, and audio generation.

What You'll Bring To The Team (required)

• Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, statistics, or a related field.

• 5+ years of programming skills in Python or similar languages.

• 5+ years experience in developing and deploying AI models in real-world applications.

Preferred Skills

• Understanding and hands on experience in Large Language Models, Natural Language Processing, Image Processing and other generative AI techniques.

• Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or in a team.

• Comfortable and capable interacting with technologists as with business executives.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Please include a link to your profile in addition to your resume and cover letter.

Why Cisco

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we're "old" (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we're also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do -you can't put us in a box!

But "Digital Transformation" is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don't care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That's cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us.

We recognize that diverse teams make the strongest teams, and we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.

#LI-Remote

#LI-TA2

Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S.:

When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.

U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. Employees accrue up to 20 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their PTO. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. Employees are also able to purchase company stock through our Employee Stock Purchase Program.

Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco pays at the standard rate of 1% of incentive target for each 1% revenue attainment against the quota up to 100%. Once performance exceeds 100% quota attainment, incentive rates may increase up to five times the standard rate with no cap on incentive compensation. For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.
name: AI Engineer Developer - 1403500

contents:
We are accelerating and securing the energy transition sustainably and profitably.

Siemens Smart Infrastructure Grid Software enables grid operators as well as industry and infrastructure companies to accelerate and secure the energy transition in a sustainable and profitable way. We connect the physical and the digital world with an integrated OT and IT landscape along the entire value chain from planning through operations to maintenance - following its design principles of modularity, openness, user-centricity, interoperability and resilience.

The net zero challenge is driving a fundamental change in energy generation and consumption, with a seven-fold increase in DER installations projected by 2030. This groundbreaking transformation of the energy sector, characterized by a bi-directional power flow from intermittent renewable energy resources and new consumption patterns, results in enormous complexity.

Our bigger purpose? We believe that software is the key to turn these challenges into opportunities.

Are you passionate about creating new possibilities?

In our newly formed fast-growing business, we are looking for people with the skills and vision to build an energy-efficient and decarbonized future to support a more sustainable environment. Join our team, get inspired, and help us re-imagine the world!

Change the world of tomorrow with us.

Do you want to be part of this transformation and create new opportunities?

  • In your new role, you'll work on the solutions our customers need to protect and control tomorrow's energy grids. The digital transformation of the electric power system and the challenges of the energy transition require new thinking and breaking with paradigms
  • As a Senior Developer (f/m/d) you will develop drivers for our ground breaking and modular products and platforms
  • You are responsible for the implementation of low-level software on FPGA-based systems.
  • Additionally, you will build specifications and documentation for your software and develop tests and test automations
  • You work in agile and multi-functional teams
  • You fully chip in your previous experience and cooperate with other developers and engineers in the integration of embedded systems into higher abstraction levels

Your profile to change the world of tomorrow with us:
  • You have a master's degree in computer science, electrical engineering, physics or a comparable degree
  • Moreover, you can draw on many years of professional experience in driver and VHDL development
  • You are familiar with embedded systems with real-time requirements
  • Experiences with WindRiver VxWorks and Embedded Linux you can demonstrate
  • You are proficient in programming in C/C++ and have a good understanding of modern, professional software systems
  • With your structured, solution- and goal-oriented approach and working methodology you convince us
  • You have the confidence to take over the technical leadership in teams
  • Furthermore, you communicate authoritatively in German and English

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Broad range of wellbeing offerings
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

The opportunity to work with innovative and modern technologies - products and services in the field of electrification, automation and digitalization. A working atmosphere and culture based on trust, responsibility and respect.

We value the fact that our employees are individuals and have different preferences and needs. If we all thought the same way, we would never come up with anything new! That is why we recruit exceptional minds from all walks of life. We strive to promote our culture of diversity, equality and inclusion. We encourage applications from a diverse talent pool and are happy to provide opportunities to discuss flexibility and reasonable adjustment requirements. Many of our teams work effectively in a virtual environment, which gives us the opportunity to offer you more flexibility with your schedule.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ - if you need further information on the application process.

contents:
Siemens Digital Industries Software - Where today meets tomorrow.

Let's make the difference together!

Meet the team - Video

Siemens Digital Industries Software is an innovation leader in automation and digitalization. Closely, collaborating with partners and customers, we care about the digital transformation in the process and discrete industries. With our Digital Enterprise portfolio, we provide and encourage companies of all sizes with an end-to-end set of products, solutions and services to integrate and digitalize the entire value chain. Meaningful optimization for the specific needs of each industry, our outstanding portfolio supports customers to achieve greater efficiency and flexibility. We are constantly adding innovations to its portfolio to integrate ground-breaking future technologies. We have our global headquarters in Nuremberg, Germany, and have around 75,000 employees internationally.

We offer a role with responsibility, independence, and the possibility to contribute proactive. We foster a teamwork culture with room for individual development

Please visit https://www.siemens.com/plm

About the role

Join our team as "Program Manager - PCB/EDM Design Flow (m/f/d)" anywhere remotely in Europe.

Siemens Industry Software is a leader in electronic design automation (EDA). We enable companies to develop better electronic products faster and more cost-effectively. We are seeking a high-energy, experienced Program Manager.

The Program Manager is a key role within the Consulting Services team. The Program Manager is responsible for managing the execution of electronic design services projects. We are seeking a high energy leader, with a successful track record for building customer loyalty through transparent and consistent delivery.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Partner with account teams and technical leads to manage a successful sales campaign
  • Utilize services offering based input forms to capture Customer objectives and requirements
  • Work with assigned technical leads to scope project effort and capture project proposals
  • Develop Statement of Work (SOW) documents along with assigned technical lead
  • Developing and maintaining detailed project plans
  • Managing project execution based on project plans
  • Maintaining a log of agreements, open issues, and risks.
  • Manage project scope, and utilize change control logs to capture scope changes
  • Provide project status reports to Customer stakeholders
  • Financial Management of assigned services projects
  • Tracking and reporting project governance and performance metrics
  • Active management of Customer Relationships through execution best practices
  • Capture Customer success metrics and conduct surveys through the project lifecycle
  • Continually look for improvement opportunities in project delivery and metrics, to increase measurable results

Required skills and experience:

  • 8+ years of hands-on experience managing electronic design projects
  • Understanding of the PCB development process, Design and Library management, and New Product Introduction (NPI).
  • Understanding of High-Speed Design Analysis, tools, and methodologies.
  • Development of clear Statements of Work (SOW) for Deliverables, Time and Materials, and Subscription based projects
  • Strong understanding of skills and processes required to manage services projects
  • Deep understanding of project governance and project management methodologies (Waterfall and Agile)
  • Experience in project planning, risk management, and change management
  • Excellent customer focus, attitude and excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills with a sense of urgency
  • Excellent interpersonal, telephone and electronic communications skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (including Microsoft Project)
  • Consideration provided for experience in managing virtual, geographically, and culturally diverse teams
  • Consideration provided for Project Management Professional Certification

Working at Siemens Software

Why us?

Working at Siemens Software means flexibility - Choosing between working at home and the office at other times is the norm here. We offer great benefits and rewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At Siemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.

Siemens. Making real what matters

If you want to make a difference - make it with us!

contents:
Art der Anstellung: Befristet; Vollzeit

In die Praxis, fertig, los!

Unsere Praktikanten sitzen nicht auf der Ersatzbank: sie treiben und bewegen Projekte maßgeblich - und zwar von der ersten Minute an: Du bist Teil unseres Teams von mehr als 290.000 Mitarbeitern, das sich mit den wichtigsten Herausforderungen unserer Gesellschaft beschäftigt. Wie sieht die Welt der Elektrifizierung, Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in 20 Jahren aus? Lass es uns herausfinden! Zum Beispiel, indem du Bewährtes auf den Kopf stellst und nach besseren Lösungen suchst. Den Freiraum dafür bieten wir dir. Und außerdem alle Vorteile eines Unternehmens, das international bestens vernetzt ist. Worauf wartest du noch? Gestalte deine Zukunft mit uns!

name: Pflichtpraktikant*in (w/m/d): Einsatz von KI-Methoden in der Produktionssteuerung

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for an experienced Director who will be responsible for building and scaling a global best-in-class Treasury Operations function covering OTC operations, digital asset operations, and fiat operations. In this role, you will seek to actively identify and leverage synergies in operations processes to achieve standardization and automation across all operational aspects of Circle’s business.  This position plays a key strategic role in partnering with our Product, Engineering, and Customer Success teams to deliver operational solutions that help to create value for Circle’s customers. You will also lead Circle’s efforts to develop best in class processes and controls that exceed existing and future regulatory requirements. This is an opportunity to build a strategic function from the ground up.

What you'll work on: 

  • Building and scaling a best-in-class firmwide operations function to support 24/7 crypto and fiat flows.
  • Partnering closely with internal functions such as Product and Engineering to ensure that new products and services incorporate key operational features and functionality.
  • Developing and implementing a global foreign exchange strategy for crypto and fiat operations.
  • Providing operational expertise and support to the OTC market making business, including asset custody, reporting, margin operations, and financial risk management.
  • Facilitating new product launches and lines of business with robust operational process design and infrastructure.
  • Automating operational and reconciliation process flows to reduce error incidence and increase efficiencies.
  • Developing and establishing operational redundancy and resiliency to ensure continued operations and zero downtime.
  • Owning and continually improving fiat operations including funds flows, return/exception handling, critical metrics, and reporting. Developing automated reporting and reconciliation solutions across payments systems and platforms.
  • Building and maintaining operational controls, policies, standards and procedures for operational activities. 
  • Collaborating closely with internal partners to ensure end to end process flows are performed according to regulatory requirements and internal controls/processes as well as documenting evidence of compliance.
  • Testing and improving operations architecture resiliency to ensure continued operations across unplanned and unexpected events. 

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • 12+ years full time or internship experience in treasury, banking, payments industry or related field.
  • 5+ years of experience managing and leading teams. 
  • Prior experience building and scaling an operations function.
  • Strong work ethic and ability to excel in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities.
  • Inquisitiveness and interest in macroeconomics and business cycle modeling.
  • Interest in the cryptocurrency and web3 ecosystems and how they interact with the traditional finance industry.
  • Advanced excel/spreadsheet skills and/or basic computer programming capabilities (SQL, Python, AppScript, VBA, etc.)  
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to San Fransisco, CA. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $210,000 - $282,500

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

name: Director, Treasury Operations

contents:
We are looking for IT professionals who want to drive the increase of business value by partnering with the business.

As an IT partner you should become familiar with the targets, strategy, challenges, and priorities of the business and provide guidance and support to implement digital innovations. You will work with the business on strategic and innovation initiatives and process improvements via technology. The focus will be on Innovation and Data Analytics related topics in the scope of the overall Lead to Cash process.

Business scope is Digital Industries in various European countries. This position will report to the Digital Industries IT Partner organization. You will get the chance to work with an international team and on global topics.

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Drive innovation with technology and scout for opportunities to increase business value
  • Understand business requirements from different DI stakeholders in the area of data management and develop suitable data solutions
  • Ensure that data activities in Europe get well aligned with the global data strategy of Digital Industries
  • Shape data analytics activities for the Lead to Cash process across European countries
  • Proactively recommend IT approaches to business opportunities and challenges
  • Build and maintain strong, long-lasting stakeholder relationship with assigned customer
  • Understand business environment, identify objectives, and manage the portfolio of demands, projects and services
  • Plan, drive and manage demands and projects from beginning to end.
  • Support the implementation of global tools in alignment with HQ
  • Keep the management and employees informed on IT strategies, key priorities, initiatives and projects
  • Align and share best practices with IT and Digital Industries IT organizations


What do you need to join us?

  • Preferably bachelor's degree in engineering/IT/Computer Science/Business Intelligence/Data Science. Other may be considered.
  • 3-5 years of experience in IT (preferably in customer facing IT role)
  • Knowledge about Siemens Digital Industries Business setup and processes
  • Program / Project management / Agile Methodology skills
  • Data Analytics, Data Engineering and Data Architect skills
  • Experience in requirement analysis, business case proposals and solution design
  • Versed with emerging technology trends: Robotics automation, AI/ML and Analytics, BI Frontend technologies, Data warehouse technologies (e.g. Snowflake)
  • Should have handled at least 2 mid-size project or/and 1 project in Digital technologies using agile project management methodology

Behavioral Skills:

  • Customer and value oriented
  • Relationship management soft skills (Stakeholder mgmt., business /customer centricity, conflict management)
  • Effective communication skills at all levels of the business and IT organizations
  • Strong analysis and trouble shooting skills
  • Experience in working with leadership independently
  • Willingness to learn, grasp and adapt new skills
  • Willingness to travel
  • Enthusiastic and Experimental
  • Resilience

We have quite a lot to offer you:

  • employment in an international organization who is a world leader in its sector and has a stable market position
  • chance for professional development, possibilities to learn and gain new skills
  • wide range of responsibilities and the opportunity to make a real impact on business
  • good work atmosphere and organizational culture based on trust, responsibility and respect
  • work in an international environment, opportunity to collaborate with cross-region teams
  • attractive benefits package, including:
    • cafeteria benefits system (Multisport card, cinema / theater tickets / concerts, shopping)
    • private medical care
    • life insurance
    • employee pension scheme
    • additional paid days off
    • lunch card

Siemens is an Equal Opportunity Employer

If we all thought the same way, we would never create anything new. We know that by creating a diverse work environment, we have a real impact on the success of our company, so we encourage you to apply for Candidates from different backgrounds (with different experiences and approaches). By creating a friendly and open work environment, we take care to support the culture of diversity at every stage of our activities. All applicants will be assessed in terms of their competences, knowledge and skills.

We are waiting for you application!

Please send us your CV in English.

contents:
Art der Anstellung: Befristet

In die Praxis, fertig, los!

Unsere Praktikanten (w/m/d) sitzen nicht auf der Ersatzbank: sie treiben und bewegen Projekte maßgeblich - und zwar von der ersten Minute an: Du bist Teil unseres Teams von mehr als 370.000 Mitarbeitern, das sich mit den wichtigsten Herausforderungen unserer Gesellschaft beschäftigt. Wie sieht die Welt der Elektrifizierung, Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in 20 Jahren aus? Lass es uns herausfinden! Zum Beispiel, indem du Bewährtes auf den Kopf stellst und nach besseren Lösungen suchst. Den Freiraum dafür bieten wir dir. Und außerdem alle Vorteile eines Unternehmens, das international bestens vernetzt ist. Worauf wartest du noch? Gestalte deine Zukunft mit uns!

Manche nennen es Aufgaben. Wir "Auf-in-die-Zukunft"!

  • Unser Forschungsteam, mit Fokus auf Digital Manufacturing Technologies, ist in der gesamten Produktlebenszykluskette vertreten: von der Bauteile-Definition in 3D-CAD, über die Produktion und Produktionssteuerung, bis hin zur Qualitätskontrolle.
  • Gemeinsam mit unserem Team erarbeitest du neue Konzepte für die Automatisierung von Prozessen im CAD mittels Künstlicher Intelligenz.
  • Während deines Praktikums sammelst du Erfahrungen in diesem spannenden, zukunftsweisenden Entwicklungsfeld und kannst täglich deine Ideen einbringen.
  • Dein theoretisch erarbeitetes Wissen kannst du in Projekten an verschiedenen Siemensstandorten einbringen und erhältst so einen weitreichenden Einblick in unsere Industrie 4.0 Projekte.
  • Im Anschluss besteht die Möglichkeit der Betreuung deiner Abschlussarbeit.

Wir suchen keine Superhelden. Sondern super helle Köpfe.

  • Derzeit studierst du erfolgreich (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Elektrotechnik, Maschinenbau oder einen vergleichbaren Studiengang.
  • Du bringst Interesse an der Automatisierung von 3D-CAD-Prozessen mittels intelligenter Algorithmen mit.
  • Du besitzt praktische Erfahrungen mit Programmierung (z.B. Python oder C#) und konntest idealerweise bereits eigene Projekte mit Methoden der Künstlichen Intelligenz umsetzen.
  • Idealerweise besitzt du praktische Erfahrung im Umgang mit CAD-Systemen.
  • Zusätzlich zeichnet dich eine selbstständige und zuverlässige Arbeitsweise aus.
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab.

Die Praktikumsdauer orientiert sich nach der Studienordnung der jeweiligen Hochschule.

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a Treasury Integrations Manager to join the team owning the collaboration and cross-functional effort between Treasury and Product teams. This team is working to streamline processes associated with treasury infrastructure across our products including design, operational needs, and reporting. This position will play a key role in partnering with both Product, Engineering, and Treasury on business roadmap and key initiatives. 

What you'll work on:

  • Developing and documenting problem statements and business needs for Treasury with input from subject-matter experts.
  • Supporting and facilitating the success of integration projects resulting from business need and Product planning such as feature updates, banking integrations, Treasury Management Systems, etc. 
  • Defining and developing project plans from a Treasury perspective where applicable.
  • Reviewing the Product organization’s project plans, designs and features to evaluate impact on Treasury organization.
  • Collaborating with Product, SMEs and Treasury leads to review project(s) scope and requirements including reporting, tooling, or other needs.
  • Supporting roadmap planning efforts including evaluating time and resources needed from partners.
  • Partnering with Treasury team leads to understand their roles and responsibilities.
  • Developing and communicating project updates within the Treasury Organization.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • 7+ years of experience in consulting, financial services or payments industry required.
  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or related field. 
  • Able to think critically, understand complex topics/technologies, define complex problems by developing concise summarization of technical initiatives put out by the business or problems identified by SMEs.
  • Proven collaborative problem solving skills with the ability to think critically and ask thoughtful questions.
  • Startup mindset.
  • Highly organized and detail oriented.
  • Takes pride in working on projects to successful completion.
  • Excels in a highly collaborative environment with different stakeholders and SMEs.
  • Practical experience creating process documentation and reports.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate information into actionable insights as well as the ability to coordinate feedback under tight timelines.
  • Highly proficient technical writing capabilities.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Salt Lake City, UT. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $125,000 - $165,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.
