contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld - herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert

In Ihrer neuen Rolle sind Sie im Außendienst (Montage) - gegebenfalls mehrtägig - tätig und für die reibungslose Funktion der Systeme und Komponenten in Bahnverkehrsanlagen zuständig.

Ihr Einsatzort wird innerhalb des Bundeslandes Ihres Wohnortes sein.

Einstellort ist Braunschweig oder Berlin.

  • Nach einer fundierten Einarbeitung montieren, prüfen und setzen Sie Komponenten in Bahnverkehrsanlagen in Betrieb.
  • Die Montageeinsätze auf Baustellen erfolgen zumeist mehrtätig.
  • Von Ihrem Bauleiter erhalten Sie Ihren Arbeitsauftrag. Sie prüfen die Aufträge auf Vollständigkeit, und bereiten den Montageeinsatz vor (Material, Werkzeuge, Arbeitsablauf).
  • Sie montieren die elektrischen bzw. mechanischen Teile und schließen die Komponenten elektrisch an.
  • Danach führen Sie die Funktionsprüfung durch und identifizieren und beseitigen Fehler.
  • Zuletzt erstellen Sie die Dokumentation Ihrer Montagearbeiten (z. B. Prüfprotokolle).

Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat

  • Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene elektrotechnische Berufsausbildung z. B. als Mechatroniker (w/m/d), Elektroniker (w/m/d) oder Industrieelektriker (w/m/d).
  • Darüber hinaus überzeugen Sie mit einschlägiger Berufserfahrung in Wartung, Instandhaltung, Montage oder Service.
  • Es macht Ihnen Spaß, immer wieder neue Baustellen kennenzulernen. Deshalb sind Sie auch zu mehrtägigen auswärtigen Einsätzen bereit.
  • Sie besitzen eine gültige Fahrerlaubnis der Klasse B und sprechen fließend Deutsch.

So treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt - einfach und direkt

contents:
Mentor Graphics is now Siemens EDA

SIEMENS EDA is a global technology leader in electronic design automation software. Our tools enable companies around the world to develop new and highly innovative electronic products faster and more cost effectively. Our customers use our tools to push the boundaries of technology and physics in order to deliver better products in the increasingly complex world of chip, board and system design.



Position Overview

The Formal Verification Specialist AE will lead and drive Formal Verification technical engagements across the Americas customers. As a Specialist AE, you will be working with the FV ATMs (Account Technology Manager) and the regional FAEs to qualify, win, and deploy Formal products and apps in customer's verification flow. Primary focus will be on developing Formal expertise within the FAE teams, orchestrating and executing Formal campaigns in focus accounts, partnering with product marketing to develop roadmap and supporting sales collaterals to drive growth of Formal business

Responsibilities Include:

• Providing Formal Verification expertise to the FAE team

• Evangelizing Formal methodologies, tools and apps across the customer base

• Working with the Account teams, ATMs, and FAEs to develop strategy for driving adoption of Formal methodologies, tools, and apps

• Organize boot camp and other events to train the FAEs in Formal tools

• Work with Product Marketing and Product Engineering teams to develop roadmap and supporting collaterals to drive adoption of Formal

• Travel will be involved within the Americas region

Qualifications:

• Demonstrated expertise in working with Formal techniques

• Hands on experience in implementing Formal Verification flows and using those flows in ASIC/SOC designs

• Hands on experience in working with customers to drive adoption of Formal tools

• Strong written and verbal skills are required

• BSEE or equiv., 10+ years of experience in semiconductor design, verification, and testbench development and EDA Functional Verification experience desired

Ifyou reside in the Bay Area the total cash compensation range for this position is$133,500 to $253,500 with 20% of this being comprised of an annual incentive target. The actual compensation offered is based on the successful candidate's work location as well as additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education/training. Siemens offers avariety of health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding ourbenefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com. In addition, thisposition is eligible for time off in accordance with Company policies,including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exempt employees)or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

At Siemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

Thisrole will support the growth strategy, as we are undergoing a Transformationwhich will enable the company to scale & support next generation SaaSproducts & services. In alignment with the strategy, we are seeking amanager with strong experience in supporting our digital sales operations.

Youwill be a critical member in the sales operations team focused on working crossfunctionally to enable and streamline digital / ecommerce sales processes for ahigh-profile SaaS tech company. This role will supply to development anddeployment of new Configure, Price and Quote processes for the business unit

Responsibilities:

  • To continually improve the performance and efficiency (cost of operation) of our business systems; improve benefits of the system at the lowest achievable cost while delivering the required functionality
  • Leading brainstorming sessions, using market research for future products and/or product features that address our customers' growing needs
  • Help lead Digital Sales design & development projects through all phases of the product life cycle using Agile development principles
  • Planning & collaborating with product marketing on how to market and promote our products and the digital store
  • Working with our content team to ensure accurate training and development of support content
  • Develop detailed product design & requirements documentation
  • Use e-commerce platforms to enable a detailed customer experience for demos, purchase, activation, and renewals
  • Lead the go to market strategy through collaboration with our e-commerce channel manager, user experience guides and collaborators
  • Act as a product owner to identify, develop and evolve the product and technical requirements for the delivery and fulfillment of SaaS/PaaS products on our digital/e-commerce platforms.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education and Experience:

  • Very organized with a high attention to detail while keeping the big picture in mind
  • 4-6 years of product management experience in high-tech subscription or service-based products in a B2B environment, including use case and requirements definition
  • Functional knowledge of Software as a Service, E-commerce fundamentals, and user experience design, specifically including demos, free trials, subscriptions, and renewals
  • In depth experience evaluating and analyzing data and analytics, specifically for recurring, subscription-based revenue
  • Knowledge of Salesforce CRM and Commerce Cloud (required)
  • Knowledge of Salesforce Flow
  • Experience building cases, strategy, and alignment with product portfolios
  • Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently while collaborating with team members to achieve campaign timelines and goals
  • A good eye for UI/UX design.

Key Factors to Success:

  • Financial growth of the SaaS product revenue through digital sales
  • LeanData experience
  • Accurate case and market needs assessments for streamlined customer journey from purchase to use.

Thesalary range for this position is $113,900 to $205,000 and this role iseligible to earn incentive compensation. Siemens offers a varietyof health and wellness benefits to employees. contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a Treasury Integrations Manager to join the team owning the collaboration and cross-functional effort between Treasury and Product teams. This team is working to streamline processes associated with treasury infrastructure across our products including design, operational needs, and reporting. This position will play a key role in partnering with both Product, Engineering, and Treasury on business roadmap and key initiatives. 

What you'll work on:

  • Developing and documenting problem statements and business needs for Treasury with input from subject-matter experts.
  • Supporting and facilitating the success of integration projects resulting from business need and Product planning such as feature updates, banking integrations, Treasury Management Systems, etc. 
  • Defining and developing project plans from a Treasury perspective where applicable.
  • Reviewing the Product organization’s project plans, designs and features to evaluate impact on Treasury organization.
  • Collaborating with Product, SMEs and Treasury leads to review project(s) scope and requirements including reporting, tooling, or other needs.
  • Supporting roadmap planning efforts including evaluating time and resources needed from partners.
  • Partnering with Treasury team leads to understand their roles and responsibilities.
  • Developing and communicating project updates within the Treasury Organization.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • 7+ years of experience in consulting, financial services or payments industry required.
  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or related field. 
  • Able to think critically, understand complex topics/technologies, define complex problems by developing concise summarization of technical initiatives put out by the business or problems identified by SMEs.
  • Proven collaborative problem solving skills with the ability to think critically and ask thoughtful questions.
  • Startup mindset.
  • Highly organized and detail oriented.
  • Takes pride in working on projects to successful completion.
  • Excels in a highly collaborative environment with different stakeholders and SMEs.
  • Practical experience creating process documentation and reports.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate information into actionable insights as well as the ability to coordinate feedback under tight timelines.
  • Highly proficient technical writing capabilities.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Miami, FL. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $135,000 - $180,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

contents:
Wir verbessern Wohlbefinden und Arbeitsabläufe. Das ist Dein größter Beitrag.

Die Arbeitswelt befindet sich im digitalen kontinuierlichen Wandel. Die Gebäude, in denen wir Arbeiten, entwickeln sich weiter. Sie werden smart und nachhaltig. Die Erwartungen an einen ausgezeichneten innovativen Arbeitsplatz steigen. Mit Hilfe unserer Digital Building & Workplace Solutions ermöglichen wir es unseren Kunden, von den Chancen der Digitalisierung zu profitieren und eine Arbeitsumgebung zu schaffen, bei denen der Mensch im Mittelpunkt steht.

Indoor Navigation, Real Time Location Systems, Asset Tracking, Workplace Apps (Desk Booking und Room Booking) und auch intelligente Infrastrukturen sprechen dich an dann.

Verändere mit uns gemeinsam die Welt von morgen.

  • Du bist zentrale Ansprechperson für unser Portfolio mit Schwerpunkt Software as a Service (SaaS) im Bereich Digital Building & Workplace Solutions
  • Du promotest und standardisierst unser SaaS-Portfolio und definierst Marktpakete
  • Du bereitest und implementierst die Markteinführung des Portfolios in Deutschland und bist im Anschluss Dreh- und Angelpunkt bei Rückfragen zum Portfolio
  • Du kollaborierst mit internationalen Teams und sicherst dadurch die erfolgreiche Anpassung des Portfolios für den deutschen Markt
  • Du hast Freude eng mit Kunden zusammenzuarbeiten und unterstützt unser Sales & Customer Success Management Team bei wichtigen Kundengesprächen, internen Veranstaltungen oder auch externen Messen im deutschen Markt
  • Du bist die Ansprechperson für Expertise zu sinnvollen technischen Umsetzungsmöglichkeiten und identifizierst Kundenanforderung, um diese ins Portfolio Management einzubeziehen.
  • Du analysierst Markttrends und Mitbewerber und bewertest und priorisierst neue Ideen und erarbeitest Machbarkeitsanalysen
  • Im Rahmen von dedizierten Trainingseinheiten und Kundenprojekten vermittelst du sowohl Grundlagen wie auch Fachwissen im SaaS-Bereich von Digital Building & Workplace Solutions
  • Du gewährleistest die Erstellung und Verfügbarkeit von Dokumentation, Schulungen, Marketingmaterial und technischen Vorführungen

Dein Profil für zusammen "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Du verfügst über mehrjährige Erfahrung im Portfolio Management von Software as a Service (SaaS) Anwendungen, idealerweise im Smart Infrastructure oder Digital Buildings Umfeld
  • Du hast Expertise im Software-Kontext und bei Cloud Technologien, z. B. APIs, Konnektivität und UI/UX
  • Du überzeugst durch ein exzellentes Verständnis der unterschiedlichen IoT-Lösungen am Markt und kannst dein Wissen auf die verschiedenen Bedürfnisse unserer Kunden übertragen und Lösungskonzepte erstellen
  • Wir freuen uns zudem, wenn du die aktuellen Trends und Innovationen in der modernen Gebäudetechnik kennst, insbesondere im Bereich Smart Infrastructure
  • Du verstehst es, zuzuhören und hast ein feines Gespür für die möglichen Herausforderungen der Kunden
  • Außerdem bist du eine Persönlichkeit, die gerne in internationalen Teams und mit Technologie-Partnern zusammenarbeitet und mit ihren Kommunikationsfähigkeiten unsere Kunden begleitet und berät
  • Ein Masterabschluss zusammen mit sehr guten Deutsch- und Englischkenntnissen machen dein Profil komplett

Was wir bieten.

  • Coaching bei Deiner persönlichen und fachlichen Weiterentwicklung
  • Empowerment - als Basis für Deine Tätigkeit,
  • New Work Modus mit 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als zukünftiger, weltweiter Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Dich und Deine Familie ermöglichen
  • Aktienprogramme um Miteigentümer der Siemens AG zu werden
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass du willst: Bewirb dich!

JobID: 337099

Type of employment:Permanent/full-time

(Senior) Consultant in Cyber Security (f/m/d), Munich/hybrid

About Siemens Advanta Consulting

Siemens Advanta Consulting is the global management consultancy of oneof the world's most innovative engineering and technology companies. Wenavigate companies through their unique digitalizationjourney - from strategy to operations. Our mission is to transformour clients' future and develop today's talent into the business leaders andexperts of tomorrow.

Our cyber security team connects business and marketunderstanding and digital expertise, thus stretching beyond classicalconsulting. We combine securing cloud, IT and OT landscapes, applications, andnetwork segments with strong management consulting expertise. For ourcustomers, we unite all disciplines in the cyber security domain with anemphasis on strategic solutions.

What you'll be doing

• Inspireour clients with innovative technical solutions and play a central role inpiloting cyber security projects

• Developsolutions in cyber risk management, cyber security mechanisms in OT and IT, aswell as in the cloud, and verify of the effectiveness of security measures

• Performsecurity assessments for applications, physical infrastructure or networksegments and develop effective protection mechanisms

• Drivesolutions in identity and access management, zero trust architecture (ZTA),public key infrastructure (PKI), network architectures, security operation, orbusiness continuity and disaster recovery

• Establishcyber security teams and organizations for clients, prepare them for challengesand develop their business model and target operating model

• Adviseorganizations on regulatory compliance and link the cyber security strategy tointernal governance, policies and principles

• Developdata-driven solutions or conduct digital forensics investigations

• CombineAI solutions, analytics, natural language processing and image recognition withcyber security to explore new and innovative directions

• Gaininsights into data analytics projects and implement topics from neighboringfields such as machine learning, data analytics, and AI for enterprise andindustrial applications

• Communicatewith stakeholders at all levels - from top management to end users - and act asan interface between business functions and IT functions

• Bepart of the talent incubator within Siemens to acquire leadership and people-managementskills

What it takes

• An excellent university or college degree (master's/Ph.D.) in cyber security,computer science, data science or similar field

• As an entry-level Consultant: You have in-depth knowledge in at least one domain ofcyber security - practical experience in consulting or cyber security is a plus

• As anentry-level Senior Consultant: You have accumulated two to five years ofrelevant professional experience, either at a management consultancy, arenowned industrial company or a cyber security startup

• Experiencewith common IT security tools and processes

• Knowledgeof cloud technologies, virtualization or containerization (e.g., AWS, Azure,VMWare, Docker, etc.)

• Understandingof relevant standards, legislation or frameworks (e.g., BSI baseline protection,EU GDPR, ISO 27001, NIST Cybersecurity Framework) is a plus

• Relevantsecurity certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM, CISA, CySA+, CASP+, CompTIA, OSCP)or knowledge of IEC 62443 is advantageous

• Outstandinganalytical and conceptual skills and a strong entrepreneurial mindset

• Highlydeveloped communication skills in English

• A highlevel of passion, social competence and team spirit

You'd like to join our team, but are hesitatingbecause you don't check all the boxes? Please go ahead and apply anyway.

AtSiemens Advanta Consulting, we're an international and interdisciplinary teamconnecting diverse perspectives and experiences. We're convinced that diversityacross all dimensions builds the basis for shaping sustainable and value-addedsolutions that truly matter to our clients.

Unlock the digital future with us. Apply now.

As an equal-opportunity employer, we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

Applicant Privacy Notice

Looking to join a world-class blockchain development team? Ava Labs makes it simple to deploy high-performance solutions for Web3, led by innovations on Avalanche. The company was founded by Cornell computer scientists, who partnered with Wall Street veterans and early Web3 leaders to execute a promising vision for redefining the way people build permissionless networks. Ava Labs is redefining the way people create value with Web3. Join us as we empower people to easily and freely digitize all the world’s assets on one open, programmable blockchain platform

WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Fuzz and maintain existing Snow-Family Consensus Algorithms implemented in AvalancheGo
  • Implement enhancements to the Snow-Family Consensus Algorithms (ex: Snowman++): https://github.com/ava-labs/avalanchego/blob/master/vms/proposervm/README.md 
  • Produce testing frameworks to simulate the correctness and liveness of new consensus algorithms

WHAT MAKES YOU A GOOD FIT

  • You believe in a future where blockchain technologies make the world a more fair and free place for everyone.
  • You have the desire to work on open-source code and engage with the community. You wish to work together with other talented contributors instead of working alone.
  • You are a coder. You implement demos and proofs-of-concept before writing multi-page technical documents.
  • You create and find projects that provide value. You don’t need to wait for someone to tell you what to research or work on. We hire awesome engineers to tell us what we should build, not the other way around.
  • You have an obsession with code quality and performance. You ship code when it is ready, not as soon as it passes unit tests.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING

  • Demonstrated capability in subject area (open source code or published work is a bonus)
  • Rust, Golang, Java, or C++ programming experience

What about minimum experience or education?  If you are smart and talented, it doesn’t matter how you became smart and talented. What about location restrictions? We have a fully remote engineering team and look to hire the best wherever they are.

Salary Range: $158,400.00 - $208,200.00 (**This is not a guarantee of compensation or salary, a final offer amount may vary based on factors including but not limited to experience and geographic location.)

#LI-Remote #LI-DS1

WHY AVA LABS?

If you've ever thought about joining an early stage Web3 company - this is it! We're a global, world-class team of experts in computer science, economics, finance, marketing, and law with offices in New York City and Miami. We're highly passionate about Web3 and redefining the way people build and use finance and decentralized applications of all kinds. The company received early-stage funding from Andreessen Horowitz, Initialized Capital, and Polychain Capital, with angel investments from Balaji Srinivasan and Naval Ravikant. Join us and be a pioneer in a new technology that will have implications across a range of verticals such as finance, gaming, investing, collectibles, among many others.

Ava Labs is committed to diversity in the workplace and we’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not hire on basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state or federal law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.
name: Senior Consensus Engineer

contents:
Who we are

Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations™ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing — and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.

Working at Samsara means you’ll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team that’s shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, you’ll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term. 

Recent awards we’ve won include:

Great Place To Work Certified™ 2023

Best Place to Work by Built In 2023

Financial Times The Americas’ Fastest Growing Companies 2023

Deloitte Fast 500 Companies

IoT Analytics Company of the Year in 2022’s IoT Breakthrough Winners

We see a profound opportunity for data to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of operations, and hope you consider joining us on this exciting journey. 

Please provide your information below to keep in touch and hear more about our Engineering, Ops, & Product teams.

#LI-DNI

At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background, race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, etc. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

Accommodations

Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or click here if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.

Benefits

Full time employees receive an above market total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at our Benefits site to learn more.

Flexible Working 

At Samsara, we have adopted a flexible way of working, enabling teams and individuals to do their best work, regardless of where they’re based. We value in-person collaboration and know a change of scenery and quiet space to work is welcomed from time to time, but also appreciate that the world of work has changed. Our offices remain open for those who prefer to collaborate or work in-office, but we also encourage fully remote applicants. As most roles are not required to be in the office, we are able to hire remotely where Samsara has an established presence. If a role is required to be in a certain location and candidates do not have work authorization for that location, Samsara will conduct an immigration assessment. If the role is not required to be in a specific location, Samsara will move forward with the remote location that works best for the business. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individual’s ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company. 

 

Please note: Samsara does not accept agency resumes and is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Samsara employees.
name: Learn more about the Engineering, Ops & Product Teams

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld - herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert

  • Ihr Weg führt Sie in das zentrale Safety Assesssment Center, in dem wir bereits zugelassene Leit- und Sicherungstechnik (LST) für den Bahnverkehr abnehmen.
  • Als verantwortlicher Prüfsachverständiger (w/m/d) führen Sie eigenverantwortlich Abnahmen von Neu- und Umbauten im Bereich der LST-Stellwerkstechnik durch und erbringen auftragsbezogene Prüfleistungen für LST- Anlagen gemäß VV BAU-STE.
  • Dabei liegt Ihr Fokus bei Stellwerken und zugehörigen Systemen vorwiegend bei unserem Kunden Deutsche Bahn.
  • Sie stellen mit großer Sorgfalt sicher, dass unsere Anlagen plangerecht realisiert sind - hierbei arbeiten Ihnen Prüfassistenten zu.
  • Mit Ihrem Experten-Know-how beraten Sie die internen Auftraggeber (Vertrieb bzw. Entwicklung) zu Prüfthemen von Anlagen der Leit- und Sicherungstechnik und fungieren als wichtiger Schnittstellenpartner (w/m/d) für Betreiber und Aufsichtsbehörden während der durchzuführenden Abnahmeprüfungen.
  • Außerdem bewerten Sie die Prüfanmeldungen hinsichtlich Prüfumfang, Prüfzeitraum und des daraus resultierenden Ressourcenbedarfs und erstellen die Aufwandskalkulation.

Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat

  • Grundlage Ihres Erfolges bildet ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Master / Diplom) einer ingenieurwissenschaftlichen Fachrichtung.
  • Zudem überzeugen Sie mit langjähriger Berufserfahrung in der Eisenbahnsignaltechnik.
  • Im besten Fall sind Sie bereits heute schon als Prüfsachverständiger (w/m/d) tätig.
  • Auf jeden Fall bringen Sie die Anerkennung vom Eisenbahn-Bundesamt als Abnahmeprüfer (w/m/d) bzw. Prüfsachverständiger Abnahme (w/m/d) mit.
  • Ihre Einsätze erfolgen deutschlandweit mit Ihrem Firmenwagen - daher ist eine hohe Reisebereitschaft (Mittelwert 80 %) für Sie ebenso verständlich wie eine gültige Fahrerlaubnis der Klasse B.
  • Sie kommunizieren außerdem sicher auf Deutsch und möchten Ihren breiten Erfahrungsschatz zukünftig bei Siemens Mobility einbringen? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung.

contents:
About us:

We'reSiemens. Award winning; Ranked on Fortune 500; Digital Engineering globalleader. A collection of over 300,000 excellent minds who are all making thefuture. This position is within the Simcenter Presales group, part of ourDigital Industries Software Business Unit.

Position overview:

As anApplication Engineer Modeling & Simulation you will act as the technicallead in demonstrating and promoting our Simcenter Simulation Solutions(primarily Simcenter Prescan) to our customers in a diverse range of industries,with primary focus on sophisticated driver assistance systems (ADAS) andautonomous vehicles (AV).

Thisexciting opportunity promoting innovative simulation solutions whilemaintaining a high level of technical knowledge offers a diverse range of skilldevelopment, from understanding the first principles of ADAS and AV Systems, todeveloping customer focused presentations, demonstrations, proof of conceptsand account leadership skills in support of our larger sales strategies.

Inthis position you will collaborate with the presales manager of ourfast-growing Simcenter Simulation and Test Solutions and be part of a largeteam of technical specialists, application and support engineers within theSiemens Digital Industries Software organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Work alongside the sales team to apply technical skills in the Simcenter Prescan portfolio, using a combination of application and domain expertise
  • Develops proof of concept models, provide demonstrations, and drives benchmarks using the Siemens Simcenter Simulation and Test Solutions portfolio
  • Collaborates with the product development roadmap by evaluating current product functionality, identifying customer needs, analyzing competitive products, analyzing and relaying customer requirements to the Siemens Simcenter product development team
  • Train and mentor client technical leads and domain authorities in the application of primarily Simcenter Prescan
  • Conduct technical discussions with customers to collect and understand simulation requirements, propose solutions, and explain benefits of our Simcenter portfolio
  • Join a community of highly skilled individuals maintaining professional and technical knowledge to stay at the forefront of innovation.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Master of Science in Automotive, Aerospace, Mechanical Engineering or other engineering team. Bachelor of Science with several years of shown experience will also be considered
  • Knowledge and experience using CAE simulation software
  • Strong interpersonal skills, communication skills and problem solving capabilities. Ability to work as an individual contributor and as a team member
  • Ability to travel up to 25%

QualifiedApplicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States.Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization nowor in the future for employment in the United .

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Experience using World, Sensor and Vehicle Modeling tools: Simcenter Prescan, Matlab/Simulink, Simcenter Amesim, Simcenter Heeds, Polarion, IPG Carmaker, Applied Intuition, Carla, SUMO, dSpace Aurelion, Carsim/Trucksim,
  • Proficiency with C/C++ and/or Python
  • Understanding of the properties and technologies of the sensors used in automated and autonomous systems (Camera/Lidar/Radar/Ultrasonic/dGPS/V2X)
  • Knowledge of the ADAS/AD system design process, including the validation and verification (V&V) process, including SIL/MIL/HIL
  • Experience with 3D design tools (CAD / Blender / OBS Studio)
  • Experience in student projects such as SAE Formula Student, EcoCAR Mobility Challenge, GM AutoDrive Challenge, Indy Autonomous Challenge
  • Industry domain experience in one of the following areas: Automotive / Ground Vehicle, Aerospace / Defense, Industrial Machinery

Thetotal cash compensation range for this position is $76,300 to $152,600with 10% of this being comprised of an annual incentive target. Theactual compensation offered is based on the successful candidate's worklocation as well as additional factors, including job-related skills,experience, and relevant education/training. Siemens offers a variety of healthand wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be foundhere: www.benefitsquickstart.comIn addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

AtSiemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We needthe most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a transaction monitoring expert to join our Financial Crimes Compliance team. Reporting to the Global Head of Financial Crimes Compliance, the Director, Financial Crimes Transaction Monitoring, will be responsible for enhancing the design of our global AML/CTF transaction monitoring program, across both fiat and crypto. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working with financial intelligence, data and engineering teams to design transaction monitoring systems and scenarios, and is looking to find creative approaches to detect financial crimes in the fast-changing crypto ecosystem.

What you'll work on: 

  • Owning Circle’s global AML/CTF transaction monitoring program, including definition of scenarios, rules and thresholds.
  • Working closely with the Financial Intelligence Unit and Investigations Operations teams to enhance transaction monitoring based on SARs filed and broader ecosystem intelligence.
  • Partnering with Compliance Data & Technology, Product, and Engineering teams to implement enhancements to the transaction monitoring systems.
  • Driving scenario testing and tuning exercises to identify optimal transaction monitoring scenarios and thresholds.
  • Identifying opportunities to improve the overall efficacy of the transaction monitoring program, including but not limited to, use of machine learning and artificial intelligence to detect unusual activity.
  • Staying at the forefront of money laundering, terrorist financing and other financial crimes risks and typologies, and technologies to detect suspicious activity.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • A passion for harnessing the power of digital currency and blockchain technology and services built on top of it.
  • B.A./B.S. degree; quantitative or technical degree a plus.
  • 12+ years of relevant experience in AML/CTF, with a minimum of 5+ years developing transaction monitoring programs.
  • 5+ years of experience managing and leading teams. 
  • Deep knowledge of global financial crimes transaction monitoring programs and systems.
  • Deep understanding of cryptocurrency transactions, risks and typologies.
  • Experience with blockchain analytics and monitoring platforms, such as TRM Labs, Chainalysis or Elliptic.
  • An innovative and creative mind looking to suggest new solutions to old problems.
  • Proven experience working collaboratively and effectively with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders and internal teams.
  • Experience and comfort working in an ever changing industry and the flexibility to quickly react to changing demands.
  • CGSS, CAMS, or CFCS certification is a plus.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Phoenix, AZ. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $180,000 - $245,000

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Siemens Real Estate verantwortet das globale Siemens-Immobilienportfolio. Weltweit sind wir für 8,7 Millionen Quadratmeter Büro- und Produktionsflächen an rund 1.400 Standorten verantwortlich. Wir planen, bauen und gestalten. Wir bringen jahrzehntelange Erfahrung und modernstes technisches Know-how über den gesamten Lebenszyklus von Immobilien ein.

Was tragen Sie bei?

  • In Ihrer Funktion leiten Sie die Regional Asset Management Einheit Süd für das Siemens Mobility Geschäft. Dabei verantworten Sie das Produktions- und Büroportfolio an den Standorten München, Erlangen, Nürnberg und Ludwigshafen.
  • Für die Teammitglieder, derzeit 3 Property Manager (w/m/d), sind Sie erster Ansprechpartner (w/m/d) bei herausfordernden fachlichen Sachverhalten und leiten das Team fachlich und disziplinarisch.
  • In enger Abstimmung mit der Leitung der Region Deutschland setzen Sie Ziele für das Regional Asset Management und verantworten darüber hinaus die Einhaltung dieser.
  • Sie evaluieren die Performance Ihres Portfolios und leiten nachhaltige Optimierungsmaßnahmen ab. Ferner identifizieren Sie potenzielle operative Risiken und leiten ggf. die nötigen Gegenmaßnahmen ein.
  • Sie sind Ansprechpartner (w/m/d) für den Kunden und übernehmen die Mieterbetreuung sowie die Auswahl, Steuerung und Entwicklung von internen und externen Dienstleistern.
  • Ferner sind Sie für die Verhandlung, Erstellung und den Abschluss von Miet- und Dienstleistungsverträgen sowie für die Sicherstellung der vertraglich vereinbarten Leistungen verantwortlich.
  • Sie pflegen ein partnerschaftliches Netzwerk mit wichtigen Siemens-internen Kunden und tragen somit zu einem erfolgreichem Immobilienmanagement bei.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Der Grundstein Ihres beruflichen Erfolgs bildet ein abgeschlossenes technisches oder betriebswirtschaftliches Studium (Master) mit Schwerpunkt Immobilienwirtschaft.
  • Ferner überzeugen Sie uns mit Ihrer mehrjährigen umfassenden Berufserfahrung im Asset & Property Management sowie mit Ihren fundierten Kenntnissen des deutschen Immobilienmarkts.
  • Erfahrungen mit Produktionsimmobilien und immobilientechnisches Verständnis sind klare Pluspunkte.
  • Auf Ihre praxiserprobte Erfahrung im People Management und Stakeholder Management ist Verlass.
  • Außerdem bringen Sie Erfahrung in Verhandlungen für Immobiliengeschäfte mit.
  • Sie sind mit den neuesten technologischen Entwicklungen vertraut und haben die Fähigkeit, die erforderlichen Ableitungen für Siemens Real Estate zu treffen.
  • Ihr Profil wird durch verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse abgerundet. Diese Funktion erfordert zudem die Bereitschaft zu regelmäßigen Dienstreisen.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns haben Sie die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Sie zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein können. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Attraktive Konditionen

Sie erhalten ein attraktives Vergütungspaket einschließlich der Leistungen des Tarifvertrages (z.B. Zusatzentgelte und Urlaubsgeld) und weiteren Extras (z.B. betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Aktienprogramm).

Weiterentwicklung

Wir bieten Ihnen umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Mit unserem Learning Campus verfügen wir über einen Inhouse-Dienstleister mit einem vielfältigen On- und Offline-Angebot.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt?

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for:

You will design and help customers implement complex and business-critical solutions. As a member of the broader revenue team, you will play an integral role in executing our solution validation processes across the entire customer lifecycle. From discovery calls to post-sales support and implementation, you will partner with prospects and clients and guide them along their technical evaluation of Circle’s suite of products and services. You will help develop customized PoCs, solution diagrams, and implementation plans that articulate the value of Circle’s technology for our customers. You will heavily collaborate with our Product and Engineering teams to provide market feedback and analysis that will influence our product roadmap. Most importantly, you will set the foundation for long-term, successful customer relationships that rely on Circle’s technology and future innovation to grow their business.

What you'll work on:

  • Partnering with Circle’s sales executives and owning all technical & solution aspects of the prospective client engagement.
  • Explaining and demonstrating Circle's products to prospective clients and letting them understand options to meet desired requirements.
  • Leading technical discovery calls and capturing requirements.
  • Unlock deals by designing technical client solutions and collaborating across functions to navigate around potential product gaps.
  • Working with product and engineering teams to prioritize and close gaps.
  • Partnering with Circle’s customer success manager and owning all technical aspects of the client engagement post-sales.
  • Gathering market feedback and sharing with internal stakeholders, including product and engineering.
  • Building and maintaining an internal knowledge base with information about current and future products.
  • Consulting with internal and external stakeholders about Circle’s products and solutions.  

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle:

  • 5+ years experience as a Solutions Engineer, Sales Engineer, Pre-Sales Consultant, Product Manager, or similar at a B2B SaaS organization. 
  • You are exceptionally good at making complex things simple and structuring solutions in simple, clear, yet comprehensive terms.
  • Excellent communication, storytelling, and presentation skills at multiple levels of the organization.
  • You are a real generalist who cracks problems with creative solutions.
  • You are client-centric and seen as a reliable partner for sales, client success, and product executives.  
  • A successful track record of scoping, designing, and validating technical solutions for large enterprise organizations.
  • Hands-on in testing APIs, querying databases, drafting technical flow charts, and using developer tools.
  • Experience working with developers on implementing, integrating, and building SaaS-based products. 
  • Experience in managing a team is preferred. 
  • A strong interest in blockchain solutions and, preferably, a background in Fintech.
  • Finally, you have an entrepreneurial drive and enjoy moving at a fast pace, building strong cross-functional relationships, and helping clients thrive.
  • Occasional travel in South East Asia will be required. 
  • Proficiency in Google Suite, Slack, and Macbook preferred.
  • English speaking required, Mandarin speaking preferred.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

name: Senior Solutions Engineer, APAC

contents:
Are you brave enough to challenge yourself?

Siemens Digital Industries Software is not a manufacturing company. We are a growing software company - bringing the technologies and innovations of tomorrow to our customers today. With the resources and opportunities of a large corporation, your opportunities are endless. The role you apply for today, is only the first step in your Siemens journey.

Siemens EDA is one of the top tier suppliers in the Electronic Design Automation industry and part of Siemens DI. As a technology leader, the company offers innovative solutions for electronic hardware and software design.

The Application Engineer (AE) is the key connection between Siemens EDA and its customers. It's a dynamic & challenging role, requiring deep technical expertise and strong communication & business skills.

AEs work with businesses across all technology sectors, helping them to address their technical and business challenges by utilizing the latest verification solutions provided by Siemens EDA.

The AE role requires continuous development of knowledge & skills so provides an interesting & fulfilling career.

Join our team as Digital Functional Verification Application Engineer (f/m/d) and help us digitalize the future.

Our hybrid work model allows you to flexibly work from home, at customer sites or on-site at any of our 18 locations within Germany.

You will work as part of an account team to drive the growth of Siemens EDA functional verification business in Europe, through the successful adoption and expansion of Siemens EDA products and services.

How are you shaping the world of tomorrow? Challenging and future-oriented!

  • Drive business for Siemens EDA using hands-on technical expertise. This requires working directly with customers as a part of an account team.
  • Provide customer verification methodology guidance, verification tools training, and verification problem identification & resolution.
  • Build & maintain ongoing positive relationships with customers, understanding their technical needs & challenges.
  • Manage multiple customer issues concurrently, prioritizing activities as required. Work with design & verification engineers as well as their level managers.
  • Provide technical feedback to Siemens EDA product development teams relating to critical issues and recommended product enhancements.

How do you become part of our team? With a lot of drive and passion!

  • Education: MSEE (or equivalent) required with 3+ years' experience or BSEE (or equivalent) with 5+ years' experience in design & functional verification.
  • Experience should include:
    • A strong understanding of design and verification concepts in ASIC & FPGA flows is required.
    • Expert RTL coder including clock/reset and low power design & verification techniques.
    • Experienced with simulation and debug tools, with understanding of how to configure & optimize tools for maximum efficiency.
    • Verification planning and management experience with block level and top-level designs.
    • Expert in HDL coding (VHDL/Verilog/System Verilog) is mandatory; UVM, PSL/SVA expertise would be preferred.
    • Experience of a Functional Safety process & flow is a plus.
    • Experience with Linux and Windows environments including scripting languages.
    • Excellent presentation and communication skills are required.
    • Self-motivated and self-disciplined.
  • English mandatory / German preferable
  • Willingness to travel (domestically and internationally)

We offer an international environment with more than 140,000 customers around the world who already rely on our expertise in digitization. In Germany, more than 2,000 colleagues are involved in exciting and varied customer projects in the aerospace, automotive and transportation, consumer products and retail, electronics and semiconductors, energy and utilities, industrial machinery and heavy machinery, maritime, and medical devices and pharmaceuticals industries. With us, you will find a team-oriented work environment, comprehensive training options and attractive benefits. Through individual target agreements and diverse career models with specialization options, we offer you the opportunity to grow professionally and personally.

Are you an innovator? Then become part of our team!

If you would like to clarify initial questions with our recruiting team, please contact us by mail: careers-DACH.sisw@siemens.com

Contact person for this job posting is Jaclyn Krieger.

Want to learn more about Siemens Digital Industries Software before you apply?

Check out Mission / Vision and our software portfolio - or visit our homepage.

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities.

At Siemens, we believe people who've had real experiences dealing with being different will excel as leaders. Let's foster a culture of creativity and innovation. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

contents:
Siemens Digital Logistics (part of the Siemens Group) specializes in thedigitization of logistics processes. With its comprehensive portfolio ofsoftware and consulting solutions it is one of the leading IT service providersin the global supply chain management industry. It comprises of the AX4logistics platform as well as the Supply Chain Suite for the data-basedanalysis, simulation, and optimization of logistics processes. Siemens DigitalLogistics was established in 2018 as a result of a merger of three renownedcompanies: AXIT, LOCOM Consulting, and LOCOM Software.

We are a dynamic, medium-sized company where you'll have the opportunity towork in an international business setting with world-class clients. Employing atotal of 300 experts across several locations globally we pride ourselves onsafety as our main priority.

JavaScriptDeveloper (back-end) Regular

Your area of responsibility:

  • A JavaScript developer withina AX4 platform, providing the best quality solutions in a timely and efficientmanner
  • Working on providing customersolutions within an international team collaborating and liaising with consultants,architects, and project managers to ensure customer objectives are met
  • Accountable for the deliveryof individual project consulting and basic technical expertise at Siemens coreproduct portfolio throughout the project lifecycle (includingimplementation/installation, configuration, testing, deployment, productionsupport)
  • Actively participating inCountry Communities of Practice, leveraging technical and industry best practicesand providing experiences to support continual improvement

Requirements:

  • Knowledge of JavaScript (min 2years experience)
  • Solid knowledge of relationaldatabases and SQL
  • Ability to analyze technical specifications
  • Ability to implement solutionbased on business and technical documentation
  • Knowledge of programmingprinciples (clean code, algorithms, data structures)
  • General knowledge of Java,GIT, Webservice
  • Meticulous with attention todetail
  • Good command of the Englishlanguage at a min. B2 level (required daily)
  • A team player
  • Curious of current andupcoming technology and business-related developments

Niceto have:

  • Experience in handling UX/UI
  • Experience in collaboration, especially SCRUM
  • Knowledge of logistics and supply chains

Thisis what we offer:

  • Professional development opportunities in the following areas: programming,testing, design, business analysis, team, and project management and anopportunity to participate in large international projects
  • Working with creative people who are passionate about identifying solutionsand supporting each other
  • A positive and forward thinking team building environment
  • Sport card

contents:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow.

Domain Architect with in-depth knowledge of the purchase2pay (P2P) end2end process (architecture as well as business process know how). The P2P domain architect operates within the P2P process cluster in a large transformation program while closely collaborating with the enterprise architecture team.

The architect is taking primary responsibility for the development of the future end2end P2P technology landscapes, target architectures and roadmaps which feed into the transformation program as well as into the overall IT Strategy.

The P2P domain architect will provide a holistic view and take ownership of the purchase2pay architecture and supporting technologies, building consensus and agreements for the future direction. This requires working with senior leaders and delivery teams including solution architects, and other domain architects to ensure cohesive roadmap alignment and well considered purchasing decisions.

What part will you play?

  • You will be the lead in developing the strategic P2P architecture and defining system evolution plans
  • Moreover, you will work in tandem with the transformation program to gather and understand the key (business) strategies that are both in place and emerging, to ensure the target architecture and technical roadmap are effectively aligned to the future needs
  • Your responsibilities will also include producing high-quality documentation to enable decisions or drive delivery. Also ensuring all decision points, building blocks, design principles, design rationale, roadmaps and all interdependencies are understood, documented, and communicated across stakeholders, where appropriate
  • Act as a trusted advisor within the team and beyond to provide specialist knowledge (also outside in perspective) and technology expertise
  • You will also provide consultancy services to the transformation program by offering strategic guidance and ensuring architecture principles are adhered to

What you need to make real what matters.
  • You have successfully completed your master studies in Computer Science, Business Administration, Economics or similar with a focus on IT
  • In addition, you have many years of professional experience in the role of an IT solution architect in projects and large programs, preferably applying agile methodologies
  • Along with your purchase2pay process expertise you gained practical experience with the latest technologies (e.g. SAP S/4 products) and cloud solutions
  • You have profound conceptual and strategic capabilities in the analysis and development of large IT applications
  • You know and understand the IT market, digital business models and the corresponding IT contracts with external suppliers (e.g. SaaS, PaaS, IaaS)
  • You can work in teams, build up networks and communities. You have a proven track record in managing projects and stakeholders within senior management
  • Strong communication skills, a high level of commitment and strong goal orientation are your hallmarks
  • Business fluent English skills round off your profile, German is a plus

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.

Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Dich! Hilf uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Dir bieten ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Mach mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Deiner Karriere.

Verändere mit uns die Welt von morgen.

  • Unsere Leittechnikexpertinnen und -experten unterstützen unsere Kunden aus der Ferne und auch vor Ort. Dafür suchen wir motivierte und gut ausgebildete Persönlichkeiten.
  • Deine Aufgaben tragen zu einem wesentlichen Teil dazu bei die Versorgungssicherheit des Stromnetzes sicherzustellen und die Energiewende zu beschleunigen.
  • Du arbeitest in Umspannanlagen und Schalthäusern, um diese auf den neuesten Stand der Technik zu bringen. Cyber-Security erlebst Du dabei hautnah.
  • Du nimmst Verteilstationen zur Versorgung der Ladeinfrastruktur in Betrieb und verbindest diese mittels IoT in die Cloud.
  • Du konzipierst und entwickelst Visualisierungssysteme und nimmst diese in Industrie- und Energieversorgungsnetzen in Betrieb.
  • Du begleitest deine Kunden während der Projektphase und unterstützt unsere Projektleitung mit deinem Fachwissen. Die Projektierung und Parametrierung führst Du gemäß des Projektumfangs durch und übergibst die Anlage nach erfolgreicher Inbetriebnahme an deine Kunden.
  • Du arbeitest gerne kooperativ im Team und leistest als Teamplayerin oder Teamplayer einen wichtigen Teil zu unserem Erfolg.
  • Du hast bis hierhin gelesen und fragst dich, wie Du das alles lernen kannst? Zur Einarbeitung wird Dich eine Mentorin oder ein Mentor dabei unterstützen dein berufliches Netzwerk aufzubauen, dich in einem großen Konzern zurechtzufinden und Dir zudem die Tricks und Details unserer Produkte erklärt.

Dein Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Elektrotechnik oder eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung zum staatlich geprüften Elektrotechniker (m/w/d) in den Fachrichtungen Automatisierungs- und Informationstechnik. Zusätzlich bringst Du mehrjährige relevante Berufserfahrung mit.
  • Deine Kommunikationsfähigkeit, dein Kundenfokus, dein Selbstmanagement und deine offene Art ermöglichen es dir, sowohl allein als auch im Team zu arbeiten.
  • Deine Begeisterung für IT und dein Umgang mit gängigen Office-Tools zeichnen Dich aus.
  • Du hast Erfahrung im Einrichten von Netzwerken, außerdem sind Zertifikate und Verschlüsselung keine Fremdwörter für dich.
  • Du besitzt eine fortgeschrittene Erfahrung im Erstellen und Analysieren von Funktionsplänen.
  • Idealerweise kannst Du Erfahrung im Umgang mit Kommunikationsprotokollen wie IEC 61850, IEC 60870-5-104, IEC 60870-5-103, IEC 60870-5-101 oder Modbus RTU/TCP vorweisen.
  • Du besitzt ausgeprägte Analysefähigkeiten für die Störungssuche und Problemlösung.
  • Du verfügst über einen Führerschein Klasse B und Reisebereitschaft für Einsätze bei unseren Kunden in Bayern.
  • Du sprichst sehr gut Deutsch und hast gute Englischkenntnisse.

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Deine berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • Ein Arbeitsumfeld, in dem sich jeder mit seiner ganzen Persönlichkeit einbringen kann und sich als Teil von Siemens fühlt
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Dich und Deine Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Vielfältige Gesundheitsangebote
  • Attraktive Siemens Altersvorsorge
  • Attraktive Job Ticket Angebote und kostenfreie Nutzung von e-Ladesäulen (standortabhängig)
  • Barrierefreie Standorte
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Du willst: Bewirb Dich!

contents:
Art der Anstellung: Befristet; 15-20 h/Woche

In Richtung Zukunft? Bitte einsteigen.

Wie werden wir in Zukunft miteinander kommunizieren, Energien sinnvoll nutzen und uns fortbewegen? Wir können an den Antworten zusammenarbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorien in die Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken.

Als Werkstudent*in stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife jetzt die Chance und werde Teil unseres globalen Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Wir freuen uns, wenn du dein Talent bei uns einbringen willst!

Verändere mit uns die Welt von morgen.

Du arbeitest im Bereich der Mitarbeitenden-Kommunikation für GBS Deutschland und unterstützt uns bei folgenden Aufgaben:

  • Design, Konzept und Umsetzung unserer Webseiten (Office365 / SharePoint) Pflegen und Aktualisieren des GBS DE Sharepoints
  • Entwerfen, schreiben und gestalten von Texten für verschiedene Zielgruppen und Kanäle
  • Aufbereiten, Gestalten und Strukturieren von Textinhalten und PowerPoint Präsentationen
  • Pflegen der Social-Media-Kanäle (Office365 Viva Engage &LinkedIn, ggf. Whats App)
  • Erstellung von Content und Pflege des Digital Engagement Service
  • Recherche, Aufbereitung und Aktualisierung Unternehmenspräsentation in verschiedenen Formaten (Offline und Online)
  • Vor- und Nachbereitung von Meetings und Veranstaltungen
  • Produktion von Video-Content
  • Unterstützung bei Entwicklung und Umsetzung Kommunikationsplan (auch internationale Kommunikationsprojekte enthalten), da Teil eines globalen Netzwerkes
  • Analyse der Kommunikationsaktivitäten und Ableitung geeigneter Maßnahmen

Dein Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Du studierst erfolgreich Unternehmenskommunikation, Kommunikations- oder Medienwissenschaften, Kommunikationsmanagement, Public Relations und bist uns auch als Quereinsteiger mit entsprechendem Interesse willkommen
  • Erste praktische Erfahrungen durch ein Praktikum oder eine Ausbildung bzw. in einer Agentur, Redaktion oder Kommunikations-/Marketingabteilung eines Unternehmens etc. sind ein Plus
  • Ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit, Initiative, Planungs- und Organisationsgeschick sowie eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe und strukturiertes Arbeiten zeichnen dich aus
  • Im Umgang mit Office 365 Tools bist du fit, idealerweise hast du auch schon Erfahrung mit SharePoint und MS-Forms sowie MS-Teams gesammelt
  • Du arbeitest schnell und zuverlässig, hast ein Auge fürs Detail und ein Händchen für Gestaltung der Assets
  • Du hast Spaß daran, Artikel zu unterschiedlichen Themen und Anlässen zu schreiben
  • Design und Gestaltung sowie Erlernen bzw. Einsetzen neuer Anwendungen / Apps für unterschiedliche Kommunikationszwecke ist deine Stärke
  • Perfekte Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab

Wir wollen, dass du willst: Bewirb dich!

wenn du vor deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchtest.

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.



Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten?   • Sie sind sicher in der Anwendung von Constraining und im Einsatz von Rational ClearCase (User-Level, GUI und Kommandozeile)
  • Sie haben fundierte Kenntnisse in der digitalen Signalverarbeitung (Filterentwurf)
  • Sie haben Erfahrung als Projektmitarbeiterin/Teilprojektleiterin in unterschiedlichen Projekten gesammelt und waren aktiv in TotalCost Projekten involviert
  • Sie verfügen über erweiterte Kenntnisse in Design-to-cost Ansätzen während der Designphase
  • Zudem bringen Sie Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit mit international besetzten Entwicklungsteams mit
  • Sie überzeugen mit Ihrer ausgeprägten Team und Kommunikationsfähigkeit sowie mit ihrer Analyse- und Entscheidungsfähigkeit

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard

  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
