name: Performance Controller (f/m/d)

contents:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.
 

The Team:

The Data Pipeline team builds and operates a collection of microservices that ensure a reliable, performant and predictable data flow within our cloud product.

We design, build and maintain the ETL pipeline supporting massive amounts of data intake, services that orchestrate pipeline workers, as well as intuitive UIs and APIs to configure the Celonis Data Integration. Made of a group of highly skilled engineers, we are passionate about reliability and best-in-class resiliency patterns, linear scalability, low latency, and high availability.

The Role:
We are looking for a Staff Software Engineer to bring their experiences building large scale data pipelines and architecting Java based systems to join our Data Pipeline team.  

The work you’ll do:

  • Influence the technical vision of the Data Pipeline area
  • Lead the design and technical architecture of new distributed and asynchronous data ingestion systems
  • Hands-on software development of Java/Spring cloud services
  • Receive work in the form of objectives that regularly require innovation around original ideas
  • Translate targeted solutions into end-to-end architectural designs
  • Independently own multiple large problem spaces with significant ambiguity
  • Communicate well to all levels of product development and across the company
  • Proactively engage with internal and external peers and management to develop unprecedented solutions

Requirements

  • 10+ years of professional software engineering experience
  • 5+ years of experience architecting and building Java-based multi-cloud SaaS software
  • Experience building large scale data pipelines or ETL software
  • Streaming and batch data ingestion
  • Microservice and event-driven architecture
  • Distributed systems
  • Relational and transactional databases
  • Metric-based observability
  • Building CI/CD pipelines
  • Java, Spring Boot
  • PostgreSQL
  • Kafka, RabbitMQ
  • S3
  • Docker, Kubernetes

Preferred But Not Required

  • Tech Lead experience
  • Vertica
  • Operating services in both AWS and Azure
  • Datadog and SLO-based observability
  • GitHub Actions deployment pipeline

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis enables customers to optimize their business processes. Powered by its leading process mining technology, Celonis provides a unique set of capabilities for business executives and users to continuously find improvement opportunities within and across processes, and execute targeted actions to rapidly enhance process performance. This optimization yields immediate cash impact, radically improves customer experience, and reduces carbon emissions. Celonis has thousands of implementations with global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices

contents:
LeadFull-Stack Engineer - Remote US

Are youlooking for a company that empowers talent?

Here atSiemens, we take pride in enabling sustainable progress through technology. Wedo this through empowering customers by combining the real and digital worlds.Improving how we live, work, and move today and for the next generation!

From Day 1, you are empoweredto create an impact with your full potential and creativity to make adifference for tomorrow.

We truly have an inclusive anddiverse team culture where you can be yourself.

Our extensive global presence offers a diverserange of career opportunities across various industries, nations, and jobdomains, empowering our workforce to continuously enhance their skills and staycompetitive.

Create abetter tomorrow with us!

About EV Charging-As-A-Service(EV CaaS)

EV CaaSis redefining the EV charging market for private and public fleets, includingautonomous driving fleets, transit bus agencies, and municipal and privatefleets. We are building the next level of charging as a service, takingcomplete ownership and control of the charging infrastructure, the schedulingof the vehicles, the cloud platform, and the utility meter - in order toprovide the highest availability and resilience in the market. In this way, wewill accelerate the adoption of electric-powered fleets by optimizing thedelivery of power and making refueling seamless and efficient. By takingcontrol of the utility meter, and optimizing EV charge rate and vehicle processflow, EV CaaS provides the lowest cost of electric fueling possible.

In thisrole, you will be leading the effort to build and deliver innovative dataservices and solutions for our EV fleet management customers. You'll work witha team of talented engineers to build solutions that transform multiple datasources into actionable insights, driving operational efficiency and strategyfor our customers. From ideation to deployment, you'll be leading the effort toshape the future of EV fleet management.

As theLead Full-Stack Engineer, you will:

  • Be a technical leader, mentor, collaborator, and champion of best practices
  • Architect, design, develop, and deploy solutions to analyze and visualize real-time IoT datasets
  • Develop real-time dashboards and ad-hoc reports
  • Develop predictive monitoring of events (and notification) before they occur
  • Influence and make decisions on tools and the technology roadmap to meet our analytics and reporting requirements
  • Be a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional agile team
  • Participate in code reviews, retrospectives, and lunch-and-learns
  • Mentor junior developers to help them improve their coding practices
  • Investigate and resolve system functionality and performance issues

You willmake impact if you have the following qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related technical field
  • 5+ years of experience with Python development
  • 5+ years of experience working on data-driven web applications using SQL
  • Experience developing web applications using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS on multiple platforms, including mobile devices
  • Experience developing and deploying REST API's using Python or Java
  • Development experience using JavaScript frameworks, such as Angular
  • Design and development experience for use cases involving real-time dashboards and analytic reports
  • Significant experience in developing and optimizing SQL for complex queries
  • Web development experience in AWS, or other cloud platforms
  • Experience with CI/CD processes for building and deploying high-quality services
  • Ability to collaborate across multiple development teams to ensure performance, quality, and a positive user experience
  • Strong analytical, planning, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
  • Ability to analyze requirements and define the design and tools necessary to build maintainable solutions

PreferredQualifications:

  • 2+ years of team lead experience
  • Experience developing solutions with PySpark
  • Experience with Java development
  • Experience with Flask for building and deploying data API's
  • Experience visualizing complex time series data using JavaScript libraries, such as Chart.js, FusionCharts, Highcharts, D3.js, etc

Where permitted by applicable law, Siemens may require employees to befully vaccinated against COVID-19 based on job requirements, and in accordancewith accommodation based on legally protected reasons.

  • Competitive salary based onqualifications
  • Health, dental, and visionplans with options
  • Matching 401(k)
  • Competitive paid time offplan, holidays, and floating holidays
  • Paid parental leave
  • Wellness Program
  • Flexible Time off or Generouspaid - time off depending on position level

Click here to learn more about our extensive benefits offerings.

contents:
About us:

We'reSiemens. Award winning; Ranked on Fortune 500; Digital Engineering globalleader. A collection of over 300,000 excellent minds who are all making thefuture. This position is within the Simcenter Presales group, part of ourDigital Industries Software Business Unit.

Position overview:

As anApplication Engineer Modeling & Simulation you will act as the technicallead in demonstrating and promoting our Simcenter Simulation Solutions(primarily Simcenter Prescan) to our customers in a diverse range of industries,with primary focus on sophisticated driver assistance systems (ADAS) andautonomous vehicles (AV).

Thisexciting opportunity promoting innovative simulation solutions whilemaintaining a high level of technical knowledge offers a diverse range of skilldevelopment, from understanding the first principles of ADAS and AV Systems, todeveloping customer focused presentations, demonstrations, proof of conceptsand account leadership skills in support of our larger sales strategies.

Inthis position you will collaborate with the presales manager of ourfast-growing Simcenter Simulation and Test Solutions and be part of a largeteam of technical specialists, application and support engineers within theSiemens Digital Industries Software organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Work alongside the sales team to apply technical skills in the Simcenter Prescan portfolio, using a combination of application and domain expertise
  • Develops proof of concept models, provide demonstrations, and drives benchmarks using the Siemens Simcenter Simulation and Test Solutions portfolio
  • Collaborates with the product development roadmap by evaluating current product functionality, identifying customer needs, analyzing competitive products, analyzing and relaying customer requirements to the Siemens Simcenter product development team
  • Train and mentor client technical leads and domain authorities in the application of primarily Simcenter Prescan
  • Conduct technical discussions with customers to collect and understand simulation requirements, propose solutions, and explain benefits of our Simcenter portfolio
  • Join a community of highly skilled individuals maintaining professional and technical knowledge to stay at the forefront of innovation.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Master of Science in Automotive, Aerospace, Mechanical Engineering or other engineering team. Bachelor of Science with several years of shown experience will also be considered
  • Knowledge and experience using CAE simulation software
  • Strong interpersonal skills, communication skills and problem solving capabilities. Ability to work as an individual contributor and as a team member
  • Ability to travel up to 25%

QualifiedApplicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States.Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization nowor in the future for employment in the United .

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Experience using World, Sensor and Vehicle Modeling tools: Simcenter Prescan, Matlab/Simulink, Simcenter Amesim, Simcenter Heeds, Polarion, IPG Carmaker, Applied Intuition, Carla, SUMO, dSpace Aurelion, Carsim/Trucksim,
  • Proficiency with C/C++ and/or Python
  • Understanding of the properties and technologies of the sensors used in automated and autonomous systems (Camera/Lidar/Radar/Ultrasonic/dGPS/V2X)
  • Knowledge of the ADAS/AD system design process, including the validation and verification (V&V) process, including SIL/MIL/HIL
  • Experience with 3D design tools (CAD / Blender / OBS Studio)
  • Experience in student projects such as SAE Formula Student, EcoCAR Mobility Challenge, GM AutoDrive Challenge, Indy Autonomous Challenge
  • Industry domain experience in one of the following areas: Automotive / Ground Vehicle, Aerospace / Defense, Industrial Machinery

Thetotal cash compensation range for this position is $76,300 to $152,600with 10% of this being comprised of an annual incentive target. Theactual compensation offered is based on the successful candidate's worklocation as well as additional factors, including job-related skills,experience, and relevant education/training. Siemens offers a variety of healthand wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be foundhere: www.benefitsquickstart.comIn addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was tragen Sie bei?

Der Bereich "Control, Communication and Information" ist für die Erstellung der Fahrzeugsteuerung für die Siemens Lokomotiven zuständig. Für die Nachweisführung im Rahmen des europäischen Zulassungsprozesses elektrischer und dieselelektrischer Lokomotiven suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Verstärkung.

  • In Ihrer neuen Rolle sind Sie verantwortlich für die Erstellung von Zulassungsnachweisen in den Fachgebieten der Fahrzeugsteuerung, v.a. Zugbeeinflussungssysteme, Datenrekorder, Zugfunk und den Funktionen der Zugsteuerung.
  • Hierfür arbeiten Sie mit den Kollegen (w/m/d) des Systemengineerings an der Erstellung von Zulassungsnachweisen und am zugehörigen Erstellungsprozess.
  • Sie stellen sicher, dass die Nachweisführung vollständig und zeitgerecht erfolgt und stehen dazu im Austausch mit den internen wie externen Beteiligten.
  • Sie erweitern kontinuierlich Ihr Systemwissen und erlangen zunehmend eine funktional breite Sicht auf die Fahrzeugsteuerung unserer Lokomotiven.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes technisches Studium (z. B. Elektrotechnik, Maschinenbau, Mechatronik).
  • Des Weiteren konnten Sie bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich des Engineerings von Schienenfahrzeugen sammeln.
  • Idealerweise haben Sie bereits Erfahrungen im europäischen Zulassungsprozess von Schienenfahrzeugen gesammelt und Zulassungsvorhaben im Rahmen Ihrer Projekterfahrung bereits erfolgreich durchlaufen.
  • Vorteilhaft ist es, wenn Sie bereits die Verantwortung für zulassungsrelevante Funktionen in Entwicklung und Nachweis wahrgenommen haben
  • Sie haben Freude daran, komplexe Problemstellungen zu durchdringen und gemeinsam mit Kollegen (w/m/d) zu bearbeiten. Dazu agieren Sie verbindlich, sprechen fließend Deutsch und Englisch und bringen eine Europa-weite Reisebereitschaft (ca. 10 %) mit.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Inklusion & Vielfalt

Bei Siemens Mobility setzen wir uns gegen Ungerechtigkeit und Ungleichheit ein. Bei uns finden Sie ein Umfeld vor, in dem Sie Sie selbst sein können und dazugehören.

Purpose

Wir sind Pioniere der Mobilität. Bei uns tragen Sie in einem Zukunftsmarkt aktiv zu Verkehrswende und Klimaschutz bei, weil unsere Transportlösungen in aller Welt den CO2-Ausstoß verringern.

Weiterentwicklung

Wir bieten Ihnen umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Mit unserem Learning Campus verfügen wir über einen Inhouse-Dienstleister mit einem vielfältigen On- und Offline-Angebot.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt?

www.siemens.de/mobility

contents:
Who we are

Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations™ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing — and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.

Working at Samsara means you’ll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team that’s shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, you’ll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term. 

Recent awards we’ve won include:

Great Place To Work Certified™ 2023

Best Place to Work by Built In 2023

Financial Times The Americas’ Fastest Growing Companies 2023

Deloitte Fast 500 Companies

IoT Analytics Company of the Year in 2022’s IoT Breakthrough Winners

We see a profound opportunity for data to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of operations, and hope you consider joining us on this exciting journey. 

About the role:

As a Software Engineer at Samsara, you will design and develop features across a broad surface area with a tangible impact on active and future customers. You’ll tackle engineering challenges ranging from architecting data structures for mass data collection to presenting data analytics in intuitive and performant ways on web and mobile.

We use Golang for our backend, Typescript and React for our web client, GraphQL to fetch data from our backend, and React Native for our mobile app. Direct experience with these technologies is not required.

 

Click here to learn about what we value at Samsara. 

In this role, you may: 

  • A system that optimizes routes for fleets of vehicles that drive a million miles per week
  • Live rendering and animating thousands of vehicles concurrently on country-scale maps
  • Video processing and automatically classifying dangerous driving behavior with our internet-connected dashboard camera
  • Using driving quality metrics computed from vehicle sensor data to gamify the driver experience
  • Creating a driver messaging platform end to end, from bringing up services to staged mobile app rollouts

Please provide your information below to keep in touch and hear more about our Software Engineering team.

 

#LI-DNI

At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background, race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, etc. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

Accommodations

Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or click here if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.

Benefits

Full time employees receive an above market total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at our Benefits site to learn more.

Flexible Working 

At Samsara, we have adopted a flexible way of working, enabling teams and individuals to do their best work, regardless of where they’re based. We value in-person collaboration and know a change of scenery and quiet space to work is welcomed from time to time, but also appreciate that the world of work has changed. Our offices remain open for those who prefer to collaborate or work in-office, but we also encourage fully remote applicants. As most roles are not required to be in the office, we are able to hire remotely where Samsara has an established presence. If a role is required to be in a certain location and candidates do not have work authorization for that location, Samsara will conduct an immigration assessment. If the role is not required to be in a specific location, Samsara will move forward with the remote location that works best for the business. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individual’s ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company. 

 

Please note: Samsara does not accept agency resumes and is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Samsara employees.
name: Learn More About Software Engineering

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for:

In 2020, Circle unveiled Circle APIs: a set of solutions and smarter technology to help businesses accept payments in a more global, scalable and efficient alternative to traditional banking rails (spoiler: we’re using USD Coin under the hood). The Circle Security Team works to protect Circle; our customers, clients, and partners; and the financial markets upon which we rely.  As a member of this team, you’ll lead projects and be responsible for key deliverables of the security program while collaborating across Circle teams.  You will continue to learn and stay current in a fun and rapidly changing environment.

What you'll work on:

  • Conduct analysis of user behavior and organizational controls apparent in security logging.
  • Leverage analysis to build technical detections and controls.
  • Drive the development and implementation of automated data access checks across various platforms to help detect abuse and data exfiltration.
  • Perform security incident investigations using data analytics and computer forensics.
  • Build automation and detection models to support identification of anomalous activity to mitigate insider risk at scale.
  • Identify gaps in our infrastructure, and work with business partners to gain visibility through logging and detection.
  • Partner with stakeholders to contribute to Security Awareness messaging, training and exercises.
  • Drive deployment, development, and improvements in Security Incident and Event Management, Case Management, and Automation.
  • Provide security guidance to various organizations throughout the company.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle:

  • 5-7+ years experience in security operations such as technical investigations or Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) with a minimum of two years (can be overlapping) with a focus on Insider Threat.
  • Experience with technologies relevant to Insider Threat (SIEMs, DLP solutions, CASBs, UEBA tools, host forensic solutions).
  • Experience in data science and analytics solutions applicable to the insider threat detection space.
  • Exposure to programming, scripting and query languages such as Python, Golang, bash, SQL.
  • Strong ability to work collaboratively across teams during high-stress situations.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order of priorities on the fly.
  • Self-motivated and creative problem-solver able to work independently with minimal guidance.
  • Enthusiasm for scalable, reproducible security management. 
  • In-depth knowledge of the insider threat landscape.
  • Deep knowledge of SIEM, Case Management, EDR/ MDR, and DLP solutions.
  • Experience working in financial services or financial technology desired.
  • Experience working in an AWS environment preferred.
  • Experience communicating technical findings to a variety of stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in Google Suite, Slack and Apple MacOS preferred. 
  • Certifications such as CMU CERT ITPM/ ITVA, CCITP, CISM, CDPSE or similar will receive favorable consideration but are not required.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Phoenix, AZ. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $160,000 - $215,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

Thisrole will support the growth strategy, as we are undergoing a Transformationwhich will enable the company to scale & support next generation SaaSproducts & services. In alignment with the strategy, we are seeking amanager with strong experience in supporting our digital sales operations.

Youwill be a critical member in the sales operations team focused on working crossfunctionally to enable and streamline digital / ecommerce sales processes for ahigh-profile SaaS tech company. This role will supply to development anddeployment of new Configure, Price and Quote processes for the business unit

Responsibilities:

  • To continually improve the performance and efficiency (cost of operation) of our business systems; improve benefits of the system at the lowest achievable cost while delivering the required functionality
  • Leading brainstorming sessions, using market research for future products and/or product features that address our customers' growing needs
  • Help lead Digital Sales design & development projects through all phases of the product life cycle using Agile development principles
  • Planning & collaborating with product marketing on how to market and promote our products and the digital store
  • Working with our content team to ensure accurate training and development of support content
  • Develop detailed product design & requirements documentation
  • Use e-commerce platforms to enable a detailed customer experience for demos, purchase, activation, and renewals
  • Lead the go to market strategy through collaboration with our e-commerce channel manager, user experience guides and collaborators
  • Act as a product owner to identify, develop and evolve the product and technical requirements for the delivery and fulfillment of SaaS/PaaS products on our digital/e-commerce platforms.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education and Experience:

  • Very organized with a high attention to detail while keeping the big picture in mind
  • 4-6 years of product management experience in high-tech subscription or service-based products in a B2B environment, including use case and requirements definition
  • Functional knowledge of Software as a Service, E-commerce fundamentals, and user experience design, specifically including demos, free trials, subscriptions, and renewals
  • In depth experience evaluating and analyzing data and analytics, specifically for recurring, subscription-based revenue
  • Knowledge of Salesforce CRM and Commerce Cloud (required)
  • Knowledge of Salesforce Flow
  • Experience building cases, strategy, and alignment with product portfolios
  • Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently while collaborating with team members to achieve campaign timelines and goals
  • A good eye for UI/UX design.

Key Factors to Success:

  • Financial growth of the SaaS product revenue through digital sales
  • LeanData experience
  • Accurate case and market needs assessments for streamlined customer journey from purchase to use.

Thesalary range for this position is $113,900 to $205,000 and this role iseligible to earn incentive compensation. Siemens offers a varietyof health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefitscan be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com.In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was tragen Sie bei?

  • In Ihrer Funktion unterstützen Sie uns dabei, die digitale Transformation von Siemens Mobility weiter voranzutreiben - mit einer IT-Architektur, die eine schlanke und agile IT-Landschaft ermöglicht, um das Siemens-Geschäft effizient und effektiv zu unterstützen und es kontinuierlich mit neuen digitalen Produkten und Services zu bereichern.
  • Dabei leiten und managen Sie IT-Architektur-Workstreams strategischer IT- und Business-Projekte in enger Abstimmung mit Business-Architekten (w/m/d) und stellen die Integration in die gesamte Siemens Enterprise IT-Architekturlandschaft sicher.
  • Außerdem treiben Sie die Entwicklung von Zielarchitekturen zusammen mit Geschäfts- und IT-Stakeholdern voran und bereiten Entscheidungsvorlagen für Programmmanager und das Senior IT Management vor.
  • Darüber hinaus definieren Sie die Architektur-Frameworks und richten diese aus, um die Dokumentation und Implementierung der Zielarchitektur zu fördern.
  • Sie leiten virtuell ein Team von Solution Architects (w/m/d) in enger Abstimmung mit der Programmleitung und anderen Stakeholdern, um die Erreichung der Programmziele innerhalb des vorgegebenen Zeitplans, der Qualität und des Budgets zu unterstützen.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie verfügen über einen abgeschlossenen Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder vergleichbar.
  • Darüber hinaus verfügen Sie über langjährige Berufserfahrung in der Solution Architektur und bringen Projektmanagementerfahrung in strategischen Geschäfts- und IT-Programmen (z.B. Prozess-IT-Enabling, Applikationsrollout, Outsourcing) mit.
  • Sie sind erfahren in der Entwicklung von Programm-IT-Architekturen und Implementierungsmethoden mit Schwerpunkt auf Unternehmensanwendungs- und Plattformarchitekturen und Softwareauswahl.
  • Darüber hinaus bringen Sie Kenntnisse in mindestens einer der wichtigsten Geschäfts- und IT-Prioritäten des Unternehmens ein: Digital Sales, Internet of Things, Factory Digitalization, SAP S/4HANA ERP Transformation oder Digital Workplace
  • Außerdem haben Sie bereits Führungserfahrung (funktional) eines komplexen und interdisziplinären Teams sammeln können.
  • Fließende Englischkenntnisse sind unabdingbar für diese Funktion. Gute Deutschkenntnisse sind von Vorteil aber nicht notwendig.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns haben Sie die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Sie zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein können. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Purpose

contents:
Siemens Digital Industries Software - Where today meets tomorrow.

Let's make the difference together!

Video: MEET US in 2 Minutes!

Are you brave enough to challenge yourself?

Siemens Digital Industries (DI) is an innovation leader in automation and digitalization. Closely, collaborating with partners and customers, we care about the digital transformation in the process and discrete industries. With our Digital Enterprise portfolio, we provide and encourage companies of all sizes with an end-to-end set of products, solutions, and services to integrate and digitalize the entire value chain. Meaningful optimization for the specific needs of each industry, our outstanding portfolio supports customers to achieve greater efficiency and flexibility. We are constantly adding innovations to its portfolio to integrate groundbreaking future technologies. We have our global headquarters in Nuremberg, Germany, and have around 75,000 employees internationally.

Join our team as "C++ Software Development Engineer from our office in Katowice, Poland or any of our other Siemens locations within Poland. We consider a mix between working remotely from home and meet with the team in the office. As a C++ Software Development Engineer, you will participate in developing breakthrough Electronic Design Automation (EDA) software, which is used by our customers to create a variety of amazing products, from smartphones to satellite systems. We believe in Agile development, so our teams are expected to be self-sufficient and perform without the classical management structure. Furthermore, these teams foster culture that allows everyone to express their views, be a contributor, and grow as a professional.

You'll help our customers drive digital innovation by

  • Develop new competitive functionalities and support the existing software solutions
  • Develop integration of existing software solution with modern Web Application based on Cloud Services
  • Analyze requirements and contribute to all levels of the architecture
  • Create automated tests on a regular basis and then maintain them
  • Participate in software design and code reviews
  • Collaborate within and outside your Agile scrum team in an international environment
  • Grow professionally together with your teammates

What do you need to realize what matters?

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer/Software Engineering, Electronics, or a related discipline
  • C++ knowledge with significant experience in C++ programming
  • Analytical skills and an understanding of data structures and algorithms
  • Experience with object-oriented software design and design patterns
  • Ability to work independently or with a team in a dynamic environment
  • English language skills that enhance collaboration (verbal and written) with your foreign colleagues

What we offer?

  • Competitive salary and benefits (Lunch Subvention, Holiday Allowance, Medical Care, Sport Card, Life Insurance)
  • Extra paid vacation days
  • Work on implementations as product producer (Siemens) not a partner company
  • Interesting and challenging career path within Siemens
  • Support with relocation (candidate outside of Katowice)

We offer an international environment with more than 140,000 customers around the world who already rely on our expertise in digitization. We are involved in exciting and varied customer projects in the aerospace, automotive and transportation, consumer products and retail, electronics and semiconductors, energy and utilities, industrial machinery and heavy machinery, maritime, and medical devices and pharmaceuticals industries. With us, you will find a team-oriented work environment, comprehensive training options and attractive benefits. Through individual target agreements and diverse career models with specialization options, we offer you the opportunity to grow professionally and personally.

We are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. Be part of the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

We'd love to hear from you, so apply now on siemens.com!

We look forward to your application! Please use only our career platform, which you can access via "Apply now".

Come and learn more about Siemens Software: Mission / Vision and our software portfolio - or visit our homepage.

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities. At Siemens, we believe people who've had real experiences dealing with being different will excel as leaders. Let's foster a culture of creativity and innovation. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was trägst Du bei?

  • Als unser neuer Werkstudent (w/m/d) unterstützt Du bei internen und externen Kommunikationsaufgaben.
  • Du erhältst Einblicke in die Welt der Unternehmenskommunikation bei der Siemens Mobility GmbH für den Bereich der schlüsselfertigen Lösungen
  • Zudem unterstützt Du uns bei der Erstellung von Inter- und Intranet Seiten. Du hilfst uns, indem du Texte für interne und externe Kanäle, u.a. für unsere Social Media Auftritte schreibst.
  • Du planst und veröffentlichst Beiträge und arbeitest dafür mit verschiedenen Redaktions- und CMS-Systemen.
  • Außerdem greifst Du deinen Kollegen im operativen Tagesgeschäft unter die Arme.
  • Du unterstützt bei der Entwicklung von Konzepten für interne und externe Events und erstellst aussagekräftige Präsentationen.

Was bringst Du mit?

  • Du studierst Politik- oder Sozialwissenschaften, Journalismus, PR, Marketing, Kommunikation, BWL, Anglistik oder eine vergleichbare Studienrichtung.
  • Du hast bereits praktische Erfahrungen in einer vorherigen Tätigkeit gemacht.
  • Außerdem begeisterst Du dich für die Themen Kommunikation und Digitalisierung, und hast idealerweise Erfahrung im Verfassen von Artikeln für Print-, Onlinemedien sowie Social Media gesammelt.
  • Ferner sind erste Kenntnisse über Medien/Kanäle sowie deren Wirkung wünschenswert.
  • Selbstverständlich besitzt Du Kenntnisse im Umgang mit MS-Office.
  • Idealerweise besitzt Du Vorkenntnisse in der Bildbearbeitung oder Layout.
  • Du hast hervorragende Englischkenntnisse.

Was bieten wir Dir?

Inklusion & Vielfalt

Bei Siemens Mobility setzen wir uns gegen Ungerechtigkeit und Ungleichheit ein. Bei uns findest Du ein Umfeld vor, in dem Du Du selbst sein kannst und dazugehörst.

Purpose

Wir sind Pioniere der Mobilität. Bei uns trägst Du in einem Zukunftsmarkt aktiv zu Verkehrswende und Klimaschutz bei, weil unsere Transportlösungen in aller Welt den CO2-Ausstoß verringern.

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns hast Du die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Du zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein kannst. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie trittst Du mit uns in Kontakt?

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a transaction monitoring expert to join our Financial Crimes Compliance team. Reporting to the Global Head of Financial Crimes Compliance, the Director, Financial Crimes Transaction Monitoring, will be responsible for enhancing the design of our global AML/CTF transaction monitoring program, across both fiat and crypto. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working with financial intelligence, data and engineering teams to design transaction monitoring systems and scenarios, and is looking to find creative approaches to detect financial crimes in the fast-changing crypto ecosystem.

What you'll work on: 

  • Owning Circle’s global AML/CTF transaction monitoring program, including definition of scenarios, rules and thresholds.
  • Working closely with the Financial Intelligence Unit and Investigations Operations teams to enhance transaction monitoring based on SARs filed and broader ecosystem intelligence.
  • Partnering with Compliance Data & Technology, Product, and Engineering teams to implement enhancements to the transaction monitoring systems.
  • Driving scenario testing and tuning exercises to identify optimal transaction monitoring scenarios and thresholds.
  • Identifying opportunities to improve the overall efficacy of the transaction monitoring program, including but not limited to, use of machine learning and artificial intelligence to detect unusual activity.
  • Staying at the forefront of money laundering, terrorist financing and other financial crimes risks and typologies, and technologies to detect suspicious activity.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • A passion for harnessing the power of digital currency and blockchain technology and services built on top of it.
  • B.A./B.S. degree; quantitative or technical degree a plus.
  • 12+ years of relevant experience in AML/CTF, with a minimum of 5+ years developing transaction monitoring programs.
  • 5+ years of experience managing and leading teams. 
  • Deep knowledge of global financial crimes transaction monitoring programs and systems.
  • Deep understanding of cryptocurrency transactions, risks and typologies.
  • Experience with blockchain analytics and monitoring platforms, such as TRM Labs, Chainalysis or Elliptic.
  • An innovative and creative mind looking to suggest new solutions to old problems.
  • Proven experience working collaboratively and effectively with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders and internal teams.
  • Experience and comfort working in an ever changing industry and the flexibility to quickly react to changing demands.
  • CGSS, CAMS, or CFCS certification is a plus.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Austin, TX. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $185,000 - $260,000

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

contents:
If you really want to make a difference - make it with us

Siemens Mobility is a separately managed company of Siemens AG and has been a leading supplier in the field of mobility for over 160 years. Our core business includes rail vehicles, rail automation and electrification solutions, turnkey systems and related services. We have always been very innovative in making traveling faster, safer and more comfortable. Today, we need new solutions to new challenges such as climate change and rising populations worldwide. That's what drives us. That's why we shape mobility with passion, always being one step ahead. Through digitalization, we make infrastructures smart and create opportunities that get us from A to B sustainably and seamlessly. Our 38,200 employees are pioneers in mobility who help to keep the world moving.

What do you contribute?

  • In general you will help us to drive the digital transformation of Siemens Mobility - with an IT Architecture enabling a lean, agile, and resilient IT landscape to efficiently and effectively support Siemens business and its continuous enrichment with new digital products and services.
  • In doing so you will lead and manage IT architecture workstreams of strategic IT and business projects in close alignment with business architects and ensure integration into the overall Siemens enterprise IT architecture landscape.
  • Also, you will drive the development of target architectures together with business and IT stakeholders and will prepare decision papers for Program Manager and senior IT management.
  • Next to this, you will define and align the architecture frameworks to foster documentation and implementation of the target architecture.
  • You will lead a Team of Solution Architects (virtual) in close alignment with program leadership and other stakeholders to support achieving program goals within the given timeline, quality, and budget.

What do you bring along?

  • You hold a completed university degree in computer science, business informatics or comparable.
  • Next to this, you do have long-term experience within solution architecture and bring in project management experience in strategic business and IT programs (e.g., process IT enabling, application roll-out, outsourcing).
  • You are experienced in program IT architecture development and implementation methodologies with a focus on enterprise application and platform architectures and software selection.
  • In addition, you bring in knowledge in at least one of the key Corporate Business and IT priorities: Digital Sales, Internet of Things, Factory Digitalization, SAP S/4HANA ERP Transformation or Digital Workplace
  • Also, you do have leading experience (functional) in a complex and interdisciplinary team.
  • Fluent English language skills are mandatory.

What do we offer you?

Inclusion & Diversity

At Siemens Mobility, we're committed to fighting injustice and inequality. At our company, you will find an environment where you can be yourself and belong.

Career growth

We offer comprehensive training opportunities for your professional and personal development. With our Learning Campus, we have an in-house service provider with a wide range of online and offline training courses

Mobile working /Remote working

With us, you will have the opportunity to work hybrid. This means that you can work remotely to a considerable extent. We have officially regulated this through a company agreement.

You can find an overview of our benefits here.

How do you get in touch with us?

contents:
Wir schaffen Räume für die Arbeit von morgen. Sind Sie dabei?

Sie fragen sich, wie wir in Zukunft arbeiten werden? Und wie wir es schaffen, dass der Mensch hierbei im Mittelpunkt steht? Wie Gebäude zum Schlüssel für nachhaltiges Wachstum werden? Und wie man mit Datensammeln CO2 sparen kann? Dann kommen Sie zu uns, wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung! Siemens Real Estate verantwortet das globale Siemens-Immobilienportfolio. Weltweit sind wir für 8,7 Millionen Quadratmeter Büro- und Produktionsflächen an rund 1.400 Standorten verantwortlich. Wir planen, bauen und gestalten. Wir betreiben und bieten die dazugehörigen Services.

Unsere Leidenschaft gilt den Menschen, unserem Planeten und den unternehmerischen Anforderungen. Wir bringen jahrzehntelange Erfahrung und modernstes technisches Know-how über den gesamten Lebenszyklus von Immobilien ein. Wir bieten Lösungen für die Transformation unserer Arbeitswelt und für nachhaltiges Wachstum. Mit unserem Wissen beraten wir auch externe Unternehmen.

Verändern Sie mit uns die Welt von morgen.

Als Accounting Professional (w/m/d) bei Siemens Real Estate (SRE) übernehmen Sie folgende Aufgaben:

  • In Ihrer neuen Rolle sind Sie als Gesellschaftsbetreuer verantwortlich für die Monats-, Quartals- und Jahresabschlüsse (IFRS und HGB) und ermitteln die latenten Steuern (SiTax) für ausgewählte inländische SRE-Gesellschaften
  • Sie erstellen die erforderlichen Forecasts für diese Gesellschaften und hinterlegen diese im konzerninternen Berichterstattungssystem (ESPRIT)
  • Sie sind verantwortlich für die Erstellung der HGB-Abschlüsse ausgewählter Gesellschaften und erläutern diese der Geschäftsführung
  • Darüber hinaus unterstützen Sie uns bei der bilanziellen Würdigung von komplexen Geschäftsvorfällen und Verträgen (einschließlich Investitionsanträgen) nach IFRS und HGB und bearbeiten steuerliche Anfragen (insbesondere Umsatzsteuer)
  • Sie unterstützen uns bei der Umsetzung von gesellschaftsrechtlichen Vorgängen und Umstrukturierungen
  • Sie unterstützen die Optimierung von internen Arbeitsprozessen
  • Sie arbeiten eng mit internen und externen Stakeholdern zusammen (z.B. Shareholder-controlling (CF R 6), Wirtschaftsprüfer, Steuerberater) Ihre Tätigkeit schließt zudem die Mitarbeit in Projekten (bspw. die Implementierung neuer Accounting Standards und Unterstützung von M&A Aktivitäten) ein

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, idealerweise mit Fokus auf Finanzen, Rechnungslegung und/oder Steuern. Alternativ bringen Sie eine vergleichbare Ausbildung gepaart mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung mit
  • Sie haben erste praktische Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Rechnungswesen, Controlling, Wirtschaftsprüfung oder Steuern während Ihres Studiums oder Ausbildung gesammelt
  • Sie verfügen über fundiertes Wissen in IFRS und HGB
  • Sie sind vertraut im Umgang mit MS Office Produkten und haben idealerweise Grundkenntnisse in SAP / Buchhaltungssystemen
  • Sie haben eine analytische und kundenorientierte Arbeitsweise, verfügen über eine ausgeprägte "Hands-on" Mentalität und bringen eine hohe Einsatzbereitschaft und Belastbarkeit mit
  • Ihre Kommunikationsstärke können Sie auf Deutsch und auch auf Englisch demonstrieren

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.

Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten, ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Machen Sie mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer Karriere.

Verändern Sie zusammen mit uns die schöne Welt von morgen.

  • Sie sind Teil unseres ca. 120-köpfigen Service-Teams in einem langfristigen Kundenprojekt in München
  • Zu Ihren Aufgaben gehören die Instandhaltung und Störbeseitigung an CNC-, SPS-gesteuerten Produktionsanlagen und zugehöriger Peripherie
  • Sie analysieren verlässlich Fehlerursachen, sorgen für eine nachhaltige Fehlerbehebung und erarbeiten wirksame Abstellmaßnahmen
  • Ihre Arbeitsaufträge erhalten und dokumentieren Sie in SAP PM
  • Sie sind im unmittelbaren Austausch mit dem Endkunden und führen servicebezogene Beratungsgespräche durch

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung, wenn Sie eine abgeschlossene elektrotechnische Ausbildung z.B. Mechatroniker (w/m/d) oder Elektroniker (w/m/d) haben
  • Sie haben mindestens einjährige, einschlägige Erfahrung im Service oder der Instandhaltung von Werkzeugmaschinen oder Produktionsanlagen
  • Sie besitzen erste Kenntnisse über CNC-/ SPS-Steuerungen (Sinumerik/Simatic)
  • Darüber hinaus punkten Sie mit Ihrer zuverlässigen Arbeitsweise, einem kundenfreundlichen Auftreten, zukunftsorientierter Denkweise sowie mit einer engen kooperativen Zusammenarbeit im Team
  • Eine generelle Bereitschaft zur Schicht,- Samstagsarbeit und Rufbereitschaft sowie sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden Ihr eigenes Profil ab

Was wir bieten.

  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

contents:
Rethinking IT.

We have lots of ideas about how to successfully drive digitalization in companies. For example, with open cloud platforms, highly developed security systems, and clever tools for developers. What is your role in this? Move the world from behind the scenes with your IT expertise and passion for game-changing information technology. Rethink IT and steer projects in completely new directions. Be bold when others would have given up. In short, play a key role in driving digitalization forward! We'll provide the resources you need to do this. We also offer a variety of opportunities to get involved and to be part of a global network of IT experts and professionals. Welcome to our world!

We make real what matters. This is your role.

You drive cost efficient and entrepreneurially minded decision-making and improve the productivity of the various stakeholders like Service-Managers in close collaboration with the IT Finance community.

Key areas of responsibility:

  • You take over all tasks related to the commercial management of our public cloud providers such as:
    • Definition and maintenance of Siemens-internal value flows
    • Budget and regular Forecast preparation including related management reporting
    • Invoice-Management for public cloud providers
    • Single point of contact for stakeholders (internal customers, taxes, accounting)
    • Commercial optimization of cloud usage
Furthermore, you would engage in following activities:

  • You drive sustainable process automation and optimization of IT Controlling considering future challenges to decrease manual routine tasks amongst the community
  • You foster strategic decision making by analyzing and connecting financial and non-financial data from different systems /across units

Use your skills to move the world forward.

  • You hold a university degree in business administration or equivalent
  • You have at least 5 years of expertise in Controlling (accounting, closing, tax) and are used to think end-to-end
  • Your tool-literacy (Office/SAP/BI-Solutions) is solid with no mention
  • (Ideally) you have gained professional experiences in the finance area within IT
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager to drive change
  • You like to work in teams and communicate effectively with relevant stakeholders
  • You have an affinity to technology and IT and you are eager to learn things on the fly
  • You are fluent in German and English
  • And last not least you are solution-oriented with strong common sense

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

We've got quite a lot to offer. How about you?

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

name: Performance Controller (f/m/d)

contents:
Accelerate your career. Grow & Develop with us!

Controlling and Finance Assurance (CF A) helps Siemens to achieve their goals by providing objective, factual and independent assurance to the Siemens Managing Board and Audit Committee. As a business partner to Siemens executive management, we leverage our expertise in a wide range of topics in order to create an impact that drives change with improved financial results. We offer a vibrant, diverse and inclusive environment which ensures a variety of perspectives and enables big picture thinking.

CF A is a unique Global Leadership Development Program inside Siemens, stretched over a period of three to five years. We offer continuous career coaching and mentoring throughout the program, all whilst working with top Siemens business leaders on multiple high-profile projects around the world. This is your chance to build your network within the company, develop your operational experience and prepare yourself for a leading role if you wish.

The Cybersecurity team of the Cybersecurity and Applications Practice provides core assurance over the cybersecurity health of the company which includes IT, OT and R&D infrastructures, product security, and cloud applications. We are on the lookout for people with a great skillset, an international mindset, and new ideas. People who understand Siemens businesses and how Cybersecurity helps enable and increase market value. Are you one of them?

To discover more about CF A have a look at www.siemens.com/cfa.

What part will you play?

  • Lead our diverse and international ethical hacking team and manage red teaming activities as part of the cyber security audit engagements
  • Lead your team by example, be a career coach and mentor - Live the CF A People Strategy
  • Evaluate cybersecurity threats that could impact Siemens arising from various threat actors, vulnerabilities, and weak points. Design relevant attack scenarios to identify such threats within Siemens' IT/OT infrastructure and execute appropriate red teaming activities
  • Lead and conduct multiple Cyber Security assessments on Siemens IT systems, products, services, factories, and software development centers. Effectively communicate highlights and technical findings to management and help them take effective actions.
  • Fully own the client relationship to senior management during red teaming engagements.
  • Work closely with security experts from multiple industries to improve their solutions by tackling the root cause of the issues and find innovative solutions to modern challenges.
  • Represent Siemens in relevant Cybersecurity conferences - as a participant or as a speaker.

What you need to make real what matters.

  • Academic history with a degree in IT, Computer Science or other related fields; certifications such as GIAC GPEN, GXPN, OSCP, OSCE, are a plus.
  • Good scripting and programming skills. Experience with languages like Bash, Python, Ruby, Powershell, and C++ / C#.
  • At least 10+ years of professional experience within Siemens or a related industry, penetration testing and / or development of industrial IT/OT services and solutions with a proven record of continuous career development.
  • Demonstrated affinity to learn about the latest trends in cybersecurity and keep up to date in a continuously challenging environment.
  • You have experience with one or more of the following aspects: application and software security, blue / red teaming, industrial security controls, network security, IT operations, penetration testing, etc.
  • Demonstrated experience in capture the flag (CTFs) events, bug hunting or vulnerability research (CVEs) is a plus.
  • You have an international mindset and are open to travelling and working in a diverse and international team.

What we offer:

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a future global standard
  • An environment where everyone can bring their whole self to work and feel a sense of belonging
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Pension plan to ensure financial security
  • 50+ learning hours per year for both personal and professional growth

contents:
Are you a highly motivated individual with a passion for the latest engineering and manufacturing software trends including Edge Computing, IOT, and cloud-based solutions? Do you have the ability to guide customers through sophisticated digital transformations? Are you looking for a fast-paced high growth career? If so, please apply for this outstanding opportunity at Siemens Digital Industry Software!

Our Customers ...

Many companies are partnering with Siemens to build their Comprehensive Digital Twin; the virtual representation that give them the capability of linking design and virtual simulations, to physical engineering and manufacturing. These companies are in the Aerospace, Automotive, Consumer Products & Packaging, Electronics, Medical Device, and Semiconductor industries where this technology gives them a competitive advantage. These companies are selecting Siemens because we have a Comprehensive Digital Twin, available today - from concept through manufacturing into field maintenance.

Your Challenge ...

Can you be a creative and independent domain specialist?

Become a member of our Customer Outcomes team as a PLM Junior Consultant. As a PLM Junior Consultant you will work closely with customers to provide software solutions to help them realize their Comprehensive Digital Twin. Helping our customers blur the boundaries between industry domains by integrating the virtual and physical, hardware and software, design, and manufacturing worlds.

Who we are looking for ...

A strong technical contributor that will implement our software solutions for our customers. As part of our team, you will work efficiently with Consultants, Solution Architects, Project Managers, and other internal and external interfaces such as Industry and Product Development teams to ensure that the customer succeeds in their objectives. Be responsible for providing specialist product expertise by consulting, advising, recommending, designing, and where appropriate deploying, specific technical solutions for the Siemens Digital industries Software solution to be delivered optimally and provide value to the customer. Support project/program management activities to control scope, cost, schedule, and quality and in line with program and project processes and messaging, interact with the customer to support the management of customer expectations and support customer adoption.
We need you to already have:

  • Graduated college with a degree in engineering, computer science, etc.
  • One to three years' experience with Teamcenter or other enterprise PLM, ERP or MES systems
  • Experience with the phases of software implementation projects including installation, configuration, testing, deployment, and postproduction support.
  • Experience with Software Development Lifecycles (SDLC) best practices, standards, and testing.
  • Familiarity with programming languages and tools such as JAVA, C++, C#, SQL, JavaScript or JS Frameworks
  • General knowledge with Microsoft Windows administration
  • Familiarity with Windows and/or Linux operating system, Amazon Web Services and/or Microsoft Azure, server/client communications, VPN and reverse proxies and TLS (HTTP vs HTTPS), Docker or Kubernetes, Web Servers (IIS, JBOSS, Tomcat, WebLogic), databases (Oracle, SQL, Aurora, RDS)
Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.

About Us ...

Siemens is a large international corporation with diverse interests. This includes a digital industries software division that is focused on external sales, maintenance, and deployment of software that enables the fourth industrial revolution (Industry 4.0). Our customers are therefore progressive problem solvers, pursuing change that will make them market leaders.

Our products and services are based on Microsoft technologies, which scale for both small or medium companies, and large multi-national corporations. This position is with the Siemens Customer Outcomes team that architects and deploys comprehensive solutions in North America; other teams in South America, Europe, and Asia provide local services for global solutions.

Join Us ...

See the Digital Twin in action; watch, as virtual representations become real products!
Links:
Siemens Digital Industries Software

[Unlimited Tomorrow] A young innovator makes prosthetics personalized
The New Era of Smart Innovation

contents:
Siemens EDA is a global technology leader in Electronic Design Automation software. Our software tools enable companies around the world to develop new and highly innovative electronic products faster and more cost-effectively. Our customers use our tools to push the boundaries of technology and physics in order to deliver better products in the increasingly complex world of chip, board and system design.

We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-focused engineer to be both the technical driver of pre-sales customer engagements and providerof post-sales technical assistance for our Tessent Embedded Analyticsproducts.

The successful candidate will work closelywith the sales team to help identify and understand customers' technical needs& challenges, provide technical presentations and demonstrations as well assupporting product evaluations.

The role enables the development of closerelationships with customers through post-sales support and program managementand requires regular interaction with the internal product management team to influenceproduct development and evolution.

~20% Travel will be required (post Covid-19restrictions).

Responsibilities

  • Assist Account Managers to determinesales execution strategy based on customers' technical requirements
  • Provide technical presentationsand demonstrations to convey the benefits and solutions addressed by thetechnology to prospective customers
  • Drive technical customer engagements,including creating, supporting and winning of evaluations leading to businesswin
  • Provide technical leadership andprogram management for assigned accounts
  • Provide technical support tocustomers in both pre-sales and post-sales situations including technicalproblem resolution and training
  • Develop close relationshipswith customers through as many levels as possible, to be able to assess theirtechnical and business requirements
  • Work with the Product Managementteam to articulate your customers' technical needs and requirements
  • Other reasonable actions asrequired by management or leadership.

RequiredSkills & Experience

  • BS degree (or equivalent) inElectrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field
  • 3+ years of experience as anApplications Engineer or related field
  • 5+ years of experience ofdigital IC/FPGA design from RTL to gate-level (Verilog/VHDL)
  • Good understanding of SoC architecturesand methodologies
  • Effective presentation skills
  • Great communication skills,both written and verbal
  • Ability to communicate at alllevels, both internally and with the customer
  • Self-starter with initiativeand capable of managing their own work
  • Good organizational skills andability to work on multiple concurrent tasks
  • Good problem solving skills

Desirable Additionalskills (not mandatory)

  • Python coding
  • Experience with debuggingembedded software with
  • Experience in (andunderstanding of) verification techniques and methodologies
  • Knowledge of modern CPU architectures
  • Familiarity with the salescycle
  • Remote Ok

The actual compensation offered is based on the successful candidate's work location as well as additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education/training.
