contents:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.
 

The Team:

As an Intern Value Engineer you join our Value Engineering team to focus on driving and closing opportunities by identifying and selling the value Celonis can bring to customers. The team works closely together with the respective Sales Executive to convert opportunities into deals.

The Role:

Value Engineers are the trusted advisors for our prospects and customers that bring together Product, Technology and Process Know-how to solve our prospects' and customers' most pressing challenges You will gain experience in executing proof of value projects and take part in technical discussions with stakeholders. By creating customer-based business cases, you support the strategic business development activities for the DACH market. 

The work you’ll do:

  • Analyze data from our customers to increase transparency in business processes
  • Understand the pain points of our customers and translate them to what the Celonis Execution Management System offers 
  • Quantify the business and financial potential of the Celonis Execution Management System and prepare management ready presentations
  • Present findings together with your team in front of customers' C-level and decision makers

The qualifications you need:

  • Student of business administration / communication science / psychology / economics / industrial engineering / business informatics or of a comparable program
  • Strong communicational skills and interest in interacting with potential customers
  • Experience in consulting and are highly interested in Data Analytics
  • Knowledge in SQL or related database query languages
  • Analytical mindset and the ability to work in a structured manner and quickly comprehend new topics
  • Fluent in German and English (any additional language is a plus)
  • Availability as soon as possible for a minimum of 5 months (full-time)

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis enables customers to optimize their business processes. Powered by its leading process mining technology, Celonis provides a unique set of capabilities for business executives and users to continuously find improvement opportunities within and across processes, and execute targeted actions to rapidly enhance process performance. This optimization yields immediate cash impact, radically improves customer experience, and reduces carbon emissions. Celonis has thousands of implementations with global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
name: Intern Value Engineering

contents:
Securing the Future Enterprise Today

Our Cybersecurity team is comprised of out-of-the-box thinkers passionate about looking at problems differently. This cadre of security specialists protects not only Siemens critical data and systems, but through the products and services we provide, ultimately, we aim to positively impact society with safer modes of transportation, power generating systems, medical devices, and more.

We make real what matters. This is your role.

  • As a Department Head (f/m/d), you will define, implement, and continuously improve corresponding OT security protection service and consulting portfolio for internal and external customers.
  • You are responsible of strategy, budged and personnel. You will lead an international team of ca. 17 experts located in Spain, Germany, Portugal and Switzerland.
  • In this role, you understand our Operational Technology approach and their attack vectors and define the required security protection service portfolio.
  • You define missing services and drive the implementation with stakeholders on a risk-based approach.
  • Also, you provide input for OT Security Governance to ensure an adequate security level.
  • You align with Businesses, other Cybersecurity departments and further relevant stakeholders in definition and implementation of the OT Security strategy
  • Understanding customers' business, processes and challenges rounds up this role.

Use your skills to move the world forward.
  • You have a technical background in Engineering, Computer Science or Business Information Technology, ideally with focus on cybersecurity.
  • Furthermore, you can provide long-term work experience in security and risk management, with focus on OT environments.
  • You earned experience of consulting business in international environments.
  • You are experienced in global leadership (managing teams in multiple location), stakeholder management and service management.
  • You have a good understanding of corporate and cybersecurity processes.
  • Ideally, you already have know-how about processes in factories.
  • Knowledge in some of the following certifications are a plus: Certified Operational Technology Cybersecurity Professional (TÜV), GIAC Global Industrial Cyber Security Professional (GICSP), Certified SCADA Security Architect (CSSA), Industrial Security Professional Certification (NCMS-ISP), ISA 99 / IEC 62443 Cyber Security Certificate Program, Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM).
  • Your CV proves that you have the ability to learn quickly and adapt to a fast-paced, evolving, growing, and multi-faceted environment.

We've got quite a lot to offer. How about you?

Do you want to know more about Cybersecurity at Siemens? www.siemens.com/cybersecurity

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Broad range of wellbeing offerings
  • Appealing Siemens pension benefits
  • Attractive job ticket offers and free use of e-charging stations (dependent on location)
  • Location-dependent childcare services to combine family and career
  • Barrier-free locations
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

name: Head (f/m/d) OT Protection & Consulting

contents:
We are looking for IT professionals who want to drive the increase of business value by partnering with the business.

As an IT partner you should become familiar with the targets, strategy, challenges, and priorities of the business and provide guidance and support to implement digital innovations. You will work with the business on strategic and innovation initiatives and process improvements via technology. The focus will be on Innovation and Data Analytics related topics in the scope of the overall Lead to Cash process.

Business scope is Digital Industries in various European countries. This position will report to the Digital Industries IT Partner organization. You will get the chance to work with an international team and on global topics.

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Drive innovation with technology and scout for opportunities to increase business value
  • Understand business requirements from different DI stakeholders in the area of data management and develop suitable data solutions
  • Ensure that data activities in Europe get well aligned with the global data strategy of Digital Industries
  • Shape data analytics activities for the Lead to Cash process across European countries
  • Proactively recommend IT approaches to business opportunities and challenges
  • Build and maintain strong, long-lasting stakeholder relationship with assigned customer
  • Understand business environment, identify objectives, and manage the portfolio of demands, projects and services
  • Plan, drive and manage demands and projects from beginning to end.
  • Support the implementation of global tools in alignment with HQ
  • Keep the management and employees informed on IT strategies, key priorities, initiatives and projects
  • Align and share best practices with IT and Digital Industries IT organizations


What do you need to join us?

  • Preferably bachelor's degree in engineering/IT/Computer Science/Business Intelligence/Data Science. Other may be considered.
  • 3-5 years of experience in IT (preferably in customer facing IT role)
  • Knowledge about Siemens Digital Industries Business setup and processes
  • Program / Project management / Agile Methodology skills
  • Data Analytics, Data Engineering and Data Architect skills
  • Experience in requirement analysis, business case proposals and solution design
  • Versed with emerging technology trends: Robotics automation, AI/ML and Analytics, BI Frontend technologies, Data warehouse technologies (e.g. Snowflake)
  • Should have handled at least 2 mid-size project or/and 1 project in Digital technologies using agile project management methodology

Behavioral Skills:

  • Customer and value oriented
  • Relationship management soft skills (Stakeholder mgmt., business /customer centricity, conflict management)
  • Effective communication skills at all levels of the business and IT organizations
  • Strong analysis and trouble shooting skills
  • Experience in working with leadership independently
  • Willingness to learn, grasp and adapt new skills
  • Willingness to travel
  • Enthusiastic and Experimental
  • Resilience

We have quite a lot to offer you:

  • employment in an international organization who is a world leader in its sector and has a stable market position
  • chance for professional development, possibilities to learn and gain new skills
  • wide range of responsibilities and the opportunity to make a real impact on business
  • good work atmosphere and organizational culture based on trust, responsibility and respect
  • work in an international environment, opportunity to collaborate with cross-region teams
  • attractive benefits package, including:
    • cafeteria benefits system (Multisport card, cinema / theater tickets / concerts, shopping)
    • private medical care
    • life insurance
    • employee pension scheme
    • additional paid days off
    • lunch card

Siemens is an Equal Opportunity Employer

If we all thought the same way, we would never create anything new. We know that by creating a diverse work environment, we have a real impact on the success of our company, so we encourage you to apply for Candidates from different backgrounds (with different experiences and approaches). By creating a friendly and open work environment, we take care to support the culture of diversity at every stage of our activities. All applicants will be assessed in terms of their competences, knowledge and skills.

We are waiting for you application!

Please send us your CV in English.

name: IT Partner Professional (f/m/d)

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you'll be responsible for:

Circle is looking for a passionate Security Leader with an expertise in Blockchain Security, deep understanding of different Blockchain technologies and Cloud based Product development. You’ll be part of the Security Engineering team and closely partner with the Engineering teams responsible for the development, deployment of USDC and supporting services.

What you'll work on: 

  • Own Circle’s Blockchain Security strategy, implementation and operationalization
  • Perform due diligence on potential Blockchains where USDC may be deployed to, in partnership with Product Compliance, Product and Engineering teams.
  • Recommend and validate Security controls and improvements across our technology stack
  • Own and build relationships with key external stakeholders such as customers, vendors, and auditors
  • Produce data-based reports on technology risk for senior management
  • Drive continuous improvement in the tech stack

You will aspire to our four core values: 

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you'll bring to Circle: 

  • 12+ years of experience as a security engineer or product security engineering leader with a minimum of five years (can be overlapping) with a focus on cybersecurity.
  • 5+ years demonstrated experience with security standard methodologies for Blockchain smart contract development and Cryptography
  • Demonstrated ability developing security controls that are easy to test and audit
  • Extensive knowledge of Security tool usage across SDLC including SAST, DAST and/or Security end to end testing
  • Proven experience developing automated, scalable, and reproducible security practices
  • Proficiency in managing multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order or priorities on the fly for themselves and their team.
  • Ability to influence internal and external customers to expediently resolve issues and achieve organizational objectives
  • The ability to design and operate controls that are easy to test and audit
  • Experience working in financial services or financial technology desired
  • Advanced degree in computer science, or related fields strongly preferred.
  • 5+ years proven experience building and managing small to medium sized teams
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to New York, NY. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $200,000 - $280,000

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

name: Director, Blockchain Security

contents:
Art der Anstellung: Befristet; 15-20 Stunden/Woche

In Richtung Zukunft? Bitte einsteigen.

Wie werden wir in Zukunft miteinander kommunizieren, Energien sinnvoll nutzen und uns fortbewegen? Wir können an den Antworten zusammenarbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorien in die Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken.

Als Werkstudent*in stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife jetzt die Chance und werde Teil unseres globalen Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Wir freuen uns, wenn Du dein Talent bei uns einbringen willst!

Wir setzen um, worauf es ankommt. Das ist dein Beitrag.

  • In unserem Team wirst Du den Bereich der Organisationsentwicklung unterstützen und mitgestalten
  • Du entwickelst eigenständig Alteryx Workflows, um organisationale Daten aufzubereiten und analysieren zu können
  • Aus verdichteten Datensätzen leitest Du erste Interpretationen für Optimierungspotenziale ab
  • Auf Grundlage von gewonnen Datenbasen entwickelst Du Business Intelligence Dashboards mit z.B. Tableau
  • Auf Basis von Power Automate modellierst Du Prozesse, die uns dabei helfen, effizienter zu arbeiten

Was Du können solltest. Damit die Welt mehr kann.

Uns ist zuallererst deine Persönlichkeit wichtig. Wenn Du in unser Team passt, wobei der Teamgedanke, Ehrgeiz und eine offene Kommunikation für uns im Vordergrund stehen, hast Du den größten Schritt bereits gemeistert!

  • Derzeit absolvierst Du ein technisches Studium (bevorzugt Informatik, Mechatronik oder Elektrotechnik) und hast Interesse an einem längerfristigen Werkstudierendenjob
  • Du hast sehr gute Erfahrung mit Tableau, idealerweise verfügst Du ebenso über Alteryx- und Power Automate Kenntnisse
  • Im Umgang mit den gängigen Microsoft Anwendungen bist Du routiniert
  • Fließende Kenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch sind bei uns Voraussetzung, um dich im Team und mit Kunden problemlos verständigen zu können
  • Home-Office und Remote-Work sind für dich keine Hürden

contents:
Aboutus:

SiemensPLM Software is a world-leading provider of product lifecycle management (PLM)software. We help thousands of companies make great products by optimizingtheir lifecycle processes, from planning and development through manufacturingand support.

Byproviding thoughtfully integrated information at exactly the right time, in thecorrect context, and with the precise level of detail for everyone involved inthe product lifecycle process, our customers achieve a new level ofproductivity, make inquisitive, timely decisions and deliver great products

Positionoverview:

SiemensPLM Software is looking for a highly qualified candidate to provide enterpriseintegration pre-sales, architecture, configuration, and implementationservices. A very strong knowledge of Teamcenter PLM fundamentals is required.The successful candidate must be able to conduct customer business processassessments, evaluate existing processes and suggest new improved ones. Thisindividual must understand diverse environments where the latest in PLM, ERPand MES software is being deployed, as they will be at the forefront of helpingto create integrated enterprise software landscapes.

Responsibilities:

  • Apply advanced knowledge of customer business needs, engineering and manufacturing processes, industry standard methodologies and competitive differentiation, prepare and deliver customized demonstrations of Integration products and solutions to customers in support of selling efforts
  • Educate customers on the strategic business benefits of Integration products and solutions and answer questions on capabilities and usage and solve sales and customer problems
  • Ability to architect and design integration solutions between Teamcenter and other enterprise applications.
  • Lead projects requiring a solid overall understanding of manufacturing systems (PLM), manufacturing processes and data flow into enterprise applications such as ERP, CRM, MES, MRP, and others.
  • Act as the ultimate authority on the integration design to address business problems.
  • Provide direction for integration design, deployment, and rollout activities.
  • Assist in the development of integration proposals based on requirements; deliver solution proposals in context of customer meetings.
  • Responsibilities typically include leading workshops, being responsible for the technical content of the integration solution and design specifications, validating solution configurations, leading unit testing, and acting as an advisor to the team supporting customer user acceptance testing and deployment activities.
  • Technical delivery experience required, but also requires the ability to act as a leader and technical mentor to the supporting Integration Implementation Consultants.
  • Work comfortably and collaboratively with other Siemens resources when required.
  • Work on projects both internally and at customer sites.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or another technical field is required. Additional certifications that reflect an ongoing investment in yourself will be an added plus
  • 5-7 years of experience with Teamcenter Product Lifecycle Management solutions in a customer facing technical delivery role is required. Functional Process expertise in SAP Business Suite or Oracle E-Business Suite preferred
  • Exercise strong problem-solving skills to overcome obstacles. Have a meticulous attention to detail.
  • Understands the competitive landscape as well as industry trends in manufacturing
  • Shown soft skills, business acumen, and the ability to read the room and effectively communicate and present to a diverse audience including technical and non-technical audiences including both Siemens and customer management teams
  • Must have excellent oral and written communications skills
  • Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, Project, Visio, and Outlook;
  • The ability to travel both domestic and international approximately 30% of the time after COVID restrictions are lifted
  • Exercises integrity and confidentiality when taking care of sensitive corporate and partner information.
  • Additional Experience in Enovia, Windchill or other PLM products will be considered.
  • Preferred work locations: Milford, OH; Chicago, IL; Detroit, MI.

Thesalary range for this position is $136,700 to $246,100 and thisrole is eligible to earn incentive compensation. The actual compensationoffered is based on the successful candidate's work location as well asadditional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevanteducation/training. Siemens offers a variety of health and wellness benefits toemployees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com.In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

AtSiemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We needthe most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

Job Title
Field Service Engineer 4, Medical Laser (Charlotte, NC)

Job Description

Field Service Engineer (Charlotte, NC)

Allow your passion for improving lives to shine in this role where you'll be responsible for customer relationship management through the effective use of technical knowledge to install, troubleshoot, service, and maintain equipment at customer sites.

Your role:

  • Provide exceptional customer service by adhering to customer entitlements, setting clear expectations, and meeting commitments and arrival times to address and resolve customer needs. Understand the customer's business and competitive environment; generate service revenue.
  • Actively participate as a member of the regional work team; work to improve team processes and identify training gaps. Seek out opportunities to increase capability and capacity (i.e. may be required to become qualified in multiple modalities, learns new tools).
  • Perform all administrative duties within established Philips, State, and Federal regulatory requirements and timeframes including timesheets, service work orders, expense reports, Field Change Orders (FCO), preventative maintenance (PM), installation documents, site and service documentation, and other related paperwork. Adhere to established training, quality, and safety requirements.
  • Utilize tools, support, resources, and escalation processes within required time frames to resolve customer and system problems timely and effectively. Complete PMs, FCOs, installation and all related tasks (diagnose and resolve electronic, network, and mechanical problems).
  • Travel across the specified geography is required. The average driving time is 1-4 hours daily and may exceed 50% at times. Occasional overnight stays and travel by air and/or train may be required.
You're the right fit if:
  • You've acquired 2+ years of experience in a diagnostic imaging (field or hospital-based) service environment or 4+ years' in electromechanical industries.
  • 5+ years of related experience is preferred in the medical device service field. imaging laser and/or Optic experience is a plus.
  • Your skills include the ability to understand and apply electronic, mechanical, and networking theory to install, diagnose, and repair equipment, including knowledge and use of all necessary tools and test equipment.
  • You have an Associate Degree in electronics or equivalent combination of education and experience; BSEE/BSEET/BSME/BSMET preferred.
  • You must be able to successfully perform the following minimum Physical, Cognitive and Environmental job requirements with or without accommodation for this Field Service position.
  • You must be able to:
    • Work in an office/home office and/or remote setting, as well as in a hospital/healthcare environment; adhere to requirements.
    • Work flexible hours (based on business needs to include overtime, weekends, and on-call rotations).
    • Safely work with radiation sources and/or radioactive materials; wear all required personal protective equipment.
About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.
  • Learn more about our business .
  • Discover our rich and exciting history.
  • Learn more about our purpose.
  • Read more about our employee benefits .
If you're interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here .

Additional Information

US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa, now or in the future.

The territory for this position supports North Carolina and South Carolina. The ideal candidates should reside within a commutable distance to the territory ( Charlotte, NC)

Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld - herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert

  • Für unseren Kunden Deutsche Bahn prüfen Sie Software für Leit- und Sicherungstechnik für Betriebszentralen sowie Leitstände und setzen diese in Betrieb.
  • Zunächst prüfen Sie in unserem Testzentrum die Softwarekomponenten auf die Erfüllung der Kundeanforderungen.
  • Dazu spielen Sie Testszenarien durch, arbeiten Prüfpläne ab und stoßen ggf. Änderungsmaßnahmen an.
  • Nach Fertigstellung der Software führen Sie die Inbetriebnahme einschließlich Montagetätigkeiten beim Kunden vor Ort durch.
  • Dazu koordinieren Sie einen Arbeitsplan mit dem Kunden und spielen die Daten gemeinsam mit ihrem Team auf den Kundensystemen ein.

Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat

  • Sie sind staatlich geprüfter Techniker (w/m/d) mit Schwerpunkt Elektrotechnik / Datenverarbeitung und begeistern sich für die Administration und Inbetriebnahme von komplexen IT-Systemen.
  • Sie zeichnen sich durch gute MS Office-Kenntnisse und idealerweise auch SAP-Know-how aus.
  • Sie bringen sehr gute Deutsch-Kenntnisse sowie Reisebereitschaft (ca. 50% innerhalb Deutschlands) mit.

So treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt - einfach und direkt

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.

Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die die Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns zudem in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Machen Sie zusammen mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer beruflichen Laufbahn. Verändern Sie zusammen mit uns die Welt von morgen.

Verändern Sie zusammen mit uns die schöne Welt von morgen.

Sie sind Teil unseres ca. 120-köpfigen Service-Teams in einem langfristigen Kundenprojekt in München. Der betreute Maschinenpark umfasst im Schwerpunkt verfahrenstechnische Produktionsanlagen wie z.B. Strahlanlagen, automatisierte Rissprüfstraßen, Galvanotechnik sowie Robotik.

  • Sie verantworten verlässlich die mechanische sowie elektrische Instandsetzung und Störbeseitigung an CNC-, SPS-gesteuerten Produktionsanlagen und zugehöriger Peripherie
  • Sie führen selbstständig Wartungen, Instandsetzungen und Störungsbehebungen durch
  • Sie analysieren zuverlässig Fehlerursachen, sorgen für eine nachhaltige Fehlerbehebung und Erarbeiten wirksame Abstellmaßnahmen
  • Sie sind im direkten Austausch mit dem Endkunden, führen servicebezogene Beratungsgespräche und stehen im Kontakt mit den Maschinenherstellern
  • Die Betreuung von Fremdfirmen im Rahmen von Instandhaltungsaufträgen zählt ebenso in Ihren Aufgabenbereich
  • Des Weiteren dokumentieren Sie Ihre Arbeiten in SAP und ggf. MS Office

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung, wenn Sie eine abgeschlossene technische Berufsausbildung wie z.B. Mechatroniker (w/m/d) haben
  • Sie haben mindestens einjährige, einschlägige Erfahrung im Service von Maschinen und Anlagen
  • Idealerweise besitzen Sie bereits Kenntnisse und Serviceerfahrungen im Bereich von Strahlanlagen, Robotern oder automatisierten Produktionsanlagen im Galvanikbereich
  • Darüber hinaus überzeugen Sie mit Ihrer zuverlässigen Arbeitsweise, Ihrer hohen Kundenorientierung sowie Ihrer kollaborativen Zusammenarbeit im Team
  • Eine generelle Bereitschaft zur Schicht,- Samstagsarbeit und Rufbereitschaft sowie sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden Ihr eigenes Profil ab

Was wir bieten.

  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Aktienprogramme, um Miteigentümer der Siemens AG zu werden
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

contents:
We are accelerating and securing the energy transition sustainably and profitably.

Siemens Smart Infrastructure Grid Software enables grid operators as well as industry and infrastructure companies to accelerate and secure the energy transition in a sustainable and profitable way. We connect the physical and the digital world with an integrated OT and IT landscape along the entire value chain from planning through operations to maintenance - following its design principles of modularity, openness, user-centricity, interoperability and resilience.

The net zero challenge is driving a fundamental change in energy generation and consumption, with a seven-fold increase in DER installations projected by 2030. This groundbreaking transformation of the energy sector, characterized by a bi-directional power flow from intermittent renewable energy resources and new consumption patterns, results in enormous complexity.

Our bigger purpose? We believe that software is the key to turn these challenges into opportunities.

Are you passionate about creating new possibilities?

In our newly formed fast-growing business, we are looking for people with the skills and vision to build an energy-efficient and decarbonized future to support a more sustainable environment. Join our team, get inspired, and help us re-imagine the world!

Change the world of tomorrow with us.

  • You will be responsible for consulting on and conception of solution modules for the secure design of applications, products, and solutions in the environment of grid software
  • You will review and ensure the secure configuration of different cloud providers and Kubernetes
  • You actively drive research and development in the broad area of cyber security, e.g., secure architectures, web security, cloud computing security, IoT, identity and access management, certificate management, digital signatures, embedded systems
  • You will take ownership for the development of new technologies, tools, and methods to protect IT and industrial equipment against present and future security threats

What you need to make real what matters.
  • You have a university's degree in computer science or a comparable education/qualification
  • You are experienced with cloud security in development and/or operation of Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure
  • You have good knowledge in security technologies (for e.g., JWT, OAuth, OIDC and mTLS)
  • You are familiar with relevant IETF standards (for e.g., X.509 PKI, digital signatures, IAM)
  • Additionally, you have long term experience in the area of software architectures and cyber security, preferably with a focus on IAM, e.g., Identity Federation, SSO (OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, SAML), securing service to service communication (service mesh / SPIFFE), access management and authorization (RBAC/ABAC/...), or related topics in the field critical infrastructure
  • You are used to working agilely and independently in an international team and communicate authoritatively in English and German

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a future global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Broad range of wellbeing offerings
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

The opportunity to work with innovative and modern technologies - products and services in the field of electrification, automation and digitalization. A working atmosphere and culture based on trust, responsibility and respect.

We value the fact that our employees are individuals and have different preferences and needs. If we all thought the same way, we would never come up with anything new! That is why we recruit exceptional minds from all walks of life. We strive to promote our culture of diversity, equality and inclusion. We encourage applications from a diverse talent pool and are happy to provide opportunities to discuss flexibility and reasonable adjustment requirements. Many of our teams work effectively in a virtual environment, which gives us the opportunity to offer you more flexibility with your schedule.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

contents:
Siemens Digital Industries Software - Where today meetstomorrow.

Let's make the difference together!

Video: MEET US in 2 Minutes!

Are you brave enough to challengeyourself?

Siemens Digital Industries (DI) is an innovation leader inautomation and digitalization. Closely, collaborating with partners andcustomers, we care about the digitaltransformation in the process and discrete industries. With our DigitalEnterprise portfolio, we provide and encourage companies of all sizes with an end-to-end set of products, solutions, andservices to integrate and digitalize the entire value chain. Meaningfuloptimization for the specific needs of each industry, our outstanding portfolio supportscustomers to achieve greater efficiency and flexibility. We are constantlyadding innovations to its portfolio to integrategroundbreaking future technologies. We have our global headquarters inNuremberg, Germany, and have around 75,000 employees internationally.

Join our team as Build and Release Engineer from our office in Katowice, Poland or any ofour other Siemens locations within Poland. We consider a mix between workingremotely from home and meet with the team in the office. As a Build and ReleaseEngineer, you will participate in developing breakthrough Electronic Design Automation (EDA) software, which is usedby our customers to create a variety of amazing products, from smartphones to satellite systems. We believe in Agiledevelopment, so our teams are expected to be self-sufficient and performwithout the classical management structure. Furthermore, these teams fosterculture that allows everyone to express their views, be a contributor, and growas a professional.

You'll help ourcustomers drive digital innovation by

• Support the development teams withmaintenance and development of the build and configuration scripts

• Reinforce the teams delivering customerescalations with build and branch maintenance

• Take part in research and adoption of newbuild and Continuous Integration (CI) related tools and enhance the usage ofexisting ones Resolve technical challenges related to build and CI systems

• Collaborate with Agile scrum teams in aninternational environment

• Grow professionally together with yourteammates

What do you needto be successful in the role?

• Bachelor's or Master's degree inComputer/Software Engineering, Electronics, or a related field Knowledge ofContinuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD) paradigms

• Proficiency in source control managementsystems, particularly SVN

• Experience with Windows Batch &Powershell Scripting

• Familiarity with Linux Shell & ShellScripting

• Experience maintaining Jenkins automationserver and creating pipelines

• Knowledge of Infrastructure-as-a-Code (IaaC);familiarity with Ansible is a plus

• C ++ knowledge is a plus

• Experience with Virtualization (VMWare) &containerization (Docker) is desirable

• Ability to work independently orcollaboratively in a dynamic environment

• Effective verbal and written communicationskills in English for collaboration with foreign colleagues

What we offer?

• Competitive salary and benefits (LunchSubvention, Holiday Allowance, Medical Care, Sport Card, Life Insurance,Additional Siemens free days) Extra paid vacation days

• Work on implementations as product producer(Siemens) not a partner company

• Interesting and challenging career pathwithin Siemens

• Support with relocation (candidate outside ofKatowice)

We offer an international environment with more than 140,000customers around the world who already rely on our expertise in digitization.We are involved in exciting and variedcustomer projects in the aerospace, automotive and transportation, consumerproducts and retail, electronics and semiconductors, energy and utilities, industrial machinery and heavymachinery, maritime, and medical devices and pharmaceuticals industries. Withus, youwill find a team-oriented work environment, comprehensive training options andattractive benefits. Through individual target agreements and diverse career models withspecialization options, we offer you the opportunity to grow professionally andpersonally.

We are always challenging ourselves tobuild a better future. Be part of the most innovative and diverse Digital Mindsto develop tomorrow's reality. Findout more about the Digital world ofSiemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

We'd love to hear from you, so apply now on siemens.com!

contents:
Thisrole will support the growth strategy, as we are undergoing a Transformationwhich will enable the company to scale & support next generation SaaSproducts & services. In alignment with the strategy, we are seeking amanager with strong experience in supporting our digital sales operations.

Youwill be a critical member in the sales operations team focused on working crossfunctionally to enable and streamline digital / ecommerce sales processes for ahigh-profile SaaS tech company. This role will supply to development anddeployment of new Configure, Price and Quote processes for the business unit

Responsibilities:

  • To continually improve the performance and efficiency (cost of operation) of our business systems; improve benefits of the system at the lowest achievable cost while delivering the required functionality
  • Leading brainstorming sessions, using market research for future products and/or product features that address our customers' growing needs
  • Help lead Digital Sales design & development projects through all phases of the product life cycle using Agile development principles
  • Planning & collaborating with product marketing on how to market and promote our products and the digital store
  • Working with our content team to ensure accurate training and development of support content
  • Develop detailed product design & requirements documentation
  • Use e-commerce platforms to enable a detailed customer experience for demos, purchase, activation, and renewals
  • Lead the go to market strategy through collaboration with our e-commerce channel manager, user experience guides and collaborators
  • Act as a product owner to identify, develop and evolve the product and technical requirements for the delivery and fulfillment of SaaS/PaaS products on our digital/e-commerce platforms.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education and Experience:

  • Very organized with a high attention to detail while keeping the big picture in mind
  • 4-6 years of product management experience in high-tech subscription or service-based products in a B2B environment, including use case and requirements definition
  • Functional knowledge of Software as a Service, E-commerce fundamentals, and user experience design, specifically including demos, free trials, subscriptions, and renewals
  • In depth experience evaluating and analyzing data and analytics, specifically for recurring, subscription-based revenue
  • Knowledge of Salesforce CRM and Commerce Cloud (required)
  • Knowledge of Salesforce Flow
  • Experience building cases, strategy, and alignment with product portfolios
  • Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently while collaborating with team members to achieve campaign timelines and goals
  • A good eye for UI/UX design.

Key Factors to Success:

  • Financial growth of the SaaS product revenue through digital sales
  • LeanData experience
  • Accurate case and market needs assessments for streamlined customer journey from purchase to use.

Thesalary range for this position is $113,900 to $205,000 and this role iseligible to earn incentive compensation. Siemens offers a varietyof health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefitscan be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com.In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Companypolicies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exemptemployees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees).

AtSiemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We needthe most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

contents:
The successful applicant will be performing work on US Government classified environments, and therefore, must be a U.S. Person (i.e., U.S. citizen, U.S. national, lawful permanent resident, asylee, or refugee). This position may also perform work that the U.S. government has specified can only be performed by a U.S. citizen on U.S. soil. The successful applicant must have a current US Government TS/SCI Clearance - Current/active or previously held within the last 6 months

WHAT YOU'LL DO

You will be working in an agile, fast-paced, and collaborative environment. You will work to establish relationships, build effective teaming/pairing, harness and use the strengths of a team, influence where possible, and drive towards vital deliverables. You will establish partnerships in the Security & Trust Organization, Cisco Legal, People and Communities, Product Engineering, Incident Response (CSIRT), DES (IT), Supply Chain, Talos, Strategic Communications, and Corporate Security to identify and focus threat research and inside risk. You will also:

  • Help to draft and document internal solutions that are responsive to emerging inside risk.
  • Conduct and document hands-on technical research, in coordination with internal and external partners, on lead data related to potential (digital) threats to Cisco.
  • Author and coordinated on papers and presentations to deliver internally across Cisco and to partners/customers, with a near-term focus on risks posed by emerging threats and industry trends.
  • Understand the current threat landscape and help to translate insights into technical and operational security requirements.
  • Support efforts to influence industry trends. Share your thought leadership with policy and government leaders to help them develop the best regulations and frameworks to enhance security.

WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH

Cisco's Trust Office is a part of the Security and Trust Organization (STO) and plays a central role in making Cisco trustworthy, transparent, and accountable in security, privacy, and data protection. We work with our Cisco teammates, plus global customers, regulators, and industry leaders to influence critical emerging security standards. We also develop and incubate internal strategies to embed the cyber security and data protection needs of our customers and enable sales by reducing customer friction. We play a significant role in helping our customers to have deeply rooted trust in Cisco.

WHO YOU ARE:

An innovative, technical, and highly motivated team-player who is passionate about growing our corporate insider risk program. You will identify and implement new insider threat tools, in addition to applying existing security capabilities to mitigate risk. Using your experience and skills, you will design, implement, and document technical and administrative controls to detect, deter, and respond to insider threats; create, evaluate, and hone insider threat alerting criteria; and automate and streamline security processes.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field preferred.
  • 3-5+ years of experience identifying and prioritizing sensitive information, assets, and activities, evaluating the threat(s), identifying vulnerabilities, and implementing appropriate countermeasures to streamline and automate existing processes and champion new technologies to enhance Cisco's insider threat posture.
  • Must have experience conducting investigations related to insider threats and other related and administrative topics as directed
  • 2+ years' experience as a Credentialed Counterintelligence (CI) Officer trained by a certified US Federal Government organization, or equivalent, preferred
  • 2+ years' experience of OPSEC, INFOSEC, Law enforcement, and CI
  • Must have technical skills related to data triage (large volumes of data) and forensic analysis of endpoint devices.
  • Expert-level in Splunk (as this will be used ~80% daily, and specific experience and use of Digital Guardian, Exabeam, Code42 is required.
  • Be able to and know how to maintain mechanisms for the exchange of threat and vulnerability information and best practices
  • Experience interpreting data from network and host-based monitoring solutions and ingesting and analyzing non-technical data feeds to uncover anomalies and attributes of potential insider risk activity
  • Elevate events of concern and produce insider threat leads that document issues on computer misuse, various violations of policies, counterintelligence concerns, foreign influence, financial stressors, threats to self or others, and other insider threat concerns
  • Effectively collaborate with internal organizations and external partners on cases of concern, and to implement technical controls, identify use cases, integrate, and ingest appropriate data sources, develop analytics, and refine alert criteria.
  • Provide analytic support to investigations, and administrative or security inquiries.
  • Be able to maintain SOPs, and brief team members on emerging threats and indicators.
  • Collaborate with outside Insider Threat Professionals and Functional teams to develop innovative insider threat capabilities to further enhance our proactive and reactive process; ensure compliance with SOPs, policies, and directives. Where guidance does not exist but should, then be able to create and assist in leading policy through approval process.
  • Knowledge of Cyber Security Operations Center or similar environment methodology, to include threat monitoring, intrusion detection, incident response, handling, and remediation
  • Superior writing and briefing skills to present and publish finished analytical reports, synopses and other briefings as required
  • Understanding of statecraft, national security and international affairs, and foreign policy preferred`
  • CAP, CISSP, CISA, CISM or related SANS certifications preferred

WHY CISCO?

#WeAreCisco. We are all unique, but collectively we bring our talents to work as a team, to develop innovative technology and power a more inclusive, digital future for everyone. How do we do it? Well, for starters - with people like you!

Nearly every internet connection around the world touches Cisco. We're the Internet's optimists. Our technology makes sure the data travelling at light speed across connections does so securely, yet it's not what we make but what we make happen which marks us out. We're helping those who work in the health service to connect with patients and each other; schools, colleges and universities to teach in even the most challenging of times. We're helping businesses of all shapes and size to connect with their employees and customers in new ways, providing people with access to the digital skills they need and connecting the most remote parts of the world - whether through 5G, or otherwise.

We tackle whatever challenges come our way. We have each other's backs, we recognise our accomplishments, and we grow together. We celebrate and support one another - from big and small things in life to big career moments. And giving back is in our DNA (we get 10 days off each year to do just that).

We know that powering an inclusive future starts with us. Because without diversity and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. Our 30 Inclusive Communities, that bring people together around commonalities or passions, are leading the way. Together we're committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, whilst supporting the most vulnerable with a collective effort to make this world a better place either with technology, or through our actions.

So, you have colorful hair? Don't care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That's cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco

Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S.:

When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.

U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. Employees accrue up to 20 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their PTO. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. Employees are also able to purchase company stock through our Employee Stock Purchase Program.

Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco pays at the standard rate of 1% of incentive target for each 1% revenue attainment against the quota up to 100%. Once performance exceeds 100% quota attainment, incentive rates may increase up to five times the standard rate with no cap on incentive compensation. For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.
name: Security and Risk Specialist (TS/SCI)

contents:
Are you brave enough to challenge yourself?

Siemens Digital Industries Software is not a manufacturing company. We are a growing software company - bringing the technologies and innovations of tomorrow to our customers today. With the resources and opportunities of a large corporation, your opportunities are endless. The role you apply for today, is only the first step in your Siemens journey.

The ABU (Automotive Business Unit) is developing automotive software for a German premium OEM according to the Automotive SPICE process. According to this process traceability between the Software requirements and the SW Units as well as between the SW Architecture and the Detailed Design need to be established, which traditionally is done with the help of traceability matrices. Today's matrices are generated by a dedicated tool that gets the requirements as well as the source code as input and will generate the matrix as an output. The tooling so far is manual and shall be automated with the help of this work.

Join our team as a Working student - Automotive SPICE automatic traceability matrix generation (f/m/d) and help us to digitalize the future.

How are you shaping the world of tomorrow? Challenging and future-oriented!

Your tasks will involve:

  • Automate creation of the traceability matrix for training SW requirements to SW Units
    • Parse the Detailed design document (HTML) where to find the source code
    • Automate the download of the source code from the Source Control System (Bitbucket)
    • Automate the download of the SW requirements from the Requirements Management System (Polarion)
    • Automate the tool that creates the traceability matrices (ReqTracer)
  • Generate report for traceability between SW Architecture and Detailed Design
    • Parse the architecture model (Rhapsody)
    • Parse the Detailed Design (HTML)
    • Create a report about tracing architecture to Detailed Design

How do you become part of our team? With a lot of drive and passion!

  • You are enrolled at a Germany university
  • Knowledge of the English language is a pre-requisite to be able to communicate with teams abroad
  • Interest in Automation and scripting
  • Well versed with Python scripting
  • Interest in REST APIs
  • Interest in automotive software development processes
  • Interest in SW Tooling

We offer an international environment with more than 140,000 customers around the world who already rely on our expertise in digitization. In Germany, more than 2,000 colleagues are involved in exciting and varied customer projects in the aerospace, automotive and transportation, consumer products and retail, electronics and semiconductors, energy and utilities, industrial machinery and heavy machinery, maritime, and medical devices and pharmaceuticals industries. With us, you will find a team-oriented work environment, comprehensive training options and attractive benefits.


Are you an innovator? Then become part of our team!

If you would like to clarify initial questions with our recruiting team, please contact us by mail: careers-DACH.sisw@siemens.com

Contact person for this job posting is Alessandra Heppting.

Want to learn more about Siemens Digital Industries Software before you apply? Check out Mission / Vision and our software portfolio - or visit our homepage.

At Siemens, we believe people who've had real experiences dealing with being different will excel as leaders. Let's foster a culture of creativity and innovation. contents:
CO Salary Range: USD 76,300.00 - 152,600.00 per year

Are you a highly motivated individual with a passion for the latest engineering and manufacturing software trends including Edge Computing, IOT, and cloud-based solutions? Do you have the ability to guide customers through sophisticated digital transformations? Are you looking for a fast-paced high growth career? If so, please apply for this outstanding opportunity at Siemens Digital Industry Software!

Our Customers ...

Many companies are partnering with Siemens to build their Comprehensive Digital Twin; the virtual representation that give them the capability of linking design and virtual simulations, to physical engineering and manufacturing. These companies are in the Aerospace, Automotive, Consumer Products & Packaging, Electronics, Medical Device, and Semiconductor industries where this technology gives them a competitive advantage. These companies are selecting Siemens because we have a Comprehensive Digital Twin, available today - from concept through manufacturing into field maintenance.

Your Challenge ...

Can you be a creative and independent domain specialist?

Become a member of our Customer Outcomes team as a PLM Junior Consultant. As a PLM Junior Consultant you will work closely with customers to provide software solutions to help them realize their Comprehensive Digital Twin. Helping our customers blur the boundaries between industry domains by integrating the virtual and physical, hardware and software, design, and manufacturing worlds.

Who we are looking for ...

A strong technical contributor that will implement our software solutions for our customers. As part of our team, you will work efficiently with Consultants, Solution Architects, Project Managers, and other internal and external interfaces such as Industry and Product Development teams to ensure that the customer succeeds in their objectives. Be responsible for providing specialist product expertise by consulting, advising, recommending, designing, and where appropriate deploying, specific technical solutions for the Siemens Digital industries Software solution to be delivered optimally and provide value to the customer. Support project/program management activities to control scope, cost, schedule, and quality and in line with program and project processes and messaging, interact with the customer to support the management of customer expectations and support customer adoption.
We need you to already have:

  • Graduated college with a degree in engineering, computer science, etc.
  • One to three years' experience with Teamcenter or other enterprise PLM, ERP or MES systems
  • Experience with the phases of software implementation projects including installation, configuration, testing, deployment, and postproduction support.
  • Experience with Software Development Lifecycles (SDLC) best practices, standards, and testing.
  • Familiarity with programming languages and tools such as JAVA, C++, C#, SQL, JavaScript or JS Frameworks
  • General knowledge with Microsoft Windows administration
  • Familiarity with Windows and/or Linux operating system, Amazon Web Services and/or Microsoft Azure, server/client communications, VPN and reverse proxies and TLS (HTTP vs HTTPS), Docker or Kubernetes, Web Servers (IIS, JBOSS, Tomcat, WebLogic), databases (Oracle, SQL, Aurora, RDS)
Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.

About Us ...

Siemens is a large international corporation with diverse interests. This includes a digital industries software division that is focused on external sales, maintenance, and deployment of software that enables the fourth industrial revolution (Industry 4.0). Our customers are therefore progressive problem solvers, pursuing change that will make them market leaders.

Our products and services are based on Microsoft technologies, which scale for both small or medium companies, and large multi-national corporations. This position is with the Siemens Customer Outcomes team that architects and deploys comprehensive solutions in North America; other teams in South America, Europe, and Asia provide local services for global solutions.

Join Us ...

See the Digital Twin in action; watch, as virtual representations become real products!

name: PLM Junior Consultant REMOTE

contents:
Art der Anstellung: Befristet; 10-20 max. Stunden/Woche

Entwickeln, was morgen wichtig ist.
Wie werden wir in Zukunft miteinander kommunizieren, Energien sinnvoll nutzen und uns fortbewegen? Wir können an den Antworten zusammenarbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorien in die Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken. Als Werkstudent*in stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife jetzt die Chance und werde Teil unseres globalen Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Wir freuen uns, wenn du dein Talent bei uns einbringen willst!

Wir setzen um, worauf es ankommt. Das ist dein Beitrag.

  • SCM, Logistik? Stichworte, die dich begeistern? Dann ist unser Team genau das Richtige für dich! Wir suchen eine engagierte Teamverstärkung, die uns mit ca. 20 Std./Woche im Tagesgeschäft unter die Arme greift.
  • Du unterstützt unsere Expert:innen im Bereich Produktionsplanung und -steuerung in der täglichen Abwicklung, indem du mögliche Planungsanpassungen in verschiedenen Software-Tools (SAP, OpCenter) prüfst und mit deinen Schnittstellen in Auftragsabwicklung und Fertigung kommunizierst.
  • Außerdem führst du mehrstufige Materialverwender-Analysen durch, z.B. zur Ermittlung von Langzeitbedarfen im Rahmen der Abwicklung abgekündigter Bauelemente
  • Du hast die Chance, Praxiserfahrung in einer der modernsten High-Tech-Elektronikfertigungen zu sammeln und lernst von den besten Fachexpert:innen im Bereich Supply Chain Management.

Was du können solltest. Damit die Welt mehr kann.

  • Du studierst Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL oder einen ähnlichen Studiengang, vorzugsweise mit dem Schwerpunkt Logistik / SCM, und stehst uns längerfristig zur Verfügung.
  • Du bringst ein gutes Verständnis für Logistikprozesse und hohe Affinität zum Umgang mit Zahlen und Daten mit.
  • Mit den gängigen MS Office-Anwendungen kennst du dich sehr gut aus, Erfahrungen in SAP sind ein Plus.
  • Da unser Team global agiert, zeichnen dich sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift aus.
  • Last but not least: Auf dich ist Verlass, weil du strukturiert sowie ergebnisorientiert vorgehst und dein Arbeitsstil von großer Sorgfalt und Selbständigkeit geprägt ist.

Wir wollen, dass du willst: Bewirb dich!

www.siemens.de
wenn du vor deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchtest.

Du hast Fragen zur Bewerbung? Hier findest du Antworten auf häufig gestellte Fragen.

www.siemens.de/fragenzurbewerbung

contents:
Siemens Digital Industries Software - Where today meets tomorrow.

Let's make the difference together!

Meet the team - Video

Siemens Digital Industries Software is an innovation leader in automation and digitalization. Closely, collaborating with partners and customers, we care about the digital transformation in the process and discrete industries. With our Digital Enterprise portfolio, we provide and encourage companies of all sizes with an end-to-end set of products, solutions and services to integrate and digitalize the entire value chain. Meaningful optimization for the specific needs of each industry, our outstanding portfolio supports customers to achieve greater efficiency and flexibility. We are constantly adding innovations to its portfolio to integrate ground-breaking future technologies. We have our global headquarters in Nuremberg, Germany, and have around 75,000 employees internationally.

We offer a role with responsibility, independence, and the possibility to contribute proactive. We foster a teamwork culture with room for individual development

Please visit https://www.siemens.com/plm

About the role

Join our team as "Program Manager - PCB/EDM Design Flow (m/f/d)" anywhere remotely in Europe.

Siemens Industry Software is a leader in electronic design automation (EDA). We enable companies to develop better electronic products faster and more cost-effectively. We are seeking a high-energy, experienced Program Manager.

The Program Manager is a key role within the Consulting Services team. The Program Manager is responsible for managing the execution of electronic design services projects. We are seeking a high energy leader, with a successful track record for building customer loyalty through transparent and consistent delivery.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Partner with account teams and technical leads to manage a successful sales campaign
  • Utilize services offering based input forms to capture Customer objectives and requirements
  • Work with assigned technical leads to scope project effort and capture project proposals
  • Develop Statement of Work (SOW) documents along with assigned technical lead
  • Developing and maintaining detailed project plans
  • Managing project execution based on project plans
  • Maintaining a log of agreements, open issues, and risks.
  • Manage project scope, and utilize change control logs to capture scope changes
  • Provide project status reports to Customer stakeholders
  • Financial Management of assigned services projects
  • Tracking and reporting project governance and performance metrics
  • Active management of Customer Relationships through execution best practices
  • Capture Customer success metrics and conduct surveys through the project lifecycle
  • Continually look for improvement opportunities in project delivery and metrics, to increase measurable results

Required skills and experience:

  • 8+ years of hands-on experience managing electronic design projects
  • Understanding of the PCB development process, Design and Library management, and New Product Introduction (NPI).
  • Understanding of High-Speed Design Analysis, tools, and methodologies.
  • Development of clear Statements of Work (SOW) for Deliverables, Time and Materials, and Subscription based projects
  • Strong understanding of skills and processes required to manage services projects
  • Deep understanding of project governance and project management methodologies (Waterfall and Agile)
  • Experience in project planning, risk management, and change management
  • Excellent customer focus, attitude and excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills with a sense of urgency
  • Excellent interpersonal, telephone and electronic communications skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (including Microsoft Project)
  • Consideration provided for experience in managing virtual, geographically, and culturally diverse teams
  • Consideration provided for Project Management Professional Certification

Working at Siemens Software

Why us?

Working at Siemens Software means flexibility - Choosing between working at home and the office at other times is the norm here. We offer great benefits and rewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At Siemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow's reality.

Siemens. Making real what matters

If you want to make a difference - make it with us!

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Die Digitalisierung stellt viele Unternehmen vor große Herausforderungen und wird die Prozesse in den kommenden Jahren immens verändern. So auch bei der Siemens Mobility GmbH - als IT Architect & Service Integrator (w/m/d) werden Sie bei uns aktiv ein Siemens Teamcenter Transformationsprojekt mitgestalten und begleiten. Das Projekt arbeitet nach der SAFe-Methodik.

Was tragen Sie bei?

  • Sie verstärken unser Team als erfahrener IT Solution Expert (w/m/d). In dieser anspruchsvollen Rolle sind Sie für das Release Management von komplexen IT-Anforderungen und -Projekten, innerhalb der bestehenden Mobility Teamcenter-Landschaft, verantwortlich.
  • Sie organisieren selbständig zusammen mit Ihren IT-Kollegen entsprechende Releases, beschreiben den funktionalen Umfang und führen erforderliche System- und Integrationstests durch. Sie erstellen anschließend die nötigen Release-Notes und kommunizieren ihre Ergebnisse in vorhandenen Gremien.
  • Das Erstellen von Plänen und Berichten über den Zustand der Releases gehört mit zu Ihren täglichen Aufgaben.
  • Zusammen mit Business-Ansprechpartner planen und koordinieren Sie den globalen Rollout der Releases.
  • Sie leisten Applikations- und Prozesssupport, um auch weiterhin effiziente und harmonische Geschäftsprozesse und Strukturen zu gewährleisten.
  • Dazu gehört auch die ständige Verbesserung des Software Release-Prozesses inklusive der Zeitstrecken und Erhöhung des Automatisierungsgrades.
  • Als Teamplayer arbeiten Sie Hand in Hand mit den relevanten Fachabteilungen und internationalen Kollegen, sowie externen Dienstleistern und stimmen sich regelmäßig mit Ihnen zu diesen vielfältigen Themen/Aufgaben ab.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik-, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einer ähnlichen Studienrichtung.
  • Sie haben darüber hinaus mehrjährige Berufserfahrung mit klassischen und agilen Methoden des Projektmanagements sammeln können.
  • Zudem überzeugen Sie uns mit sehr guten Kenntnissen als IT Solution Expert (w/m/d) im Release Management, idealerweise im Teamcenter-Umfeld.
  • Sie bringen eine strukturierte, eigenständige und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise sowie Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit mit.
  • Ihre Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit in globalen Teams sowie idealerweise der fachlichen Führung/Management von Mitarbeitenden setzen wir für diese Funktion voraus.
  • Fortgeschrittene Englischkenntnisse sind aufgrund der globalen Unternehmensausrichtung und Funktion unbedingte Voraussetzung.
  • Die Bereitschaft zu Dienstreisen (ca.20%) rundet Ihr Profil ab.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns haben Sie die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Sie zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein können. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Attraktive Konditionen

Sie erhalten ein attraktives Vergütungspaket einschließlich der Leistungen des Tarifvertrages (z.B. Zusatzentgelte und Urlaubsgeld) und weiteren Extras (z.B. betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Aktienprogramm).

Weiterentwicklung

Wir bieten Ihnen umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Mit unserem Learning Campus verfügen wir über einen Inhouse-Dienstleister mit einem vielfältigen On- und Offline-Angebot.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt?

www.siemens.de/mobility
wenn Sie vor Ihrer Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchten.
+49 (9131) 17 52430
wenn Sie erste Fragen gern persönlich mit unserem Recruiting Team klären möchten. Ansprechpartner für diese Stellenausschreibung ist Frau Julia Krzystek.
www.siemens.de/karriere
wenn Sie mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchten.

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.
