name: IT Solution Expert (w/m/d) Release Management

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a Treasury Integrations Manager to join the team owning the collaboration and cross-functional effort between Treasury and Product teams. This team is working to streamline processes associated with treasury infrastructure across our products including design, operational needs, and reporting. This position will play a key role in partnering with both Product, Engineering, and Treasury on business roadmap and key initiatives. 

What you'll work on:

  • Developing and documenting problem statements and business needs for Treasury with input from subject-matter experts.
  • Supporting and facilitating the success of integration projects resulting from business need and Product planning such as feature updates, banking integrations, Treasury Management Systems, etc. 
  • Defining and developing project plans from a Treasury perspective where applicable.
  • Reviewing the Product organization’s project plans, designs and features to evaluate impact on Treasury organization.
  • Collaborating with Product, SMEs and Treasury leads to review project(s) scope and requirements including reporting, tooling, or other needs.
  • Supporting roadmap planning efforts including evaluating time and resources needed from partners.
  • Partnering with Treasury team leads to understand their roles and responsibilities.
  • Developing and communicating project updates within the Treasury Organization.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • 7+ years of experience in consulting, financial services or payments industry required.
  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or related field. 
  • Able to think critically, understand complex topics/technologies, define complex problems by developing concise summarization of technical initiatives put out by the business or problems identified by SMEs.
  • Proven collaborative problem solving skills with the ability to think critically and ask thoughtful questions.
  • Startup mindset.
  • Highly organized and detail oriented.
  • Takes pride in working on projects to successful completion.
  • Excels in a highly collaborative environment with different stakeholders and SMEs.
  • Practical experience creating process documentation and reports.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate information into actionable insights as well as the ability to coordinate feedback under tight timelines.
  • Highly proficient technical writing capabilities.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to San Francisco, CA. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $145,000 - $190,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

#LI-Remote
name: Treasury Integrations Manager

contents:
If you really want to make a difference - make it with us

Siemens Mobility is a separately managed company of Siemens AG and has been a leading supplier in the field of mobility for over 160 years. Our core business includes rail vehicles, rail automation and electrification solutions, turnkey systems and related services. We have always been very innovative in making traveling faster, safer and more comfortable. Today, we need new solutions to new challenges such as climate change and rising populations worldwide. That's what drives us. That's why we shape mobility with passion, always being one step ahead. Through digitalization, we make infrastructures smart and create opportunities that get us from A to B sustainably and seamlessly. Our 38,200 employees are pioneers in mobility who help to keep the world moving.

What do you contribute?

  • In general you will help us to drive the digital transformation of Siemens Mobility - with an IT Architecture enabling a lean, agile, and resilient IT landscape to efficiently and effectively support Siemens business and its continuous enrichment with new digital products and services.
  • In doing so you will lead and manage IT architecture workstreams of strategic IT and business projects in close alignment with business architects and ensure integration into the overall Siemens enterprise IT architecture landscape.
  • Also, you will drive the development of target architectures together with business and IT stakeholders and will prepare decision papers for Program Manager and senior IT management.
  • Next to this, you will define and align the architecture frameworks to foster documentation and implementation of the target architecture.
  • You will lead a Team of Solution Architects (virtual) in close alignment with program leadership and other stakeholders to support achieving program goals within the given timeline, quality, and budget.

What do you bring along?

  • You hold a completed university degree in computer science, business informatics or comparable.
  • Next to this, you do have long-term experience within solution architecture and bring in project management experience in strategic business and IT programs (e.g., process IT enabling, application roll-out, outsourcing).
  • You are experienced in program IT architecture development and implementation methodologies with a focus on enterprise application and platform architectures and software selection.
  • In addition, you bring in knowledge in at least one of the key Corporate Business and IT priorities: Digital Sales, Internet of Things, Factory Digitalization, SAP S/4HANA ERP Transformation or Digital Workplace
  • Also, you do have leading experience (functional) in a complex and interdisciplinary team.
  • Fluent English language skills are mandatory.

What do we offer you?

Inclusion & Diversity

At Siemens Mobility, we're committed to fighting injustice and inequality. At our company, you will find an environment where you can be yourself and belong.

Career growth

We offer comprehensive training opportunities for your professional and personal development. With our Learning Campus, we have an in-house service provider with a wide range of online and offline training courses

Mobile working /Remote working

With us, you will have the opportunity to work hybrid. This means that you can work remotely to a considerable extent. We have officially regulated this through a company agreement.

You can find an overview of our benefits here.

How do you get in touch with us?

www.siemens.de/mobility
if you would like to find out more about Siemens before applying.
+49 (9131) 17 52430
if you wish to discuss any initial questions with our recruitment team. The contact person handling this job ad is Mrs. Julia Krzystek.
www.siemens.com/careers
if you would like more information about jobs and careers at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

Experience Level: Experienced Professional

name: Senior IT Enterprise Architect (w/m/d)

contents:
If you really want to make a difference - make it with us

Siemens Mobility is a separately managed company of Siemens AG and has been a leading supplier in the field of mobility for over 160 years. Our core business includes rail vehicles, rail automation and electrification solutions, turnkey systems and related services. We have always been very innovative in making traveling faster, safer and more comfortable. Today, we need new solutions to new challenges such as climate change and rising populations worldwide. That's what drives us. That's why we shape mobility with passion, always being one step ahead. Through digitalization, we make infrastructures smart and create opportunities that get us from A to B sustainably and seamlessly. Our 38,200 employees are pioneers in mobility who help to keep the world moving.

What do you contribute?

We supply our international customers with locomotives that are used for cross-border freight and passenger transport. Our product platforms are very successful due to the cross-border application possibilities; we are constantly developing and optimising country corridors and equipment for this purpose. The operational safety of our products is largely guaranteed by the integrated train control systems. And this is where you come in:

  • You will lead our cross-location, European engineering team for the integration of the on-board train control systems in our locomotives.
  • As a technical and disciplinary manager, you are responsible for the strategic development and expansion of the specialist group, for the further development of the integration process and the cooperation with the specialists involved. Your primary goal is to continuously improve the cooperation and the workflow and to further expand the performance.
  • As the main contact person, you will design the working methods to bring the product and project requirements from legal and customer contracts as well as internal requirements into our developments. You will set the terms of reference and responsibilities in your cross-site team and define the work and development objectives within the framework of our product strategy.
  • Your responsibility is demanding, as we use a wide variety of train control systems in our products. Our team of experts in engineering therefore comprises a mid-double-digit number of employees at several locations in Europe. In your role as a manager, you will be responsible for shaping the expansion and cooperation of this team. To this end, you will use the networks and contacts of our business unit and will be the face of your department both internally and externally.
  • You will focus on the structural and methodological development of the team, further develop the management, personnel and location structure and focus on the further development of the work organisation.

What do you bring along?

  • Your basis is a completed master's degree in electrical or mechanical engineering.
  • You have many years of professional experience in the field of train control systems - ideally in vehicle integration of ETCS plus standard national systems in multi-system rail vehicles, but at least in the development of on-board systems for modern European train control systems.
  • You know the market and supplier situation and are confident in your knowledge of the current legislation and standards for European train control systems (EN 50128, EN 50129 and EN 50657). You are methodically and practically familiar with the clear definition, validation and verification of requirements in the environment of safety-relevant software and hardware development.
  • You have knowledge / experience of the vehicle integration of commercially available ETCS train control systems from the suppliers Siemens, Alstom/Bombardier, Thales and national European products.
  • You organise business contacts with internal and external interface partners, customers and suppliers in a structured and professional manner. You are open to a corresponding travel activity (20%).
  • You consciously organise the working methods in presence, hybrid meetings and remote work for yourself and your employees. You organise communication across several locations and take care of modern, efficient meeting culture and team development in hybrid working environments. You are therefore experienced in facilitating team meetings and appointments with clients and suppliers and have a clear systematic approach to defining work tasks, coordinating them and following them up.
  • If you already have experience in the application of agile methods in project management, this is desirable.

What do we offer you?

Inclusion & Diversity

At Siemens Mobility, we're committed to fighting injustice and inequality. At our company, you will find an environment where you can be yourself and belong.

Purpose

We are pioneers in mobility. At Siemens Mobility, you will actively contribute to the transformation of transportation and climate protection in a market of the future, because our transportation solutions reduce CO2 emissions all over the world.

Mobile working /Remote working

With us, you will have the opportunity to work hybrid. This means that you can work remotely to a considerable extent. We have officially regulated this through a company agreement.

You can find an overview of our benefits here.

How do you get in touch with us?

www.siemens.de/mobility
if you would like to find out more about Siemens before applying.
+49 (9131) 17 52430
if you wish to discuss any initial questions with our recruitment team. The contact person handling this job ad is Mr. Peter Wiebories.
www.siemens.com/mobility-jobs
if you would like more information about jobs and careers at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

name: Engineering Group Leader (f/m/d)  Automatic Train Control Systems for Locomotives

contents:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.
 

The Role:
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer working primarily on the backend in Java with some frontend (Angular) responsibilities as well, to build new features for our Extractors team supporting the expansion of Process Mining Adoption by companies worldwide.

The Team:
We, as Extractor Teams at Celonis, bring the customer data into the EMS (Execution Management System), we are the entry point for our customers. We are responsible for extracting data from a wide variety of source systems (JDBC, Web APIs, and Streaming Solutions) in a performant, robust and scalable way. In addition to our in-house built native integrations, we also give our customers a possibility to build their own extractor via a low-code development tool. We continuously work on improving data integration experience.

The work you’ll do:

  • Take responsibility for pieces of work throughout the stages of development - from design to deployment.
  • Implement maintainable and reliable software that meets expectations, including complex features and applications.
  • Take open ended technical problems and develop practical solutions that meet stakeholder needs.
  • Handle requests from customer support finding the right technical solution.

The qualifications you need:

  • 5+ years of professional experience building Java applications
  • Good knowledge of Spring Boot
  • Experience in REST APIs and distributed microservices architecture
  • Experience with relational databases and SQL
  • Familiar with containerization technologies (e.g. Docker, kubernetes)
  • Strong communication skills (English is a must)
  • Passion and motivation to learn and grow as a Software Engineer
  • Nice to have: Angular knowledge and DataDog monitoring

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis enables customers to optimize their business processes. Powered by its leading process mining technology, Celonis provides a unique set of capabilities for business executives and users to continuously find improvement opportunities within and across processes, and execute targeted actions to rapidly enhance process performance. This optimization yields immediate cash impact, radically improves customer experience, and reduces carbon emissions. Celonis has thousands of implementations with global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
name: Senior Software Engineer - Data Extraction

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for:

In 2020, Circle unveiled Circle APIs: a set of solutions and smarter technology to help businesses accept payments in a more global, scalable and efficient alternative to traditional banking rails (spoiler: we’re using USD Coin under the hood). The Circle Security Team works to protect Circle; our customers, clients, and partners; and the financial markets upon which we rely.  As a member of this team, you’ll lead projects and be responsible for key deliverables of the security program while collaborating across Circle teams.  You will continue to learn and stay current in a fun and rapidly changing environment.

What you'll work on:

  • Conduct analysis of user behavior and organizational controls apparent in security logging.
  • Leverage analysis to build technical detections and controls.
  • Drive the development and implementation of automated data access checks across various platforms to help detect abuse and data exfiltration.
  • Perform security incident investigations using data analytics and computer forensics.
  • Build automation and detection models to support identification of anomalous activity to mitigate insider risk at scale.
  • Identify gaps in our infrastructure, and work with business partners to gain visibility through logging and detection.
  • Partner with stakeholders to contribute to Security Awareness messaging, training and exercises.
  • Drive deployment, development, and improvements in Security Incident and Event Management, Case Management, and Automation.
  • Provide security guidance to various organizations throughout the company.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle:

  • 5-7+ years experience in security operations such as technical investigations or Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) with a minimum of two years (can be overlapping) with a focus on Insider Threat.
  • Experience with technologies relevant to Insider Threat (SIEMs, DLP solutions, CASBs, UEBA tools, host forensic solutions).
  • Experience in data science and analytics solutions applicable to the insider threat detection space.
  • Exposure to programming, scripting and query languages such as Python, Golang, bash, SQL.
  • Strong ability to work collaboratively across teams during high-stress situations.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order of priorities on the fly.
  • Self-motivated and creative problem-solver able to work independently with minimal guidance.
  • Enthusiasm for scalable, reproducible security management. 
  • In-depth knowledge of the insider threat landscape.
  • Deep knowledge of SIEM, Case Management, EDR/ MDR, and DLP solutions.
  • Experience working in financial services or financial technology desired.
  • Experience working in an AWS environment preferred.
  • Experience communicating technical findings to a variety of stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in Google Suite, Slack and Apple MacOS preferred. 
  • Certifications such as CMU CERT ITPM/ ITVA, CCITP, CISM, CDPSE or similar will receive favorable consideration but are not required.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Salt Lake City, UT. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $160,000 - $215,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order of priorities on the fly.
  • Self-motivated and creative problem-solver able to work independently with minimal guidance.
  • Enthusiasm for scalable, reproducible security management. 
  • In-depth knowledge of the insider threat landscape.
  • Deep knowledge of SIEM, Case Management, EDR/ MDR, and DLP solutions.
  • Experience working in financial services or financial technology desired.
  • Experience working in an AWS environment preferred.
  • Experience communicating technical findings to a variety of stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in Google Suite, Slack and Apple MacOS preferred. 
  • Certifications such as CMU CERT ITPM/ ITVA, CCITP, CISM, CDPSE or similar will receive favorable consideration but are not required.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Los Angeles, CA. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $175,000 - $230,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

contents:
We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us.
 

The Team:

We are a young and diverse team of data analytics enthusiasts that implement Celonis at the Customer. We set up the Celonis connection and implement all kinds of use cases and automation scenarios within different processes. During the implementation we work closely together with the customer to understand their requirements and support their onboarding to Celonis.

The Role:

You will gain experience in the implementation of our Celonis technology to accelerate our customers’ digital transformation and drive Celonis’ international expansion. Besides comprehensive analytical skills as well as process and product knowledge in Process Analytics, Process Automation, Task Mining and Machine Learning you will gain experience in project management and customer

The work you’ll do:

  • Work closely with customer to understand and translate their business requirements into technical requirements
  • Support your team colleagues with the implementation process and transform the customer’s data using SQL to create the data model for process analysis
  • Use the Celonis Execution Management System to develop new, innovative execution solutions for the customer using automation tools and YAML
  • Apply PQL to analyze the data in order to identify process inefficiencies and understand the root causes to jointly suggest approaches to overcome them
  • Quantify the business and financial potential and prepare management ready presentations about your findings

The qualifications you need:

  • Student of mathematics, business informatics, economics or a comparable degree program with outstanding performance
  • Know-how in Business Intelligence and data analytics
  • Interest in working with customers and awesome presentation and communication skills
  • Experience in programming, working with databases and ETL
  • Knowledge in SQL or related database query languages
  • Demonstrate initiative, work independently and think outside of the box to the main characteristics you feature and seek in a job
  • Business fluent in German and English (any additional language is a plus)
  • At least 5 months of full-time availability before potentially switching into a working student position

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (ownership of projects, exposure to senior management, mentorship and buddy programs, guided learning paths, internal mobility opportunities)
  • Mental well-being support (mindfulness tools such as Headspace, flexible working hours, virtual events, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counselling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis enables customers to optimize their business processes. Powered by its leading process mining technology, Celonis provides a unique set of capabilities for business executives and users to continuously find improvement opportunities within and across processes, and execute targeted actions to rapidly enhance process performance. This optimization yields immediate cash impact, radically improves customer experience, and reduces carbon emissions. Celonis has thousands of implementations with global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws.  As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.  Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
name: Intern / Working Student Business Analytics Consulting

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was tragen Sie bei?

In unserem Werk München Allach fertigen wir moderne Lokomotiven für den Güterverkehr weltweit. Lernen Sie unser Werk näher kennen:
www.siemens.de/allach-jobs
#Jobs-mit-Loks #Allach

  • In Ihrer neuen Rolle führen Sie die ca. 60 Mitarbeiter des Bereiches fachlich und disziplinarisch.
  • Insbesondere motivieren Sie Ihr Team und unterstützen Ihre Mitarbeiter bei deren persönlicher Weiterentwicklung.
  • Im Austausch mit der Fertigungsteuerung führen Sie die Personal- und Produktionsplanung durch.
  • Sie optimieren unsere bestehenden Fertigungsprozesse in enger Abstimmung mit den Bereichen Arbeitsvorbereitung, Logistik und Schweißaufsicht.
  • Ferner stellen Sie die Einhaltung von Terminen, Kosten und Qualität sicher.
  • Sie gewährleisten, dass die jeweils relevanten Gesetze, Richtlinien und Vorschriften eingehalten werden.

Was bringen Sie mit?

  • Sie besitzen eine abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung mit Weiterbildung zum Meister oder Techniker.
  • Idealerweise sind Sie zudem ausgebildeter Schweißfachmann.
  • Sie konnten bereits langjährige praktische Erfahrungen als Abteilungsmeister sowie in der Führung von Mitarbeitern sammeln.
  • Zudem überzeugen Sie mit fundierten Kenntnissen im Stahlbau.
  • Kenntnisse in LEAN, KVP und 6S sind wünschenswert.
  • Sie zeichnen Sich durch eine eigenständige Arbeitsweise, unternehmerisches Denken sowie Teamfähigkeit und Durchsetzungsvermögen aus.
  • Sie sprechen fließend Deutsch.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Attraktive Konditionen

Sie erhalten ein attraktives Vergütungspaket einschließlich der Leistungen des Tarifvertrages (z.B. Zusatzentgelte und Urlaubsgeld) und weiteren Extras (z.B. betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Aktienprogramm).

Purpose

Wir sind Pioniere der Mobilität. Bei uns tragen Sie in einem Zukunftsmarkt aktiv zu Verkehrswende und Klimaschutz bei, weil unsere Transportlösungen in aller Welt den CO2-Ausstoß verringern.

Weiterentwicklung

Wir bieten Ihnen umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Mit unserem Learning Campus verfügen wir über einen Inhouse-Dienstleister mit einem vielfältigen On- und Offline-Angebot.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt?

www.siemens.de/mobility

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for a Treasury Integrations Manager to join the team owning the collaboration and cross-functional effort between Treasury and Product teams. This team is working to streamline processes associated with treasury infrastructure across our products including design, operational needs, and reporting. This position will play a key role in partnering with both Product, Engineering, and Treasury on business roadmap and key initiatives. 

What you'll work on:

  • Developing and documenting problem statements and business needs for Treasury with input from subject-matter experts.
  • Supporting and facilitating the success of integration projects resulting from business need and Product planning such as feature updates, banking integrations, Treasury Management Systems, etc. 
  • Defining and developing project plans from a Treasury perspective where applicable.
  • Reviewing the Product organization’s project plans, designs and features to evaluate impact on Treasury organization.
  • Collaborating with Product, SMEs and Treasury leads to review project(s) scope and requirements including reporting, tooling, or other needs.
  • Supporting roadmap planning efforts including evaluating time and resources needed from partners.
  • Partnering with Treasury team leads to understand their roles and responsibilities.
  • Developing and communicating project updates within the Treasury Organization.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • 7+ years of experience in consulting, financial services or payments industry required.
  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or related field. 
  • Able to think critically, understand complex topics/technologies, define complex problems by developing concise summarization of technical initiatives put out by the business or problems identified by SMEs.
  • Proven collaborative problem solving skills with the ability to think critically and ask thoughtful questions.
  • Startup mindset.
  • Highly organized and detail oriented.
  • Takes pride in working on projects to successful completion.
  • Excels in a highly collaborative environment with different stakeholders and SMEs.
  • Practical experience creating process documentation and reports.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate information into actionable insights as well as the ability to coordinate feedback under tight timelines.
  • Highly proficient technical writing capabilities.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Phoenix, AZ. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $125,000 - $165,000

Annual Bonus Target: 15%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

name: Treasury Integrations Manager

contents:
Wissen für die neue moderne Welt von morgen.

Siemens Smart Infrastructure verbindet die realen und die digitalen Welten über Energiesysteme, Gebäude und Industrien hinweg. Insbesondere befassen wir und mit den Medien Strom und Gas sowie den Wärmeenergieträgern für Wärme und Kälte. Damit verbessern wir die Art und Weise, wie Menschen leben und arbeiten und sorgen gleichzeitig für mehr Effizienz und Nachhaltigkeit. Wir arbeiten mit Kunden und Partnern zusammen daran ein Ökosystem zu schaffen, das sowohl intuitiv auf die Bedürfnisse der Menschen eingeht als auch den Kunden hilft, ihre Ziele zu erreichen. Es hilft unseren Kunden erfolgreich zu sein, Gemeinschaften voranzubringen und unterstützt eine nachhaltige Entwicklung, um unseren Planeten für die nächste Generation zu bewahren.

Welche Rolle wirst du spielen?

  • Als Solution Designer bist du die Angebotsleitung in der Konzeptions-, Studien- und Analysephase von ganzheitlichen Energie- und Medienversorgungslösungen für unsere Kunden im Umfeld von Industrie, Gewerbe, Stadtwerken und Kommunen.
  • Du arbeitest eng und respektvoll mit unserem eigenen Vertrieb an Kundenangeboten und bist hier unsere wichtige Ansprechperson.
  • Zusammen mit dem Vertrieb erstellst du Kosten- und Nutzenrechnungen unserer eigenen Lösungen und Services und optimierst diesen gewinnbringend für unsere Kunden.
  • Du steuerst die weitere Ausarbeitung unserer techno-ökonomischen Lösungen und Services.
  • Die Fachleute und Ingenieure aus den einzelnen Disziplinen werden von dir fachlich geführt.
  • Für das Gesamtlösungsdesign unter weiterer Berücksichtigung der Kundenanforderungen und unseres Lösungs- und Serviceportfolios bist du zuständig.
  • Zu deinen weiteren Aufgaben gehört zudem die Kalkulation von Angebotsprojekten und die Verfolgung der Angebotskosten und -fortschritte.
  • Des Weiteren erstellst du Terminpläne für die Angebotsprojekte und verfolgst die Einhaltung von Meilensteinen.
  • Du entwickelst die Konzeptions-, Studien- und Analyseprojekte in ein Umsetzungs- und Serviceangebot an unsere Kunden.
  • Mit der Beauftragung der entsprechenden Angebote bist du für eine reibungslose Übergabe an unser Projekt Management verantwortlich.
  • Zu deinen klassischen Aufgaben gehört des Weiteren die operative Umsetzung von Gelerntem und die anschließende Optimierung von verschiedenen internen Prozessen.

Was du brauchst, um das zu verwirklichen, was zählt.

  • Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Maschinenbau, Elektrotechnik, Energie- und Versorgungstechnik oder Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen und bringst mindestens 5 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung mit.
  • Du konntest langjährige, einschlägige Berufserfahrung in der Konzeptionierung, Planung und Ausführung im Industrie- und Anlagenbau vorweisen und kennst dich mit allen Leistungsphasen der Vorbereitung bestens aus.
  • Du kannst Aufwände in der Ausarbeitung von Analysen, Konzepten und Angeboten abschätzen.
  • Kundenanforderungen erkennst du schnell und kannst entsprechende Grundkonzepte erstellen.
  • In der Erstellung von Angebotsstrukturen bist du versiert, ebenso in der Zusammenstellung von Angebotsprojektteams.
  • Du überzeugst durch deine Kommunikationsstärke und bist ein vertrauensvoller und gleichzeitig kollegialer Teamplayer.
  • Du behältst den Überblick, wer was bis wann machen muss.
  • Abgerundet wird dein Profil durch fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.

Das bieten wir dir:

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als zukünftiger, globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für deine berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für dich und deine Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Mitarbeiteraktienplänen
  • Attraktive Siemens Altersvorsorge
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Gesucht: Mitgestalter von morgen.

contents:
Who we are

Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations™ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing — and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.

Working at Samsara means you’ll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team that’s shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, you’ll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term. 

Recent awards we’ve won include:

Great Place To Work Certified™ 2023

Best Place to Work by Built In 2023

Financial Times The Americas’ Fastest Growing Companies 2023

Deloitte Fast 500 Companies

IoT Analytics Company of the Year in 2022’s IoT Breakthrough Winners

We see a profound opportunity for data to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of operations, and hope you consider joining us on this exciting journey. 

About the role:

Samsara is hiring a Full Stack Software Engineer to join our Event Ingestion and Filtering team, a critical part of our Safety product offering. The global, connected fleets of Samsara customers are continually detecting events that safety managers use to coach risky driver behaviors and recognize/reward safe driving. Once those events have been detected, their journey through Samsara continues, and this team ensures that all events that reach the customer are relevant and coachable for the end user.

We are constantly building out new capabilities that process billions of minutes of video safety events atop a platform that connects business operations to the physical world. We solve real problems that impact operations globally. We work closely with customers to gather requirements, get feedback and iterate on solutions as the products come to life. We collaborate across engineering and other disciplines to learn from each other and ensure that we build the best solution for our customers, keeping their needs in mind. Our team owns critical products that impact our entire Safety offering and we shape the future of how events are created, filtered, and presented. We build complex market leading end-to-end solutions that touch the full stack within a distributed platform that scales at an incredibly fast pace to meet the needs of the next generation of IoT applications.

You should apply if:

  • You want to impact the industries that run our world: The software, firmware, and hardware you build will result in real-world impact—helping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely.
  • You want to build for scale: With over 2.3 million IoT devices deployed to our global customers, you will work on a range of new and mature technologies driving scalable innovation for customers across industries driving the world's physical operations.
  • You are a life-long learner: We have ambitious goals. Every Samsarian has a growth mindset as we work with a wide range of technologies, challenges, and customers that push us to learn on the go.
  • You believe customers are more than a number: Samsara engineers enjoy a rare closeness to the end user and you will have the opportunity to participate in customer interviews, collaborate with customer success and product managers, and use metrics to ensure our work is translating into better customer outcomes.
  • You are a team player: Working on our Samsara Engineering teams requires a mix of independent effort and collaboration. Motivated by our mission, we’re all racing toward our connected operations vision, and we intend to win—together.

Click here to learn about what we value at Samsara. 

In this role, you will: 

  • Solve complex problems and own the success of your solutions as you architect, build, test and deliver full-stack products.
  • Communicate, collaborate and develop with engineers, platform/infrastructure teams, product managers, designers and support teams.
  • Build upon skills and knowledge across a range of technologies such as Go, GraphQL, Typescript, React and MySQL. Previous experience with these technologies is not required.
  • Own the operational health of production systems as we build for the future scale of an ever growing customer base.
  • Understand how an IoT platform solves real world problems as well as how to incorporate customer feedback and requirements into solutions.
  • Make an impact on our core architecture, roadmap and the wider engineering community.
  • Champion, role model, and embed Samsara’s cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices.

Minimum requirements for the role:

  • This level role at Samsara is for someone with experience playing a key role in a skilled software engineering team. You’ll be hungry to learn, help others to learn from your experience and be fascinated by the future! 
  • You don’t need to have worked with a big name or have a Computer Science degree, but you’ll be comfortable writing clean code and capable of building complex systems at scale.
  • You’ll be comfortable with designing and building out complex end-to-end solutions as well as leading complex projects. A preference for front-end or back-end development is okay, but you’ll need to be happy working across the stack here.
  • Communication skills are important to our engineering team. You’ll be able to explain why you build something a certain way and be open to suggestions from other engineers and stakeholders.
  • You enjoy understanding users and their problem space to ensure that what you build has a real and relevant impact on customers' day-to-day processes.

#LI-Remote

At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background, race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, etc. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

Accommodations

Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or click here if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.

Benefits

Full time employees receive an above market total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at our Benefits site to learn more.

Flexible Working 

At Samsara, we have adopted a flexible way of working, enabling teams and individuals to do their best work, regardless of where they’re based. We value in-person collaboration and know a change of scenery and quiet space to work is welcomed from time to time, but also appreciate that the world of work has changed. Our offices remain open for those who prefer to collaborate or work in-office, but we also encourage fully remote applicants. As most roles are not required to be in the office, we are able to hire remotely where Samsara has an established presence. If a role is required to be in a certain location and candidates do not have work authorization for that location, Samsara will conduct an immigration assessment. If the role is not required to be in a specific location, Samsara will move forward with the remote location that works best for the business. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individual’s ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company. 

 

Please note: Samsara does not accept agency resumes and is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Samsara employees.
name: Software Engineer, Full Stack - Fleet Safety

contents:
Knowledge for the world of tomorrow.

We develop networks that supply our cities with light and heat intelligently and we know our way around automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. For these and many other future projects, we need smart thinkers who bring skills, creativity, and dedication to the table. People like you! Experienced researchers who boldly broaden horizons, true specialists, and clever minds who like to get to the bottom of things. In short, help us tackle the most exciting challenges and put into practice what really matters. We'll give you the opportunity to really make a difference. So what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.

What part will you play?

  • In your new role as a senior research scientist in embedded security testing you perform security assessments of Siemens embedded / industrial IoT products and bring your offensive perspective into the design of such systems
  • You manage projects and funded research activities and develop new technologies and methods in the fields of embedded security and embedded hacking
  • You apply R&D results in projects with Siemens business units and develop pilots for proof-of-concept purposes
  • You drive cooperation with national and international partners, both internally and at universities and research institutions
  • You provide technical consulting to Siemens business units on embedded security topics
  • You actively share your know-how within our team and supervise interns and working students

What you need to make real what matters.
  • You have successfully completed your PhD or master's degree with equivalent experience in cyber security, computer science, mathematics, electrical engineering, or physics
  • Besides, you already gained 5+ years of professional and project management experience in the field of cyber security
  • You have a solid understanding of state-of the-art cyber security concepts and extensive expertise in penetration testing, embedded hacking, and binary analysis
  • Experience in embedded software programming and knowledge in Linux OS and industrial communication protocols are a plus
  • In addition, you have professional experience in applied research and in the transfer of R&D results into prototypes and customer offers
  • You distinguish yourself by an innovative mindset, openness to address new topics, very good communication skills, strong customer orientation, with a high degree of personal initiative and a team-player mindset
  • Your English and preferably German language skills are business ﬂuent

What we offer.

  • 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
  • Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
  • Location-dependent childcare services to combine family and career
  • Barrier-free locations
  • Find more benefits here

Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

name: Senior Research Scientist (f/m/d) - Embedded Security Testing

contents:
Wir beschleunigen und sichern die Energiewende nachhaltig und profitabel.

Siemens Smart Infrastructure Grid Software ermöglicht Netzbetreibern sowie Industrie- und Infrastrukturunternehmen die Energiewende nachhaltig und gewinnbringend zu beschleunigen. Wir verbinden die physische und digitale Welt mit einer integrierten OT- und IT-Landschaft entlang der gesamten Wertschöpfungskette von der Planung über den Betrieb bis zur Wartung. Dabei folgen wir den Designprinzipien Modularität, Offenheit, Nutzerzentrierung, Interoperabilität und Ausfallsicherheit.

Die "Net Zero"-Herausforderung führt zu einem grundlegenden Wandel bei der Energieerzeugung und dem Energieverbrauch. Bis 2030 wird ein siebenfacher Anstieg der DER-Installationen prognostiziert. Diese bahnbrechende Transformation des Energiesektors, gekennzeichnet durch einen bidirektionalen Stromfluss aus intermittierenden erneuerbaren Energiequellen und neuen Verbrauchsmustern, führt zu einer enormen Komplexität. Hier kommen wir ins Spiel.

Unser großes Ziel? Wir glauben, dass Software der Schlüssel ist, um diese Herausforderungen in Chancen zu verwandeln.

Willst Du Teil dieser Transformation sein und neue Möglichkeiten schaffen?

  • In Deiner neuen Rolle arbeitest Du an den Lösungen, die unsere Kunden für den Schutz und die Steuerung der Energienetze von morgen benötigen. Die digitale Transformation des Elektroenergiesystems und die Herausforderungen der Energiewende erfordern neues Denken und das Brechen mit Paradigmen
  • Als Senior Entwickler (w/m/d) arbeitest Du an der Entwicklung von Treibern für unsere hochmodernen und modularen Produkte und Plattformen
  • Du bist verantwortlich für die Implementierung von Low-Level-Software auf FPGA-basierten Systemen
  • Darüber hinaus erstellst Du Spezifikationen und Dokumentationen für Deine Software und erarbeitest Tests und Testautomatisierungen
  • Du arbeitest in agilen und cross-funktionalen Teams
  • Deine bisherigen Erfahrungen bringst Du voll mit ein und kooperierst mit anderen Entwicklern und Ingenieuren bei der Integration der Embedded-Systeme in höhere Abstraktionsebenen

Dein Profil, um mit uns die Welt von morgen zu verändern:
  • Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Masterstudium in Informatik, Elektrotechnik, Physik oder einen vergleichbaren Abschluss
  • Zudem kannst Du auf langjährige Berufserfahrung in der Treiber- und VHDL-Entwicklung zurückgreifen
  • Du kennst Dich mit Embedded Systemen mit Echtzeitanforderungen aus
  • Erfahrungen mit WindRiver VxWorks und Embedded Linux kannst Du vorweisen
  • Du programmierst sicher in C/C++ und findest Dich in modernen, professionellen Software-Systemen gut zurecht
  • Mit Deiner strukturierten, lösungs- und zielorientierten Vorgehensweise und Arbeitsmethodik überzeugst Du uns
  • Du traust Dir zu, in Teams die technische Führung zu übernehmen
  • Dazu kommunizierst Du sicher in Deutsch und Englisch

Wir haben einiges zu bieten, lernen Sie uns kennen.

Bei uns hat jede und jeder die Möglichkeit, mit innovativen und modernen Technologien zu arbeiten. Unser Portfolio umfasst Produkte und Dienstleistungen im Bereich der Elektrifizierung, Automatisierung und Digitalisierung. Eine Arbeitsatmosphäre und -kultur, die auf Vertrauen, Verantwortung und Respekt basiert.

Wir schätzen die Tatsache, dass unsere Mitarbeitenden Individuen sind und unterschiedliche Vorlieben und Bedürfnisse haben. Wenn wir alle gleich denken würden, würde uns nie etwas Neues einfallen! Deshalb rekrutieren wir außergewöhnliche Menschen aus allen Bereichen des Lebens. Wir sind bestrebt, unsere Kultur der Vielfalt, Gleichberechtigung und Integration zu fördern. Wir ermutigen Bewerbungen aus einem vielfältigen Talentpool und geben gerne die Möglichkeit, über Flexibilität und angemessene Anpassungsanforderungen zu sprechen. Viele unserer Teams arbeiten effektiv in einer virtuellen Umgebung, was uns die Möglichkeit gibt, noch mehr Flexibilität bei der Zeiteinteilung zu bieten. Bringen Sie Ihre Neugierde und Kreativität mit und helfen Sie uns, die Zukunft zu gestalten!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

https://new.siemens.com/ - wenn Du mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchtest.

name: Senior Embedded Softwareentwickler (w/m/d) Treiber und VHDL

contents:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for an experienced Director who will be responsible for building and scaling a global best-in-class Treasury Operations function covering OTC operations, digital asset operations, and fiat operations. In this role, you will seek to actively identify and leverage synergies in operations processes to achieve standardization and automation across all operational aspects of Circle’s business.  This position plays a key strategic role in partnering with our Product, Engineering, and Customer Success teams to deliver operational solutions that help to create value for Circle’s customers. You will also lead Circle’s efforts to develop best in class processes and controls that exceed existing and future regulatory requirements. This is an opportunity to build a strategic function from the ground up.

What you'll work on: 

  • Building and scaling a best-in-class firmwide operations function to support 24/7 crypto and fiat flows.
  • Partnering closely with internal functions such as Product and Engineering to ensure that new products and services incorporate key operational features and functionality.
  • Developing and implementing a global foreign exchange strategy for crypto and fiat operations.
  • Providing operational expertise and support to the OTC market making business, including asset custody, reporting, margin operations, and financial risk management.
  • Facilitating new product launches and lines of business with robust operational process design and infrastructure.
  • Automating operational and reconciliation process flows to reduce error incidence and increase efficiencies.
  • Developing and establishing operational redundancy and resiliency to ensure continued operations and zero downtime.
  • Owning and continually improving fiat operations including funds flows, return/exception handling, critical metrics, and reporting. Developing automated reporting and reconciliation solutions across payments systems and platforms.
  • Building and maintaining operational controls, policies, standards and procedures for operational activities. 
  • Collaborating closely with internal partners to ensure end to end process flows are performed according to regulatory requirements and internal controls/processes as well as documenting evidence of compliance.
  • Testing and improving operations architecture resiliency to ensure continued operations across unplanned and unexpected events. 

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • 12+ years full time or internship experience in treasury, banking, payments industry or related field.
  • 5+ years of experience managing and leading teams. 
  • Prior experience building and scaling an operations function.
  • Strong work ethic and ability to excel in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities.
  • Inquisitiveness and interest in macroeconomics and business cycle modeling.
  • Interest in the cryptocurrency and web3 ecosystems and how they interact with the traditional finance industry.
  • Advanced excel/spreadsheet skills and/or basic computer programming capabilities (SQL, Python, AppScript, VBA, etc.)  
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Los Angeles, CA. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $197,500 - $267,500

Annual Bonus Target: 20%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

#LI-Remote
name: Director, Treasury Operations

contents:
Wissen für die Welt von morgen.

Wir entwickeln Netzwerke, die unsere Städte schlauer mit Licht und Wärme versorgen und kennen uns in Sachen Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Prozess- und Fertigungsindustrie bestens aus. Dafür und für viele weitere Zukunftsprojekte brauchen wir kluge Köpfe, die ihr Können und ihre Kreativität aktiv einbringen. Menschen wie Sie! Helfen Sie uns dabei, die spannendsten Herausforderungen gemeinsam anzugehen und umzusetzen, worauf es ankommt. Was wir Ihnen bieten ist die Chance, wirklich etwas zu bewegen. Also worauf warten? Machen Sie mit uns den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer Karriere.

Verändern Sie zusammen mit uns die schöne Welt von morgen.

  • Zu Ihren Aufgaben zählt die Erstellung von Angeboten für unser Portfolio, insbesondere für Mittelspannungsschaltanlagen und Niederspannungsschaltanlagen
  • Ebenso wickeln Sie die Aufträge eigenverantwortlich ab und projektieren und kalkulieren Mittelspannungsschaltanlagen
  • Sie führen technische und kommerzielle Klärungen zuverlässig durch und arbeiten eng mit internen und externen Kooperationen zusammen
  • In Ihren Verantwortungsbereich fällt die Termin- und Kostenverfolgung und die Übernahme der Nachkalkulationen
  • Sie bereiten die Auftragsabrechnung verlässlich vor und werten z.B. Aufmaße aus

Ihr Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".

  • Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene elektrotechnische Berufsausbildung sowie mehrjährige einschlägige Berufserfahrung
  • Sie überzeugen uns durch fundierte Kenntnisse in Schaltanlagen sowie gutes technisches Wissen über das Produktportfolio der Mittelspannung sowie der angrenzenden Bereiche
  • Sie sind sicher im Umgang mit SAP, Projektierungstools sowie MS Office
  • Darüber hinaus punkten Sie mit einer hohen Affinität und ausgeprägten Neugierde für digitale Themen und Technologien, Ihrer zuverlässigen Arbeitsweise sowie einem kundenfreundlichen Auftreten
  • Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie gute Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr eigenes Profil ab

Was wir bieten.

  • 2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als globaler Standard
  • Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für Ihre berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Sie und Ihre Familie ermöglichen
  • Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
  • Und viele weitere Benefits hier

Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.

Wir wollen, dass Sie wollen: Bewerben Sie sich!

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.

name: Projektbearbeitung (w/m/d) Mittelspannungs- und Niederspannungsschaltanlagen

contents:
Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied

Siemens Mobility ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 38.200 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Was trägst Du bei?

Wir suchen einen Masterstudenten (w/m/d) mit Schwerpunkt Change & Communication, der uns bei dem Transformationsprogramm SHERPA X - Project Business unterstützt. Du arbeitest sehr eng mit der Organization Change Managerin zusammen und steuerst gemeinsam mit ihr die Change- und Kommunikationsaktivitäten.

  • In Deiner neuen Rolle wirst Du eng mit dem E2E (End2End) Process und Compatibility Manager (w/m/d) zusammenarbeiten und die Data & Process Mining Aktivitäten für das Transformationsprogramm erstellen und aussteuern.
  • Dazu gehören z.B. die Analyse der relevanten Prozesse und deren konkrete Aktivitäten, die Zuordnung bzw. das Auslesen entsprechender Datenobjekte, die Gestaltung geeigneter Dashboards zur Darstellung der Daten, erarbeiten einer Umsetzungsplanung für die gesamte Prozesslandschaft des Unternehmens bis hin zur operativen Umsetzung.
  • Du evaluierst, welche Datenobjekte für die verschiedenen Prozesse relevant und geeignet sind.
  • Du unterstützt Kommunikationsmaßnahmen wie Newsletters, erzeugst Dashboards und definierst geeignete Maßnahmen das Thema "bekannt zu machen".
  • Du organisierst verschiedene DEMO-Veranstaltungen mit klarer Konzeption, Planung, Produktion und reibungsloser Umsetzung - vor allem auch virtuell.
  • Beim Aufbau einer Experten-Community bist Du maßgeblich beteiligt.

Was bringst Du mit?

  • Du bringst ein abgeschlossenes Bachelor-Studium in einem technischen Bereich oder IT mit. Ggfls. wäre auch eine Business Administration Vorbildung passend. Deinen MBA kannst Du begleitend mit der FAU Erlsngen-Nürnberg im Präsenzstudium oder alternativ im Onlinestudium über die AKAD abschließen.
  • Du hast bereits in Transformationsprojekten in einem idealerweise internationalen Umfeld gearbeitet, mit einem starken Fokus auf die prozessuale Ausrichtung und deren Daten- und Performance Messung.
  • Du verfügst über Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Dashboards und der übersichtlichen Darstellung von "Massendaten".
  • Du bist kreativ und hast Spaß daran, neue Konzepte zu entwickeln, die über das bereits Bekannte hinausgehen und die Themen Data- und Process Mining auf eine neue Ebene heben (z.B. Erstellung von Queries, E-Mails, Newsletter etc.).
  • Erfahrungen in agilen Ansätzen/Methoden (z.B. SAFe, SCRUM) sind ein Plus.
  • Fließende deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse runden Dein Profil ab.

Was bieten wir Dir?

Inklusion & Vielfalt

Bei Siemens Mobility setzen wir uns gegen Ungerechtigkeit und Ungleichheit ein. Bei uns findest Du ein Umfeld vor, in dem Du Du selbst sein kannst und dazugehörst.

Purpose

Wir sind Pioniere der Mobilität. Bei uns trägst Du in einem Zukunftsmarkt aktiv zu Verkehrswende und Klimaschutz bei, weil unsere Transportlösungen in aller Welt den CO2-Ausstoß verringern.

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns hast Du die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Du zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein kannst. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie hier.

Wie trittst Du mit uns in Kontakt?

www.siemens.de/mobility
wenn Du vor deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchtest.
+49 (9131) 17 52430
wenn Du erste Fragen gern persönlich mit unserem Recruiting Team klären möchtest. Ansprechpartner für diese Stellenausschreibung ist Frau Julia Greff.
www.siemens.com/mobility-jobs
wenn Du mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchtest.
